# title:                Montgomery New Testament<br>The New Testament in English
# URL:                  http://sourceforge.net/projects/zefania-sharp/files/Bibles/ENG/Montgomery%20New%20Testament/
# copyright_short:      Public Domain
# copyright_long:       Publisher: SnowBall<br>Contributors: Sword Project<br>Source: http://www.crosswire.org/sword/servlet/SwordMod.Verify?modName=Montgomery<br>Rights: Public Domain<br><br>Montgomery New Testament (1924) by Helen Barrett Montgomery. This is the only modem speech translation of the New Testament produced by a woman. Helen Barrett Montgomery's translation is marked by a conversational style, with the text arranged into paragraphs.
40001001	The book of the generation of Jesus Christ , the son of David , the son of Abraham .
40001002	Abraham was the father of Isaac ; Isaac was the father of Jacob ; Jacob , of Judah and his brethren ;
40001003	Judah ( by Tamar ) , of Perez and Zerah ; Perez , of Hezron ; Hezron , of Ram ;
40001004	Ram , of Amminadab ; Amminadab , of Nahshon ; Nahshon , of Salmon ;
40001005	Salmon ( by Rahab ) , of Boaz ; Boaz ( by Ruth ) , of Obed ; Obed , of Jesse ;
40001006	And Jesse , of David the king . David ( by Uriahs widow ) , was the father of Solomon ;
40001007	Solomon , of Rehoboam ; Rehoboam , of Abijah ; Abijah , of Asa ;
40001008	Asa , of Jehoshaphat ; Jehoshaphat , of Joram ; Joram , of Uzziah ;
40001009	Uzziah , of Jotham ; Jotham , of Ahaz ; Ahaz , of Hezekiah ;
40001010	Hezekiah , of Manasseh ; Manasseh , of Amon ; Amon , of Josiah ;
40001011	Josiah , of Jechoniah and his brethren , at the time of the carrying away to Babylon .
40001012	And after the carrying away into Babylon , Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel ; Shealtiel , of Zerubbabel ;
40001013	Zerubbabel , of Abiud ; Abiud , of Eliakim ; Eliakim , of Azor ;
40001014	Azor , of Sadoc ; Sadoc , of Achim ; Achim , of Eliud ;
40001015	Eliud , of Eleazar ; Eleazar , of Matthan ; Matthan , of Jacob ;
40001016	And Jacob , of Joseph , the husband of Mary , of whom was born Jesus , who is called Christ .
40001017	So the whole number of generations from Abraham to David is fourteen ; from David to the exile to Babylon is fourteen ; and from the exile to Babylon to Christ is fourteen .
40001018	The birth of Jesus Christ took place in this way . After his mother , Mary , had been betrothed to Joseph , before they came together , she was found to be with child by the Holy Spirit .
40001019	But Joseph her husband , because he was just a man and unwilling to disgrace her , was minded to put her away secretly .
40001020	And while he was having this in mind , behold ! an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream , saying .
40001021	" Joseph , son of David , do not be afraid to take Mary your wife home , for what is begotten in her is by the Holy Spirit ; and she will bear a son , and you are to call him Jesus , for he will save his people from their sins . "
40001022	All this happened that the word of the Lord spoken through the prophet might be fulfilled .
40001023	Behold ! the virgin shall be with child , and shall bear a son ; and they shall call his name Immanuel , a word which means " God with us . "
40001024	Now when Joseph awoke from his sleep he did as the angel of the Lord had directed him , and took his wife home ,
40001025	but did not live with her until after the birth of her son , whom he called Jesus .
40002001	After the birth of Jesus , which took place at Bethlehem in Judea , during the reign of King Herod , lo ! certain Magi arrived in Jerusalem , saying .
40002002	" Where is the new-born King of the Jews ? For we have seen his star in the East , and are come to worship him . "
40002003	When King Herod heard this he was troubled , and all Jerusalem with him .
40002004	So when he had gathered together all the chief priests and rabbis of the people , he began to inquire of them where the Christ was to be born .
40002005	And they told him . " At Bethlehem in Judea , as it is written in the prophet .
40002006	" And thou Bethlehem in the land of Judah , Thou are not least among the princes of Judah , For out of thee shall come a ruler Who shall shepherd my people , Israel . "
40002007	Thereupon Herod sent secretly for the Magi , and found out from them the time when the star appeared .
40002008	Then he sent them to Bethlehem , saying , " Go and make careful inquiry about the child , and as soon as you have found him bring me word , that I , too , may go and worship him . "
40002009	The Magi listened to the king , and went on their way , and lo ! the star which they had seen in the east led them until it came and stood over the place where the young child was .
40002010	And when they saw the star , they rejoiced with great gladness .
40002011	When they had entered the house , they saw the child with Mary , his mother , and opening their treasure-chests they gave him gifts , gold and frankincense and myrrh .
40002012	But because they were forbidden by God in a dream to go back to Herod , they returned to their own country by another route .
40002013	When they were gone an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream , saying ; " Rise ! Take the young child and his mother and flee into Egypt , and there remain until I bring you word ; for Herod intends to make a search for the child , in order to put him to death . "
40002014	So Joseph arose , took the child and his mother , by night , and departed to Egypt .
40002015	There he remained until the death of Herod , in order that the word of the Lord through the prophet might be fulfilled , which says , Out of Egypt I called my son .
40002016	As soon as Herod saw that he had been mocked by the Magi , he was furious . He sent and put to death all the boys in Bethlehem and all the neighborhood who were two years old or under , in accordance with the date which he had ascertained from the Magi .
40002017	Then were fulfilled the words spoken through Jeremiah , the prophet , saying ,
40002018	A voice was heard in Ramah , Weeping and lamentation - Rachel weeping for her children , Inconsolable , because they were no more !
40002019	But after Herods death an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt ,
40002020	saying , " Rise ! Take the child and his mother , and came into the land of Israel , for those who were seeking the life of the child are dead . "
40002021	So he rose and took the child and his mother , and came into the land of Israel .
40002022	But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning in Judea in place of his father , Herod , he was afraid to go there ; and being warned of God in a dream , he withdrew into Galilee and settled in a town called Nazareth ,
40002023	in fulfillment of the word spoken through the Prophets , He shall be called a Nazarene .
40003001	In those days came John the Baptist preaching in the desert of Judea ;
40003002	" Repent , " said he , " for the kingdom of heaven is at hand . "
40003003	This Johnit was of whom it was said through Isaiah , the prophet , The voice of one who cries aloud in the desert , " Prepare a way for the Lord , Make the paths straight for him . "
40003004	This Johnwore a garment of camels hair , and a leather belt around his waist , and his food was locusts and wild honey .
40003005	Then Jerusalem began to go out to him , and all Judea , and the whole neighborhood of the Jordan ,
40003006	and were baptized by him in the river Jordan , confessing their sins .
40003007	But when Johnsaw that many of the Pharisees and Sadducees were coming for baptism , he said . " O brood of vipers ! Who has warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
40003008	Then bring forth fruit worthy of repentance .
40003009	And do not presume to say to yourselves , We have Abraham as our father-I tell you that out of these very stones God is able to raise up descendants for Abraham .
40003010	And already the axe is lying at the roots of the trees . Any tree , therefore , that does not bear good fruit is cut down and cast into the fire .
40003011	I indeed am baptizing you in water , unto repentance ; but One is coming after me , mightier than I , whose sandals I am not worthy to carry . He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and in fire .
40003012	His winnowing-fan is in his hand , and he will thoroughly cleanse the threshing-floor . He will store his wheat in the granary , but will burn up the chaff in unquenchable fire . "
40003013	At that very time Jesus was on his way from Galilee to the Jordan , to John , to be baptized by him .
40003014	But he tried to prevent him . " It is I , " he said , " who need to be baptized by you , and are you coming to me ? "
40003015	But Jesus answered , " Permit it now , for so it is fitting for us to fulfill every religious duty . "
40003016	Then he consented . And after Jesus was baptized , as soon as he rose out of the water , lo ! the heavens opened , and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and alighting upon him ,
40003017	while a voice from heaven said , " This is my son , the beloved , In whom I delight . "
40004001	Then Jesus was led up into the desert by the Spirit , to be tempted by the devil .
40004002	And after he had fasted forty days and forty nights , he became hungry ,
40004003	So the tempter came and said to him , " If you are the Son of God , bid these stones to become bread . "
40004004	Jesus answered him , " It is written , Not by bread alone shall man live , but by every word that comes from the mouth of God . "
40004005	Then the devil took him up into the Holy City and stood him on the parapet of the temple ,
40004006	and said to him . " If you are the Son of God , throw yourself down ; for it is written , " He will give his angels charge over thee ; Upon their hands they will bear thee up , Lest thou dash thy foot against a stone . "
40004007	" It is written again , " answered Jesus , " Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God . "
40004008	Then the devil took Jesus to a very high mountain , and showed all the kingdoms of the earth and the glory of them ,
40004009	and said to him , " All these will I give you , if you will fall down and worship me . "
40004010	" Begone , Satan ! " answered Jesus , " for it is written , " Thou must worship the Lord thy God , and Him only must thou serve . "
40004011	Then the devil left him , and behold ! angels came and began ministering to him .
40004012	Now when Jesus heard that Johnhad been arrested , he withdrew into Galilee .
40004013	He left Nazareth , and settled in Capernaum-by-the-Lake , near the borders of Zebulun and Naphtali ,
40004014	in order that these words spoken through Isaiah the prophet , might be fulfilled .
40004015	Land of Zebulun , land of Naphtali ; The road by the Lake ; the country beyond Jordan ; Galilee of the Gentiles !
40004016	The people who were dwelling in darkness Have seen a great light ; And on those who were dwelling in the land of the shadows of death Light has dawned .
40004017	From that time Jesus began to preach , saying , " Repent for the kingdom of heaven is near . "
40004018	And as he was walking by the see of Galilee , he saw two brothers - Simon who is called Peter , and Andrew , his brother-casting their net into the sea , for they were fishermen .
40004019	" Come , follow me , " said Jesus , " And I will make you fishers of men . "
40004020	And they dropped their nets at once , and followed him .
40004021	As he went farther on he saw two other brothers , Jamesthe son of Zebedee , and Johnhis brother , in the boat with Zebedee their father , mending their nets , and he called them .
40004022	They immediately left the boat and their father , and followed him .
40004023	Then Jesus went about through Galilee , teaching in the synagogues , and preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing every kind of disease and infirmity among the people .
40004024	And his fame spread throughout all Syria . They brought all the sick to him , those who were suffering from various diseases and troubles - demoniacs , epileptics , paralytics-and he healed them .
40004025	Great crowds followed him from Galilee , from the ten towns , from Jerusalem , and Judea , and from beyond Jordan .
40005001	When he saw the crowds , he went up the mountain , and when he had seated himself , his disciples came to him ,
40005002	and opening his lips he began to teach them , saying .
40005003	" Blessed are the poor in spirit , for the kingdom of heaven is theirs .
40005004	" Blessed are those who mourn , for they shall be comforted .
40005005	" Blessed are the gentle , for they shall inherit the earth . "
40005006	" Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for the righteousness , for they shall be completely satisfied .
40005007	" Blessed are the merciful , for they shall obtain mercy .
40005008	" Blessed are the pure in heart , for they shall see God .
40005009	" Blessed are the peacemakers , for they shall be called sons of God .
40005010	" Blessed are those who have been persecuted in the cause of righteousness , for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
40005011	" Blessed are you when they shall revile you , and persecute you , and say all manner of evil against you falsely , for my names sake .
40005012	" Rejoice and exult in it , because your reward was great in the heavens ; for so did they persecute the prophets before you .
40005013	" You are the salt of the earth ; but if the salt lose its savor , in what way shall it be salted ? It is henceforth good for nothing but to be thrown out and trodden under foot of men .
40005014	" You are the light of the world . A city built on a hilltop cannot be hid ;
40005015	" nor do men light a lamp , and put it under the bushel , but on the lamp-stand , and it gives light to all who are in the house .
40005016	" So let your light shine before men that they may see good you do , and give glory to your Father who is in heaven .
40005017	" Do not suppose that I am come to destroy the Law or the Prophets . I am come not to destroy , but to fulfil .
40005018	" In solemn truth I tell you that until heaven and earth pass away , not an iota , not a comma , will pass from the Law until all has taken place .
40005019	" So whoever breaks one of these least commandments , and teaches others to break them , will be least in the kingdom of heaven . But he who keeps them and teaches them , he will be called great in the kingdom of heaven .
40005020	" For I assure you that unless your righteousness exceed that of the scribes and Pharisees , you will not find entrance into the kingdom of heaven .
40005021	" You have heard that it was said to the ancients , " Thou shall not commit murder , and " he who commits murder shall be liable to condemnation by the court ;
40005022	but I say to you that he who becomes angry with his brother shall be liable to condemnation by the court ; and he who says to his brother Raca , shall be liable to condemnation by the Sanhedrin , while he who curses his brother shall be liable to the Gehenna of Fire .
40005023	" If therefore when you are offering your gift upon the altar , and there remember that your brother has a grievance against you ,
40005024	" leave there your gift before the altar , and go and make friends with your brother , first of all ; then come and offer your gift .
40005025	" Come to terms with your opponent quickly , while you are yet with him on the way to the court , to prevent your opponent from handing you over to the judge , and the judge to the jailer , and so you be thrown into prison .
40005026	" I tell you truly that you would certainly not get out from there until you had paid back the last cent .
40005027	" You have heard that it was said , " Thou shalt not commit adultery .
40005028	But I say to you that whoever looks with lust at a woman has already committed adultery with her in his heart .
40005029	And if your eye , your right eye , entices you to sin , pluck it out and cast it from you . It is better for you to lose one of your bodily organs , than to have your whole body go down into the pit .
40005030	And if your right hand entices you into sin , cut it off and cast it from you ; for it is better for you to lose one of your bodily organs , than to have your whole body go down into the pit .
40005031	" It was also said , " Whoever divorces his wife must give her a bill of separation .
40005032	But I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife , except on the ground of unchastity , makes her an adulteress , and whoever marries her when so divorced , commits adultery .
40005033	" Again you have heard that it was said to the men of old , " You must not forswear yourselves , but must perform your vows to the Lord .
40005034	" But I say to you , swear not at all ; neither by the sky , for it is Gods throne ;
40005035	" nor by the earth , for it is the footstool of his feet ; nor by Jerusalem , for it is the city of the Great King .
40005036	" Nor must you swear by your head , since you cannot make one hair white or black .
40005037	" But let your word be simply Yes or No ; anything beyond this comes from the Evil One .
40005038	" You have heard that it was said , " An eye for an eye , a tooth for a tooth .
40005039	" But I tell you not to retaliate the injury ; but whoever strikes you on the right cheek , turn the other to him also ;
40005040	" and if any one wants to go to law with you and takes away your coat , let him take your cloak also .
40005041	" Whoever impresses you to go one mile , go two miles with him .
40005042	" Give to him who asks , and from him who wants to borrow from you , do not turn away .
40005043	" You have heard that it was said , " You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy . "
40005044	" But I say to you , love your enemies , and pray for those who persecute you .
40005045	" So you will become sons of your heavenly Father ; for he makes his sun to rise upon sinners as well as saints , and sends rain upon the unjust and the just .
40005046	" For if you love only those who love you , what reward have you ?
40005047	" Even the tax-gatherers do that , do they not ? And if you show courtesy to your brother only , what are you doing more than others ? Even the Gentiles do that , do they not ?
40005048	" You then must be perfect , as your heavenly Father is perfect . "
40006001	" Be careful not to do your good deeds in the sight of men , in order to be observed by them . If you do , you have no reward with your heavenly Father .
40006002	" And whatever you give alms , do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and streets , in order that men may praise them . In solemn truth I tell you they already have their reward in full .
40006003	" But when you give alms , do not let your right hand know what your left is doing ,
40006004	" so that your alms may be in secret ; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly .
40006005	" And whenever you pray , do not be like the hypocrites . For they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on the corners of the avenues , in order that men may see them . In solemn truth I tell you that they have their reward in full .
40006006	" But you , when you pray , go into your own room and shut your door ; pray to your Father who is in secret , and your Father who sees in secret will reward you .
40006007	" While praying do not say the same words over and over again , as the Gentiles do , for they suppose that by their much speaking they will gain attention .
40006008	" Do not be like them , for your Father knows what you need before you ask him .
40006009	" So pray in this way . " Our Father who art in heaven , May thy name be hallowed ,
40006010	thy kingdom come , and thy will be done , On earth , as in heaven .
40006011	Give us today our bread for the day before us ;
40006012	And forgive us our debts as we also have forgiven our debtors ;
40006013	And lead us not into temptation , but deliver us from the Evil One ; For thine is the kingdom and the power and the glory . Amen .
40006014	" For if you forgive men their offenses against you , your heavenly Father will forgive you also ;
40006015	" but if you do not forgive men your offenses , neither will your heavenly Father forgive you your offenses .
40006016	" When you fast , do not look downcast like the hypocrites ; for they disfigure their faces so that it may be apparent to men that they are fasting . In solemn truth I tell you , they already have received their reward .
40006017	" But when one of you fasts , let him anoint his head and wash his face ,
40006018	" so that he may not appear to men to be fasting , but to his Father who is in secret ; and his Father who sees in secret will reward him .
40006019	" Store up for yourselves no treasures on earth , where moth and rust consume , and where thieves break through and steal ;
40006020	" but store up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where neither moth nor rust consume , and where thieves do not break through nor steal .
40006021	" For wherever your treasure is , there will your heart be also .
40006022	" The lamp of the body is the eye . Therefore if your eye is sound , your whole body will be well lighted ;
40006023	" but if your eye is unsound , your whole body will be darkened . If then the very light within you is darkness , how dense is that darkness !
40006024	" No slave can serve two masters , for either he will hate the one and love the other , or he will pay heed to the one and despise the other . You cannot be the slaves both of God and of gold .
40006025	" For this reason I say to you , do not be anxious about your life , inquiring what you shall eat or what you shall drink , nor yet for your body , inquiring what you shall wear . Is not your life more than its food , and your body than its clothing ?
40006026	" Behold ! the birds in the sky ! They neither sow , nor reap , nor gather into barns , yet your heavenly Father feeds them ; and are not you worth more than they ?
40006027	" Which one of you by being anxious is able to add even one cubit to his stature ?
40006028	" Why be anxious then about clothing ? Consider the lilies of the field , how they grow . They toil not , neither do they spin .
40006029	" But I say to you that not even Solomon in all his glory was robed like one of these .
40006030	" If God then so clothes the grass of the field , which blooms today , and tomorrow is cast into the oven , will he not much more clothe you , you of little faith ?
40006031	" Then do not be anxious , saying , What shall we eat ? or What shall we drink ? or What shall we wear ? "
40006032	" For all these are things that the Gentiles are eagerly seeking ; for your heavenly Father knows that you have need of them all .
40006033	" But continue to seek first his kingdom and his righteousness , and all these things shall be added to you .
40006034	" Do not then be anxious about tomorrow , for tomorrow will bring its own anxieties . Enough for each day are its own troubles . "
40007001	" Judge not , that you may be judged , yourselves ;
40007002	" for with what judgment you judge , you will be judged , and in what measure you measure , others will measure to you .
40007003	" And why do you look at the mote in your brothers eye , and fail to notice the beam which is in your own eye ?
40007004	" Or how will you say to your brother , Permit me to remove the mote from your eye , when , behold , the beam is in your own eye ?
40007005	" Hypocrite ! First cast out the beam from your own eye , and then you will see clearly how to cast the mote out of your brothers eye .
40007006	" Do not give what is holy to the dogs , nor cast your pearls before swine ; lest in turn they trample them under their feet , and then turn and attack you .
40007007	" Ask , and it will be given you ; seek , and you will find ; knock , and the door will be opened to you .
40007008	" For every one who asks receives , and he who seeks finds , and to him who knocks the door is opened .
40007009	" What man of you is there who , when his son asks a loaf , will give him a stone ?
40007010	" or if his son asks for a fish , will offer him a snake ?
40007011	" If you then , evil as you are , know how to give good gifts to your children , how much more will your heavenly Father give good gifts to those who ask him ?
40007012	" Therefore everything that you would have men do to you , do you also the same to them ; for this is the Law and the Prophets .
40007013	" Enter by the narrow gate ; for broad is the gate and wide the road that leads to destruction , and many are they who go in by it ;
40007014	" but the gate is narrow and the road is steep , which leads to life , and they are few who find it .
40007015	" Beware of the false prophets who come to you in sheeps clothing , but within they are ravening wolves .
40007016	" By their fruits you will know them . Are grapes gathered of thorns , or figs of thistles ?
40007017	" No , every good tree bears good fruit , but a worthless tree bears bad fruit .
40007018	" A good tree cannot bear bad fruit ; neither can a worthless tree bear good fruit .
40007019	" Every tree which does not bear good fruit is cut down and cast into the fire .
40007020	" Hence it is by their fruit you will know them .
40007021	" Not everyone who says to me , Lord , Lord , will enter into the kingdom of heaven , but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven .
40007022	" Many in that day will say to me , " Lord , Lord , have we not prophesied in your name , and in your name cast out demons , and in your name done many mighty works ?
40007023	" Then I will tell them plainly , " I never knew you ; depart from me , you workers of iniquity .
40007024	" Every one who hears my words and does them I will liken to a wise man who built his house upon the rock .
40007025	" And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon the house , but it fell not , for it was founded upon the rock .
40007026	" And every one who hears these words of mine and does them not , I will liken to a foolish man , who built his house upon the sand .
40007027	" And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon that house , and it fell , and great was the fall of it . "
40007028	Now when Jesus had finished his discourse , the crowds were astounded at his teaching ,
40007029	for he was teaching them as one having authority , and not as their scribes taught them .
40008001	As he went down from the mountain , great crowds followed him .
40008002	And behold ! a leper came and knelt before him , saying , " Lord if you choose , you can make me clean . "
40008003	Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him " I do choose , " he said , " become clean , " and immediately he was cleansed of his leprosy .
40008004	Jesus said to him , " See that you tell no one , but go , show yourself to the priest , and offer the gift which Moses commanded , as an evidence to them . "
40008005	When he entered Capernaum , an army captain came , and entered him ,
40008006	saying , " Lord , my slave at home is lying ill with paralysis , in terrible agony . "
40008007	" I will come and heal him , " said Jesus .
40008008	" Lord , " said the captain in reply , " I am not worthy to have you under my roof , but speak the word only , and my slave will be cured ,
40008009	" For I myself also am a man under authority , and I have soldiers under me . To one man I say Go , and he goes ; to another , Come , and he comes ; and to my slave , Do this , and he does it . "
40008010	As Jesus listened to this reply he was astonished , and said to those who followed him . " In solemn truth I tell you that I have found faith like this in any Israelite .
40008011	" I tell you that many will come from the east and from the west , and sit down with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven .
40008012	" but the sons of the kingdom will be cast out into the outer darkness ; there will be the wailing and the gnashing of teeth . "
40008013	Then Jesus said to the captain . " Go ! As you have believed , so be it unto you . " And his slave was healed in that very hour .
40008014	When Jesus came into Peters house , he found his wifes mother prostrated with fever .
40008015	He touched her hand , and the fever left her ; and she arose and waited upon him .
40008016	At evening-time they brought to him many demoniacs . He cast out the demons with a word , and healed all who were ill ,
40008017	that the word spoken through Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled , He took upon himself our weaknesses , and bore the burden of our diseases .
40008018	When Jesus saw the great crowds about him , he had given directions to cross to the other side ,
40008019	when a Scribe came up and said to him , " Teacher , I will follow you wherever you go ! "
40008020	" Foxes have their holes , " answered Jesus , " and wild birds their roosting-places , but the Son of man has not where to lay his head . "
40008021	Another of his disciples said to him , " Lord , allow me first to go and bury my father , "
40008022	" Follow me , " Jesus said to him , " and leave the dead to bury their own dead . "
40008023	Then he went in board a fishing-boat , his disciples accompanying him ;
40008024	and behold , a sudden storm arose on the sea , so that the boat began to be buried by the waves .
40008025	But he was asleep . And they came and woke him , saying . " Lord save us ! We are drowning ! "
40008026	" Why are you afraid ? " he said , " you men of little faith ! " Then he rose and rebuked the winds and the sea , and there came a great calm .
40008027	But the men were amazed , saying , " What manner of man is this , that even the winds and the sea obey him ? "
40008028	When he arrived on the other side , in the country of the Gadarenes , he was met by two demoniacs who were coming out of the tombs . They were so violently fierce that no one dared pass along that road .
40008029	" You Son of God , " they shouted , " what have you to do with us ? Are you come to torment us before the time ? "
40008030	Now there was , at some distance from them , a herd of many swine feeding ;
40008031	and the demons began entreating him . " If you are driving us out , " they said , " send us into the herd of swine . "
40008032	He answered , " Go ! " So they came out of the men , and went into the swine , and behold ! the entire herd rushed headlong down from the cliff into the sea , and perished in the water .
40008033	The swineherds fled . They went away into the city and told all about it , and what had befallen the demoniacs .
40008034	At once all the citizens came out to meet Jesus ; and when they had seen him , they begged him to move away from their country .
40009001	So he went on board , crossed the sea , and came to his own city .
40009002	And here they brought to him a paralytic lying on a bed . When Jesus saw their faith he said to the paralytic , " Courage , son , your sins are forgiven . "
40009003	And behold ! certain scribes said to themselves , " This man is blaspheming . "
40009004	And because Jesus knew well their thought , he said .
40009005	" Why do you think evil in your hearts ? For which is easier , to say Your sins are forgiven , or to say , Rise and walk ?
40009006	" But that you may know that the Son of man has power on earth to forgive sins " - he then says to the paralytic , " Rise , take up your bed , and go to your home . "
40009007	And he rose and went to his home .
40009008	But all the crowd were awestruck , and glorified God , who had given such power to men .
40009009	As Jesus was passing thence , he saw a man called Mathew sitting at the tax-office , and said to him , " Follow me . "
40009010	And he rose and followed him . And while he was at table in Matthews house , there came many tax-gatherers and sinners , and they dined with Jesus and his disciples .
40009011	When the Pharisees saw it , they kept saying to his disciples , " Why does your Teacher eat with the tax-gatherers and sinners ? "
40009012	" It is not those who are well , " said Jesus , when he heard this , " but the sick , who need a doctor .
40009013	" But go and learn what this means , " It is mercy I desire , and not sacrifice ; for I am come not to call just men , but sinners . "
40009014	At that time the disciples of Johncame and asked him , " Why are we and the Pharisees always fasting , while your disciples are not ? "
40009015	" Can the friends fast at a wedding-feast , " said Jesus , " so long as the bridegroom is with them ? But the days will come when the bridegroom has been taken from them , and then they will fast .
40009016	" No one ever sews a piece of undressed cloth on an old cloak . If they did , the patch put on to fill it up would tear away from the cloak , and the rent be made worse .
40009017	" Nor do they put new wine into old wine-skins ; if they did , the wine-skins would split , the wine would run out , and the skins be ruined . Instead , they put new wine into fresh wine-skins and both are preserved . "
40009018	As he was saying these words to them , a ruler came up and knelt before him , saying . " My daughter has just died ; but come , put your hand upon her , and she will live . "
40009019	And Jesus rose and followed him , and so did his disciples .
40009020	But a woman who had had a hemorrhage for twelve years came up behind him , and touched the tassel of his cloak .
40009021	For she said to herself , " If only I can touch his cloak , I shall be cured . "
40009022	But Jesus turned and saw her and said , " Be of good courage , daughter , your faith has healed you . " And the woman was healed from that hour .
40009023	Now when Jesus had come into the house of the ruler , and had seen the flute-players and the wailing crowd , he said ,
40009024	" Leave the room , for the little girl is not dead , she is sleeping . " And they began laughing at him .
40009025	When , however , the crowd had been driven out , he went in and took her hand , and the little girl woke up .
40009026	And the report of this spread throughout that whole region .
40009027	And as he went on from thence two blind men followed Jesus , crying , " Have pity on us , Son of David ! "
40009028	And when he had gone indoors , they came to him . " Do you believe that I can do this ? " asked Jesus . " Yes , Lord , " they answered .
40009029	Then he touched their eyes , saying " According to your faith be it unto you , " and their eyes were opened .
40009030	Jesus charged them sternly , saying , " See to it that you let no one know . "
40009031	But they went and published his fame in that whole region .
40009032	And as they were departing a dumb demoniac was brought to him ,
40009033	and when he had driven out the demon , the dumb spoke . The crowds were amazed , saying , " Never was such a thing seen in Israel ! "
40009034	But the Pharisees kept saying , " It is in the power of the Prince of the demons that he is casting out demons . "
40009035	And Jesus continued to go throughout all the cities and towns , teaching in the synagogues , preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing every kind of disease and infirmity .
40009036	And when he saw the crowds he had compassion on them because they were distressed and fainting , like sheep without a shepherd .

40009038	" therefore beseech the Lord of the harvest to thrust forth laborers into his harvest field . "
40010001	And when he had called his twelve disciples to him , he gave them power over evil spirits , to cast them out , and to heal every kind of disease and infirmity .
40010002	These are the names of the apostles ( missionaries ) . First , Simon who is called Peter , and Andrew , his brother ; Jamesthe son of Zebedee , and John , his brother ;
40010003	Philip and Bartholomew ; Thomas , and Matthew , the tax-gatherer ; James , the son of Alphaeus , and Lebbaeus , whose surname is Thaddeus ;
40010004	Simon the Zealot , and Judas Iscariot who betrayed him .
40010005	These men , the Twelve , Jesus sent forth , after giving them the following instructions . " Do not go among the Gentiles , or enter any Samaritan town ,
40010006	" but rather be on your way to the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
40010007	" As you go , preach , saying , The kingdom of heaven is at hand .
40010008	" Heal the sick , raise the dead , cleanse the lepers , cast out demons . Freely you have received , freely give .
40010009	" Take no gold or silver or coppers in your purses ;
40010010	" not even a bag for the journey , or a change of clothes , or sandals , or even a stick ; for the worker is worth his rations .
40010011	" Into whatever city or town you enter , inquire for some worthy person there , and stay with him until you leave .
40010012	" When you enter the house , salute it ;
40010013	" and if the house is worthy let your blessing sit upon it ; but if it be unworthy , let your blessing return to you .
40010014	" And whoever will not receive you or listen to your words , as you go out from that house or that city , shake off the very dust from your feet .
40010015	" I tell you solemnly it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the Day of Judgment than for that town .
40010016	" Behold , it is I who am sending you forth like sheep among wolves . Be then as serpents and as guileless as doves .
40010017	" But beware of men ! For they will give you up to the Sanhedrin , and flog you in their synagogues .
40010018	" And you will be taken before governors and kings for my sake , as a testimony to them and to the Gentiles .
40010019	" But whenever they apprehend you , do not be anxious about how you shall speak or what you shall say ; for it will be given you in that very hour what to say .
40010020	" For it will not be you who is speaking , but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you .
40010021	" And brother will betray brother to death , and a father his child ; and children will rise up against their parents and put them to death .
40010022	" You will be hated by all men because of my name ; and he who endures to the end shall be saved .
40010023	" But when they persecute you in one city , flee to the next . In solemn truth I tell you that you shall not have completed the cities of Israel , before the Son of man comes .
40010024	" A pupil is not above his teacher , nor a slave above his masters .
40010025	" It is enough for the pupil to fare like his teacher , and the slave like his master . If they called the master of the house Beelzebub , how much more , the members of his household .
40010026	" So do not fear them ; for there is nothing concealed which shall not be revealed , nor anything secret which shall not become known .
40010027	" What I am telling you is in the darkness , do you speak in the light ; and what is whispered in your ear , proclaim upon the housetops .
40010028	" Do not be afraid of those who kill the body , but cannot kill the soul ; but fear rather him who can destroy both soul and body in Gehenna .
40010029	" Are not two sparrows sold for a half-penny ? Yet not one of them will fall to the ground without your father .
40010030	" The very hairs on your head are all numbered .
40010031	" Cease to be afraid ! You are of greater value than many sparrows .
40010032	" Every one , then , who will confess me before men , I also will confess before my Father who is in heaven .
40010033	" But whoever disowns me before men , I also will disown before my Father who is in heaven .
40010034	" Do not suppose that I am come to bring peace on the earth ; I am come not to bring peace , but a sword .
40010035	" For I came to set " a man against his father , a daughter against her mother , a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law ;
40010036	" and a mans own household will be his enemies .
40010037	" He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me ; and he who loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me ;
40010038	" and he who does not take his cross and follow after me is not worthy of me .
40010039	" He who has saved his life shall lose it ; and he who has lost his life for my sake shall find it .
40010040	" Whoever receives you is receiving me , and he who receives me is receiving Him who sent me .
40010041	" Whoever receives a prophet because he is a prophet , shall receive a prophets reward ; and whoever receives a righteous man , shall receive a righteous mans reward .
40010042	" And whoever gives to drink to one of these little ones a cup of cold water only , because he is a disciple , I tell you in solemn truth , he shall not lose his reward .
40011001	After finishing his instructions to his twelve disciples , Jesus left that place , in order to teach and to preach in the neighboring cities .

40012001	At that time Jesus walked through the wheatfields one Sabbath Day ; and his disciples were hungry , and began to pluck some ears of wheat and to eat them .
40012002	But the Pharisees , when they perceived it , said to him . " Look ! Your disciples are doing what it is not lawful to do on the Sabbath ! "
40012003	" Have you not read , " answered Jesus , " what David did when he was hungry , and his men , too ?
40012004	" How he went into the House of God , and there they ate the loaves of the Presence , which neither he nor his men were permitted to eat , but the priests only ?
40012005	" Have you not read in the Law how on the Sabbath the priests in the Temple break the Sabbath and are guiltless ?
40012006	" But I tell you that One is here who is greater than the temple .
40012007	" And if you knew what this means , " It is mercy I desire , not sacrifice ,
40012008	" you would not have condemned the guiltless . For the Son of man is Lord of the Sabbath . "
40012009	As he passed along he went into their synagogue , and there he saw a man with a withered hand .
40012010	And in order to get a charge against him they asked him , " Is it permitted to heal on the Sabbath ? " ( So that they might have something to accuse him . )
40012011	" Is there a man of you , " he replied , " who has but a single sheep , who will not lay hold of it and lift it out , if it falls into a pit on the Sabbath Day ?
40012012	" And how much more is a man worth than a sheep ? Therefore it is right to do good on the Sabbath . "
40012013	Then he said to the man , " Stretch out your hand . "
40012014	The man stretched it out , and it had become sound like the other . But when the Pharisees came out , they consulted together how they might destroy him .
40012015	So when Jesus knew it , he withdrew from that place , and numbers of people followed him .
40012016	He cured them all ; but he strictly forbade them to blaze abroad his doings ,
40012017	that the word spoken through Isaiah , the prophet , might be fulfilled .
40012018	Behold my servant whom I have chosen , My beloved , in whom my soul delights ; I will breathe my spirit upon him , and he shall announce justice to the Gentiles
40012019	He will not strive nor cry aloud , Nor shall anyone hear is voice in the streets
40012020	The bruised reed will not break ; The dimly burning wick will not quench ; Till he has led justice on to victory .
40012021	And in his name shall the Gentiles hope .
40012022	Then they brought to him a blind and deaf demoniac ; and he healed him , so that the dumb both spoke and saw .
40012023	And all the crowds were amazed , and he began to say , " Can this be the Son of David ? "
40012024	When the Pharisees heard it they said , " It is only by the aid of Beelzebub , the Prince of the demons , that this fellow is driving out demons . "
40012025	Because Jesus knew what was in their minds , he said to them . " Any kingdom divided against itself will become desolate ; and any city or household divided against himself will not stand .
40012026	" So if Satan drives out Satan , he is divided against himself ; how then will his kingdom stand ?
40012027	" And if I am casting out demons in the power of Beelzebub , in whose power do your sons cast them out ? So they themselves shall be your judges .
40012028	" But if it is in the power of the Spirit of God is already upon you .
40012029	" Or how can any one enter the strong mans house and carry off his goods without first binding the strong man ? Then he can rob his house .
40012030	" He who is not with me is against me ; and he who is not gathering with me , scatters .
40012031	" Therefore I tell you that every sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven men ; but the blasphemy against the Holy Spirit shall not be forgiven .
40012032	" And if any man say a word against the Son of man , it shall be forgiven him ; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit , it shall not be forgiven him , either in this age or in that which is to come .
40012033	" Either make the tree good and its fruit good , or make the tree corrupt and its fruit corrupt ; for by its fruit the tree is known .
40012034	" You generation of vipers ! How can you speak good , when you are evil ? For the mouth speaks what the heart is full of . " When the time of fruit drew near , he sent his slaves to the vine-dressers seized to get his fruit .
40012035	" A good man out of his good treasure brings forth good ; and from his evil treasure a bad man brings out evil .
40012036	" I tell you that for every careless word that men speak they shall give account on the day of judgment .
40012037	" For by your words you will each be justified , and by your words be condemned . "
40012038	Then some of the Scribes and Pharisees accosted him . " Teacher , " they said , " we want to see some sign from you . "
40012039	In reply Jesus told them . " An evil and faithless generation seeks a sign , and no sign will be given them except the sign of the prophet Jonah .
40012040	" For just as Jonah was three days and three nights in the sea-monsters belly , so the Son of man will be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth .
40012041	" The men of Nineveh will stand up in the Judgment with this generation and condemn it , because they repented under the preaching of Jonah , and lo ! a greater than Jonah is here !
40012042	" The Queen of the South will rise in the judgment with this generation , and condemn it , because she came from the ends of the earth to listen to the wisdom of Solomon ; and lo ! a greater than Solomon is here !
40012043	" Whenever an unclean spirit leaves a man , it wanders through waterless places , seeking rest but finding none .
40012044	" Then it says , " I will go back to my house which I left ; and on arrival finds it empty , swept , and garnished .
40012045	" Then it goes and brings with it seven other spirits worse than itself ; and they enter in and dwell there . And the last state of that man is worse than the first . So shall it be with this wicked generation . "
40012046	While he was still talking to the crowd , his mother and brothers were standing outside , desiring to speak to him .
40012047	So some one told him , " Your mother and brothers are standing outside , and wanting to speak to you . "
40012048	But he answered the man who told him , " Who is my mother and who are my brothers ? "
40012049	And stretching his hand toward his disciples , he said ,

40013001	On that same day , after Jesus had left the house , he took his seat on the seashore ;
40013002	and such a great crowd gathered about him that he got into a boat and sat in it , while all the crowd stood on the beach .
40013003	Then he told them many truths in parables . " Behold , " he said , " the sower went forth to sow ;
40013004	and as he sowed , some seed fell by the roadside , and the birds came and ate it .
40013005	Some fell on rocky ground where there was not much earth . Now because it had no depth of soil , it sprang up at once ;
40013006	but when the sun rose it was scorched , and withered away because it had no root .
40013007	Some fell among thorns , and the thorns sprang up and choked it .
40013008	But some fell on good soil , and bore a crop , some a hundredfold , some sixty , some thirty .
40013009	He who has ears , let him hear ! "
40013010	Now when his disciples came up to him , they said ,
40013011	" Why do you speak to them in parables ? " Jesus answered . " To you it has been granted to understand the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven ; but to them it has not been granted .
40013012	" For whoever holds , to him shall more be given , and he shall have abundance ; but whoever does not hold , from him shall be taken away even what he holds .
40013013	" This is why I speak to them in parables , because seeing they do not see , and hearing they do not hear , nor do they understand .
40013014	And in them is being fulfilled that prophecy of Isaiah which says . " Hearing you will hear and not understand ; Seeing you will see and not perceive ;
40013015	For the heart of his people is made fat , Their ears are dull of hearing ; Their eyes , too , have they closed , Lest some day their eyes should perceive , And their ears should hear , And their heart should understand and turn , And I should heal them .
40013016	" But happy are your eyes , because they see , and your ears because they hear .
40013017	" In solemn truth I tell you that many prophets and holy men have seen it not , and to hear what you are hearing , and have not heard it .
40013018	" Listen then , to the parable of the sower .
40013019	" Whenever any one hears the message of the kingdom , and does not understand it , the Evil One comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart .
40013020	" This is the seed sown by the wayside . And the word , and at once receives it with joy .
40013021	" But he has no root in himself ; he continues for a time , but when trouble arises , or persecutions , on account of the word , at once he stumbles and falls .
40013022	" And the seed sown among thorns is he who hears the word , but the anxieties of the age and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word , and it becomes unfruitful .
40013023	" But the seed sown in good soil is he who hears the word and understands it , who indeed bears fruit , and makes now an hundredfold , now sixty , now thirty . "
40013024	He told them another parable . " The kingdom of heaven , " he said , " is like a man who sowed good seed in his field ;
40013025	" but while men were asleep his enemy came and sowed tares among his wheat and went away .
40013026	" And when the blade shot up and formed the wheat-kernel , then the tares also appeared .
40013027	" The slaves of the owner went to him and said . " Was it not good seed , sir , that you sowed in your field ? From whence then , do you get tares ?
40013028	" It is an enemy who has done this , he answered . " The slaves said to him , Do you want us to go and collect them ?
40013029	" No , he answered , for fear lest while you are collecting the tares , you at the same time pull up the wheat .
40013030	" Let both grow together until harvest , and at harvest-time I will tell the reapers to first gather the tares and tie them in bundles for burning , but to bring all the wheat into my store-house . "
40013031	He set forth to them another parable , saying . " The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard-seed which a man took and planted in his field .
40013032	" This is indeed the smallest of seeds , but when it is grown it is greater than any herb , and becomes a tree , so that the winged things of the sky come and roost in its branches . "
40013033	He told them another parable . He said , " The kingdom of heaven is like leaven which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour , until the whole was leavened . "
40013034	Jesus told all this to the crowd in parables ; indeed he never spoke to them except in parables ,
40013035	in fulfilment of the word spoken by the prophet , I will open my mouth in parables , I will utter things kept secret since the foundation of the world . "
40013036	After he had sent the people away and gone into the house , his disciples came to him and said , " Explain to us the parable about the weeds in the field . "
40013037	" The sower of the seed , " he answered , " is the Son of man ;

40013040	" Just as the weeds are collected together and burnt with fire , so will it be at the end of the age .
40013041	" The son of man will send forth his angels , and they will gather out of his kingdom all hindrances , and whoever practises iniquity ,
40013042	" and will throw them into the fiery furnace . There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth .
40013043	" And then shall the just shine forth like the sun in the kingdom of their Father . Let him who has ears to hear , listen !
40013044	" The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure buried in the ground , which a man finds but buries again , and then in his joy goes and sells all that he has and buys that land .
40013045	" Again , the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant in search of beautiful pearls .
40013046	" When he finds one of great price , he goes and sells everything he has and buys it .
40013047	" Again , the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was cast into the sea and gathered fish of every kind .
40013048	" When it was full they hauled it upon the beach , and sat down and sorted the good fish into baskets , but threw the worthless fish away .
40013049	" So will it be at the end of the age . The angels will go forth and separate the wicked from the righteous , and fling them into the furnace of fire .

40013051	" Have you understood all this ? " he asked . " We have , " they answered him .

40013053	After Jesus had finished these parables , he withdrew from that place ,

40013055	" Is not this the carpenters son ? Is not his mother called Mary ? and his brothers Jamesand Joseph and Simon and Judas ?
40013056	" Are not his sisters all living among us ? Where , then , did he get all these powers ? "

40014001	Just then Herod , the Tetrarch , heard of Jesus fame , and said to his courtiers .

40014017	" We have nothing here , " they replied , " except five loaves and two fishes . "
40014018	" Bring them here to me , " said Jesus .
40014019	Then he told the people to sit down on the grass , and after taking the five loaves and the two fishes , he looked up to heaven and blessed them . Then he broke the loaves and handed them to the disciples , and the disciples handed them to the crowds .
40014020	And they all ate and were fully satisfied , and they took up of the fragments that remained , twelve basketfuls .
40014021	Those who had eaten were about five thousand men , besides women and children .
40014022	Then he made his disciples get aboard the boat and precede him to the other side , while he sent away the crowds .
40014023	After he had sent the crowds away , he went up into the mountain alone , to pray . When night came he was there alone .
40014024	But the boat was already a long way from shore , buffeted by the waves , for the wind was contrary .
40014025	And in the fourth watch of the night he came toward them , walking upon the sea ,
40014026	but when the disciples saw him walking upon the sea , they were terrified . " It is a phantom , " they said , and cried out for fear .
40014027	But at once Jesus spoke to them , " Courage , " he said , " it is I . Fear not . "
40014028	Peter answered , " Master , if it is you , bid me come to you upon the water . "
40014029	" Come , " said Jesus . Then Peter got down from the boat and walked on the water to go to Jesus .
40014030	But when he saw the wind , he was afraid , and as he began to sink , he cried out , " Master , save me ! "
40014031	At once Jesus stretched out his hand and caught hold of him , saying to him . " O little faith ! What made you doubt ? "
40014032	Then as they climbed into the boat the wind grew weary ,
40014033	and the men in the boat fell upon their knees before him , saying , " You are , indeed , the Son of God . "
40014034	Then they crossed over and came to land at Gennesaret ;
40014035	and when the men of that country recognized him , they sent into all the country round about , and brought to him all the sick ,
40014036	and kept begging him to let them touch the tassel of his cloak - and all who touched were completely cured .
40015001	Then some Scribes and Pharisees from Jerusalem came to Jesus , saying ,
40015002	" Why do your disciples keep transgressing the tradition of the elders by not washing their hands before eating ? "
40015003	" And why do you also keep transgressing the command of God by your tradition ? " he asked .
40015004	" For God said , Honor your father and mother , and , Let him who reviles father or mother be put to death ;
40015005	but you say that whoever tells his father or mother , Whatever of mine might have been of service to you is dedicated to God ,
40015006	is in no way bound to honor his father . Thus do you make void the word of God by your tradition !
40015007	Hypocrites ! Well did Isaiah prophesy concerning you , saying .
40015008	This is a people that honors me with their lips , But their heart is far from me .
40015009	In vain do they worship me , While they teach doctrines that are the commands of men . "
40015010	Then Jesus called the people to him and said .
40015011	" Listen , and pay attention . It is not what goes into a mans mouth that defiles him , but what comes out of it , that defiles the man . "
40015012	Then his disciples came to him and said , " Do you know that the Pharisees were scandalized when they heard that saying ? " He replied .
40015013	" Any plant that my heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted .
40015014	" Let them alone . They are blind men leading the blind ; and if one blind man leads another , both of them will fall into a ditch . "
40015015	Then Peter said to Jesus , " Explain the parable to us . "
40015016	He answered . " Are even you still without understanding ?
40015017	" Do you not know how all that goes into the mouth passes into the stomach and is afterward evacuated ;
40015018	while what comes out of the mouth comes from the heart - and that is what defiles a man .
40015019	For out of the heart come forth evil thoughts , murder , adultery , unchastity , theft , perjury , slander .
40015020	These are the things that defile a man ; to eat with unwashed hands does not defile a man . "
40015021	Jesus then left that place , and withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon .
40015022	Behold , there came to him a Canaanite woman of those parts . She wailed loudly , saying . " Pity me , Lord , thou Son of David ! My daughter is possessed of an evil spirit . "
40015023	But he answered her not a word . Then the disciples came up and kept beseeching him . " Send her away , " they said , " because she wails after us . "

40015031	so that the crowd wondered when they saw the dumb speaking , the cripples walking , and the blind seeing . And they glorified the God of Israel .
40015032	But Jesus called his disciples to him and said . " My heart yearns over the crowd , for they have been with me now three days , and they have nothing to eat . I am not willing to send them away hungry , for fear they faint on the road . "
40015033	" In a lonely place like this , " asked the disciple . " where can we get bread enough to satisfy such a crowd ? "
40015034	" How many loaves have you ? " answered Jesus . They replied , " Seven , and a few small fish .
40015035	So when he had summoned the crowd , and seated them upon the ground ,

40015039	When he had sent the crowds away , he got into the boat and came into the region of Magadan .
40016001	Then the Pharisees and Sadducees came to him , and in order to test him , asked him to show them a sign from heaven .
40016002	In answer he said . " In the evening you say , It will be fine weather , for the sky is red as fire ;
40016003	and at dawn you say , It will storm today , for the sky is red and lowering . You know how to discern the look of the sky , but the signs of the times you cannot read .
40016004	A wicked and faithless generation is seeking a sign , but no sign shall be given it but the sign of Jonah . " So he left them and went away .
40016005	When his disciples reached the other side of the lake , they had forgotten to bring bread .
40016006	Presently Jesus said to them , " Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees . "
40016007	And they began discussing it among themselves , saying , " It is because we did not bring any bread . "

40016009	" Do you not remember the five loaves for the five thousand , and how many large basketfuls you took up ?
40016010	" Nor the seven loaves for the four thousand , and how many large basketfuls you took up ?

40016013	When Jesus came into the neighborhood of Caesarea Philippi , he asked his disciples , " Who do people say that the Son of man is ? "

40017001	Six days later Jesus took with him Peter and Jamesand his brother John , and led them up a high mountain , by themselves apart .

40017026	And when he replied , " From aliens , " Jesus said . " Then their people go free .

40018001	At that hour his disciples came to Jesus and asked him , " Who is really greatest in the kingdom of heaven ? "
40018002	When he had called a little child to him , Jesus set him among them , and answered .
40018003	" In solemn truth I tell you that unless you turn and become like little children , you will not even enter the kingdom of heaven .
40018004	" Whoever therefore will humble himself like this little child , is greatest in the kingdom of heaven ;
40018005	" and whoever receives one such child for my sake , receives me .
40018006	" But whoever shall cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble , it would be better for him if a great millstone were hung about his neck , and he were drowned in the depths of the sea .
40018007	" Woe unto the world because of such stumbling-blocks ! They will surely come , but woe unto each man by whom they come !
40018008	" If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble , cut it off and cast it from you . It is better for you to enter into life maimed or crippled , than to keep both hands or both feet and be cast into the everlasting burning .
40018009	" If your eye keeps causing you to stumble , pluck it out and cast it from you . It is better for you to enter into life with only one eye , than to keep both eyes and be cast into the Gehenna of fire .
40018010	" See to it that you never despise one of these little ones , for I tell you that in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father in heaven .
40018011	" For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost .
40018012	" How does it seem to you , when a man has a hundred sheep and loses one of them ? Will he not leave the ninety and nine on the hills , to go and search for the one that has strayed ?
40018013	" And if he succeeds in finding it , I tell you solemnly that he rejoices over it more than over the ninety and nine that never strayed away .
40018014	" Just so it is not the will of my Father in heaven that one of these little ones should perish .
40018015	" If your brother sins against you , go and show him , between yourself and him alone . If he listens , you have won your brother .
40018016	" But if he will not listen to you , take one or two others along , so that by the testimony of two or three witnesses every word may be established . If he will not listen to them , tell the church ;
40018017	" but if he will not heed the church , let him be to you as a Gentile or a tax-gatherer .
40018018	" I tell you all in solemn truth that whatever you forbid upon earth will be forbidden in heaven , and whatever you permit on earth will be permitted in heaven .
40018019	" And again I tell you that if two of you on earth symphonize your praying concerning anything for which you have asked , it shall be done for you by my Father in heaven .
40018020	" For wherever there are two or three gathered together in my name , there am I among them . "
40018021	Just then Peter came to him , and asked him , " Lord , how often shall my brother sin against me , and I forgive him ? till seven times ? "
40018022	" I do not tell you till seven times , " answered Jesus , " but till seventy times seven .
40018023	" Thus the kingdom of heaven may be compared to a king who wished to settle accounts with his slaves .
40018024	" But when he began to settle , one of them was brought before him who owed him fifteen million dollars .
40018025	" And since he was unable to pay , his master ordered him to be sold , and his wife and children and all that he had , toward the payment of the debt .
40018026	" Thereupon his slave threw himself on his knees before him , crying , " Have patience with me , and I will pay you all !
40018027	" So then the master pitied his slave , and let him go , and forgave him his debt .
40018028	" But on his way out , that slave met a fellow slave who owed him fifty dollars . Seizing him by the throat , and nearly choking him , he exclaimed , " Pay me what you owe me !
40018029	" Then his fellow slave fell at his feet , and besought him , saying , " Be patient with me , and I will pay you .
40018030	" But he would not ; on the contrary he went and threw him into prison until he should pay the debt .
40018031	" When therefore his fellow slaves saw what had happened , they were very angry ; and they went and explained to their master all that had happened .
40018032	" Immediately his master summoned him and said . " You wicked slave ! I forgave you all that debt because you implored me .
40018033	" Ought not you also to have had pity on your fellow slave , just as I had pity on you ?
40018034	" Then in hot anger his master handed him over to the torturers , until he should pay him all his debt .
40018035	" So will my heavenly Father do to you also , unless from your heart each one of you forgive his brother . "
40019001	It came about after Jesus had finished these teachings , that he removed from Galilee , and went to that part of Judea which lay across the Jordan .
40019002	A great multitude followed him , and he healed them there .
40019003	Presently some of the Pharisees came up to him , and made test of him by asking , " Is it right for a man to divorce his wife for every cause ? "
40019004	" Have you not read . " he answered , " that He who created them from the beginning made them male and female , and said ,
40019005	" For this cause shall a man leave his father and his mother and shall cleave to his wife ; and the two shall be one flesh ?
40019006	" Thus they are no longer two , but one . Therefore what God has joined together , let not man separate . "
40019007	They answered , " Why then did Moses command the husband to give her a written bill of divorce , and so to put her away ? "
40019008	" Moses , " said Jesus , " permitted you to divorce your wives on account of the hardness of your hearts , but from the beginning it was not so .
40019009	" And I tell you that any man who divorces his wife for any cause except her unfaithfulness , and marries another woman , commits adultery . "

40019011	He answered them . " Not all are accepting this teaching , but only those to whom it has been granted .
40019012	" For there are eunuchs who have been such from birth ; others who have been made such by men ; and others who have made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of God . He who is able to receive this , let him receive it . "
40019013	Then young children were brought to him , that he might lay his hands on them and pray . His disciples interfered , but Jesus said to them .

40019018	" Which commandments ? " asked the man . Jesus replied . " Thou shalt not kill ; Thou shalt not commit adultery ; Thou shalt not steal ; Thou shalt not bear false witness ;
40019019	" Honor thy father and thy mother ; and , Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself . "

40019030	" But many who are first shall be last , and many who are last shall be first .
40020001	" For the kingdom of heaven is like a householder who went out at dawn to hire workmen for his vineyard .
40020002	" And when he had agreed with the workmen for two shillings a day , he sent them into his vineyard .
40020003	" About nine oclock he went out and noticed some other workmen standing idle in the market-place ;
40020004	" and he said to them , " Do you also go into the vineyard , and whatever is just I will pay you .
40020005	" So they went . Again at noon , and about three oclock , he went out and did the same thing .
40020006	" When he went out about five oclock , he found others standing around , and said to them , " Why have you been standing here idle , all the day long ?
40020007	" Because no one has hired us , they replied . " He said to them , Do you also go into the vineyard .
40020008	" And when evening came , the Lord of the vineyard said to his steward , " Call the workmen and pay them their wages , beginning with the last hired and ending with the first .
40020009	" When those came who had begun at five oclock , they received two shillings apiece ;
40020010	" and when the first came they supposed that they would get more , but they also received each two shillings .

40021001	And when they approached Jerusalem , and had reached Bethphage on the Mount of Olives , then Jesus sent two disciples , saying to them .

40021023	When he had entered the Temple courts , and was teaching , the high priests and elders of the people came to him and asked him , " By what authority are you doing these things , and who gave you this authority ? "
40021024	Jesus answered . " I also will put a question to you , which , if you tell me , I also will tell you by what authority I am doing these things .
40021025	Johns baptism , whence was it , from heaven or from man ? " So they began debating about it among themselves .
40021026	" If we say , From heaven , he will ask us , Why then did you not believe him ? But if we say , From men , we are afraid of the crowd , for they all regard Johnas a prophet . "

40021033	" Listen to another parable . " A man who was a householder planted a vineyard , fenced it about , dug a wine vat in it , built a tower , then rented it to vine-dressers and went abroad .
40021035	" And the vine-dressers seized his slaves , flogged one , killed another , and stoned a third .

41004017	but because they have no root in themselves they last for a time ; but when suffering or persecution ensues because of the Word , they at once fall away .
41004018	There are others who are sown among thorns .
41004019	When they have heard the Word , the anxieties of life and the snares of wealth , and all sorts of other ambitions , come in to choke the Word , so that it proves unfruitful .
41004020	But those , on the other hand , who were sown on that good soil , are those who listen to the Word , and welcome it , and bear fruit , thirty , sixty , or a hundredfold . "
41004021	He went on to say . " Is the lamp brought in to be put under the bushel or the bed ? Is it not rather to be put on the lamp-stand ?
41004022	There is nothing hidden except what is to be disclosed , and nothing concealed except what is to be revealed .
41004023	If any man has ears to hear , let him hear . "
41004024	And he said to them . " Take heed what you hear . With what measure you measure it will be measured to you , and more will be given to you .
41004025	For he who holds , to him will more be given , and he who holds not , from him will be taken even what he holds . " " It is with the kingdom of God , " he continued , " as if a man should have sown seed in the earth ;
41004027	night and day he sleeps and wakes while the seed is sprouting and growing tall , he knows not how .
41004028	Of its own accord the earth bears its crops ; first the blade , then the ear , then the full grain in the ear .
41004029	Then as soon as the crop is ready the man has the sickle put in at once , because harvest-time is come .
41004030	" To what shall we compare the kingdom of God ? " he said again . " in what parable shall we set it forth ?
41004031	It is like a mustard-seed , which , when sown in the soil , is the smallest seed in the world ;
41004032	yet when sown shoots up and becomes larger than any plant , sending out such branches that the wild birds build their nests under its shadow . "
41004033	With many such illustrations Jesus used to tell his message to people as far as they were able to receive it ;
41004034	and to them it was his practice never to speak except in parables . But he used to explain everything in private to his disciples .
41004035	On the evening of that same day Jesus said to them , " Let us go across to the other side . "
41004036	So , leaving the crowd behind , they took him with them just as he was in the boat ; and the other boats were with him .
41004037	But a great gale of wind came up , and the waves were dashing into the boat so that it began to fill .
41004038	Now he himself was sleeping on the cushion in the stern , so they woke him up , saying , " Master , do you not care if we perish ? "
41004039	And he awoke , rebuked the wind , and said to the sea , " Peace , be still ! "
41004040	The wind fell , and there ensued a great calm . Then he said to them . " Why are you so afraid ? Have you still no faith ? "
41004041	Then they were awestruck , and said one to another , " Who can this be , that even the wind and the sea obey him ! "
41005001	Then they came to the country of the Gadarenes , on the opposite side of the sea ;
41005002	and he had no sooner stepped out of the boat , than a man out of the tombs came to meet him , a man with an unclean spirit ,
41005003	who lived among the tombs .
41005004	Not even with a chain could any man bind him , for he had been bound with fetters and chains again and again , and had snapped the chains , and broken the fetters ; and there was no one strong enough to master him .
41005005	And always , night and day , he remained among the tombs and in the mountains , shrieking and gashing himself with stones .
41005006	As he caught sight of Jesus from afar , he ran and knelt before him ,
41005007	and with a shriek he cried out in a loud voice . " Jesus , son of God most high , what business have you with me ? I adjure you by God , torment me not ! "
41005008	For Jesus was saying , " Foul spirit , come out of the man . "
41005009	He continued asking him , " What is your mane ? " " Legion is my name , for we are many . "
41005010	Over and over he continued to beg Jesus not to send them away out of the country .
41005011	Now there was on the hillside a great drove of swine feeding .
41005012	So the spirits begged him , saying , " Send us into the swine , that we may enter into them . "
41005013	And he gave them leave . And out came the foul spirits and entered the swine ; and the drove rushed down from the steep into the sea , in number about two thousand , and were choked in the sea .
41005014	On this the swineherds ran away and spread the news in town and country . So the people went to see what had happened .
41005015	When they got to Jesus they found the demoniac sitting there clothed and in his right mind - the man who had had the " Legion " - and they were awestruck .
41005016	And those who had been eye-witnesses told them what had happened to the demoniac and to the swine .
41005017	Then they began to beg Jesus to depart from their district .
41005018	As he was getting into the boat the man who had been demon-possessed kept begging to go with him ; but he said ,
41005019	" Go home to your own people , and tell them what great things God has done for you , and has had mercy upon you . "
41005020	So he went and began to publish abroad in the District of the Ten Towns all that Jesus had done for him ; and every one was astonished and all men marveled .
41005021	Then after Jesus had recrossed in a boat to the other side , a vast multitude came crowding around him ; so he stayed on the seashore .
41005022	Then one of the wardens of the synagogue , named Jairus , came up , and as soon as he saw Jesus , fell at his feet , with many entreaties ,
41005023	" My little daughter , " he said , " is dying . I beseech you , come and lay your hands on her , that she may recover and live . "
41005024	So he went with him , and a great crowd followed him and thronged about him .
41005025	Now there was a woman who had had a hemorrhage for twelve years ,
41005026	and had suffered many things of many physicians , and had spent all that she had , but was no better ; on the contrary , rather grew worse .
41005027	She had heard about Jesus , so she came in the crowd behind and touched his cloak .
41005028	" If I can touch even his clothes , " she kept saying to herself , " I shall get well . "
41005029	At once the fountain of her blood was dried up , and she felt in her body that she was cured of her complaint .
41005030	Jesus , instantly conscious that the power within him had gone forth , turned about in the crowd , and said , " Who touched my clothes ? "
41005031	" You see the crowd thronging about you , " said his disciples , " and yet you say , Who touched me ? "
41005032	But he kept looking about to see who had done it ,
41005033	and the woman knowing what had happened to her , came in fear and trembling , and fell down before him , and told him all the truth .
41005034	" Daughter , " he said , " your faith has saved you . Go in peace , and be cured of your complaint . "
41005035	While he was still speaking men came from the house of the warden of the synagogue to tell him , " Your daughter is dead , why trouble the Teacher any further ? "
41005036	But Jesus , paying no attention to the remark , said to the warden of the synagogue , " Have no fear , only believe . "
41005037	He would not permit any one to go with him , except Peter and Jamesand John , the brother of James .
41005038	As they came to the house of the warden of the synagogue , he gazed upon a tumult , many weeping and wailing shrilly .
41005039	" Why all this tumult and loud weeping ? " he asked .
41005040	" The child is not dead , but asleep . " And they began to laugh him to scorn . Then he put them all outside , took the father and mother of the child and those he brought with him , and entered the room where the child was lying .
41005041	Then he took the childs hand and said to her , " Talitha , cumi , " that is to say , " Little girl , I am speaking to you ; arise ! "
41005042	And instantly the little girl stood up , and began to walk , for she was twelve years old , They were at once beside themselves with utter amazement .
41005043	He , however , repeatedly cautioned them not to let any one know about it , and directed them to give her something to eat .
41006001	Jesus left that place , and accompanied by his disciples , came into his own part of the country .
41006002	When it came Sabbath he began to teach in the synagogue ; many , as they listened , were deeply impressed . " Where did he get all this ? " they asked ; " What is the wisdom that is given to this man , and miracles such as these that happen at his hands ?
41006003	Is not this the carpenter , the son of Mary , and the brother of Jamesand Joses and Judas and Simon ? And are not his sisters here with us ? "
41006004	So they disapproved of him . Then Jesus said to them , " A prophet is not without honor except in his native land and among his relatives and in his home . "
41006005	And he was unable to do any miracle there , except that he laid his hands on a few sick folk and healed them .
41006006	And he wondered at their lack of faith . So he went among the neighboring villages , teaching .
41006007	Then summoning the Twelve to him , he began to send them out two by two , giving them authority over unclean spirits .

41006009	they were to wear sandals , but not to put on two tunics .
