41006011	and if any place does not receive you , or listen to you , as you go out of it shake off the dust under your feet , as a warning to them . "
41006012	So they fared forth and summoned men to repentance .
41006013	They cast out many demons , and anointed many sick people with oil and cured them .
41006014	King Herod heard it , for the name of Jesus had become well known , People were saying , " Johnthe Baptist is risen from the dead , and on that account these powers are working in him . "
41006015	" He is Elijah , " said others . And still others were saying , " He is a prophet , like one of the old prophets . "

41006019	So Herodias hated him , and wished to put him to death ;
41006020	but she could not , for Herod was afraid of Johnbecause he knew that he was a just and holy man . So he kept him safe . When he listened to Johnhe was much exercised , yet he found pleasure in listening to him .
41006021	Then came a convenient day , when Herod on his birthday held a feast for his lords and generals and the leading men of Galilee ,
41006022	at which the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced . She charmed Herod and his guests . " Ask me whatever you want , " said the king to the young girl , " and I will give it to you . "

41006024	So she came out and said to her mother , " What shall I ask for ? " " The head of Johnthe Baptist , " she replied .
41006025	So she at once hurried in to the king and made her request , " I want you , " she said , " to give me , without delay , the head of Johnthe Baptist on a charger . "
41006026	Then the king was exceedingly sorry ; yet on account of his oaths and his guests he was unwilling to disappoint her .
41006027	So he sent at once a soldier of the guard with orders to bring his head .
41006028	And he went and beheaded Johnin prison , brought his head on a platter , and gave it to the young girl , and she gave it to her mother .
41006029	When Johns disciples heard of this , they came , and took his body , and laid it in a tomb .
41006030	When the apostles had come back to Jesus , they told him all the things they had done , and all they had taught .
41006031	Then he said to them , " Come apart , yourselves , to a quiet spot , and rest a while . " For there were many coming and going , and they could not get time even to eat .
41006032	So they sailed away privately to a solitary place .
41006033	However , many saw them going , and recognized them , and ran together by land from all the neighboring towns , and arrived there first .
41006034	So when Jesus landed he saw a vast multitude , and he was moved with compassion for them , because they were like sheep without a shepherd , and he began to teach them many things .
41006035	Then when the day was now far spent , his disciples came to him and said . " This place is desert , and the day is now far spent .
41006036	Send the people away so that they may go to the farms and villages about here , and buy themselves something to eat . "
41006037	In answer he said to them , " You yourselves are to give them food . " " Are we to go and buy fifty dollars worth of bread , " they said , " and give them food ? "
41006038	" How many loaves have you ? " he answered . " Go and see . " When they had found out , they said , " Five , and two fishes . "
41006039	Then he directed them to make all sit down by companies on the green grass .
41006040	And they sat down like beds in a garden , by hundreds and by fifties .
41006041	Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes , and looking up to heaven he blessed , broke the loaves in pieces , and kept giving to the disciples to distribute .
41006042	The two fish also he divided to them all .
41006043	All ate and had enough ; and they carried away broken fragments of bread and of fish , enough to fill twelve baskets .
41006044	Those who ate the bread were five thousand adult men .
41006045	Then he at once compelled the disciples to embark in the boat and go before him to Bethsaida on the other side , while he sent the people away .
41006046	After he had taken leave of them , he went away into the mountain to pray .
41006047	And when evening came , the boat was half-way across the sea , while he was on shore alone ;
41006048	but when he saw them distressed in rowing ( for the wind was against them ) , about the fourth watch of the night he went to them , walking upon the sea ,
41006049	they thought it was an apparition and shrieked aloud , for they all saw him and were terrified .
41006050	But he at once spoke with them , saying . " Courage ! It is I . Do not be afraid ! "
41006051	Then he got into the boat beside them , and the wind ceased , and they were utterly astounded ,
41006052	for they had not understood about the loaves ; on the contrary their heart was hardened .
41006053	When they had crossed over they landed at Gennesaret and moored to the shore .
41006054	As soon as they got out of the boat , the people at once recognized him ,
41006055	and began running over that whole country , and carrying the sick about on their beds , wherever they heard he was .
41006056	And whenever he entered into villages or cities or the fields they would lay the sick in the market-places and beseech him to let them touch even the tassel of his cloak , and all who touched him were made well .
41007001	One day the Pharisees came to him in a body with some Scribes who had come from Jerusalem .
41007002	They had noticed that some of his disciples were eating with " common , " that is to say , unwashed hands .
41007003	For the Pharisees and all of the Jews do not eat until they have ceremoniously washed their hands in obedience to the tradition of the elders ;
41007004	and when they come from the market-place they do not eat without bathing first . and they have many other customs which they have received and observe , such as the washing of cups and jugs and copper pans .
41007005	So the Pharisees and Scribes asked him . " Why do your disciples not follow the traditions of the elders ? Why do they eat with common unwashed hands ? "
41007006	" Well did Isaiah prophesy of you , hypocrites , " he answered . " As it is written , " This people honor me with their lips , While their hearts are far from me ;
41007007	But in vain do they worship me , For their teaching is only human precepts .
41007008	" You neglect the commandment of God , and hold fast the traditions of men . "
41007009	" It is praiseworthy , is it , " he exclaimed , " to reject the command of God that you may keep your tradition !
41007010	For although Moses said , Honor your father and mother , and Let him who curses father or mother suffer death ,
41007011	you say that if a man tells his father or mother , This money which otherwise you would have received from me , is Korban ( that is , a thing devoted to God ) ,
41007012	you exempt him from doing any service for his father or mother .
41007013	Thus by your tradition which you have handed down you set at naught the word of God ; and you do many other things like that . "
41007014	Then again he called the crowd to him and said .
41007015	" Listen to me , all of you , and understand ; there is nothing outside a man which by entering in can defile him ; but it is what comes from him that defiled him . "
41007017	After he had left the crowd and gone indoors his disciples began asking him about the parable .
41007018	" Are even you without understanding ? " he said . " Do you not perceive that nothing whatever from without can defile a man by entering him ,
41007019	because it does not go into his heart , but into his belly , and passes away , ejected from him ? " By these words he pronounced all foods clean .
41007020	" What comes out of a man , " he continued , " is what defiles him .
41007021	From within , from the heart of man , proceed evil purposes -
41007022	fornication , theft , murder , adultery , greed , malice , deceit , wantonness , envy , slander , arrogance , reckless folly -
41007023	all these wicked things issue from within and defile a man . "
41007024	After he rose and left that place , he went away into the region of Tyre and Sidon . Here he went into a house and wished no one to know it but he could not be hid .
41007025	Forthwith a woman whose little daughter was possessed by an unclean spirit , heard of him , and came and fell at his feet
41007026	( the woman was a Greek , a Syro-phoenician by race ) , and again and again she begged him to cast the demon out of her daughter .
41007027	" Let the children be filled first , " he said to her . " It is unseemly to take the childrens bread and throw it to the dogs . "
41007028	" True , Master , " she answered , " but the dogs under the table do pick up the childrens crumbs . "
41007029	" For that saying of yours , go home , " he replied ; " the demon has departed from your daughter . "
41007030	So she went home , and found the child lying in her bed and the demon departed .
41007031	Again he left the region of Tyre , and passed through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee , crossing the District of the Ten Towns .
41007032	And they brought to him a deaf man who stammered , and begged him to lay his hands upon him .
41007033	So Jesus took him aside from the crowd , by himself , and put his finger in the mans ears , and moistened his tongue with saliva ;
41007034	then looking up to heaven with a sigh , he said to him , " Ephphatha ! " ( that is , " Be opened . " )
41007035	And his ears were opened and the bond of his tongue was loosened , and he spoke plainly .
41007036	Then Jesus charged them not to tell any one , but the more he charged them , the more they published it ;
41007037	and people were amazed beyond measure saying . " How successfully he does things ! Even the deaf he makes to hear , and the dumb to speak . "
41008001	In those days when a large crowd had again assembled and had nothing to eat , Jesus called together his disciples and said to them .
41008002	" My heart aches for the crowd , because they have remained with me three days now , and they have nothing to eat ;
41008003	and if I send them away fasting to their homes , they will faint on the way . Moreover , some of them are from a distance . "
41008004	" Where will it be possible , " answered his disciples , " for one to fill these men with bread in a lonely place like this ? "
41008005	He asked them , " How many loaves have you ? " " Seven , " they said .
41008006	So he directed the crowd to sit down on the ground ; and when he had taken the seven loaves , he gave thanks , broke them , and gave to his disciples to distribute to the crowd .
41008007	They had also a few small fish ; after blessing these he told his disciples to distribute them also .

41008011	And the Pharisees came out and began to question him , seeking from him a sign from heaven , by way of testing him .

41009001	" In solemn truth I tell you , " he said , " there are some standing here who shall not taste death till they see the kingdom of God , come with power . "

41009019	" O unbelieving generation ! " replied Jesus ; " how long must I be with you ? How long must I be patient with you ? Bring him to me . "

41009038	" Master , " said John , " we saw a man casting out demons in your name , and we tried to stop him because he did not follow us . "
41009039	" Do not try to stop him , " Jesus answered , " for there is no one who performs a miracle in my name who can soon speak evil of me .
41009040	He who is not against us is for us .
41009041	For whoever gives you even a cup of water to drink because you belong to Christ , in solemn truth I tell you , that he shall certainly not lose his reward .
41009042	" And if any one shall cause one of these little ones who believe on me to stumble , it would be better for him if he were thrown out into the sea with a great millstone about his neck .
41009043	" If your hand cause you to stumble , cut it off ! It is better to be maimed and to enter into life than to have two hands and go away into hell , into the fire that cannot be put out .
41009045	If your foot cause you to stumble , cut it off ! It is better to enter into the life a cripple , than to have two feet and be cast into hell .
41009047	If your eye cause you to stumble , tear it out ! It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God one-eyed that to keep both your eyes and be cast into hell ,
41009048	where their worm never dies and the fire does not go out .
41009049	For by fire every one will be salted ;
41009050	salt is excellent , but if the salt has lost its savor , what will you use to restore its saltness ? Then have salt in yourselves , and be at peace with one another . "
41010001	On leaving that place Jesus came into the borders of Judea , on the other side of the Jordan , Once more the people flocked about him , and again , as usual , he began teaching them .
41010002	Presently some Pharisees came up and tested him , by asking if it was lawful for a man to divorce his wife .
41010003	" What did Moses command you ? " he replied ,
41010004	" Moses , " said they , " permitted a man to draw up a bill of separation and divorce her . "
41010005	But Jesus said to them . " Moses gave you that command because of the hardness of your hearts ;
41010006	but from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female .
41010007	" For this cause a man shall leave his father and his mother , and shall cleave to his wife ; and the two shall become one flesh ;
41010008	so that they are no more two , but one flesh .
41010009	What therefore God has joined together , let not man put asunder . "
41010010	When indoors the disciples began to question Jesus again about this , and he said .
41010011	" Any man who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery against her ;
41010012	and if she divorces her husband and marries another man , she commits adultery . "
41010013	Now people were bringing little children to Jesus for him to touch them ; but the disciples rebuked them .
41010014	Jesus was indignant when he saw it , and said . " Let the little children come to me . Do not hinder them ; for the kingdom of God belongs to such .
41010015	I tell you true that unless a man receives the kingdom of God as a little child , he shall not even enter it . "
41010016	Then he took them in his arms , and laid his hand upon them in blessing .
41010017	As he started to go forth into the road , a man came running up to him , and knelt down before him . " Good Teacher , " he asked , " what must I do to inherit eternal life ? "
41010018	Jesus said to him . " Why do you call me good ? No one is good save one , God himself .
41010019	You know the commandments . Do not murder , do not commit adultery , do not steal , do not bear false witness , do not cheat , honor your father and mother . "
41010020	" Teacher , " he answered , " I have observed all these from my youth . "
41010021	Jesus loved him as he looked at him , and said . " One thing you lack . Go , sell all you have and give to the poor ; and you shall have wealth in heaven ; and come , follow me . "
41010022	But his face fell at these words , and he went away saddened , for he was one who had great wealth .
41010023	Then Jesus looked round on his disciples and said , " How hard it is for those who have wealth to enter into the kingdom of God ! "
41010024	The disciples were amazed at his words . Jesus looked around and said again to them .
41010025	" My sons , how hard it is for those who trust in money to enter the kingdom of God . It is easier for a camel to get through the eye of a needle , than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven . "
41010026	" Then who can be saved ? " they said to themselves astonished beyond measure .
41010027	When he had looked at them , Jesus said , " With men it is impossible , but not with God , for all things are possible with God . "
41010028	" But we , " Peter began to say , " we have left our all and have followed you . "
41010029	" I tell you solemnly , " said Jesus , " that there is no man who has left house , or brothers , or sisters , or mother , or father , or children , or lands , for my sake and the gospels ,
41010030	but shall receive a hundred times as much , now in this present world , houses , brothers , sisters , mothers , children , lands-and persecutions with them - and in the world to come eternal life .
41010031	But many who are first shall be last , and the last , first . "
41010032	They were still on the road going up to Jerusalem , and Jesus led the way ; and they were amazed , and some , although they followed , were afraid . Then once more he took the Twelve , and began to tell them what was about to befall him .
41010033	" See , " said he , " we are going up to Jerusalem and the Son of man will be betrayed to the high priests and the Scribes . They will condemn him to death , and will hand him over to the Gentiles ,
41010034	who will mock him , spit upon him , flog him , and put him to death ; and after three days he will rise again . "
41010035	Presently there came up to him Jamesand John , the sons of Zebedee , and said , " Teacher , we wish you would do for us whatever we ask you . "
41010036	" What is it you want me to do for you ? " said he .
41010037	They answered , " Allow us to sit , one at your right hand , and the other at your left hand , in your glory . "
41010038	" You know not what you are asking , " said Jesus . " Can you drink the cup that I drink , or be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with ? "
41010039	They answered him , " We can . " " You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink , and with the baptism that I am baptized with shall you be baptized ,
41010040	but a seat upon my right hand or my left is not mine to grant , but it is for those for whom it has been reserved . "
41010041	When they heard this the ten began to be indignant at Jamesand John , so Jesus called them to him and said .
41010042	" You know that those who are regarded as rulers among the Gentiles lord it over them , and their great ones make them feel their authority .
41010043	Not so shall it be among you . On the contrary whoever would become great among you shall be your servant ;
41010044	and whoever among you would be first , shall be slave of all ,
41010045	and justly , for even the Son of man came not to be served , but to serve , and to give his life , a ransom for many . "
41010046	Then they reached Jericho ; and as he was leaving Jericho with his disciples and a great crowd , Bartimeus , the son of Timaeus , a blind beggar , was sitting beside the road .
41010047	Hearing that it was Jesus of Nazareth , he began shouting and saying , " Jesus , thou son of David , have mercy on me ! "
41010048	and many kept rebuking him and telling him to be quiet , but he only shouted much louder , " Son of David , have mercy on me ! "
41010049	Then Jesus stood still , saying , " Call him . " So they called the blind man , and said , " Courage , rise , he is calling you . "
41010050	The man threw off his cloak , sprang to his feet , and came to Jesus .
41010051	" What do you want me to do ? " said Jesus , addressing him . And the blind man answered , " O Rabboni , that I might receive my sight ! "
41010052	" Go , " said Jesus , " your own faith has saved you , " and immediately he received his sight , and began to follow Jesus along the road .
41011001	Now when they were approaching Jerusalem , near Bethphage and Bethany , at the Mount of Olives ,
41011002	Jesus sent two of his disciples and told them . " Go to that village in front of you , and immediately on entering it you will find a colt tied , upon which no man has ever sat ; untie him and bring him here .
41011003	And if any man asks you , Why are you doing that ? " answer , The Lord has need of him , and he will immediately send him back . "
41011004	So they went and found a colt tied outside a door , in the open street , and untied it .
41011005	And some of the bystanders began to say to them , " What are you trying to do , untying that colt ? "
41011006	So they answered them just as Jesus had told them , and they let them take it .
41011007	Then they brought the colt to Jesus , and when they had thrown cloaks upon it , Jesus seated himself on it .
41011008	Then many spread their cloaks on the road , and others , soft leafy branches , which they had cut from the fields ;
41011009	and those who went before him and those who came after kept shouting . " Hosanna ! Blessed be He who comes in the name of the Lord !
41011010	Blessed be the coming kingdom of our father David ! Hosanna , in the highest ! "
41011011	Then he entered Jerusalem and went into the Temple , and after he had looked around at everything , as the hour was now late , he went out to Bethany with the Twelve .
41011012	The next day after leaving Bethany he was hungry ,
41011013	and seeing a fig tree in the distance full of leaves , he came to see if he could find anything on it , and found on it nothing but leaves ( for it was not the time of figs ) .
41011014	So , addressing the tree , he said , " Let no man ever more eat fruit from you . " And the disciples heard it .
41011015	Presently they reached Jerusalem , and , after entering the Temple courts , Jesus began to drive out those who were buying and selling there , and to upset the tables of the money-changers , and the stalls of those who sold doves ,
41011016	and he would not allow any one to carry a vessel through the Temple courts , Then he began to teach .
41011017	" Is it not written , " he said , " My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations ? But you have made it a den of robbers . "
41011018	The chief priests and the Scribes heard this , and they began to seek means of destroying him ; for they were afraid of him because all the crowd were greatly struck with his teaching .
41011019	Now every evening he used to go outside the city ;
41011020	and as they ( he and his disciples ) were passing along in the morning , they saw the fig tree already withered from the root .
41011021	Then Peter remembered , and exclaimed , " Look , Rabbi , the fig tree which you cursed is withered up . "
41011022	" Take hold on Gods faithfulness , " said Jesus to them in reply .
41011023	" In solemn truth I tell you that if any one shall say to this mountain , Up and hurl yourself into the sea ! and shall not doubt in his heart , but on the contrary shall believe that what he says will happen , it will be granted him .
41011024	That is why I am telling you that whatever you ask for in prayer , believe that you have received it , and it shall be yours .
41011025	And whenever you stand up to pray , forgive , if you have anything against any one , that so your Father also who is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses . "
41011027	Once more they came into Jerusalem ; and as he was walking in the Temple courts , there came to him the high priests and Scribes and elders and asked him .
41011028	" By what authority do you do these things ? or who gave you this authority to do these things ? "
41011029	" And I will put one question to you , " replied Jesus . " Answer this , and I will tell you by what authority I do these things .
41011030	The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or from men ? Answer me ! "
41011031	Then they began arguing with one another . " If we say , From heaven , he will ask , Why then did you not believe him ? "
41011032	On the other hand , if we say , From men ! " They were afraid , however , of the people , for every one held that Johnhad been really a prophet .
41011033	So their answer to Jesus was , " We do not know . " " Neither will I tell you , " said Jesus , " by what authority I do these things . "
41012001	Presently Jesus began to speak to them in parables . " There was once a man , " he said , " who planted a vineyard , put a fence around it , dug a pit for the wine-press , built a tower , rented it to tenants , and went abroad .
41012002	At vintage-time he sent a slave to the vine-dressers to collect some of the proceeds of the vineyard ;
41012003	but they seized him , and flogged him , and sent him away empty-handed .
41012004	Then he sent another slave to them ; and this man they knocked over the head and handled shamefully .
41012005	And he sent another ; and him they killed ; and many others ; beating some , and killing some .
41012006	He had still one , a Son beloved , He sent him last to them , saying , " They will reverence my Son .
41012007	" But those tenants said to themselves . Here is the heir ! Come , let us kill him , and the inheritance will be ours .
41012008	" So they took him and killed him , and threw his body out of the vineyard .
41012009	What will the owner of the Vineyard do ? " " He will come and put the tenants to death , " they said , " and will give the vineyard to others . "
41012010	" Have you not read this Scripture ? " ( he continued ) " The very stone which the builders rejected Has now become the corner-stone ;
41012011	This is the Lords doing ; It is marvelous in our eyes . "
41012012	And they kept seeking to lay hold on him , but were afraid of the crowd , for they knew well that he had spoken this parable about them ; so they left him and went away .
41012013	But they sent some of the Pharisees to Jesus afterward , and some of the Herodians to entrap him in conversation .
41012014	So when they came , they said . " Teacher , we know that you are sincere and are not afraid of any one , for you do not regard the face of men ; nay , but you reach the way of God in truth . Is it right to pay poll-tax to Caesar or not ?
41012015	Shall we pay , or not pay ? " But he , knowing well their hypocrisy , said to them . " Why are you testing me ? Bring me a dollar for me to look at . "
41012016	And they brought it . " Whose likeness and inscription is this ? " " Caesars , " they answered .
41012017	And Jesus said , " Render to Caesar the things that are Caesars , and to God , the things that are Gods . " They were amazed at him .
41012018	Then came up some Sadducees , men who say there is no resurrection . They too questioned him , saying .
41012019	" Teacher , Moses taught us that if a mans brother die , and leave a wife behind him , but no child , that his brother is to marry the widow and to raise up a family for his brother .
41012020	There were once seven brothers , the eldest of whom married a wife , and died leaving no family .
41012021	The second married her , and died without offspring ; the third likewise ;
41012022	and the seven had her , and died without issue .
41012023	And last of all the woman too died . In the resurrection whose wife shall she be ? For the seven had her as wife . "
41012024	" Is not this the reason for your error , " Jesus answered them , " that you know not the Scripture nor the power of God ?
41012025	When they rise from the dead men do not marry , and women are not given in marriage , but they are as the angels are in heaven .
41012026	But in regard to the rising again of the dead , have you never read in the Book of Moses , in the passage about the Bush , how God spoke to him , saying , " I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ?
41012027	God is not the God of the dead , but of the living . You are in grave error . "
41012028	Just then up came one of the Scribes who had heard them arguing , and realized that Jesus had answered them admirably . " What commandment , " he asked , " is the first of all ? "
41012029	Jesus replied . " The first is . " Hear , O Israel , the Lord our God is one Lord ;
41012030	and thou shalt love the Lord thy God , with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy mind , and with all thy strength .
41012031	" The second is this , " Thou shall love thy neighbor as thyself . Other command greater than these there is none . "
41012032	" Admirably said , O Teacher , " exclaimed the Scribe . " You have truthfully said that He is one ,
41012033	and that beside him there is none other , and to love him with all ones heart and with all ones understanding and with all ones might , and to love ones neighbor as oneself is far beyond all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices . "
41012034	Jesus saw that he had answered with discrimination , and said to him , " You are not far from the kingdom of God . " After that no one ventured to question him .
41012035	While he was teaching in the Temple courts , Jesus in his turn asked . " How is it that the Scribes say that the Christ is the son of David ?
41012036	David himself said in the Holy Spirit , " The Lord said to my Lord , Sit at my right hand until I make thy foes the footstool of thy feet .
41012037	" David himself then calls him Lord ; so how can he be his son ? " Now the great mass of the people were wont to listen to him with delight ;
41012038	and in his teaching he said . " Look out for the Scribes who like to walk about in long robes , and to receive salutations in the street , and to have prominent places in the synagogues ,
41012039	and seats of honor at dinner-parties ;
41012040	they who consume the property of widows and make long , pretentious prayers . The greater shall their condemnation be . "
41012041	Then Jesus took his seat opposite the treasury and watched the people putting their offerings into the chest . Many rich people were putting in large sums .
41012042	There came also a poor widow who dropped in two little coins , worth a cent .
41012043	On this he called his disciples to him , and said . " I tell you solemnly that this poor widow has put in more than all who have put their offerings into the treasury ;
41012044	for they have all put in what they could spare out of their surplus , but she , out of her penury , has put in all that she possessed , her whole living . "
41013001	As Jesus was walking out of the Temple courts , one of his disciples said to him , " Look , Teacher , what wonderful stones and buildings these are ! "
41013002	" You see these mighty buildings ? There shall not be left here one stone upon another which shall not be thrown down , " he answered .
41013003	When he had seated himself on the Mount of Olives , facing the Temple , Peter and Jamesand Johnand Andrew asked him privately ,
41013004	" Tell us when these things shall be , and what shall be the sign that all these predictions are about to be fulfilled . "
41013005	So Jesus began to tell them .
41013006	" Be ye watchful lest any one mislead you . Many will come in my name , saying , I am he , and will mislead many .
41013007	But when you hear of wars and rumors of wars do not be dismayed , such things must come , but the end is not yet .
41013008	For nation shall rise in arms against nation , and kingdom against kingdom . There will be earthquakes in various places , and famines ; these are the beginning of birth-pangs .
41013009	" You yourselves must be on your guard . They will hand you over to the courts , and you will be flogged on the synagogues ; and you will stand before rulers and kings for my sake , to witness to them for me .
41013010	But the gospel must first be proclaimed to all the nations .
41013011	When , however , they are leading you all to trial , do not worry beforehand about what you are to say , but whatever is given you in that hour , that say , for it is not you who speak , but the Holy Spirit .
41013012	" And brother will betray brother to death , and a father his child , and children will rise up against their parents , and have them put to death .
41013013	You will be hated by all men for my names sake , but he that endures to the end shall be saved .
41013014	" But when you see the Abomination of Desolation standing where he ought not ( let the reader ponder this ) , then let those in Judea flee to the mountains ;
41013015	let him who is on the housetop not go down , nor go in to get anything out of his house ;
41013016	and he who is in the field , let him not turn back to get his cloak .
41013017	And alas for the pregnant women , and for those that are nursing their infants in those days !
41013018	Pray that it may not come in the winter .
41013019	For those will be days of suffering the like of which has never been from the beginning of Gods creation until now , and never shall be .
41013020	And had not the Lord cut short those days , not a single person would escape ; but for the elects sake whom he has chosen , he has cut them short .
41013021	" At that time if any one tell you , See , here is Christ , or See , there he is , do not believe it ;
41013022	for false Christs and false prophets will arise and will show signs and wonders , to lead astray the very chosen , if they can .
41013023	Be on your guard ! I have told you it all beforehand .
41013024	" But when the tribulation is past , in those days the sun will be darkened and the moon will not shed her light ,
41013025	and the stars will be falling from the sky , and the powers in the heavens will be shaken .
41013026	Then will they see the Son of man coming in clouds , with great power and glory .
41013027	Then he will send forth the angels and gather his chosen from the four winds , from uttermost earth to uttermost sky .
41013028	" From the fig tree learn now her parable ; as soon as ever her branches are full of sap and bursting into leaf , you know that summer is near .
41013029	So also do you , whenever you see these things happening , know that He is near , at your very door .
41013030	I tell you truly that the present generation shall not pass until all these things begin to happen .
41013031	Earth and sky shall pass away , but my words shall not pass away .
41013032	But concerning that day or that hour no one knows , not even the angels in heaven ,
41013033	nor the Son , but only the Father .
41013034	Take heed ! Awake ! for you never know the time . As a man gone abroad and leaving his house gives authority to his slaves , to each his task ;
41013035	and orders the porter to keep watch ; keep watch then , for you do not know when the master of the house is coming - in the evening , at midnight , at cockcrow , or in the morning -
41013036	lest he should come unexpectedly and find you sleeping ;
41013037	and what I say to you , I say to all . Be awake and on guard . "
41014001	Now two days later was the feast of the Passover and of Unleavened Bread . Both the chief priests and the Scribes were continually seeking how they might arrest him by a stratagem and kill him ;
41014002	but , " Not on a feast-day , " they said , " for fear there should be a riot among the people . "
41014003	And while he was in Bethany , in the house of Simon the Leper , while he was dining , a woman came with an alabaster vase of very costly , pure spikenard perfume , and , breaking the vase , she poured the perfume on his head .
41014004	Some of those who were present said among themselves indignantly . " Why has the perfume been wasted like this ?
41014005	That perfume could have been sold for more than one hundred and fifty dollars , and given to the poor . "
41014006	So they began upbraiding her , but Jesus said . " Let her alone . Why are you troubling her ?
41014007	She has done a beautiful thing to me . For you always have the poor among you , and can show them kindness whenever you wish , but me you will not always have .
41014008	She has done what she could . she has before time anointed my body for my burial .
41014009	I tell you in solemn truth that wherever the gospel is preached throughout the whole world , there what she has done shall be told in remembrance of her . "
41014010	Now Judas Iscariot , one of the Twelve , went away to the high priests to betray Jesus to them ;
41014011	and they were glad when they heard it , and promised to pay him money . So he kept looking for an opportunity to betray him .
41014012	And the first day of the feast of Unleavened Bread , the day for killing the paschal lamb , his disciples asked him , " Where do you want us to go and make preparation for you to eat the Passover ? "
41014013	Then he sent two of his disciples , and told them . " Go into the city , and you will meet a man carrying a jar of water .
41014014	Follow him ; and whatever house he enters , say to the master of the house , The Teacher asks , " Where is your guest-chamber , where I may eat the Passover with my disciples ? "
41014015	He will himself show you a large , upper room , furnished and ready . there make preparation for us . "
41014016	So the disciples went off , and came into the city , and found everything as he had told them .
41014017	So they made ready the Passover , and as night fell he came , with the Twelve .
41014018	While they were at the table , eating , Jesus said solemnly . " It is one of you who will betray me - one who is eating with me . "

41014020	" It is one of the Twelve , " said Jesus , " one who is dipping into the same dish with me .
41014021	For the Son of man is going his way , as the Scripture says , but woe to that man through whom the Son of man is betrayed ! It were good for that man if he had never been born . "
41014022	And as they were eating he took bread , and after the blessing , broke it , and gave it to them , saying , " Take it , this is my body . "

41014024	and he said . " This is my covenant blood , which is poured out for many .
41014025	Solemnly I tell you I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine , until that day I drink it new in the kingdom of God . "

41014027	And Jesus said to them . " All of you are about to stumble , for it is written , " I will smite the shepherd , and the sheep shall be scattered abroad .

41014029	" Although they all stumble and fall , yet will not I , " answered Peter .
41014030	Jesus said to him , " I tell you in solemn truth that you yourself , today on this very night , before the cock crow twice , shall three times disown me . "
41014031	But Peter kept protesting passionately , " Though I must die with you , I will not disown you ! " And they all kept saying the same .
41014032	So they came to a place named Gethsemane , and he said to his disciples , " Sit down here while I pray . "
41014033	Then he took Peter and Jamesand Johnwith him , and began to be full of terror and distress ;
41014034	and he said to them . " My soul is full of anguish , even unto death ; wait here , and keep watch . "
41014035	So he went a little farther , and throwing himself upon the ground , he prayed repeatedly that , if it were possible , the hour might pass away from him .
41014036	" Abba , Father , " he said , " all things are possible with thee . Take this cup away from me . Yet not what I will , but what thou wilt . "
41014037	Then he came and found them asleep , and he said to Peter . " Are you sleeping , Simon ? Could you not keep watch one hour ?
41014038	Keep watch , all of you , and pray that you may not come into temptation ; the spirit is willing , but the flesh is weak .
41014039	Then he went away again and prayed , saying the same words ;
41014040	and when he returned he found them once more asleep , for their eyes were heavy with sleep , and they knew not what to say to him .
41014041	Then he came the third time , and said . " Sleep on now , and take your rest ! It is over . My hour is come . Look ! the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
41014042	Rouse yourselves , let us go . See ! my betrayer is at hand . "
41014043	At that instant , while he was yet speaking , Judas , one of the Twelve , came up , and with him a mob armed with swords and clubs , sent by the high priests and Scribes and elders .
41014044	Now the betrayer had given them a sign . " The one I kiss , " he said , " is the man . Arrest him , and take him away safely . "
41014045	So he came and going straight up to Jesus he said .
41014046	" Rabbi , " and kissed him . Then they laid hands on him and took him .
41014047	But one of the bystanders drew his sword , and struck the slave of the high priest , and cut off his ear .
41014048	But Jesus interposed , saying . " Are you come out to arrest me with swords and clubs , as if I were a robber ?
41014049	Day after day I was face to face with you in the Temple courts , teaching , and you did not seize me . But this is done that the Scriptures might be fulfilled . "
41014050	Then they all forsook him and fled .
41014051	One young man , however , began following him , with only a linen sheet thrown round his naked body .
41014052	They seized him , but he left the linen sheet and fled away naked .
41014053	Then they took Jesus to the high priest , and all the chief priests and elders and Scribes came with him .
41014054	Peter also had followed Jesus at a distance , until he was inside the court of the high priest . There he was sitting among the officers , warming himself in the light of the fire .
41014055	Meanwhile the high priests and all of the Sanhedrin were trying to get evidence against Jesus , so as to have him put to death , but they found none ;
41014056	for though many gave false witness against him , their testimony did not agree .
41014057	Some came forward and swore falsely , saying ,
41014058	" We heard him say , I will tear down this temple made by hands , and in three days I will build another temple not made by hands . "
41014059	But even their evidence did not agree .
41014060	Then the high priest rose and stood forth among them . " Have you no answer to make ? " he asked Jesus ; " What is it that these testify against you ? "
41014061	But he remained silent , and answered nothing . Again the high priest questioned him . " Are you the Christ , " he said , " the Son of the Blessed ? "
41014062	" I am , " Jesus answered , " and you all shall see the Son of man seated on the right hand of Power , and coming with the clouds of heaven . "
41014063	Then the high priest tore his vestments . " Why do we need any further witness ? " he exclaimed .
41014064	" Did you hear his blasphemy ? What is your verdict ? "
41014065	Then they all condemn him to be worthy of death . Some began to spit on him , and to blindfold him while striking him and saying , " Prophesy . " The officers , too , received him into custody with blows .
41014066	Now while Peter was below in the courtyard , there came one of the maid servants of the high priest , and saw Peter warming himself .
41014067	She looked at him , and said , " You too were with the Nazarene , Jesus . "
41014068	But he denied it . He said . " I dont know , I dont understand what you are saying . " Then he went out into the porch , and the cock crew .
41014069	Again the maid servant saw him , and began again to tell the bystanders , " He is one of them . "
41014070	A second time he continued to deny it . After a little the by-standers began to say to Peter again , " Surely you are one of them , for you are a Galilean . "
41014071	But he began with curses an solemn oaths to say , " I do not know the man you are talking about . "
41014072	At that instant for the second time a cock crew . Then Peter recalled the word which Jesus had spoken to him , " Before the cock crows twice you will disown me thrice . " And as he thought of it , he began to weep aloud .
41015001	As soon as it was down , after the high priests had conferred with the elders and the whole Sanhedrin , they bound Jesus , and took him away , and handed him over to Pilate .
41015002	Pilate questioned him , " Are you the King of the Jews ? " In reply Jesus said , " It is as you say . "
41015003	When the chief priests continued making many accusations against him , Pilate repeatedly questioned him .
41015004	" Do you make no answer ? " he said ,
41015005	" See , how many accusations they are making . " But Jesus no longer made any answer , at which Pilate wondered .
41015006	Now at the time of the feast it was customary to release to them a prisoner , whatever one they asked for .
41015007	A man named Barabbas was there in prison , with some rioters who had committed murder during an uprising .
41015008	So when the crowd went up and began asking Pilate to follow his usual custom ,
41015009	he asked them , " Do you wish me to release the King of the Jews ? "
41015010	For he recognized that it was through spite that the high priests had handed him over .
41015011	But the chief priests incited the crowds to have Barabbas released to them , instead .
41015012	So Pilate spoke to them once more , " What them shall I do to him you call King of the Jews ? "
41015013	Then they shouted again , " Crucify him ! "
41015014	" Why , what wrong has he done ? " Pilate kept saying . But they shouted furiously , " Crucify him ! "
41015015	So Pilate , who wished to make himself strong with the crowd , released Barabbas to them , and gave Jesus over for crucifixion , after he had scourged him .
41015016	The soldiers then led him away into the courtyard ( Praetorium ) , and called together the whole battalion .
41015017	They clothed Jesus in purple , and plaited a crown of thorns , and placed it on his head .
41015018	Then they began to salute him . " Hail , King of the Jews , " they said .
41015019	They kept striking him on the head with a rod , and spitting upon him ; and on bended knee they did him homage .
41015020	And after their sport with him , they stripped off the purple robe , and put on his own clothes , and led him out to crucify him .
41015021	Simon a Cyrenian , a passer-by , who was coming from the country ( the father of Alexander and Rufus ) , they commandeered to carry the cross of Jesus .
41015022	So they led him to the place called Golgotha - a name which means " the place of a skull . "
41015023	There they attempted to give him wine mingled with myrrh ; but he refused it . Then they crucified him , and divided his garments among them , casting lots upon them to see what each should take .
41015025	It was nine oclock in the morning when they crucified him .
41015026	Over his head there was written the words of the charge against him . " The King of the Jews "
41015027	Now with him they crucified two robbers , one on his right hand and one on his left .
41015029	And the passers-by kept jeering at him , wagging their heads and saying . " Ah ! you who were to destroy the sanctuary and rebuild it in three days , save yourself !
41015030	Come down from the cross !
41015031	In the same way the high priests also , as well as the Scribes , kept on mocking him to themselves . " He saved others , " they said , " but himself he cannot save .
41015032	The Christ ! The King of Israel ! Let him now come down from the cross , that we may see and believe . " They also who had been crucified with Jesus kept reviling him .
41015033	At noon a darkness came over the whole country , lasting until three in the afternoon .
41015034	At three oclock Jesus cried in a loud voice , " Eloi , Eloi , lama sabachthani ? " which means , " My God , my God , why hast thou forsaken me ? "
41015035	When they heard this , some of the bystanders said , " Listen , he is calling for Elijah . "
41015036	Then a man ran and filled a sponge full of sour wine , and put it on a stick , and offered it to him to drink , saying , " Wait , let us see whether Elijah will come to take him down ! "
41015037	But Jesus uttered a loud cry and expired .
41015038	And the curtain of the Sanctuary was torn in two from top to bottom .
41015039	Then the army captain , who was standing facing Jesus when he thus died , said , " in truth this man was a Son of God . "
41015040	There were some women also watching from a distance . Among them were both Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of Jamesthe younger and of Joses , and Salome ,
41015041	women who used to follow him when he was in Galilee , and minister to him ; and many other women who had come up to Jerusalem with him .
41015042	Toward sunset , as it was the preparation ( that is the day preceding the Sabbath ) ,
41015043	there came Joseph of Arimathea , a Councilor , honorable in rank , who was himself also looking for the kingdom of God . He boldly went in to Pilate to ask for the body of Jesus .
41015044	But Pilate wondered whether he were already dead . So he summoned the army captain , and inquired if he had been any time dead ;
41015045	and when he learned the fact from the army captain he gave the body to Joseph .
41015046	So Joseph bought him a sheet , and took Jesus down , wound him in the sheet , and laid him in a tomb which had been hewn out of a rock , and then rolled a stone against the opening of the tomb ;
41015047	and Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses were watching to see where he was laid .
41016001	When the Sabbath was past , Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James , and Salome brought spices in order to go and anoint him .
41016002	And very early in the morning , on the first day of the week , they came to the tomb as the sun was rising ;
41016003	and they kept saying to one another , " Who will roll away the stone for us from the door of the tomb ? "
41016004	But then as they looked up they saw that the stone , which was a very large one , was already rolled away ;
41016005	and upon entering the tomb they saw a young man sitting on the right side , clothed in a white robe .
41016006	They were terrified , but he said to them . " Do not be terrified ! You are seeking Jesus the Nazarene , who was crucified ? He is risen ; he is not here . See , the place where they laid him !
41016007	But go , tell his disciples and Peter , " He is going before you into Galilee , where you will see him , as he told you . "
41016008	So they went out , and ran from the tomb , for they were trembling and amazed ; and they said nothing to any one , for they were afraid -
41016009	Now after his resurrection , early on the first day of the week he appeared first to Mary Magdalene , from whom he had driven out seven demons .
41016010	She went and told those who had been with him , as they mourned and wept .
41016011	But they , although they heard that he was living and had been seen by her did not believe it .
41016012	After this he appeared in another form to two of them as they were walking on their way into the country .
41016013	They too went , and told the others ; but they did not believe them , either .
41016014	Afterward he appeared to the Eleven themselves , as they were eating , and reproached them for their lack of faith , and stubborn hearts , because they disbelieved those who had seen him risen .
41016015	And he said to them . " Go into all the world and preach the gospel to the whole creation .
41016016	He who believes and is baptized shall be saved , but he who disbelieves shall be condemned .
41016017	Moreover these signs shall follow those who believe . They shall drive out demons in my name ; they shall speak with new tongues in foreign languages ;
41016018	they shall pick up serpents , and if they drink any poison it shall not hurt them ; they shall lay hands on the sick and they shall recover . "
41016019	So then the Lord Jesus , after he had spoken to them , was taken up into heaven , and sat down at the right hand of God .
41016020	But they went forth and preached everywhere , the Lord working with them , and confirming the message by the miracles which followed .
42001001	Seeing that many have taken it in hand to draw up an account of those matters which have been fully established among us ,
42001002	just as they reported them to us , who were from beginning eye-witnesses and ministers of the word ,
42001003	it seemed good to me also accurately , from the very beginning , to write them to you in order , most excellent Theophilus ,
42001004	so that you may know the certainty of the story which you have been taught by the word of mouth .
42001005	In the reign of Herod , King of Judea , there was a certain priest , named Zachariah , belonging to the class of Abijah . He had a wife named Elizabeth ,
42001006	who was a descendant of Aaron . They were both righteous in the sight of the Lord , walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the law , blameless .
42001007	Now they had no child , for Elizabeth was barren , and both were far advanced in years .
42001008	Now while Zachariah was acting as priest before God in the due course of his class , it fell to his lot , according to the custom of priesthood ,
42001009	to enter into the sanctuary of the Lord and to burn incense .
42001010	And the whole multitude of the people were without , praying at the hour of incense .
42001011	Then there appeared to him an angel of the Lord , standing on the right side of the altar of incense .
42001012	And as he saw him Zachariah was troubled , and fear fell upon him .
42001013	But the Angel said to him . " Do not be afraid , Zachariah , because your petition has been heard , and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son , and you are to call him John .
42001014	" And he shall be to you a joy and an exultation , and many shall rejoice over his birth .
42001015	" For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord , " He shall drink neither wine nor strong drink , " He shall be filled with the Holy Spirit from the hour of his birth ,
42001016	" And shall win many of the sons of Israel to the Lord , their God .
42001017	" He shall go before Him in the wisdom and power of Elijah to turn the hearts of the fathers to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous , and so to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him . "
42001018	" How shall I be sure of this ? " said Zachariah to the Angel . " For I am an old man and my wife is advanced in years . "
42001019	" I am Gabriel , " answered the angel , " who stand in the presence of God ; and I have been sent to speak to you and to bring and to bring you this good news .
42001020	" And now you shall be silent and unable to speak until the day the day when this has taken place ; because you did not believe my words - Words which will be fulfilled at their appointed time . "
42001021	Meanwhile the people were waiting for Zachariah and wondering why he stayed so long in the sanctuary .
42001022	And when he came out he could not speak to them , and then they knew that he had seen a vision in the sanctuary . He kept making signs to them and remained dumb .
42001023	As soon as his term of priestly service was ended he went home ;

42001030	when the angel said to her . " Fear not Mary , for you have found grace with God .

42001034	And Mary said to the angel . " How can this be ? For I have no husband ? "

42001045	" And blessed is she who believed that the Lords words spoken to her would be fulfilled . "

42004002	He ate nothing during these days , and at the close of them he was hungry .

42004004	And Jesus answered him , saying , " It is written that not by bread alone shall man live . "
42004005	And the devil led him up and showed him all the kingdoms of the inhabited earth in an instant of time , and the devil said to him .
42004006	" To you will I give all this authority and this glory ; for it has been handed over to me , and I give it to whomever I wish .
42004007	" If then you will worship me , it shall all be yours . "
42004008	" It is written , " answered Jesus , " Thou shalt worship the Lord , thy God , and him only shalt thou serve . "
42004009	Then he brought him to Jerusalem , and caused him to stand upon the Temple roof , and said to him . " If you really are the Son of God throw yourself down here ;
42004010	for it is written , " He shall give his angels charge of thee , to guard thee safely ;
42004011	" They will bear thee up in their hands , Lest thou dash thy food against a stone . "
42004012	" It has been said , " replied Jesus , " Thou shalt not tempt the Lord , thy God . "
42004013	So , after exhausting on him every kind of temptation , the devil left him for a time .
42004014	Then Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee , and his fame spread throughout all the surrounding country ,
42004015	and he began to teach in their synagogues , and was glorified by all .
42004016	Then he came to Nazareth where he had been brought up . and , as was his custom , he entered into the synagogue on the Sabbath Day , and stood up to read .
42004017	And there was handed him the roll of the prophet Isaiah ; and unrolling it he found the place where it was written ,
42004018	The Spirit of the Lord is upon me Because He has anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor , He has sent me to proclaim release to the prisoners , And recovery of sight to the blind ; To set at liberty those that are bruised ,
42004019	To proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord .
42004020	Then rolling up the papyrus , he gave it back to the attendant and sat down .
42004021	The eyes of all in the synagogue were fixed on him , and he began to say to them , " Today is this scripture fulfilled in your hearing . "
42004022	And they all spoke well of him , and marveled at the words of charm that fell from his lips . " Is not this the son of Joseph ? " they asked .
42004023	Jesus answered . " Doubtless you will quote the proverb to me , " Physician , heal thyself ! Do also here in your own country all that we hear that you have done in Capernaum . "
42004024	" I tell you in solemn truth , " he added , " that no prophet is acceptable in his own country .
42004025	In very truth I tell you there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah , when the heavens were closed for three years and six months , when a great famine came over all the land ;
42004026	" yet Elijah was not sent to any one of them , but only to a widow in Zarephath in Sidon .
42004027	" And there were many lepers in Israel in the days of the prophet Elisha , yet none of them was cleansed but only Naaman the Syrian . "
42004028	When they had heard these words , those in the synagogue were filled with fury ;
42004029	they rose , hurried him outside the town , and brought him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built , intending to cast him down headlong .
42004030	But he , passing through the midst of them , took his departure .
42004031	Then he went down to Capernaum , a city of Galilee , and continued to teach the people on the Sabbath Days .
42004032	They were deeply impressed by his teaching because his speech was with authority .
42004033	And there was in the synagogue a man possessed by the spirit of a foul demon . He cried out , in a loud voice , saying .
42004034	" Ha ! Jesus of Nazareth , what business have you with us ? Are you come to destroy us ? I know you who you are , you holy one of God ! "
42004035	And Jesus rebuked him , saying . " Be quiet ! Come out of him . " And when the demon had thrown the man down before them , he came out of him without doing him any harm .
42004036	All were amazed , and began to ask one another , saying . " What is this word ? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits and they come out . "
42004037	And the talk about him spread into every locality in the surrounding country .
42004038	Now when he rose and left the synagogue , he entered into the house of Simon , where Simons mother-in-law lay sick of a great fever . And they kept entreating him for her .
42004039	And he stood over her and rebuked the fever , and it left her ; and at once she arose and ministered unto them .
42004040	At sunset all they who had any sick with any sort of disease brought them to him ; and he laid his hands on every one of them and healed them .
42004041	Demons also came out of many , screaming and saying , " You are the Son of God . " But he rebuked them , and did not permit them to speak , because they knew that he was the Christ .
42004042	And when it was daybreak he left the town , and went away to a solitary place ; and the crowd kept seeking him . Coming at length upon him , they attempted to detain him so that he should not leave them .
42004043	But he said to them . " I must preach the gospel of the kingdom of God to the other towns also ; for that is what I was sent to do . "
42004044	So he continued to preach in the synagogues of Galilee .
42005001	On one occasion when he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret , the crowd pressed upon him to listen to the word of God .
42005002	But he saw two fishing-boats on the shore of the lake ; the fishermen had disembarked and were washing their nets .
42005003	He went on board one of the boats which belonged to Simon , and asked him to push out a little way from land . Then he sat down and continued to teach the crowd from the boat .
42005004	When he had finished speaking , he said to Simon , " Push out into deep water , and let down your nets for a haul . "
42005005	" Master , " answered Simon , " although we toiled all night , we took nothing ; but at your bidding I will let down the nets . "
42005006	And when they had done this they enclosed a great multitude of fish ; and their nets began to break .
42005007	So they motioned to their partners in the other boat to come and help them . They came and filled both boats , so that they began to sink .
42005008	When Simon Peter saw this he fell down at the knees of Jesus , exclaiming , " Depart from me , O Lord , for I am a sinful man ! "
42005009	( For he was amazed , and all who were with him , at the haul of fish which they had made ;
42005010	and so were Simons partners , Jamesand John , sons of Zebedee . ) But Jesus answered Simon . " Fear not ; from this time on , you will be catching men . "
42005011	So when they had brought their boats to land they left everything and followed him .
42005012	Another time when he was in one of their cities , there was a man there full of leprosy . And he , upon seeing Jesus , fell on his face and implored him . " Lord , " he said , " if only you choose you can make me clean . "
42005013	And he stretched out his hand and touching him , said . " I do choose ; be made clean . "

42005022	Conscious of their cavilings , Jesus answered , saying .

42005024	But that you may know that the Son of man has authority on earth to forgive sins ( he said to the paralytic ) , " I bid you rise , take up your bed , and go to your house . "
42005025	And instantly he arose up before them , took up what he had been lying on , and went away to his house , glorifying God .

42005028	He rose , left everything , and followed him .
42005029	Levi also made him a great reception at his house . There was a large party of tax-gatherers and others who were dining with them .
42005030	And the Pharisees and their scribes began complaining to his disciples , saying , " Why are you eating and drinking with tax-gatherers and sinners ? "
42005031	Jesus answered them saying . " They who are well have no need of a physician , but they who are ill .

42005034	" Can you make the bridal party fast , " he asked , while the bridegroom is still with them ?
42005035	" But there is coming a day when the Bridegroom will have been taken away from them ; then at that time they will fast . "
42005036	He also told them a parable . " No one , " he said , " tears a piece from a new garment , and patches it upon an old one ; otherwise he will tear the new garment , and the patch from the new will not mend the old .
42005037	" Nor does any one pour new wine into old wine-skins ; otherwise the new wine will burst the skins , and will itself be spilled , and the skins be destroyed
42005038	" But new wine must be put into fresh wine-skins
42005039	" And no man after drinking old wine , wishes for new ; for he says , " The old is better . " "
42006001	It happened that on a Sabbath he was going through the wheat-fields . His disciples were picking the ears and eating the wheat , rubbing it out with their hands .
42006002	And some of the Pharisees asked , " Why are you doing what it is not lawful to do on the Sabbath ? "

42006020	Then raising his eyes upon his disciples he began to say to them . " Blessed are you poor , For the kingdom of God is yours .
42006021	" Blessed are you who are hungry now , For you shall be filled . " Blessed are you who are wailing now , For you shall laugh .
42006022	" Blessed are you when men shall hate you , And excommunicate you and reproach you , and cast out your name as evil because of the Son of man .
42006023	" Rejoice in that day and exult , For your reward is great in heaven ; For even so did their fathers to the prophets .
42006024	" But woe to you rich ! For you already have received your consolation .
42006025	" Woe unto you who are full now ! For you shall suffer hunger . " Woe to you who are laughing now ! For you shall wail and weep .
42006026	" Woe to you when all men shall speak well of you ! For even so did their fathers to the false prophets .
42006027	" But to you who are listening to me I say , Love your enemies , do good to those who hate you ,
42006028	Bless those who curse you , pray for those who calumniate you .
42006029	To him who gives you a blow on the jaw Turn the other jaw also ; And from him who is robbing you of your cloak Withhold not your coat also .
42006030	Give to every one who asks you ; And do not demand your goods back from him who is taking them away .
42006031	And as you would like men to do to you , So do you also to them .
42006032	" If you love those who love you what credit is it to you ? Why even sinners love those who love them .
42006033	" And if you are kind to those who are kind to you , what credit is it to you ? Even sinners do the same .
42006034	" And if you lend to those from whom you are hoping to receive , what credit is that to you ? Even sinners lend to sinners , so as to get as much back .
42006035	" But you must love even your enemies and be kind to them , And lend , despairing of no man . Then your reward will be great , And you will be the sons of the Most High ; For he is kind even to the ungrateful and to the evil .

42006037	" Do not judge , and you shall not be judged ; Do not condemn , and you shall not be condemned ;
42006038	" Pardon , and you shall be pardoned ; Give , and gifts shall be given to you ; Full measure , pressed down , shaken together , running over , they shall pour into your bosom . For with what measure you measure , they will measure back to you . "
42006039	He also told them a parable . " Can a blind man lead a blind man ? Will they not both fall into a pit ?
42006040	" There is no disciple who is above his master ; But every one when he is completely trained will be like his master .
42006041	" And why do you look at the splinter that is in your brothers eye , but never consider the beam that is in your own eye ?
42006042	" Or how can you say to your brother . " Brother , allow me to pull that splinter out of your eye , " when you do not see the beam in your own eye ? Hypocrite ! Take out first the beam from your own eye , and then you will see clearly to take out the splinter from your brothers eye .
42006043	" For there is not good tree which bears worthless fruit , nor again any worthless tree which bears good fruit ; for each tree is known by its own fruit .
42006044	" You do not gather figs from thorns , and grapes are not plucked from a bramble-bush .
42006045	" The good man out of the good treasure-house of his heart brings forth good ; and the evil man out of the evil treasure-house of his heart brings forth evil ; for the mouth speaks out of the abundance of the heart .
42006046	" And why are you calling me Lord , Lord , and not doing what I tell you ?
42006047	" I will show whom the man that comes to me , and listens to my works , and does them , is like .
42006048	" He is like a man who is building a house who digged and went deep and laid a foundation upon rock . And , when a flood came , the torrent dashed against that house , but could not move , because it had been founded upon rock .
42006049	" But he who listens but does not do , is like a man who built a house upon the soil , without foundations , against which the torrent burst , and at once it fell in , and the ruin of that house was great . "
42007001	After he had ended all his sayings in the hearing of the people , he went to Capernaum .

42007005	" for he loves our nation , and himself has built a synagogue for us . "

42007007	" and so I did not think myself worthy to come to you ; but speak the word , and let my man be cured .
42007008	" For I also am a man obedient to authority , and have soldiers under me . And I say to one come , and he comes , and to my slave do this or that , and he does it . "
42007009	But when Jesus heard this he was astonished and he turned and said to the crowd that was following him , " I tell you that not even in Israel have I found faith like that . "

42008001	It happened shortly afterwards that he began to go from town to town and village to village , preaching and telling the good news of the kingdom of God .
42008002	The twelve were with him , and certain women whom he had delivered from evil spirits and various diseases . Mary of Magdala , out of whom seven demons have been driven ,
42008003	and Joanna , the wife of Chuza , Herods steward , and Susanna , and many other women , who used to minister to him out of their substance .
42008004	As a great crowd was gathering , and men of town after town kept restoring to him , he spoke a parable to them .
42008005	" A sower went out to sow his seed , and as he sowed some fell by the wayside , and was trodden under foot , and the wild birds ate it up .
42008006	" Some other seed dropped on the rock , as soon as it grew it withered away , because it had no moisture .
42008007	" Another part fell among the thorns ; and the thorns grew with it and choked it .
42008008	" But some fell on good soil , and grew up , and brought forth fruit , a hundredfold . " When he said this , he called out , " Whoever has ears to hear with , let him listen . "
42008009	Then his disciples began to interrupt him , saying , " What does this parable mean ? "
42008010	He answered . " To you it is given to understand the mysteries of the kingdom of God ; But all others are taught in parables so that seeing they shall not see , and hearing they shall not hear .
42008011	" This is the meaning of the parable . The seed is the word of God .
42008012	" Those by the wayside are people who hear , but then comes the devil and carries off the word from their heart , so that they may not believe and not be saved .
42008013	" Those on the rock are people who , upon hearing , receive the word with joy ; but they have no root . For a time indeed they all believe , but in time of temptation they fall away .
42008014	" And that which fell upon thorns is those who have heard , but as they go on their way of word is choked with the cares and riches and pleasures of life ; so they bring no fruit of perfection .
42008015	" And that in the good soil is those who have listened to the message and , in an honest and good heart , hold fast , and bring forth fruit with patience .
42008016	" When he lights a lamp no one covers it with a vase or hides it under a bed ; he puts it on a lamp-stand so whoever may behold the light .
42008017	" For is nothing hidden that shall not be disclosed ; there is nothing secret which shall not be made known and come to the light .
42008018	" Take heed , then , how you listen . for he who has , to him shall it be given , but from him who has not , shall be taken away even what he has . "
42008019	There came to him his mother and his brothers , and they could not reach him because of the crowd .
42008020	But some one told him , " Your mother and brothers are standing outside , desiring to see you . "
42008021	" My mother and brothers , " he answered , " are those who listen to the word of God and obey it . "
42008022	Now it happened that one of these days he got into a boat , And him his disciples , and he said to them , " Let us cross to the other side of the lake . "

42008026	Then they put in at the country of Gadarenes , which is across from Galilee .

For many times it had seized him and held him , and they again and again kept him under guard , and put him in chains and fetters . But he would break his bonds asunder , as he was driven by the demon in to the desert .

42008034	And those who saw what had happened fled and reported it in the town and the villages .
42008035	Then the people came out to see what had happened , and came to Jesus , and found the man out of whom the demons had gone sitting clothed and in his right mind , at the feet of Jesus . And they were terrified .
