43004050	Jesus answered . " Go your way . Your son lives . " And the man believed the word which Jesus spoke to him , and started to go home .
43004051	And when he was already on his way down , his slaves met him , saying that his boy was living .
43004052	So he asked them at what hour he had begun mend . They answered , " Yesterday , about one oclock , the fever left him . "
43004053	Then the father realized that it had left him at the very hour when Jesus had said to him , " Your son lives , " and he himself believed , and his whole household .
43004054	This is the second sign which Jesus performed , on returning from Judea to Galilee .
43005001	After this there was a feast of the Jews , and Jesus went up to Jerusalem .
43005002	Now there is in Jerusalem a pool near the Sheep-gate , called in the Hebrew , Bethesda .
43005003	It has five colonnades . In these there used to lie a great crowd of sick people - blind , lame , paralyzed .
43005005	And there was one man there for thirty-eight years in his infirmity .
43005006	When Jesus saw him lying there , and knew that he had been there a long time , he said to him , " Do you want to get well ? "
43005007	" Sir , " answered the sick man , " I have no man to put me into the pool whenever the water is troubled ; and while I am trying to come , some one else steps down before me . "
43005008	" Rise , " said Jesus , " take up your bed and go walking away . "
43005009	Instantly the man became well , and he took up his bed and started to walk . Now it was Sabbath on that day ;
43005010	so the Jews kept saying to the man who had been cured . " It is the Sabbath Day ; it is not lawful for you to carry your bed . "
43005011	He replied , " The man who healed me told me to take up my bed and walk . "
43005012	" Who is it , " they asked , " that said to you , take up your bed and go walking away ? "
43005013	But he who had been healed did not know who it was , for Jesus had moved away , as there was a crowd in that place .
43005014	Afterward Jesus found him in the Temple , and said to him . " Look ! You have become well . Do not go on sinning , lest a worse thing befall you . "
43005015	The man went to and told the Jews that it was Jesus who made him well ;
43005016	and because of this the Jews began to persecute Jesus , because he had done it on the Sabbath .
43005017	But he answered them , " My Father has continued working until now , and I am working too . "
43005018	For this reason the Jews continued to seek the more eagerly to put him to death , because not only was he breaking the Sabbath , but he was actually speaking of God as his own Father , thus making himself of Gods equal .
43005019	So Jesus answered them in these words . " In solemn truth I tell that the Son cannot do anything of himself , except what he sees the Father doing ; for whatever he does , that the Son does also .
43005020	" For the Father loves the Son , and shows him every thing that he himself is doing . And greater deeds than these will he show him , that you may wonder .
43005021	" For just as the Father raises the dead and makes them alive , even so the Son makes whom he will alive .
43005022	" The Father indeed does not judge any one , but has given all judgment to the Son ,
43005023	" in order that all may honor the Son even as they honor the Father . He who does not honor Son , does not honor the Father who sent him .
43005024	" I tell you solemnly that he who listens to my messages and believes Him who sent me , has eternal life . He will not come under condemnation , but has passed out of death into life .
43005025	" Solemnly I tell you that the hour is coming , and now is , when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God , and those who hear shall live .
43005026	" For as the Father has life in himself , so also has he granted to the Son to have life in himself .
43005027	" And he has given him authority to pronounce judgment , because he is Son of man .
43005028	" Do not wonder at this , because an hour is coming in which all who are in their graves shall hear his voice and shall come forth again ;
43005029	" those who have done good into a resurrection of life , and those who have practised evil to a resurrection of condemnation .
43005030	" I can of my own self do nothing . As I listen , I judge , and my own judgment is just , because I am not seeking my own will , but the will of Him who sent me .
43005031	" If I bear testimony concerning myself , my testimony is not valid .
43005032	" Another bears testimony to me , and I know that the testimony which he bears concerning me is valid .
43005033	" You yourselves sent to John , and he has been and is a witness to the truth .
43005034	" ( Though for myself I accept no witness from man ; I only mention that you may be saved . )
43005035	" That man was the Lamp-burning and shining - and you were willing for a time rejoice in his light .
43005036	" But I have testimony greater than that of John ; for the work which the Father has given me to bring to completion - the work which I am doing - bears testimony concerning me , that the Father has sent me .
43005037	" And the Father who sent me has himself borne testimony concerning me . None of you has heard his at any time or seen him ,
43005038	nor had his word dwelling within you , because you do not believe him whom he sent .
43005039	" You are searching the Scriptures because you suppose that in tem you have eternal life ; and though these are they that bear witness concerning me ,
43005040	" you will not come to me that you may have life .
43005041	" I am not receiving honor from men , but I know you ,
43005042	" that you have not the love of God in yourselves .
43005043	" I am come in the name of my Father and you do not receive me . If another comes in his own name , him you will receive .
43005044	" How can you believe when you receive glory from , one another , and have no desire for the glory which comes from the only God ?
43005045	" Do not imagine that I shall accuse you to the Father . Moses is your accuser , on whom you build your hopes .
43005046	" For if you believed Moses you would believe me , for he wrote about me .
43005047	And if you do not believe his writings , how will you ever believe my words ? "
43006001	After this Jesus went away across the Sea of Galilee ( that is the lake of Tiberias ) .
43006002	A great crowd were following him , because they witnessed the signs which he was continually performing among those who were ill .
43006003	Then Jesus walked up the hills and sat down there with his disciples . Now the Jewish feast , the Passover , was at hand .
43006004	Accordingly when he looked up , and perceived a great crowd was coming unto him ,
43006005	he said to Philip , " Where shall we buy bread for these people to eat ? "
43006006	He said this to test him , for he himself knew what he intended to do .
43006007	" Thirty-five dollars worth of bread , " answered Philip , " is not enough for them , so that each can take a morsel . "
43006008	One of his disciples , Andrew , the brother of Simon , said to him .
43006009	" There is a lad who has five barley loaves and a couple of fish ; but what is that among so many ? "
43006010	" Make the men sit down , " said Jesus . The ground was covered with thick grass ; so the men sat down , in numbers about five thousand . " of righteousness , because I am going to my Father , and you will no longer see me ;
43006011	Then Jesus took the loaves , and when he had given thanks he distributed them among those who were seated ; in like manner also of the fish , as much as they wished ,
43006012	and when they were satisfied , he said to his disciples , " Gather up the fragments that are left , so that nothing may be wasted . "
43006013	So they gathered them up , and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves - the broken pieces that were left after they had eaten .
43006014	So when the people saw the sign which he had performed , they said , " This is in the truth the Prophet who is to come into the world . "
43006015	When Jesus perceived that they intended to seize him in order to make him a king , he retired again to the hill all by himself .
43006016	When evening came on , his disciples went down to the sea .
43006017	There they got in a boat , and started across the sea for Capernaum . The darkness had already fallen ,
43006018	Jesus had not yet come to them , and the sea began to rise , because a strong wind was blowing .
43006019	After they had rowed three or four miles , they saw Jesus walking upon the sea , and drawing near to the boat , and they were terrified ;
43006020	but he said to them , " It is I , be not afraid . "
43006021	Then they were willing to take him on board , and immediately the boat reached the shore they were making for .
43006022	The crowd that remained on the other side of the sea had seen that there was only one small boat there , and that Jesus had not gone aboard with his disciples , but that his disciples had gone away by themselves .
43006023	So , on the following day , when boats came from Tiberias near the place were they had eaten bread , after the Lord had given thanks , they got into the boats themselves ,
43006024	when they saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there , and went to Capernaum to look for Jesus .
43006025	When they found him on the other side of the sea , they said to him , " Rabbi , when did you get here ? "
43006026	Jesus answered . " In solemn truth I tell you that you are looking for me , not because you saw miracles signs , but because you ate of the bread and were filled .
43006027	" Labor not for food which perishes , but for the food that endures eternal life - that which the Son of man will give you ; for on the Father - God - has set his seal . "
43006028	" What are we to do habitually , " they asked him , " that we may keep working the words of God ? "
43006029	" This is the work of God , " answered Jesus , " that you believe on him whom He has sent you . "
43006030	The they said to him . " What sign , then , are you performing , so that we may see it and believe in you ? What work are you doing ?
43006031	" Our fathers ate manna in the wilderness , as it is written , He gave them bread out of heaven to eat . "
43006032	" In solemn truth I tell you , " said Jesus in reply , " Moses did not give you the bread out of heaven , but my Father does give you the true bread out of heaven ;
43006033	" for the bread of God is what come down from heaven , and gives life to the world . "
43006034	" Ah , Sir , " said they , " evermore give us this bread . "
43006035	" I myself am the bread of life , " answered Jesus ; " he who comes to me shall never hunger , and he that believes on me shall never thirst again .
43006036	" But as I told you , you have seen me , and yet you do not believe .
43006037	" Everyone whom the Father gives me will come to me ; and him who comes to me I will never reject .
43006038	" For I am come down from heaven , not to do my own will , but the will of him who sent me .
43006039	" And this is the will of him who sent me , that I should not lose one of all those whom he has given me , but should raise them up at the last day .
43006040	" For this is my Fathers will , that every one who beholds the Son and believes on him , shall have eternal life . and I will raise him up at the last day . "
43006041	Then the Jews began to find fault with Jesus , because he said , " I am the bread which comes down out of heaven , " and they kept asking .
43006042	" Is not this Jesus , the son of Joseph ? Do we not know his father and mother ? How is it that he now says , I have come down from heaven ? "
43006043	" Do not find fault with me among yourselves , "
43006044	answered Jesus ; " no one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draw him ; then I will raise him up on the last day .
43006045	" It is written in the Prophets , " And they shall all of them be taught of God . Every one who has listened to the father and learns from him , comes to me .
43006046	" Not that any one has seen the Father , except the one who is from God ; he has seen the Father .
43006047	" I tell you solemnly that he who believes has eternal life .
43006048	" I am the bread of life .
43006049	" Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness ; yet they died .
43006050	" This is the bread that comes down from heaven , that one may eat thereof and never die .
43006051	" I myself am the living bread that has come down from heaven . Any one who eats this bread will live forever ; and moreover , the bread which I will give is my flesh , given for the life of the world . "
43006052	Then the Jews began to dispute among themselves , saying , " How can this man give us his flesh to eat ? "
43006053	" I tell you solemnly , " said Jesus , " that unless you eat the flesh of the Son of man , and drink his blood , you have no life in you .
43006054	" He who feeds upon my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life , and I will raise him up on the last day .
43006055	" For my flesh is true food , and my blood is true drink .
43006056	" He who feeds upon my flesh abides in me and I in him .
43006057	" Just as the living Father has sent me , and I live by the Father , so also that man who feeds on me shall live by me .
43006058	" This is the bread which came down from heaven ; not such as your fathers ate and died , for he who feeds upon this bread shall live forever . "
43006059	He spoke these words while in the synagogue , while he was teaching in Capernaum .
43006060	So many of his disciples , when they heard it , said . " This teaching is unbelievable ! Who can listen to him ? "
43006061	Jesus , conscious within himself that his disciples were finding fault with him about his teaching , said to them .
43006062	" Does this displease you ? What then if you were to behold the Son of man ascending to where he was before ?
43006063	" The spirit is what gives life ; the flesh is of no avail . The words which I have been speaking to you , are spirit and are life .
43006064	" Yet there are some of you who do not believe . " For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe , and who it was who should betray him .
43006065	So he added , " This is why I told you that no on can come to me unless it be given from the Father . "
43006066	Therefore many of his disciples drew back and no longer companied with him .
43006067	So Jesus appealed to the Twelve . " You also do not wish to leave me , do you ? "
43006068	Simon Peter answered . " To whom shall we go Master ? You have words of eternal life ;
43006069	" and we have learned to believe and we know that you are the holy one of God . "
43006070	In reply Jesus said to them . " Have I not chosen you , the Twelve ? And yet even of you one is an enemy . "
43006071	Now Jesus was speaking of Judas , the son of Simon Iscariot ; for Judas was to betray him , although he was one of the Twelve .
43007001	After these things Jesus continued to travel about in Galilee , for he did not wish to go about in Judea , because the Jews kept trying to kill him .
43007002	When the time of the Jewish feast of Tabernacles drew near ,
43007003	his brothers said to him . " Leave here and go into Judea , so that your disciples also may behold the works which you are doing .
43007004	" For no one ever does anything in secret if he himself seeks to be known publicly . If you are performing these signs , show yourself openly to the world . "
43007005	For even his own brothers did not believe in him .
43007006	" My time is not yet come , " said Jesus , " but your time is always at hand .
43007007	" The world cannot hate you , but me it does hate , because I am bearing testimony against it , that its ways are wicked .
43007008	Do you go up to the feast . I am not yet going up to this feast , because my time is not yet fully come . "
43007009	After saying this , he remained in Galilee ; but after his brothers had gone up to feast ,
43007010	then he went too - not openly , but as it were a secret .
43007011	The Jews meanwhile kept looking for him at feast , and saying , " Where is he ? " " I am no longer in the world , but these are in the world , and I come to thee . Holy Father , keep through thine own Name these whom thou hast given me , that they may be one as we are one .
43007012	and there was much disputing about him among the crowd . Some would say , " He is a good man . " Others . " No ! he is misleading the people . " " While I was with them I kept them by the power of thy name which thou hast given me . I guarded them , and none of them was lost except the son of perdition , that the Scripture might be fulfilled .
43007013	No one , however , was speaking openly about him , for fear of the Jews . " But now I am coming to thee , and I am speaking these things while I am in the world , so that they may have my joy in all its fulness in themselves .
43007014	But when it was already the middle of the feast , Jesus went up to the Temple and began to teach . " I have given them thy word ; and the world has hated them because they are not of the world , even as I am not of the world .
43007015	The Jews were amazed . They said , " How does this fellow know the sacred writings when he has never learned them ? " " I am not asking that thou wilt take them out of the world , but that thou wilt protect them from the Evil One .
43007016	In reply Jesus said to them ; " My teaching is not mine , but is his who sent me . " They are not of the world , even as I am not of the world .
43007017	" If any one wills to do Gods will he shall know concerning my teaching , whether it is from God , or I speak my own authority . " Dedicate them in thy truth ; thy word is truth .
43007018	" The man who speaks on his own authority is always seeking his own glory . But one who is eager for the glory of Him who sent him , he is true , and therefore is nothing false about him .
43007019	" Did not Moses give you the Law ? Yet none of you is keeping the Law . Why are you seeking to kill me ? "
43007020	The crowd answered . " You have a demon ! Who is trying kill you ? "
43007021	Jesus answered them . " There was one thing I did , and you are all amazed .
43007022	" Consider , therefore , Moses has given you circumcision - not that Moses originated it , but the fathers - and you are accustomed to circumcise a child even on the Sabbath .
43007023	" If a child receives circumcision on the Sabbath , in order that the Law of Moses may not be broken , how can you be angry with me because I made a man sound and well on the Sabbath ?
43007024	" Do not judge according to appearance . Judge justly . "
43007025	Then some of the men of Jerusalem were saying . " Is not this the man they are seeking to kill ?
43007026	" And look ! he is speaking boldly and they are saying nothing to him . Can it possibly be that the rulers have really discovered that he is the Christ ?
43007027	" But we know this man and where he is from ; but when the Christ comes no one will know where he comes from . "
43007028	So Jesus cried aloud as he was teaching in the Temple , and said . " You both know me and you know where I am from ; and I am not come on my own authority , but he who sent me is trustworthy , and him you do not know .
43007029	" But I now him , because I am from him and he sent me . "
43007030	Then they kept seeking to arrest him , but no man laid hands on him , because his hour was not yet come .
43007031	But many of the crowd believed on him and began to say , " The Christ , when he comes , will he do more signs than this man has done ? "
43007032	The Pharisees heard the crowd muttering these things about him , and the high priest and Pharisees sent officers to arrest him .
43007033	Then Jesus said to them . " Still for a little longer I am with you , and then I am going my way to him who sent me .
43007034	" You will search for me and will not find me , and where I am you cannot come . "
43007035	Then the Jews said to one another . " Where does this fellow intend to go , so that we shall not find him ? He is not intending to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and to teach the Greeks , is he ?
43007036	" What does he mean saying , You shall seek me and you shall not find me , and Where I am you cannot come ? "
43007037	Now the last day , that the great day of the feast , Jesus stood up and cried in a loud voice .
43007038	" If any man thirst let him come to me and drink . From the heart of him who believes in me will flow , as the Scripture said , rivers of living water . "
43007039	Now he said this concerning the Spirit whom those who believed in him should receive . For the Spirit was not yet given , because Jesus had not yet been glorified .
43007040	Some of the crowd who had been listening to these discourses began to say , " Without a doubt this man is a Prophet . "
43007041	Other said , " He is the Christ . " But others were saying . " Surely the Christ is not to come out of Galilee , is he ?
43007042	" Does not the Scripture say that the Christ is coming of the descendants of David , and from Bethlehem , Davids town ? "
43007043	So a division arose in the crowd concerning him . Some of them wished to apprehend him , but no one laid hands on him .
43007044	Then the officers returned to the chief priest and Pharisees ,
43007045	and they asked them , " Why have you not brought him ? "
43007046	The officers answered , " Never yet did a man speak like this man . "
43007047	" Surely you have not been led astray , have you ? answered the Pharisees .
43007048	" Has any one of the rulers believed on him , or of the Pharisees ?
43007049	" As for this mob who do not understand the Law , they are accursed ! "
43007050	Nicodemus , one of their number , he who had formerly visited Jesus , said to them ,
43007051	" Our law does not condemn the accused , does it , before hearing his defense , and finding out what he is doing ? "
43007052	In answer they said to him . " You are not from Galilee , are you ? Search for yourself , and see that from Galilee arises no prophet . "
43007053	Then they departed each to his own house .
43008001	Jesus went to the Mount of Olives .
43008002	At dawn , however , he came back to the Temple , where the people came to him in crowds . He had taken his seat and was teaching them ,
43008003	when the Scribes and Pharisees had brought a woman who had been caught in the act of adultery . They made her stand in the middle of the court , and said to him .
43008004	" Rabbi , this woman has been found in the very act of adultery .
43008005	" Now Moses , in the Law , has commanded us to stone such creatures . But you , what do you say ? "
43008006	( This they said to tempt him , so that they could bring a charge against him . )
43008007	But Jesus stooped down , and began to write on the ground with his finger . When they continued to question him , he raised himself and said to them , " Let the innocent man among you be the first to throw the stone at her . "
43008008	Then he stooped down again , and again began to write on the ground .
43008009	When they heard that , they went out one by one , beginning with the eldest . And Jesus was left behind alone - and the woman in the middle of the court .
43008010	Then Jesus raised himself up and said to her . " Woman , where are they ? Has no man condemn you , "
43008011	" No one , Sir , " she answered . " Neither do I condemned you , " said Jesus . " Go , and never sin again . "
43008012	Once more Jesus addressed them . " I am the light of the world , " he said ; " He who follows me shall not walk in the darkness , but he shall have the Light of life . "
43008013	Then said the Pharisees to him . " You are bearing testimony to yourself ; your testimony is not true . "
43008014	In reply Jesus said to them . " Even if I do bear testimony to concerning myself , my testimony is true , because I know where I have come from and where I am going . But you do not know where I have come from , or where I am going .
43008015	" For you are judging according to the flesh . I am judging no man .
43008016	" Though even if I do judge , my judgment is trustworthy , because I am not alone , but the Father who sent me is with me .
43008017	" And in your Law it is written that the testimony of two men is true .
43008018	" I am one who gives testimony concerning myself , and the Father who sent me gives testimony concerning me . "
43008019	" Where is your Father ? " they asked him . " You have neither known me nor my Father , " answered Jesus . " If you had known me , you would have known my father also . "
43008020	He said these words in the Treasury , while he was teaching in the Temple ; yet no one arrested him , because his hour was not yet come .
43008021	Then again he said them . " I am going away , and you will seek me , and you will die in your sins . Where I am going , you cannot come . "
43008022	Then the Jews said . " He will not kill himself , will he ? Is that why he says , Where I am going you cannot come ? "
43008023	And he said to them . " You are from below . I am from above ; you are of this world , I am not of this world .
43008024	" That is why I said that you would die in your sins . For if you do not believe that I am He , you will die in your sins . "
43008025	" Who are you ? " then they asked him . " What I am telling you from the beginning , " Jesus answered .
43008026	" I have many things to say and to judge concerning you . But he who sent me is true , and I speak to the world only those things which I have heard from him . "
43008027	They did not understand that he meant the Father ,
43008028	so Jesus added . " When you lifted up the Son of man , then you will know that I am He ; and that I do nothing on my own authority , but that I speak just as the Father has taught me ,
43008029	" and he who sent me is with me . He has not left me alone , for I do always the things that please him . "
43008030	When he spoke in this way , many of the Jews believed in him .
43008031	So Jesus spoke to the Jews that believed him , saying . " If you abide in my teaching , you are my true disciples ;
43008032	" and you shall know the truth , and the truth will make you free . "
43008033	" We are descendants of Abraham , " they replied , " and have never been in slavery to any man . What do you mean by saying , You shall become free ? "
43008034	" In solemn truth I tell you , " Jesus replied , " every one who commits sin is a slave
43008035	" Now the slave does not remain permanently in the household , but the son does remain .
43008036	" So then , if the Son shall set you free , you will be free indeed .
43008037	" I know you are Abrahams descendants ; but you are seeking to kill me , Because my teaching has no place in you .
43008038	" I am declaring what I have seen with the Father , and you are acting as you have learned from your father . "
43008039	" Abraham is our father , " they answered . " If you are indeed Abrahams children , " said Jesus " do the deeds of Abraham .
43008040	" But now you are seeking to kill me - a man who has told you the truth which I heard from God . Abraham did not do that .
43008041	" You are doing the deeds of your father . " " We were not born of adultery , " they said ; " we have one Father , God . "
43008042	Jesus said to them . " If God were your Father , you would love me , for I proceeded forth and am now come from God . I did not come on my own authority , but God himself sent me .
43008043	" How is it that you do not understand what I say ? It is because you cannot listen to my message .
43008044	" You are of your father , the devil , and you want to do what your father desires . He was a man-slayer from the very beginning ; and he has no standing place in the truth , because truth is not in him . Whenever he utters a lie , he speaks from his nature , for he is a liar and the father of lying .
43008045	" But as for me , it is because I speak the truth to you that you do not believe me .
43008046	" Which one of you convicts me of sin ? Why then , if I am speaking the truth , do you not believe me ?
43008047	" He who is from God listens to Gods words . For this reason you do not listen , because you are not from God . "
43008048	In reply the Jews said to him , " Are we not right in saying that you are a Samaritan , and you also have a demon ? "
43008049	" I do not have a demon , " said Jesus , " but I am honoring my Father , and you are dishonoring me .
43008050	" Yet I am not seeking my own honor . There is One who is seeking it , and He is judge .
43008051	" In solemn truth I tell you that if any one obeys my teaching he shall never behold death . "
43008052	" Now we know that you have a demon , " exclaimed the Jews . Abraham died , and so did the prophets ; and yet you say , If any man obeys my teaching he shall never taste death .
43008053	" You are not greater than our father Abraham , are you ? And he died , and the prophets died . Who are you making yourself out to be ? "
43008054	" If I glorify myself . " said Jesus , " my glory is nothing . It is my Father that glorifies me , and you say , He is our God .
43008055	" You are not acquainted with him ; I know him . Were I to say , I do not know him , I should be like you , a liar . But I do know him , and I obey his teaching .
43008056	" Your father Abraham rejoiced that he should see my day ; and he saw it and was glad . "
43008057	" You are not yet fifty years old , " said the Jews to him , " and you have seen Abraham ? "
43008058	" In solemn truth I tell you , " answered Jesus , " that before Abraham came into existence , I am . "
43008059	Then they picked up stones to throw at him , but Jesus hid himself and went out of the Temple .
43009001	Now as he was passing along he saw a man , blind from birth .
43009002	" Rabbi , " his disciples asked him , " who sinned , this man or his parents , that he was born blind ? "
43009003	" Neither he nor his parents sinned . " replied Jesus ; " it happened that the works of God might be made manifest in him .
43009004	" I must work the works of him that sent me while it is day ; night is coming , when no man can work .
43009005	" While I am in the world , I am the Light of the world . "
43009006	When he had thus spoken he spat on the ground , and made clay with the spittle , and smeared the clay on the mans eyes .
43009007	Then he said to him , " Go , wash in the pool of Siloam " ( a word which means " sent " ) . So the man went and washed his eyes , and came back seeing .
43009008	Upon this the neighbors and those who used to know him by sight as a beggar , began asking , " Is not this the man who used to sit and beg ? "
43009009	Some said , " It is he . " Others said , " No , but he looks like him . " " I am the man , " he said .
43009010	So they asked him , " How then were your eyes opened ? "
43009011	He answered . " The man who is called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes , and said to me , Go to Siloam and wash ; so I went and washed and received my sight . "
43009012	" Where is he ? " they asked . " I do not know , " answered the man .
43009013	Then they brought the man who had been blind to the Pharisees .
43009014	Now it was on the Sabbath that Jesus had made clay and opened his eyes ;
43009015	so the Pharisees again began to ask him questions about how he had regained his sight ; and he said to them , " He put clay on my eyes , and I washed them , and now I see . "
43009016	Then some of the Pharisees began to say , " This man in not from God , because he does not keep the Sabbath . " But others said , " How can a man who is a sinner perform such signs ? "
43009017	So there was a difference of opinion among them . Accordingly they said to the blind man , " What have you to say about him , now that he has opened your eyes ? " " He is a prophet , " he answered .
43009018	The Jews , however , did not believe about him that he was blind and had received his sight , until they called the parents of the man whose sight had been restored ,
43009019	and questioned them . " Is this your son , " they said , " who you say was born blind ? How then does he now see ? "
43009020	Then in reply his parents said . " We know that this is our son , and that he was born blind ;
43009021	" but how he now sees we do not know , nor do we know who has opened his eyes . Ask him , himself . He is of age . He will speak for himself . "
43009022	This his parents said because they were afraid of the Jews , for the Jews had already agreed that if any one should confess that he was the Christ , he should be expelled from the synagogue .
43009023	It was because this that his parents said . " He is of age . Ask him , himself . "
43009024	So the Jews a second time summoned the man who had been blind , and said to him .
43009025	" Give glory to God ! we know that this man is a sinner . " Upon this the blind man answered . " I do not know if he is a sinner . One thing I do know , that once I was blind , and know I can see . "
43009026	" What was it he did to you ? " they asked him ; " How did he open your eyes ? "
43009027	He answered . " I have told you already , and you did not listen . Why do you wish to hear it again ? Can it be that you , too , wish to become his disciples ? "
43009028	Then they stormed at him . " You are his disciple . We are Moses disciples .
43009029	" We know that God spoke to Moses . But this fellow ! We do not know where he comes from . "
43009030	" This is truly astonishing , " said the man in reply , " that you do not know where he is from , and yet he has opened my eyes .
43009031	" We know that God does not listen to sinners , but if any one is God-fearing and does his will , to such he listens .
43009032	" Since the beginning of the world such a thing as opening the eyes of one who was born blind was never heard of .
43009033	" If this man had not come of God he could have done nothing . "
43009034	They answered , " You were wholly born in sins , and do you teach us ? " Then they cast him out .
43009035	Jesus heard that they had cast him out ; and when he had found him , he said , " Do you believe in the Son of man ? "
43009036	" Who is he , Sir , " he replied , " that I may believe on him . "
43009037	" You have already seen him , " Jesus answered , " and it is he who now speaks to you . "
43009038	" I do believe , Sir , " said the man , and he prostrated himself at his feet . And Jesus said ,
43009039	" For judgment am I come into the world , to make the sightless see , and to make the seeing blind . "
43009040	Some of the Pharisees who were with him heard this and asked , " We are not blind , are we ? "
43009041	" If you were blind , " Jesus answered them , " you would have no sin . But now you are declaring , We see ; so your sin remains .
43010001	" In solemn truth I tell you that whoever does not enter the sheepfold by the door , but climbs up some other way , that man is a thief and a robber ;
43010002	" but he who comes in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep .
43010003	" The porter opens the door for him ; the sheep listen to his voice ; and he calls his own sheep by name , and leads them out .
43010004	" When he has brought all his own sheep , he walks before them and the sheep follow him because they know his voice .
43010005	" But a stranger they will not follow , but flee from him , because they do not know the voice of strangers . "
43010006	Jesus told them this parable , but they did not understand what he was talking about ; so he said to them again .
43010007	" In solemn truth I tell you that I am the Door of the sheep .
43010008	" All that came before me are thieves and robbers , but the sheep did not listen to them .
43010009	" I am the Door . Whoever enters by me shall be saved , and he shall go in and come out and find pasture .
43010010	" The thief never comes except to steal and kill and destroy . I am come that they may have life , and may have it in abundance .
43010011	" I am the good shepherd . The good shepherd lays down his very life for the sheep .
43010012	" The hired servant , since he is not a shepherd and does not own his sheep , leaves the sheep and flees when he sees a wolf coming - and the wolf worries them and scatters them .
43010013	" He is only a hired servant , and the sheep are no care to him .
43010014	" I am the good shepherd . I know my sheep , and my sheep know me ;
43010015	just as the Father knows me , I know the Father , and I lay down my life for the sheep .
43010016	" I have other sheep also , which do not belong to this fold . I must bring them too , and they will listen to my voice , and they will become one flock , one shepherd .
43010017	" The Father loves me for this , because I am laying down my life that I may take it again .
43010018	" No man is taking it away from me . I am laying it down on my own accord . I have authority to lay it down , and I have authority to take it again . I received this commandment from my Father . "
43010019	The Jews were again divided over these words .
43010020	Many of them kept saying . " He has a demon and is mad ! Why do you listen to him ? "
43010021	Others were saying . " These are not the words of one demon-possessed . Can a demoniac open the eyes of the blind ? "
43010022	Then came the feast of the Dedication at Jerusalem .
43010023	It was winter , and Jesus used to walk in the Temple , in Solomons Portico .
43010024	Then all the Jews encircled him and kept asking him . " How long are you going to keep us in suspense ? If you are the Christ , tell us plainly . "
43010025	Jesus answered them . " I have told you , and you do not believe . The works which I am doing in my Fathers name , these bear witness concerning me .
43010026	" But you do not believe , because you are not of my sheep .
43010027	" My sheep listen to my voice , and I know them and they follow me .
43010028	" I am giving them eternal life , and they shall never perish , nor shall any one snatch them out of my hand .
43010029	" My Father who has given them to me is stronger than all , and no one can snatch them out of my Fathers hand .
43010030	" I and my Father are one . "
43010031	The Jews again took stones with which to stone him . Jesus said to them .
43010032	" I have shown you many good deeds from my Father . For which of these are you going to stone me ? "
43010033	" We are not going to stone you for a good deed , " answered the Jews , " but for blasphemy , because you , a mere man , are making yourself God . "
43010034	" Is it written in your law , " replied Jesus , " I said , You are gods ?
43010035	" If those to whom the word of God came are called gods ( and the Scripture cannot be annulled ) ,
43010036	do you mean to tell me , whom the Father has sanctified and sent into the world , You are blaspheming , because I said , I am the Son of God ?
43010037	" If I am not doing the deeds of my Father , do not believe me .
43010038	" But if I am doing them , then though you believe not me , believe the deeds , in order that you may come to know and keep on clearly understanding that the Father is in me and I am in the Father . "
43010039	Then again they attempted to seize him , but he escaped out of their hands ,
43010040	and went away again across the Jordan to the place where John had been baptizing at first , and there he remained .
43010041	Many who came to him said , " John did not perform any signs , but everything he said about this man was true . "
43010042	And many believed on him there .
43011001	Now a man named Lazarus was ill . He was from Bethany , the village of Mary and her sister Martha
43011002	- it was Mary who anointed the Lord with perfume and wiped his feet with her hair , whose brother Lazarus was ill .
43011003	So the sisters sent to him , saying . " Master , see who you hold dear is ill . "
43011004	When Jesus heard it he said , " This illness is not unto death , but for the glory of God , that through it the Son of God may be glorified . "
43011005	Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus .
43011006	However , when he heard that he was ill ,
43011007	he still remained where he was for two days ; then after that he said to his disciples , " Let us go back again to Judea . "
43011008	" Rabbi , " answered his disciples , " it was but just now that the Jews were trying to stone you , and are you going there again ? "
43011009	Jesus replied . " Are there not twelve hours in the daytime ? If any one walks in the daytime he does not stumble , because he beholds the light of this world ;
43011010	but if any one walks during the night he does stumble , because the light is not in him . "
43011011	This he said , then told them , " Lazarus , our friend , has fallen asleep , but I am going to wake him . "
43011012	" Master , if he has fallen asleep , he will get well , " replied the disciples .
43011013	Now Jesus had been speaking concerning his death , but they thought that he was talking about natural sleep .
43011014	So then he told them plainly .
43011015	" Lazarus is dead ; and for your sakes I am glad I was not there , in order that you may believe . Come , let us go to him . "
43011016	Upon this Thomas , who was called " The Twin , " said to his fellow disciples , " Let us go too , that we may die with him . "
43011017	so when Jesus arrived , he found that Lazarus had already been four days in the tomb .
43011018	Now Bethany was near Jerusalem , only about two miles away ;
43011019	so a number of the Jews had gone to Martha and Mary to sympathize with them concerning their brother .
43011020	So when Martha learned that Jesus was coming , she went to meet him , but Mary remained sitting in the house .
43011021	Then Martha said to Jesus . " Master , had you been here my brother would not have died ;
43011022	but even now I know that whatever you ask of God , God will give you . "
43011023	Jesus said to her , " Your brother will rise again . "
43011024	Martha answered , " I know that he will rise in the resurrection , at the Last Day . "
43011025	" I am the resurrection and the life , " said Jesus . " He who believes in me , even if he has died , shall live .
43011026	And every one who is living and believes in me shall never die . Do you believe this ? "
43011027	" Yes , Master , " she answered , " I have come to believe that you are the Christ , the Son of God , who was to come into the world . "
43011028	With these words she went away to call her sister Mary , saying privately , " The Teacher is here and is asking for you . "
43011029	So when Mary heard this , she rose quickly and went to meet him .
43011030	Jesus had not yet arrived in the village , but was still at the place where Martha met him .
43011031	Then the Jews who were in the house trying to console her , when they saw that Mary rose quickly and went out , followed her , because they thought she was going to the tomb to weep there .
43011032	When Mary came to the place where Jesus was , and saw him , she fell at his feet , saying , " Master had you been here , my brother would not have died . "
43011033	Then when Jesus saw her sobbing , and the Jews likewise who accompanied her , sobbing , he shuddered with indignation in his spirit , and was deeply agitated .
43011034	" Where have you laid him ? " he said . " Master , come and see , " they answered .
43011035	Jesus burst into tears .
43011036	" See how he loved him , " said the Jews . But some of them said ,
43011037	" Could not this man , who has opened the eyes of the blind man , have prevented this man also from dying ? "
43011038	Jesus therefore , again shuddering in himself with indignation , came to the tomb , which was a cave with a stone lying upon it .
43011039	" Roll away the stone , " said Jesus . " Master , " said Martha , the sister of the dead man " he is offensive by this time , for he has been four days in the tomb . "
43011040	Jesus answered her , " Did I not tell you that if you would believe you should see the glory of God ? "
43011041	Then they rolled the stone away ; and Jesus lifted up his eyes and said .
43011042	" Father , I thank thee that thou hast listened to me . And I knew that thou art ever listening to me , but for the sake of the crowd who are standing about , I said it , in order that they may believe that thou hast sent me . "
43011043	When he had said this he cried with a great voice , " Lazarus , come forth ! "
43011044	Out came the dead man , wrapped hand and foot with grave-clothes , and his face bound up in a napkin . Jesus said to them , " Untie him , and let him go . "
43011045	Many of the Jews , therefore , who had come with Mary , and had seen what he did , believed on him ;
43011046	but some of them went away to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done .
43011047	So the chief priests and Pharisees called a meeting of the Sanhedrin .
43011048	" What are we going to do ? " they said , " now that this man is performing many signs ? " If we leave him alone , this way , every one will believe on him , and the Romans will come and rob us of both our sacred place and of our people . "
43011049	But one of their number , Caiaphas by name , who was high priest that year , said to them ,
43011050	" You know nothing at all , nor do you consider that it is expedient for you that one man should die for the people , rather than the whole nation be destroyed . "
43011051	now he did not say this of his own accord ; but as high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus was about to die in behalf of the nation ,
43011052	and not in behalf of the nation alone , but in order that he might gather into one the widely scattered children of God .
43011053	So from that day they plotted to kill him .
43011054	Jesus therefore no longer went about publicly among the Jews , but went away from there into the region near the desert to a town called Ephraim ,
43011055	and there remained with his disciples . Now the Jewish Passover was near , and many people went up from the country to Jerusalem for purification before the Passover .
43011056	So they kept looking for Jesus and saying to one another , as they stood in the Temple , " What do you think - that he will not come to the feast at all ? "
43011057	Now the chief priests and Pharisees had given orders that if any one knew where he was . he should give information , so that they might arrest him .
43012001	So then Jesus came six days before the Passover , to Bethany , where Lazarus was whom Jesus had raised from the dead .
43012002	So they gave a dinner for him there , and Martha served it ; but Lazarus was one of those who reclined with him at table .
43012003	Then Mary took a pound of pure spikenard , very costly , and poured it over his feet , and wiped his feet with her hair , and the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume .
43012004	Then said Judas Iscariot , one of his disciples , who was about to betray him ,
43012005	" Why was not this perfume sold for fifty dollars , and the proceeds given to the poor ? "
43012006	This he said not because he cared for the poor , but because he was a thief , and , carrying the purse ,
43012007	used to purloin what was put in it . Then said Jesus . " Let her alone . Against the day of my burial has she kept this ;
43012008	for the poor you have with you always , but me you have not always . "
43012009	When the great mass of the Jews learned that Jesus was there , they came not alone because of Jesus , but to see Lazarus also , whom he had raised from the dead .
43012010	And the chief priests plotted to kill Lazarus too ,
43012011	because it was on his account that many of the Jews were leaving them , and beginning to believe on Jesus .
43012012	Next day the big crowd who had come up for the Passover heard that Jesus was coming into Jerusalem ,
43012013	and taking branches from the palm trees went out to meet him , shouting , " Hosanna ! Blessed is he who cometh in the name of the Lord . Even Israels King ! "
43012014	And Jesus found a young ass and seated himself on it , as it is written ,
43012015	Fear not , daughter of Zion , Behold thy King cometh seated upon an asss colt .
43012016	His disciples did not understand these things at first ; but when Jesus had been glorified , then they remembered that these things had been written concerning him , and what they had done to him .
43012017	Meanwhile the crowd which was with him when he summoned Lazarus from the tomb and raised him from the dead , kept witnessing .
43012018	For this reason , too , the crowd came to meet him , because they had heard about this sign which he had done .
43012019	Then the Pharisees said among themselves . " You see ! You can do nothing ! Look ! The world is gone after him ! "
43012020	Now there were certain Greeks among those who had come up to worship during the Passover feast ;
43012021	these came to Philip of Bethsaida in Galilee , with a request . " Sir , " they said , " we want to see Jesus . "
43012022	Philip went and told Andrew . Andrew and Philip went and told Jesus . Jesus answered .
43012023	" The hour is come that the Son of man should be glorified .
43012024	In solemn truth I tell you that except a kernel of wheat fall into the ground and die , it remains a single kernel ; but if it die it bears a great crop .
43012025	He who loves his life loses it ; and he who regards not his life in this world shall keep it for eternal life .
43012026	If any one is ready to serve me , let him follow me ; and where I am there shall my servant be also . If any man is ready to serve me , him will my Father honor .
43012027	Now is my soul disquieted . What shall I say ? Father , save me from this hour ? Nay , for this very cause I am come to this hour .
43012028	Father , glorify thy name ! " Whereupon there came a voice from heaven , saying , " I have both glorified it , and will glorify it again . "
43012029	Then the crowd who stood around and heard it , said , " It thundered ! " But others said , " An angel has spoken to him . "
43012030	" It is not for my sake , " answered Jesus , " that the voice came , but for your sakes .
43012031	Now is a judgment of this world ; now will the ruler of this world be driven out .
43012032	" AND I , IF I BE LIFTED UP FROM THE EARTH , WILL DRAW ALL MEN UNTO MYSELF . "
43012033	( In saying this he was signifying by what kind of death he was to die . )
43012034	Then the people answered . " We have heard out of the Law that the Christ abides forever . What do you mean by The Son of man must be lifted up ? Who is this Son of man ? "
43012035	" The Light is among you a little longer , " answered Jesus . " Walk while you have the Light , lest darkness overtake you . He who walks in the darkness does not know where he is going .
43012036	While you have the Light , believe in the Light , so that you may become Sons of Light . "
43012037	With these words Jesus went away and hid himself from them . But although he had wrought such signs in their presence , still they did not believe in him .
43012038	So the words spoken by Isaiah , the prophet , were fulfilled . Lord , who hath believed our message , And to whom hath the Arm of the Lord been revealed ?
43012039	This was why they could not believe , because Isaiah said again .
43012040	He hath blinded their eyes and make their hearts hard , Lest they should see with their eyes , perceive with their minds , And should turn , and I should heal them .
43012041	Isaiah uttered these words because he saw his glory , and he spoke of him .
43012042	Nevertheless , even among the rulers many believed on him , but did not confess in on account of the Pharisees , for fear lest they be put out of the Synagogue .
43012043	For they loved the approval of men rather than the approval of God .
43012044	Now Jesus , speaking in a loud voice , had said .
43012045	" He who believes in me believes not in me , but in Him who sent me ; and he who sees me sees him who sent me .
43012046	Like light am I come into the world , so that no one who believes in me may remain in darkness .
43012047	And if any one hears my words and does not keep them , it is not I who judge him ; for I am not come to judge the world , but to save the world .
43012048	He who rejects me , and does not receive my words , has indeed a judge . The message which I have spoken , that shall judge him in the Last Day ,
43012049	because I have never spoken on my own authority , but the Father himself who sent me gave me commandment what to say and what words to speak .
43012050	And I know that his commandment is eternal life . So whatever I speak , I speak as the Father has told me . "
43013001	Now just before the feast of the Passover , Jesus , knowing that his hour was come when he should leave this world to go to the Father , having loved his own who were in the world , showed forth his love to the end . " Your life you will lay down for me ? In solemn truth I tell you , the cock shall not crow before you have three times disowned me . "
43013002	So while supper was proceeding , and the devil had already put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot , the son of Simon , to betray him ,
43013003	Jesus , knowing that the Father had given everything into his hands , and that he was come from God ,
43013004	and was now going to God , rose from supper , laid aside his upper garments , and took a towel and girded himself .

43013006	Then he came to Simon Peter , who said to him , " Lord , are you going to wash my feet ? "

43013016	In solemn truth I tell you that a slave is not greater than his master , neither is a messenger greater than the one who sends him .
43013017	If you know these things , happy are you if you do them .

43013019	" From this time forward , I tell you before it comes to pass , that when it is come to pass you may believe who I am .

43013021	When he had spoken thus , Jesus was deeply moved . He testified and said , " In solemn truth I tell you that one of you will betray me . "
43013022	Then the disciples began looking at one another , wondering which one of them he meant .
43013023	There was reclining upon Jesus breast one of the disciples whom he loved .
43013024	So Simon Peter beckoned to him , saying , " Ask who it is about whom he is speaking . "
43013025	So that disciples just leaned back against Jesus breast and said to him , " Lord , who is it ? "
43013026	" It is that one , " answered Jesus , " to whom I am going to give a piece of bread , after dipping it . "
43013027	So when he had dipped the bread , he took it and gave it to Judas Iscariot , son of Simon . And after he had received the piece of bread , Satan entered into him . " What you do , do quickly , " said Jesus .

43013030	When he had taken the piece of bread , Judas went out immediately ; and it was night .
43013031	So when he was gone , Jesus said . " Now has the Son of man been glorified , and God has been glorified in him .
43013032	If God has been glorified in him , God will also glorify him in himself , and straightway will he glorify him .
43013033	" My little children , I am only to be with you a little longer . You will seek me ; just as I said to the Jews , Where I go you cannot come , so now I say to you .

43013035	By this shall all men know that you are my disciples , if you have love one for another . "
43013036	Simon Peter asked him , " Lord , where are you going ? " " Where I am going , " answered Jesus , " you cannot follow me now ; but you shall follow me later . "
43013037	" Why cannot I follow you now , Master ? " said Peter . " I will lay down my life for you . " Jesus answered him .

43014001	" Let not your hearts be troubled . You trust in God , trust in me also .

43014031	" He has nothing in me , but in his coming the world may know that I love the Father , and that I do just as the Father commanded . Rise , let us be going ! "
43015001	" I am the vine , and my Father the vine-grower .
43015002	" He cuts back any of my branches that bear no fruit , and prunes every fruit-bearing branch , that it may bear more .
43015003	" Now you are clean through the word which I have spoken to you .
43015004	" Abide in me , and I in you . Just as the branch cannot bear fruit of itself except it abide in the vine , no more can you , unless you abide in me .
43015005	" I am the Vine you are the branches . He who abides in me and I in him , bears abundant fruit ; because apart from me you can do nothing .
43015006	" If any one does not abide in me he is thrown away like a branch and withers . Such branches are gathered up and thrown into the fire and burned .
43015007	" If you abide in me and my words abide in you , ask whatever your will is , and it shall be yours .

43015010	" If you obey my commands you will abide in my love , just as I have obeyed my Fathers commands and abide in his love .
43015011	" I have told you these things that my joy might remain in you , and that your joy might be full .
43015012	" This is my command , Love one another as I have loved you .
43015013	" Greater love has no man than this , that a man lay down his life for his friends .
43015014	" You are my friends if you do what I command you .
43015015	" I no longer call you slaves , because a slave does not know what his master is doing ; but I have called you friends , because I have made known to you everything that I have learned from my Father .
43015016	" You did not choose me , but I chose you and appointed you , that you should go and bear fruit , and that your fruit should remain ; so that whatever you ask the Father in my name , he may give it to you .
43015017	" This is my command . to love one another . If the worlds hates you ,

43015020	" Remember what I told you , A slave is not better than his master . If they persecuted me , they will persecute you . If they have obeyed my word , they will obey yours also .
43015021	" But they will do all these things to you for my names sake , because they know not Him who sent me .
43015022	" If I had not come and spoken to them , they would have no sin ; but now they have no excuse for their sin .
43015023	" He who hates me hates my Father also .
43015024	" If I had not done among them such works as none ever did , they would have had no sin ; but now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father .
43015025	" And so is fulfilled the word written in their Law , They hate me without cause .
43015026	" When the Comforter is come whom I will send to you from the Father , the Spirit of Truth who comes forth from the Father , he will bear witness of me ;
43015027	" and you to shall bear witness because you have been with me from the first .
43016001	" I have told you all this so that you may not stumble .
43016002	" They will excommunicate you from their synagogues ; indeed the time is coming when any one who kills you will suppose that he is doing Gods service .
43016003	" And they will do these things because they have not known my Father , nor me .
43016004	" But I have told you these things , that when the time comes you may remember that I told you about them , myself . I did not , however , speak of these things at first , because I was with you .
43016005	" But now I go my way to Him who sent me , yet none of you asks me , Where are you going ?
43016006	" but sorrow has filled your hearts because I have told you these things .
43016007	" Yet - I am telling you the truth - my going is for your good . For unless I go away the Comforter will not come to you ; but if I depart I will send him unto you .
43016008	" And he , when he comes , will convict the world of sins and of righteousness and of judgment ;
43016009	" of sin , because they do not believe in me ;
43016011	" because the Prince of this world has been judged .
43016012	" I have yet many things to say to you , but you cannot bear them just now .
43016013	" But when he is come , that Spirit of Truth , he will guide you into the whole truth . For he will not speak on his own authority , but all that he hears he will speak , and will make known to you that which is to come .
43016014	" He will glorify me ; for he will take of what is mine and will make known to you .
43016015	" Everything that the Father has is mine ; that is why I said that he will take of what is mine and make it known to you .
43016016	" In a little while you shall behold me no more ; and again in a little while you shall see me , because I am going to the Father . "
43016017	At this some of his disciples said among themselves . " What does he mean by telling us , In a little while you shall behold me no more ; and again in a little while you shall see me , and because I am going to the Father ? "
43016018	So they kept asking . " What does that little while mean of which he speaks ? We do not know what he is talking about . "
43016019	Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him , and said . " Are you questioning one another about my saying , A little while and you shall behold me no more , and again a little while you shall see me ?
43016020	" I tell you solemnly that you will be weeping and wailing while the world is rejoicing ; you will be grief-stricken , but your grief shall be turned into gladness .
43016021	" A woman in labor has grief because her hour is come ; but when she has given birth to the babe she no longer remembers her anguish , because of joy that a child has been born into the world .
43016022	" So you also have sorrow now , but I will see you again and your heart will rejoice , and your joy shall no man snatch away from you .
43016023	" And in that day you will ask me no questions . Most solemnly I tell you that whatever you ask the Father in my name , he will give you .
43016024	" Hitherto you have asked nothing in my name ; ask , and you shall receive , that your joy may be full .
43016025	" I have told you these things in figures ; but the time is coming when I shall no longer speak in figures , but will tell you about the Father in plain words .
43016026	" In that day you shall pray in my name ; and I do not tell you that I will ask the Father on your behalf ;
43016027	" for the Father himself loves you , because you have loved me and believed that I came forth from the God .
43016028	" I came forth from the Father , and am come into the world . again , I am leaving the world , and am going to the Father . "
43016029	" Ah , " said the disciples , " now you are speaking plain language , and not using figures . Now we are sure that you know all things , and have no need for any one to question you ; by this we believe that you came forth from God . "
43016031	" Do you now believe ? " said Jesus ;
43016032	" behold the hour approaches and is already come when you will be scattered , each man to his home , and will leave me alone ; and yet I am not alone , because the Father is with me .
43016033	" I have said all this to you that in me you might have peace . In the world you will have tribulation , but be courageous ; I have overcome the world . "
43017001	When he had thus spoken , Jesus raised his eyes to heaven and said . " Father , the hour is come . Glorify the Son , that thy Son may glorify thee ;
43017002	" since thou hast given him authority over all mankind , to give eternal life to all whom thou hast given him .
43017003	" And this is eternal life , to know thee , the only true God , and Jesus Christ whom thou hast sent .
43017004	" I have glorified thee on the earth ; I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do .
43017005	" And now , O Father , glorify thou me with own self , with the glory I had with thee before the world began .
43017006	" I have made known thy name to the men whom thou gavest me out of the world . Thine they were , and thou gavest them to me , and they have kept thy word .
43017007	" They know now that whatever thou hast given me was from thee ;
43017008	" for I have given them the words which thou gavest me ; and they have received them , and they have believed that thou didst send me .
43017009	" I am praying for them ; I am not praying for the world , but for those whom thou hast given me ; for they are thine ,
43017010	" and all thine are mine , and mine are thine ; and I am glorified in them .
43017011	I am no longer in the world , but these are in the world , and I come to thee . Holy Father , keep through thine own Name these whom thou hast given me , that they may be one as we are one .
43017012	While I was with them I kept them by the power of thy name which thou hast given me . I guarded them , and none of them was lost except the son of perdition , that the Scripture might be fulfilled .
43017013	" But now I am coming to thee , and I am speaking these things while I am in the world , so that they may have my joy in all its fulness in themselves .
43017014	I have given them thy word ; and the world has hated them because they are not of the world , even as I am not of the world .
43017015	I am not asking that thou wilt take them out of the world , but that thou wilt protect them from the Evil One .
43017016	They are not of the world , even as I am not of the world .
43017017	Dedicate them in thy truth ;  thy word is truth .
43017018	" As thou hast sent me into the world , even so I also have sent them into the world .
43017019	" And for their sakes I dedicate myself , that they also may be thoroughly dedicated in the truth .
43017020	" Nor do I pray for them alone , but for those also who believe in me through their word ,
43017021	" that they may all be one , even as thou , Father , art in me and I in thee ; that they also may be in us ; in order that the world may believe that thou hast sent me .
43017022	" And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them ; that they may be one even as we are one ,
43017023	" I in them and thou in me ; that they may be made perfectly one , so that the world may recognize that thou didst send me , and hast loved them as thou hast loved me .
43017024	" Father , it is my will that wherever I am these also , thy gift to me , may be with me , that they may see the glory , my glory which thou hast given me , because thou didst love me before the foundations of the world .
43017025	" O righteous Father , though the world knew thee not , I have known thee , and these have known that though didst send me .
43017026	" And I have declared - and will declare - thy name unto them , that the love with which thou hast loved me may be in them , and that I may be in them . "
43018001	After he had spoken these words Jesus went forth with his disciples to a place across the Ravine of the Cedars , where there was a garden into which he and his disciples went .
43018002	Judas the Traitor also knew this place ; for Jesus and his disciples often met there .
43018003	So after getting troops and some Temple police from the chief priests and Pharisees , Judas came there with lanterns and torches and weapons .
43018004	Then Jesus , knowing all that was coming upon him , went forth to meet them , and asked them , " Who is it that you are looking for ? "
43018005	" For Jesus of Nazareth , " they answered . He said to them , " I am he . " ( Now Judas also , the betrayer , was standing with them . )
43018006	When Jesus said " I am he , " they drew back and fell to the ground ;
43018007	so he asked them once more , " Whom are you looking for ? " and they replied , " Jesus of Nazareth . "
43018008	" I have already told you that I am he , " said Jesus . " If , then , you are looking for me , let these go their way . "
43018009	" ( In order that the word which he had spoken might be fulfilled , " Of those whom thou hast given me I have not lost one . " )
43018010	Then Simon Peter , who had a sword , drew it , and striking at the high priests slave , cut off his right ear .
43018011	( The slaves name was Malchus . ) Then Jesus said to Peter . " Put up your sword in its sheath . the cup which my Father has given me , shall I not drink it ? "
43018012	So the troops and their commandant and the Jewish police took Jesus , and bound him ,
43018013	and led him to Annas first . ( For Annas was the Father-in-law of Caiaphas , who was the high priest that year -
43018014	the Caiaphas who had advised the Jews that it was for their advantage that one man should die for the people . )
43018015	Meanwhile Simon Peter was following Jesus , and so was another disciple who was known to the high priest , and they went in with Jesus into the court of the high priests palace .
43018016	But Peter took his stand outside , near the door . So the other disciple who was known to the high priest came out and spoke to the doorkeeper and brought Peter in .
43018017	The doorkeeper ( a maid servant ) then said to Peter , " Are not you also one of this mans disciples ? " " No I am not , " he answered .
43018018	Now the slaves and the attendants were standing and warming themselves about a charcoal fire , which they had made because it was cold ; and Peter also stood with them , and was warming himself .
43018019	Then the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching .
43018020	Jesus answered him . " I have spoken to all the world openly . I always taught in a synagogue and in the temple , places where all the Jews are wont to assemble , and in secret I have spoken nothing .
43018021	" Why do you question me ? Ask those who heard what I have said to them ; these witnesses here know what I said . "
43018022	When he had spoken these words , one of the police standing by gave him a blow with his hand , saying as he did so , " Is that the way you answer the high priest ? "
43018023	Jesus replied " If I have said anything wrong , give evidence concerning the wrong ; but if I said what was true , why do you strike me ? "
43018024	Then Annas sent him in chains to Caiaphas , the high priest .
43018025	Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself . They said therefore to him , " You are not also one of his disciples , are you not ? " He denied it , saying " I am not . "
43018026	One of the slaves of the high priest , a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off , said , " Did not I myself see you with him in the garden . "
43018027	Peter again denied it ; and at that very moment a cock crew .
43018028	From the house of Caiaphas they took Jesus to the Praetorium , and it was dawn . They themselves would not enter the Praetorium , in order that they might not be ceremonially defiled , but might be able to eat the Passover .
43018029	So Pilate came outside to them and asked , " What charge do you bring against this man ? "
43018030	In reply they said , " If he had not been a criminal , we should not have handed him over you . "
43018031	" Take him yourselves , " answered Pilate , " and judge him according to your law . "
43018032	The Jews answered him , " We are not allowed to put anyone to death " ( that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled in which he predicted the kind of death he was to die ) .
43018033	So Pilate went into the Praetorium again , and summoned Jesus . " Are you the King of the Jews ? " he said .
43018034	Jesus answered , " Are you saying this of your own accord , or did others say it to you about me ? "
43018035	" I am not a Jew , am I ? " replied Pilate ; " It is your own nation and the high priests who have handed you over to me . What have you done ? "
43018036	Jesus answered him . " My kingdom is not of this world . If my kingdom were of this world , then would my servants have fought hard that I should not be handed the Jews ; but in reality my kingdom is not of such origins . "
43018037	" You are a king , then ? You ! " said Pilate . " You say truly that I am a king . " answered Jesus , " for this purpose I was born , and to this end came I into the world , that I should bear witness to the truth . Every man who is of the truth listens to my voice . "
43018038	Pilate said to him , " What is truth ? " As he said this , he went outside again to the Jews and said to them .
43018039	" I find no crime in this man . Now it is a custom of yours that I release one prisoner to you at the time of the Passover feast . Do you wish me to release to you the King of the Jews ? "
43018040	Then they all shouted again . " No , not him ! Barabbas ! " Now Barabbas was a robber .
43019001	After that Pilate took Jesus and had him scourged ;
43019002	and the soldiers plaited a crown of thorns , placed it on his head , and threw a purple cloak about him , and kept marching up to him ,
43019003	saying , " Hail ! King of the Jews ! " They also gave him blow after blow with their hands .
43019004	Pilate again came forth and said to the people , " See , I am going to bring his out to you , that you may clearly know that I find no crime in him , "
43019005	Then as Jesus came out , wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe , Pilate said to them , " BEHOLD , THE MAN ! "
43019006	So when the chief priests and the police saw him , they shouted . " Crucify him ! Crucify him ! " " Take him yourselves and crucify him , " said Pilate , " for I find no crime in him . "
43019007	The Jews answered him , " We have a law , and by that law he ought to die , because he made himself out to be Gods Son , "
43019008	Now when Pilate heard these words he was more alarmed than ever ,
43019009	and entering the Praetorium again , he said to Jesus , " What is your origin ? "
43019010	Jesus made no answer . So Pilate said to him . " Do you not speak to me ? Do you not know that I have power to release you , or power to crucify you ? "
43019011	" You would have no power over me , " answered Jesus , " unless it had been given you from above . For this reason he who has betrayed me to you has the greater sin . "
43019012	After that Pilate began to seek to release him , but the Jews shouted out . " If you release this man you are no friend of the Emperor . Any man who makes himself out to be king is a rebel against the Emperor . "
43019013	On hearing what they said , Pilate brought Jesus out and made him sit on the judges seat in a place called the Mosaic Pavement ( the Hebrew name is Gabbatha ) .
43019014	And it was the day of Preparation for the Passover , about six oclock in the morning . Then he said to the Jews , " Behold your King ! "
43019015	Then they shouted . " Away with him ! Away with him ! Crucify him ! " " Crucify your King ? " said Pilate . The chief priests answered , " We have no king but Caesar ! "
43019016	So then he gave him over to them to be crucified .
43019017	So they took Jesus , who went forth bearing his own cross , to a place called The Place of a Skull - in the Hebrew tongue , Golgotha .
43019018	There they crucified him ; and with him two others , one on either side , and Jesus between them .
43019019	And Pilate moreover wrote an inscription and placed it above the cross . What he wrote was , " JESUS , THE NAZARENE , KING OF THE JEWS "
43019020	This inscription was read by many of the Jews , because the place where they crucified Jesus was near the city , and the inscription was written in Hebrew , Latin , and Greek .
43019021	So the high priests of the Jews said to Pilate , " Do not write King of the Jews , but He said , I am King of the Jews . "
43019022	Pilate answered , " What I have written , I have written ! "
43019023	After the soldiers had crucified Jesus , they took his garments and divided them into four parts , to each soldier a part , and the tunic . Now the tunic was seamless , woven in one piece from top to bottom ;
43019024	so the soldiers said one to another . " Let us not tear it . Let us draw lots , to see whose it shall be " - that the Scripture might be fulfilled . They divided my garments among them , For my raiment did they cast lots . This was what the soldiers did .
43019025	Now there stood near the cross of Jesus , his mother and his mothers sister , Mary the wife of Clopas , and Mary Magdalene .
43019026	When Jesus saw his mother , and standing near her the disciple whom he loved , he said to his mother , " Woman behold your son . "
43019027	Then he said to the disciple , " Behold your mother . " And from that hour the disciple took her to his home .
43019028	After that , when Jesus knew that everything was now accomplished , he said in fulfilment of the words of Scripture , " I am thirsty . "
43019029	There was a jar full of vinegar standing there ; and they filled a sponge with vinegar , and put it upon a stalk of hyssop , and put it to his lips .
43019030	Then after he had taken the vinegar , Jesus said , " IT IS FINISHED ! " And bowing his head , he yielded up his spirit .
43019031	It was Preparation Day , so in order to prevent the bodies hanging on the cross during the Sabbath ( for the Sabbath was a great day ) the Jews begged Pilate to have the legs broken , and the bodies taken away .
43019032	So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and of the other who had been crucified with him .
43019033	But upon coming to Jesus they saw that he was already dead , and did not break his legs .
43019034	One of the soldiers , however , pierced his side with a lance , and immediately blood and water flowed out .
43019035	And he who saw it has borne testimony , and his testimony is trustworthy , and he knows that he is telling the truth in order that you may believe .
43019036	For this happened that the Scripture might be fulfilled , Not one of his bones shall be broken .
43019037	And again another Scripture says , They shall look on him whom they have pierced .
43019038	After these things Joseph of Arimathea , who was a disciple of Jesus , but in secret because of fear of the Jews , asked Pilate for permission to take the body of Jesus , and Pilate gave him leave . So he came and took the body .
43019039	Nicodemus also ( the one who visited Jesus by night , at first ) came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes , weighing nearly a hundred pounds .
43019040	So they took the body of Jesus and wound it in linen with the spices , according to the Jewish mode of burial .
43019041	There was a garden near the place where Jesus had been crucified , and in the garden a new tomb in which no one had ever been laid .
43019042	Here , because of its being Preparation Day , and as the tomb was near by , they placed Jesus .
43020001	On the first day of the week , very early in the morning , while it was yet dark , Mary Magdalene came to the tomb and discovered that the stone had been removed from the tomb .
43020002	So she came running to Simon Peter and that other disciple whom Jesus loved , saying , " They have taken the Master out of the tomb , and we do not know where they have laid him ! "
43020003	So Peter and the other disciples set out at once to go to the tomb .
43020004	They both began to run ; and the other disciple ran faster than Peter , and came first to the tomb .
43020005	Stooping down he glanced in and saw the linen wrapping lying on the ground ; but he did not go in .
43020006	Then Peter also came following him , and he went inside the tomb ; and he gazed at the linen wrapping as they lay ,
43020007	and the napkin which had been about his head not lying with the wrappings , but rolled up in its own place .
43020008	Then the other disciple also who arrived first at the tomb went inside , and he perceived and believed .
43020009	For not yet had they understood the Scripture , that he must rise again from the dead .
43020010	Then the disciples went back again to their home .
43020011	Meanwhile , outside , Mary stood sobbing near the tomb . Still sobbing she stooped and looked into the tomb ,
43020012	and gazed at two angels in glistening white sitting , one at the head the other at the feet , where the body of Jesus had lain .
43020013	They said to her , " Woman , why are you weeping ? " She answered , " Because they have taken away my Master , and I do not know where they have laid him . "
43020014	When she had said this she turned around and saw Jesus standing there , but did not know that it was Jesus .
