43020015	Jesus said to her . " Woman , why are you weeping ? Whom are you seeking ? She , supposing that he was the gardener , said to him , " Sir , if you have borne him away , tell me where you have put him , and I will take him away , myself . "
43020016	" Mary , " said Jesus . She turned to him . " Rabboni ! " she cried in Hebrew . That is to say , " Teacher . "
43020017	" Do not cling to me , " said Jesus , " for I am not yet ascended to the Father . But go to my brothers and say to them , " I am ascending to my Father and your Father , to my God and your God . "
43020018	Away went Mary Magdalene to the disciples with the tidings , " I have seen the Master ! " and that he said these things to her .
43020019	On the evening of that same day , the first day of the week , although the doors of the room where the disciples gathered had been locked for fear of the Jews , Jesus came , and there he stood among them , saying . " Peace to you ! "
43020020	As he said this he showed them his hands and his side . Then were the disciple glad , when they saw the Lord .
43020021	Then Jesus said to them again . " Peace to you . As my Father has sent me forth , I also now am sending you . "
43020022	When he had said this he breathed upon them and said .
43020023	" Receive the Holy Spirit . If you remit any ones sins , they are remitted ; if you retain them they are retained . "
43020024	But Thomas , one of the Twelve , who was called " The Twin . " was not with them when Jesus came .
43020025	Accordingly the other disciples kept telling him , " We have seen the Lord . " But he told them , " Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails , and thrust my finger into the print of the nails , and thrust my hand into his side , I will not believe it . "
43020026	A week later his disciples were again in the house , and Thomas was with them . Jesus came , although the doors were locked , and stood there among and said . " Peace to you ! "
43020027	Then to Thomas he said . " Place your finger here , and see my hands ; and place your hand here , and thrust it into my side , and become not unbelieving , but believing . "
43020028	Thomas answered him , " My Lord and my God ! "
43020029	" Because you have seen me , Thomas , you have believed , " Jesus told him . " Blessed are those who , without seeing , yet believed . "
43020030	There were then many other signs which Jesus performed in the presence of his disciples , which have not been written in this book ;
43020031	but these have been written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ , the Son of God , and that by believing you may have life in his name .
43021001	After this Jesus showed himself again to his disciples by the Sea of Tiberias . He showed himself as follows .
43021002	There were together Simon Peter and Thomas , called " The Twin , " and Nathanael , from Cana of Galilee , and the two sons of Zebedee , and two others of his disciples .
43021003	Simon Peter said to them , " I am going fishing . " They answered him , " And we are going with you . " So they went out and got into the boat , and throughout the night they caught nothing .
43021004	But when day was dawning Jesus stood on the beach . The disciples , however , did not recognize that it was Jesus .
43021005	So Jesus said to them , " Lads , you havent any fish , have you ? " They answered him , " No . "
43021006	And he said to them , " Cast your net on the right side of the boat , and you will find . " So they cast it , and now they could not haul it in for the multitude of fishes .
43021007	Then that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter , " It is the Lord ! " On hearing that it was the Lord , Simon Peter girt his fishers coat about him ( for he was naked ) , and threw himself into the water .
43021008	The rest of the disciples came in the boat , for they were not far from shore - only about a hundred yards - dragging in the net full of fish .
43021009	When they got to the shore they beheld a charcoal fire ready laid , with fish on it , and some bread .
43021010	" Bring some of the fish you have just caught , " Jesus told them .
43021011	So Simon Peter went and dragged the net to shore , full of large fish , a hundred and fifty-three of them ; but for all this number the net was not torn .
43021012	" Come and have breakfast , " said Jesus to them . Not one of the disciples dared ask him , " Who are you ? " Knowing that it was the Lord .
43021013	Jesus went and took bread and gave it to them , and the fish also .
43021014	This was the third time that Jesus showed himself to the disciples after he had risen from among the dead .
43021015	When they were through breakfast , Jesus said to Simon Peter , " Simon , son of John , do you love me more than these others do ? " " Yes , Lord , you know that you are dear to me . " he answered . Jesus said to him , " Feed my lambs . "
43021016	He said to him a second time , " Simon , son of John , do you love me ? " He answered , " Yes , Lord , you know that you are dear to me . " " Be a shepherd to my sheep , " said Jesus .
43021017	The third time Jesus asked him , " Am I really dear to you ? " Peter was grieved because the third time he asked , " Am I really dear to you ? " and he answered , " Master , you know all things , you know that you are dear to me . "
43021018	" Feed my sheep , " said Jesus . " In solemn truth I tell you that when you were young , you used to put on your own girdle , and walk wherever you wished ; but when you grow old you will stretch out your hands for some one to gird you , and carry you where you do not wish to go . "
43021019	This he said to show by what kind of death Peter was to glorify God . After speaking thus , he said to him , " Follow me . "
43021020	Peter turned around and saw that the disciple whom Jesus loved was following - he who at the supper leaned back upon his breast and said , " Lord , who is to betray you ? "
43021021	On catching sight of him , Peter said to Jesus , " Lord , what about him ? "
43021022	" If I choose that he remain until I come , " said Jesus , " what is that to you ? Do you follow me . "
43021023	Accordingly the report spread among the brothers that this disciple should not die ; but Jesus did not say that he was not to die , but said , " If I choose that he remain until I come , what is that to you ? "
43021024	It is this disciple who bears testimony to these facts and who recorded them ; and we know that his testimony is true .
43021025	But there are also many other things which Jesus did ; if every one of them were to be recorded in detail I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would have to be written .
44001001	My first account , O Theophilus , dealt with all that Jesus began doing and teaching from the beginning down to the day when ,
44001002	after giving instructions through the Spirit to the apostles whom he had chosen , he was taken up to heaven .
44001003	After his sufferings he had also shown himself alive to them in many convincing manifestations , revealing himself to them during forty days , and speaking of the kingdom of God .
44001004	And once when he was eating with them he charged them not to depart from Jerusalem , but to wait for the promise of the Father . " Of this , " he said , " you have heard from me .
44001005	" For John indeed baptized in water , but you shall be baptized in the Holy Spirit not many days hence . "
44001006	So , when they came together , they began to ask him , " Master , are you at this time about to restore the kingdom of Israel ? "
44001007	He answered . " It is not for you to know times and occasions which the Father has fixed in his own authority ;
44001008	" yet you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes upon you , and you are to be my witnesses both in Jerusalem and in all Judea , and in Samaria , and to the very ends of the earth . "
44001009	When he had said this , and while they were looking at him , he was lifted up , and a cloud received him up out of their sight .
44001010	While they were gazing into the sky as he was going up , suddenly there were two men in white garments standing by them ,
44001011	and they said . " Men of Galilee , why do you stand gazing into the sky ? This same Jesus who has been taken up from you into the sky will come back in just the same way as you have seen him going into the sky . "
44001012	Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called Olivet , which is near Jerusalem , about a Sabbath Days journey distant .
44001013	On entering the city they went to the upper room where they were accustomed to meet . They were Peter and John and James and Andrew , Philip and Thomas , Bartholomew and Matthew , James , son of Alphaeus , and Simon the Zealot , and Judas the son of James .
44001014	These all with one mind gave their constant attention to prayer , together with some women , and with Mary the mother of Jesus , and his brothers .
44001015	It was during these days that Peter stood up among the brothers - the whole number of persons present was about one hundred and twenty - and said .
44001016	" Men and brothers , it was necessary for the Scripture to be fulfilled which the Holy Spirit uttered beforehand by the lips of David in regard to Judas who acted as guide to those who arrested Jesus .
44001017	" For he was numbered among us , and he did get his allotted share of this ministry .
44001018	" Now this man bought a plot of ground with the price of his treachery , and falling there headlong he burst asunder and all his bowels gushed out .
44001019	" This fact became known to the people of Jerusalem so that the place was called in their language , Acheldamach , The Field of Blood .
44001020	" For it is written in the Book of Psalms , Let his dwelling-place be desolate ; Let no man dwell there , also , Let another take his work .
44001021	" It is necessary then that , of the men who have been associated with us during the whole time in which the Lord Jesus went in and out among us ,
44001022	from his baptism by John down to the day on which he was taken up from us , one should join us a witness to his resurrection . "
44001023	So they placed two in nomination , Joseph called Bar-Sabbas ( surnamed Justas ) and Matthias ;
44001024	and they prayed , saying . " Thou , O Lord , who knowest the hearts of all men , show clearly which of these two men thou hast chosen to fill the place
44001025	" in this ministry of this apostles from which Judas went out to go to his own place . "
44001026	Then they cast lots for them , and the lot fell upon Matthias , and he was numbered with the eleven apostles .
44002001	When the day of Pentecost was fully come , and they were all together in the same place ,
44002002	there came suddenly from the sky a sound like the onrush of a mighty wind , and it filled all the house where they were sitting .
44002003	There appeared to them tongues , like flame , distributing themselves , one resting upon the head of each one ,
44002004	and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit , and began to speak with other tongues as the Spirit was giving them utterance .
44002005	Now there were , staying in Jerusalem . devout Jews from many and distant lands .
44002006	So when this noise was heard , the crowd gathered in bewilderment because each man heard them speaking in his own language .
44002007	The were beside themselves with wonder . " Are not these Galileans who are speaking ? " they exclaimed .
44002008	" Then how is it that each one of us hears them speak his own mother tongue ?
44002009	Parthians , Medes , Elamites , dwellers in Mesopotamia , in Judea , in Cappadocia , in Pontus and Asia ,
44002010	in Phrygia , Pamphylia , Egypt , and the district of Lybia around Cretans and Arabians ,
44002011	we all hear these men telling in our own tongue what great things God has done . "
44002012	All were astonished and bewildered and kept saying to one another , " What can this mean ? "
44002013	But others were saying with jeer , " These men are full of sweet wine . "
44002014	Then Peter , with the Eleven , stood up and addresses them in a loud voice . " Men of Judea and dwellers in Jerusalem , have no doubt about this matter , but listen to what I say .
44002015	" These men are not drunk , as you suppose , since it is only nine oclock in the morning .
44002016	" No , this is what the prophet Joel predicted .
44002017	" In the last days , God says , it shall come to pass that I will pour out my Spirit upon all mankind ; " Your sons and your daughters shall prophesy , your young men shall see visions , your old men shall dream dreams ;
44002018	upon my slaves , both men and women , in those days , will I pour out my Spirit , and they shall prophesy .
44002019	In the sky above I will show marvels , And signs in the earth beneath ; Blood and fire , and vapor of smoke .
44002020	Into darkness shall the sun be turned , And into blood the moon , Ere the day of the Lord come , that great and terrible day .
44002021	And every one who calls upon the name of the Lord will be saved .
44002022	" Men of Israel , listen to these words . Jesus the Nazarene , a man accredited to you by God , through mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him among you , as you yourselves know ;
44002023	him , delivered up by the settled purpose and fore-knowledge of God , you crucified and killed at the hands of lawless men ;
44002024	but God has raised him to life , having loosed the pangs of death , because it was not possible for death to hold him .
44002025	For David says of him . " I beheld the Lord always before my face ; For he is at my right hand lest I be shaken .
44002026	" Therefore my heart is glad , my tongue exults , my very body also shall pitch its tent in hope .
44002027	" For thou wilt not leave my soul in Hades , Nor give up thy Holy One to see corruption .
44002028	" Thou hast made known to me the paths of life , Thou wilt fill me with gladness in thy presence .
44002029	" Men and brothers , I can speak plainly to you concerning the patriarch David , because he not only died and was buried , but his tomb is among us even to this very day .
44002030	" Because he was a prophet and knew that God had sworn to him with an oath that of the fruit of his loins he would set one on his throne ,
44002031	" he , foreseeing this , spoke of the resurrection of Christ that neither was he left in Hades , nor did his flesh see corruption .
44002032	This Jesus God has raised up , of this we are all witnesses .
44002033	Since he is by the mighty hand of God exalted , and has received from his Father the promise of the Holy Spirit , he has poured forth this which you now see and hear .
44002034	For David did not ascend into heaven ; but he himself said , " The Lord said to my Lord Sit thou on my right hand
44002035	" Until I make thine enemies A footstool under thy feet .
44002036	" Therefore let the whole House of Israel know assuredly that Gods has made him both Lord and Christ , this Jesus whom you have crucified . "
44002037	When they heard these words they were stung to the heart , and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles . " Men and brothers , what shall we do ? "
44002038	" Repent , " answered Peter , " and be baptized , every one of you , in the name of Jesus Christ , for the remission of your sins , and you shall receive the gift of the Holy Spirit .
44002039	" For the promise belongs to you and to your children and to all who are afar off , whomever the Lord may call . "
44002040	With many other words he continued to bear testimony , and kept entreating them , saying , " Save yourselves from this perverse generation . "
44002041	Then those who welcomed his message were baptized , and in that day about three thousand souls were added to them ;
44002042	and they stedfastly continued in the teaching of the apostles , and in the fellowship , in the breaking of the bread , and in the prayers .
44002043	And awe came upon every soul , and many wonders and signs were wrought by the apostles .
44002044	And all the believers were together , and had all things in common .
44002045	They would sell their lands and other property , and distribute the proceeds among all , just as any one from time had need .
44002046	Day after day they continued stedfastly with one accord in the Temple ; and breaking bread together in their own homes , they continued to eat their food with gladness and an undivided heart ,
44002047	praising God , and looked on with favor by all the people . Meanwhile the Lord kept adding to them daily those that were being saved .
44003001	One day Peter and John were going up together for the hour of prayer , at three in the afternoon ,
44003002	when a man lame from his birth was carried along , who was wont to be laid each day near the gate of the Temple called the Beautiful Gate , to ask alms of those who were going into the Temple .
44003003	When he saw Peter and John about to go into the Temple , he kept asking them for alms ;
44003004	Peter fixed his eyes upon him , as did John , and said , " Look at us . "
44003005	So he waited , expecting to get something from them . Then Peter said .
44003006	" I have neither silver nor gold , but what I do have , this I am going to give to you ; in the name of Jesus Christ , the Nazarene , walk ! "
44003007	Then taking his right hand he lifted him up . Instantly his feet and ankle-bones were strengthened ;
44003008	and leaping forth he stood on his feet , and began to walk , and went with them into the Temple , walking , and leaping , and praising God .
44003009	When all the people saw him walking and praising God ,
44003010	and recognized that this was the man who used to sit and beg at the Beautiful Gate of the Temple , they were filled with awe and amazement at what had happened to him .
44003011	While he was clinging to Peter and John , all the people crowded awe-struck around them , in what was known as Solomons Portico .
44003012	When he saw this , Peter said to the people . " Men of Israel , why are you wondering at this ? Why do you stare at us , as if by our own power or piety we had made this man to walk ?
44003013	" The God of Abram , Isaac , and Jacob , the God of our fathers , has glorified his Servant Jesus , whom you betrayed and disowned before Pilate , when he had decided to let him go ;
44003014	" but you disowned the holy and righteous One , and asked as a favor the release of a murderer .
44003015	" The Pioneer of Life you put to death . But God has raised him from the dead , and we are witnesses of that fact .
44003016	" And his name , on the ground of faith in his name , has made strong this man , whom you now see and know ; yes , the faith that is through him has made this man sound and strong again , in the presence of you all .
44003017	" And now , brothers , I know that you did it in ignorance , as did also your rulers .
44003018	" But God has thus fulfilled what he foretold by the mouth of all the prophets , that his Christ should suffer .
44003019	" Repent then ! and reform , from the blotting out of your sins , so that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord ;
44003020	" and that he may send Jesus , your appointed Messiah ,
44003021	" whom the heavens must receive until the time of restoration of all things . " God spoke of this ages ago , through the mouth of his holy prophets .
44003022	" Moses , for example , said . " The Lord your God will raise up a Prophet for you from among your brothers , as he raised up me ; you must listen to whatever he may tell you ;
44003023	" and it shall be that every soul who will not listen to that Prophet shall be utterly destroyed from among the people .
44003024	" Yes , and all the prophets from Samuel and his successors , all that have spoken , have also told of those days .
44003025	" You are the sons of the prophets , and of the covenant which God made with your fathers , saying to Abraham , " And in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed .
44003026	" It was for you first that God raised up his Servant , and sent him to bless you in turning every one of you away from your wicked ways . "
44004001	While they were addressing the people the priests , the commander of the Temple , and the Sadducees came upon them ,
44004002	incensed at their teaching the people , and proclaiming , in the case of Jesus , the resurrection from the dead .
44004003	They arrested them , and put them in prison till the next day , for it was already evening .
44004004	But many of those who had heard the message believed , and the number of the men came to be about five thousand .
44004005	There was held in Jerusalem , next morning , a meeting of their rulers , the elders and scribes ,
44004006	and Annas , the high priest , Caiaphas , John , Alexander , and all the members of the high priests family were present .
44004007	Then they made the men stand before them and demanded , " By what power , or in what name , have you fellows done this ? "
44004008	Then Peter , filled with the Holy Spirit , answered them .
44004009	" Rulers and elders of the people , if we are being examined today concerning a benefit conferred upon a cripple , as to how has this man been cured ,
44004010	" be it known to all of you , and to all the people of Israel , that in the name of Jesus Christ , the Nazarene , whom you crucified , whom God raised from the dead , in him does this man stand before you strong and well .
44004011	" For he is the Stone , cast aside by you builders , which has become the head stone of the corner .
44004012	" There is no salvation in any other , for there is no other name under heaven given among men , in which we must be saved . "
44004013	Now when they beheld the glad fearlessness of Peter and John and had perceived that they were amazed ; and they began to recognize them , that they were companions of Jesus .
44004014	But since they saw the man standing with them who had been healed , they had nothing to answer .
44004015	So they bade them withdraw from the Sanhedrin , while they conferred together .
44004016	" What , " said they , " shall we do with these men ? For it is well known throughout Jerusalem that a notable miracle has been performed by them , and we cannot deny it .
44004017	" But that the matter may spread no further among the people , let us threaten them not to speak to any one hereafter about this name . "
44004018	So they summoned them , and ordered them not to speak at all , nor to teach in the name of Jesus .
44004019	But Peter and John said in reply . " Do you decide whether in the sight of God it is right to obey you rather than God ;
44004020	but for our part , we cannot help speaking about what we have seen and heard . "
44004021	So when they had further threatened them they let the apostles go , being quite unable to find any way of punishing them because of the people , for everybody was glorifying God over what had happened .
44004022	For the man on whom this miracle of healing had been wrought was over forty years old .
44004023	As soon as the apostles were released , they went to their friends , and told what the high priests and elders had said .
44004024	And when they heard it they all lifted up their voices in prayer to God , saying . " O Sovereign Lord , who madest heaven and earth and sea , and all that in them is ,
44004025	" who saidest through the Holy Spirit , by the lips of thy servant David , our forefather . " Why did the Gentiles rage , And the peoples form futile plans ?
44004026	" The kings of the earth set themselves in array , And the rulers were gathered together Against the Lord and against his Christ .
44004027	" In this very city they did gather together against thy holy Servant , Jesus whom thou hast anointed - Herod and Pontius Pilate , with the Gentiles and also the tribes of Israel -
44004028	" to do all that thy power and thy will had predetermined should be done .
44004029	" And now Lord , listen to their threats , and grant to thy slaves to proclaim thy message with all boldness ,
44004030	" whilst thou stretchest forth thy hand to heal ; grant too , that signs and wonders may be done through the name of thy holy Servant , Jesus . "
44004031	When they had prayed , the place where they were gathered was shaken ; and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit , and began to speak the message of the Lord with boldness .
44004032	Now the multitude of the believers was of one heart and one soul , nor did any one of them say that any of his possessions was his own ; but they had all things common .
44004033	And the apostles continued with great power to give their witness concerning the resurrection of the Lord Jesus , and great grace was upon them all .
44004034	Nor was there any one of them in want , for all who owned houses or lands would sell them and bring the price of the things that were sold , and lay it at the apostles feet ;
44004035	and distribution would be made to each according to his need .
44004036	In this way Joseph , whom the apostles called Barnabas ( " Son of Encouragement " is what it means ) , who was a native Cyprus ,
44004037	sold a farm which he had , and brought the price , and laid it at the apostles feet .
44005001	But a man named Ananias who , with his wife Sapphira , sold a farm of his ,
44005002	kept back some of the purchase price , with the connivance of his wife . He brought only a part and laid it at the apostles feet .
44005003	" Ananias , " said Peter , " why has Satan so filled your heart that you are lying to the Holy Spirit , and keeping back part of the price of the land ?
44005004	" While it remained unsold , was it not your own ? And after it was sold , was not the price at your own disposal ? How could you conceive this act in your heart ? You have not lied unto men , but unto God . "
44005005	As Ananias heard these words he fell down and expired , and all who heard were awe-struck .
44005006	But the younger men rose , wrapped the body up , and carried it out to bury it .
44005007	About three hours later his wife came in , not knowing what had happened ;
44005008	and Peter said to her , " Tell me if you got so much for the land . " " Yes , " she said , " so much . "
44005009	" Why was it , " said Peter , " that you both agreed to tempt the Spirit of the Lord ? Lo , the feet of those who buried your husband are at the door , and they shall carry you out . "
44005010	Instantly she fell down at his feet and expired , and when the young men came in they found her dead , and carried her out and buried her husband .
44005011	And great fear fell on all the church and upon all who had heard it .
44005012	Many signs and wonders continued to be wrought among the people by the hands of the apostles , and by common consent they all would meet in Solomons Porch ,
44005013	but none of the rest dared to associate with them .
44005014	Yet the people continued to hold them in high honor , and more and more believers in the Lord were joining them , both men and women .
44005015	In consequence people would even bring out their sick into the streets , and place them upon beds and pallets as Peter was passing , that at least his shadow might fall upon some of them .
44005016	The people of the towns near Jerusalem also continued to come in crowds , bringing their sick and those who were harried by unclean spirits , and all of them were healed .
44005017	This aroused bitter indignation among the high priest and his followers who were of the sect of the Sadducees ,
44005018	and they apprehended the apostles , and threw them into the public prison .
44005019	But an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors during the night , and let them out .
44005020	He said to them , " Go take your stand in the Temple , and continue to tell the people all the words of this Life . "
44005021	When they heard this they went at early dawn to the Temple , and began to teach . Meantime when the high priest and his followers arrived , they summoned the Sanhedrin and all the Council of the Elders of the sons of Israel , and sent to the prison to fetch the apostles .
44005022	But the officers who went did not find them in the prison ; so they came back and reported ,
44005023	" The prison we found locked fast , with the guards stationed at the doors , but when they were opened we found no one inside . "
44005024	When the officer in charge of the Temple and the high priest heard these words , they were perplexed concerning them , wondering what would come of it .
44005025	And some one came and told them that the very men whom they had put in prison were standing in the Temple , and teaching to the people .
44005026	On this the officer went off with his men and fetched them , not , however , by force , for they were afraid that the people would stone them .
44005027	So they brought them , and stood them before the Sanhedrin . Then the high priest questioned them .
44005028	" We strictly forbade you , did we not , to teach about this Name , and here you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching , and intend to bring this mans blood upon us . "
44005029	But Peter and the apostles said in reply .
44005030	" We must obey God rather than man . The God of our fathers has raised up Jesus , whom you slew by hanging him on a tree .
44005031	" Him God has exalted at his right hand as Prince and Saviour , to give Israel repentance and forgiveness of sins .
44005032	" And we are witnesses of these things , and so is the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey him . "
44005033	When they heard this they were infuriated , and were minded to kill the apostles ;
44005034	but Gamaliel , a Pharisee , a teacher of the law , and held in honor by all the people , rose from his seat , and ordered the apostles to be put outside for a little while .
44005035	He said . " Men of Israel , take care what you are about to do with these men .
44005036	" Years ago Theudas arose , claiming to be somebody , and was joined by about four hundred men . He was killed , and all of his followers dispersed and annihilated .
44005037	" After him Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the enrollment , and drew away some of the people after him . He also perished , and all his followers were scattered .
44005038	" And now , I say to you , hold aloof from these men . Let them alone ; for if this scheme or work be of human origin it will come to nothing ;
44005039	" but if it is from God , you cannot put it down ; you may even find yourselves fighting against God . "
44005040	They gave in to him ; and called the apostles in , and after flogging them , released them , with instructions not to speak about the name of Jesus .
44005041	So they left Sanhedrin , rejoicing that they had been deemed worthy to suffer disgrace for the sake of the Name ;
44005042	but not for a single day did they desist from teaching and preaching in the Temple , and in private houses , the Gospel of Jesus , the Messiah .
44006001	Now in these days while the number of the disciples was multiplying , the Grecian Jews began to murmur against the Hebrews , because their widows were habitually overlooked in the distribution of alms .
44006002	Then the Twelve called the general body of the disciples together , and said to them . " It is not fitting for us to leave off preaching the Word of God , and minister at tables .
44006003	" So , brothers , find from among your own number seven men of good reputation who are full of the Spirit and of wisdom , and we will appoint them over this business .
44006004	" But we will give ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the Word . "
44006005	This plan commended itself to the whole body , and they selected Stephen , a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit , and Philip , Prochorus , Nicanor , Timon , Parmenas , and Nicolas , a proselyte of Antioch .
44006006	These men they presented to the apostles who , when they had prayed , laid their hands upon them .
44006007	And the word of the Lord continued to spread ; and the number of the disciples in Jerusalem was increasing exceedingly , and a large number of priests became obedient to the faith .
44006008	Meanwhile Stephen , full of grace and power , wrought great wonders and signs among the people .
44006009	But certain men from the so-called " Synagogue of the Freedmen " and certain Cyrenians , and Alexandrians , Cilicians , and men from Roman Asia , started to dispute with Stephen ,
44006010	but were unable to withstand the wisdom and spirit with which he used to speak .
44006011	Then they instigated some to say , " We have heard him speaking blasphemy against Moses and against God ; " and in this way they excited the people .
44006012	The elders and the scribes rushed upon him , and seized him , and brought him into the Sanhedrin .
44006013	They also set up false witnesses who testified . " This fellow is continually talking against the Holy Place and against the law .
44006014	" For we have heard him say that Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place , and will change the customs which were handed down to us by Moses . "
44006015	Then all who were sitting in the council at once fixed their eyes upon him , and saw his face like the face of an angel .
44007001	And the high priest said , " Are these things so ? "
44007002	Stephen answered . " Listen , brothers and fathers . The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham , when he was in Mesopotamia , before he dwelt in Haran ,
44007003	and said to him , " Leave your country and your kindred , and come to whatever land I will show you .
44007004	" So he left Chaldea and settled in Haran , and from there , after his fathers death , God moved him to this land which you inhabit .
44007005	" But he gave him no inheritance in it , no , not a single square yard of ground ; yet he promised to bestow the land as a permanent possession on him and his posterity - he at that time being childless .
44007006	" What God said was this . " His offspring will sojourn in a foreign land where they will be enslaved and oppressed for four hundred years .
44007007	" And the nation , whichever it is , that enslaves them I will judge , said God , and after ward they shall come out , and they shall worship me in this place .
44007008	" Then he gave him a covenant of circumcision , and under this covenant he became the father of Isaac , whom he circumcised on the eighth day , and Isaac became the father of Jacob , and Jacob became the father of the twelve Patriarchs .
44007009	" The patriarchs out of jealousy sold Joseph into Egypt .
44007010	" But God was with him , and delivered him out of all his afflictions , and gave him grace and wisdom , when he stood before Pharaoh , king of Egypt , who appointed him Governor over Egypt , and over all the royal household .
44007011	" Then there came a famine over the whole of Egypt and Canaan , and great distress , so that our ancestors could not find food .
44007012	" But Jacob heard that there was food in Egypt , and sent our ancestors there on their first visit .
44007013	" On their second visit Joseph made himself known to his brothers , and Pharaoh was informed of Josephs parentage .
44007014	" Then Joseph sent and invited Jacob his father and all his family , numbering seventy-five souls , to come to him ;
44007015	" and Jacob went down into Egypt .
44007016	" There he died , and our ancestors also , and they were carried across to Shechem , and laid in the tomb which Abraham had purchased for a sum of money from the sons of Hamor in Shechem .
44007017	" but as the time drew near for the fulfilment of the promise which God made to Abraham , the people multiplied and increased in Egypt ;
44007018	" until there arose a king who knew not Joseph .
44007019	" He dealt craftily with our race , and oppressed our forefathers , by making them expose their infants so that they should not live .
44007020	" In this time Moses was born , a divinely beautiful child , who was brought up for three months in his fathers house .
44007021	" When he was exposed , Pharaohs daughter took him up , and brought him up as her own son .
44007022	" So Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians , and was mighty in his words and works .
44007023	" And when he was forty years old it came into his heart to visit his brothers , the children of Israel ;
44007024	" and when he saw one of them wronged he wrought redress for the one overpowered , by striking down the Egyptian .
44007025	" ( Now he supposed that his brothers would understand how God by his hand was bringing them deliverance ; but they did not . )
44007026	" Next day he came upon two of them fighting , and tried to make peace between them . " Sirs , he said , you are brothers . Why are you wronging each other ?
44007027	" But the man who was ill-treating his neighbor thrust him aside , saying , " Who made you a magistrate and ruler over us ?
44007028	" Do you want to kill me , as you killed the Egyptian yesterday ?
44007029	" Alarmed at this question , Moses fled from the land , and went to live in the land of Midian . There he became the father of two sons .
44007030	" But at the end of forty years there appeared to him , in the desert of Mt . Sinai , an angel in a flame of fire , in a bush .
44007031	" When Moses saw it he was astonished at the sight . But when he drew near to look , the voice of the Lord said ,
44007032	" I am the God of your fathers , the God of Abraham , Isaac , and Jacob . " And Moses trembled and dared not gaze .
44007033	" And the Lord said . " Take off your sandals , for the place on which you are standing is holy ground .
44007034	" Truly I have seen the oppression of my people in Egypt , and I have heard their groans , and am come down to rescue them ; and now , come , I will send you into Egypt .
44007035	" This Moses whom they refused when they said , Who made you to be a ruler and a judge ? that same Moses we find God sending as a ruler and a redeemer by the hand in the bush .
44007036	" This was he who brought them out , after he had shown signs and wonders in the wilderness , for forty years .
44007037	" It was this Moses who said to the Children of Israel , " God will raise up a Prophet for you from among your brothers , as he did me .
44007038	" This is the one who was in the congregation in the wilderness along with the angel who spoke to him in Mt . Sinai , and with our ancestors to whom he gave living words to hand down to us .
44007039	" To him our ancestors would not be obedient , but thrust him aside , and in their hearts turned back into Egypt .
44007040	" Said they to Aaron . " Make Gods for us who shall march in front of us ! As for this Moses who led us forth out of the land of Egypt , we know not what has happened to him .
44007041	" And they made a calf in those days , and offered a sacrifice to this idol , and began to rejoice over what they had made with their hands .
44007042	" So God turned from them , and gave them up to the worship of the heavenly host , as it is written in the book of the Prophets . " Did you offer unto me slain beasts as sacrifices during the forty years in the wilderness , O House of Israel ?
44007043	No , it was the Tabernacle of Moloch and the star-symbol of the god Rempha that you lifted up - the images which you made in order to worship them ; so I will carry you away beyond Babylon .
44007044	" In the wilderness our ancestors had the Tabernacle of Testimony built , as he appointed who told Moses to make it according to the pattern he had seen .
44007045	" That tabernacle was brought in by our ancestors , in their turn , when they under Joshua entered on the possession of the nations whom God thrust out before them , until the days of David .
44007046	" David obtained favor with God , and asked permission to find a dwelling-place for the God of Jacob .
44007047	" But it was Solomon who built him a house .
44007048	" Yet the Most High does not dwell in houses made with hands ; as said the prophet .
44007049	" The heaven is my throne , And the earth the footstool of my feet ; What kind of house will you build for me ? saith the Lord . Or what resting-place shall I have ?
44007050	Did not my hand make this universe ?
44007051	" Stiff-necked , uncircumcised in heart and ears ! You are always resisting the Holy Ghost ! As your fathers did , so do you .
44007052	" Which of the prophets did not your fathers persecute ? They killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One , whose betrayers and murderers you have now become -
44007053	" you who received the law , given through angels , and obeyed it not . "
44007054	As they heard these words they became furious and gnashed their teeth at him .
44007055	But he , full of the Holy Spirit , looked up stedfastly into heaven , and saw the glory of God , and Jesus standing at the right hand of God .
44007056	" Look , I see heaven open , " he said , " And the Son of man standing at the right hand of God . "
44007057	With a loud outcry they stopped their ears , and rushed upon Stephen in a body ,
44007058	dragged him outside the city , and stoned him , the witnesses throwing off their outer garments at the feet of a young man named Saul .
44007059	So they stoned Stephen while he prayed , " Lord Jesus , receive my spirit . "
44007060	Then he knelt down and cried aloud , " Lord , lay not this sin to their charge . "
44008001	With these words he fell asleep . And Saul fully approved of his murder . On this very day there broke out a great persecution against the church in Jerusalem , and all except the apostle were scattered throughout Judea and Samaria .
44008002	Devout men buried Stephen , and made loud lamentations over him .
44008003	But Saul was laying waste the church . He was wont to enter into every house , and to drag off men and women , and to commit them to prison .
44008004	So those who were scattered abroad were going everywhere preaching the word .
44008005	Philip went down to the city of Samaria , and began to preach Christ there .
44008006	The crowd with one accord were giving heed to what he said , when they heard and saw the signs that he did .
44008007	For with a loud cry unclean spirits would come out of many possessed by them , and many that were palsied and lame were healed .
44008008	There began to be great joy in that city .
44008009	Now for some time a man named Simon had been practising sorcery in that city , and had amazed the people of Samaria . He gave himself out to be some great person .
44008010	Many from all classes would give heed to him , declaring , " This man is the Power of God , known as the Great Power . "
44008011	They were giving heed to him because , for a long time , he had amazed them with his sorceries .
44008012	But when they believed Philip , who was preaching glad tidings about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ , they began to be baptized , both men and women .
44008013	And Simon himself also believed , and after his baptism he remained with Philip , and was full of amazement as he beheld the signs and striking miracles which were performed .
44008014	The apostle at Jerusalem , when they heard that Samaria had accepted the word of God , sent to them Peter and John .
44008015	Who came down and prayed for them , that they might receive the Holy Spirit ,
44008016	For he had not yet fallen upon any of them ; they had simply been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44008017	Then the apostles laid their hands upon them , and they received the Holy Spirit .
44008018	But when Simon perceived that , by the laying on of the apostles hands , the Spirit was given , he offered them money saying ,
44008019	" Give me , too , this power , so that on whomever I lay my hands , he may receive the Holy Spirit . "
44008020	But Peter said to him . " Your money perish with you , because you have supposed that with money you can obtain Gods free gift ! "
44008021	" You have no part or lot in this matter . " Your heart is not right in the sight of God .
44008022	Repent then of this your wickedness , and beseech the Lord to forgive you this purpose of your heart .
44008023	" For I perceive that you still stand in the gall of bitterness and in the bondage of unrighteousness . "
44008024	And Simon answered , " Pray to the Lord for me , both of you , that nothing which you have said may happen to me . "
44008025	So the apostles , after bearing solemn witness , and declaring the message of the Lord , returned to Jerusalem , evangelizing many Samaritan villages as they went .
44008026	And an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip , saying , " Arise and go on your way south , along the road that runs down from Jerusalem to Gaza , the desert way . "
44008027	So he arose and went . And behold an Ethiopian man , a eunuch , who was a high official ( a chief treasurer ) of Candace , the queen of Ethiopia , who had come to Jerusalem to worship
44008028	Was now on his way home , and was reading the Prophet Isaiah as he sat in his chariot .
44008029	And the Spirit said to Philip , " Go up and join that chariot . "
44008030	So Philip ran up , and heard him reading Isaiah the Prophet , and said to him . " Do you understand what you are reading ? "
44008031	The eunuch answered , " Why , how can I unless someone shall show me the way ? " And he begged Philip to get up and sit with him .
44008032	Now the portion of Scripture which he was reading was as follows . He was led a sheep to the slaughter ; And as a lamb before its shearer is dumb , So he opened not his mouth .
44008033	In his humiliation justice was denied him . Who will declare his posterity ? For his life is cut off from the earth .
44008034	" Pray , " asked the eunuch of Philip , " of whom is the prophet speaking ? Of himself , or of some one else ? "
44008035	Then Philip opened his lips , and beginning from that same scripture , he preached the gospel of Jesus to him .
44008036	And as they were going on their way they came to a certain water , and the eunuch said . " See , here is water ! What hinders my being baptized ? "
44008037	And Philip said , " If you believe with your whole heart , you may . " The eunuch answered , " I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God . "
44008038	And he ordered the chariot to stop ; and both of them , Philip and the eunuch , went down into the water , and Philip baptized him .
44008039	And when they had come up out of the water , the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away , and the eunuch saw him no more , but continued on his way rejoicing .
44008040	Philip found himself at Ashdod . Then visiting town after town , he kept preaching the good news in all the cities until he reached Caesarea .
44009001	Meanwhile Saul , still breathing out threats of murder against the disciples of the Lord , went to the high priest
44009002	and begged of him letters addressed to the synagogues in Damascus , so that if he found any that were of the Way , either men or women , he could bind them and bring them to Jerusalem .
44009003	And as he journeyed , when he was approaching Damascus , suddenly a light from heaven flashed round him .
44009004	He fell to the ground , and heard a voice which said to him , " Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? "
44009005	And he said , " Who are you Lord ? "
44009006	" I am Jesus , whom you are persecuting , " he said . " Stand up and go into the city , and there you shall be told what you must do . "
44009007	Meanwhile the men who were his fellow travelers stood speechless , hearing indeed the voice , but beholding no one .
44009008	And Saul got up from the ground , but although his eyes were open , he continued to perceive nothing ; so they took him by the hand and led him into Damascus .
44009009	And he remained there three days , seeing nothing , and without eating or drinking .
44009010	Now there was in Damascus a disciple named Ananias , and the Lord spoke to him in a vision , saying , " Ananias ! " And he answered , " Lo , I am here , Lord . "
44009011	And the Lord said to him . " Arise , go into the street named Straight , and make inquiries in the house of Judas for a man of Tarsus , one Saul .
44009012	He is now praying , and has seen a man named Ananias enter and lay his hands on him to restore his sight . "
44009013	" But , Lord , " said Ananias , " I have heard from many about that man , and how much evil he did to the saints at Jerusalem !
44009014	" In this city , too , he has authority from the chief priests to arrest all those who call upon thy name . "
44009015	" Go , " answered the Lord , " this man is chosen instrument of mine to bear my name before the nations and their kings , and before the Children of Israel also ;
44009016	" for I am going to show him all he has to suffer for the sake of my name . "
44009017	And so Ananias went and entered into the house , and laying his hands on him , said , " Brother Saul , the Lord , even Jesus , who appeared to you on your journey , has sent me that you may receive your sight , and be filled with the Holy Spirit . "
44009018	Instantly something like scales fell from his eyes , and he received his sight . He arose and was baptized .
44009019	Afterward he took food and was strengthened . And he remained for some time with the disciples at Damascus .
44009020	And he began at once to proclaim in the synagogues Jesus as the Son of God .
44009021	His hearers were all astonished , and began to say . " Is not this the very man who in Jerusalem made havoc of those who called upon the Name ? Did he not come hither for the express purpose of carrying them all in chains to the high priests ? "
44009022	But Saul gained more and more influence , and kept putting the Jews who lived in Damascus to confusion by his proof that Jesus was the Christ .
44009023	And when many days were fulfilled the Jews made a plot to kill Saul ;
44009024	but information of their plot was given Saul , and although they kept watch day and night on the gates , in order to make away with him ,
44009025	his disciples took him by night , and let him down over the wall , lowering him in a basket .
44009026	So he came to Jerusalem , and attempted to join the disciples , but they were all afraid of him , because they did not believe that he was a disciple .
44009027	But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles , and told them how Saul had seen the Lord in the way , and that he had spoken to him ; and also how he had preached the Name of the Lord Jesus boldly at Damascus .
44009028	Henceforth Saul was one of them , going in and out of the city , and speaking fearlessly in the Name of the Lord .
44009029	He also used to hold conversations and debates with the Grecian Jews , but they kept trying to kill him .
44009030	When they learned this the brothers took him down to Caesarea , and then sent him forth to Tarsus .
44009031	Now throughout the whole of Judea , Galilee , and Samaria the Church continued to enjoy peace and to be spiritually built up . It was increasing in members also , as it kept walking in the fear of the Lord , and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit .
44009032	Now Peter , as he was going from town to town , came down also to the saints who lived in Lydda .
44009033	Here he found a man named Aeneas , bedridden for eight years , a paralytic .
44009034	Peter said to him . " Aeneas , Jesus Christ cures you ! Rise and make your own bed ! "
44009035	At once he rose to his feet . All the people of Lydda and Sharon saw him , and they turned to the Lord .
44009036	Among the disciples at Joppa was a woman named Tabitha - which may be translated Dorcas or " Gazelle " - a woman whose life was full of good works and almsgiving , which she was doing continually .
44009037	She , as it happened , was taken ill just at that time , and died . After washing her body , they laid it in an upper room .
44009038	And as Lydda was near Joppa , the disciples , when they heard that Peter was there , sent two men to him with the entreaty , " Delay not to come to us . "
44009039	So Peter arose and went with them . On his arrival they took him up-stairs , and all the widows stood near him , weeping , and showing him the cloaks and garments which Dorcas used to make , while she was still with them .
44009040	But Peter put them all out , and kneeled down , and prayed ; and then turning to the body , he said , " Tabitha , rise ! " She opened her eyes , and on seeing Peter she sat up .
44009041	Then he gave her his hand and raised her up , and after calling the saints and the widows , he gave her back to them alive .
44009042	This incident became known throughout Joppa , and many believed in the Lord .
44009043	Peter stayed for some time in Joppa , lodging in the house of Simon , the tanner .
44010001	Now there was at Caesarea a man named Cornelius , a captain in the Italian regiment .
44010002	He was a devout man and God-fearing , and so were all his household . He gave many alms to the people , and constantly prayed to God .
44010003	About three oclock one afternoon he had a vision , and distinctly saw an angel of God enter his house and say to him , " Cornelius . "
44010004	He stared at him in terror , and said , " What is it , Lord ? " " Your prayers and your alms have risen for a memorial before God , " answered the angel ;
44010005	" and now send men to Joppa and fetch one Simon , who is called Peter .
44010006	" He is staying as a guest with Simon , a tanner , whose house is near the sea . "
44010007	And after the angel who was speaking to him was gone , he called two of his household servants and a devout soldier who was in constant attendance upon him ,
44010008	and after telling them everything , he sent them to Joppa .
44010009	The next day , while they were still on their way and were approaching the town , about noon , Peter went up to the housetop to pray .
44010010	He had become very hungry and longed for food ; but while they were preparing it , he fell into a trance .
44010011	He beheld the sky opened , and a vessel descending like an enormous sail let down to earth by four corners .
44010012	In it were all kinds of quadrupeds and creeping things of the earth , and wild birds .
44010013	A voice came to him , saying , " Rise , Peter , kill and eat . "
44010014	" Not so , my Lord , " answered Peter , " for I have never yet eaten anything common and unclean . "
44010015	And again a second time came to him a voice , saying , " What God has cleansed you must not call common . "
44010016	This happened three times ; and immediately the sail was drawn up into the sky .
44010017	Now while Peter was greatly perplexed to know what the vision which he had been sent by Cornelius , and had made inquiries for the house of Simon , stood at the gate ,
44010018	and called and asked whether Simon who was called Peter was lodging there .
44010019	So the Spirit said to Peter , who was still pondering over the vision .
44010020	" Three men are now looking for you . Rise , go down and go with them , nothing doubting ; for it is I who have sent them . "
44010021	So Peter went down to the men and said . " I am the man you are looking for . What is the reason of your coming ? "
44010022	" Cornelius , " they answered , " a captain , a devout man , and God-fearing , of whom the whole , Jewish nation speaks well , was instructed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his house , and to listen to your message . "
44010023	So he invited them in and gave them lodging . The next day he rose , and went off with them , and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied them ;
44010024	and the day after that they reached Caesarea . There Cornelius was waiting for them , and had brought together all his relatives and intimate friends .
44010025	When Peter entered the house Cornelius met him , fell at his feet , and worshiped him ;
44010026	but Peter lifted him up . " Stand up , " he said , " I am only a man , myself . "
44010027	And as he talked with him , he went in and found a large company assembled .
44010028	To them he said . " You know , yourselves , that it is illegal for a Jew to associate with or to visit one of another nation ; but God has taught me that I should not call any man common or unclean . For this reason , when sent for , I came without demur .
44010029	" I ask therefore why you sent for me . "
44010030	Cornelius answered . " Three days ago , at this very hour , I was praying in my house at three oclock in the afternoon , when suddenly a man in a shining robe stood by me ,
44010031	and said . " Cornelius , your prayer is heard , and your alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God .
44010032	" So send to Joppa and summon Simon , who is called Peter . He is lodging with Simon the tanner , in a house by the seaside .
44010033	" So I sent for you without delay , and you have been kind enough to come . Now therefore we are all here present in the sight of God , to listen to what the Lord has commanded you to speak . "
44010034	Then Peter began to speak . " Of a truth I begin to see quite plainly that God is no respecter of persons ;
44010035	" but in every nation he who fears him and works righteousness is acceptable to him .
44010036	" You cannot but know the message which he sent to the descendants of Israel , when he preached the gospel of peace by Jesus Christ who is Lord of all ;
44010037	" you know the message spread throughout all Judea , beginning in Galilee , after the baptism which John preached ;
44010038	" how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power , and how he went about everywhere doing good , and curing all who were oppressed by the devil ; for God was with him .
44010039	" And we were witnesses of all that he did , both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem . They killed him , hanging him on a tree .
44010040	" But him God raised up on the third day , and permitted him to be made manifest ,
44010041	" not to all the people , but to witnesses - men previously chosen by God - that is , to us , who ate and drank with him after he had risen from the dead ;
44010042	" when he charged us to preach to the people , and to testify that this was he whom God ordained to be the judge of the living and of the dead .
44010043	" To him all the prophets bear witness , testifying that through his name every one that believes on him will receive remission of sins . "
44010044	While Peter was still speaking , the Holy Spirit fell on all who were listening to the message .
44010045	And all the Jewish believers who had accompanied Peter were amazed , because the gift of the Holy Spirit was poured out upon the Gentiles also .
44010046	For they heard them speak with tongues and magnify God .
44010047	Then Peter said , " Can any one refuse water for the baptism of these men who have received the Holy Spirit as well as we ? "
44010048	And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ . Then they begged him to remain with them for a time .
44011001	Now the apostles and the brothers that were in Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God ;
44011002	so , when Peter came up to Jerusalem , the circumcision party disputed with him ,
44011003	saying , " You went into the houses of the uncircumcised and ate with them ! "
44011004	Then Peter began and explained the whole matter to them in order , saying .
44011005	" I was in the city of Joppa , praying , and while in a trance I saw a vision ; a certain vessel descending , what seemed to be an enormous sail let down to me ,
44011006	and while I gazed at it , I examined it carefully , and saw the quadrupeds of the earth and the wild beasts and creeping things and the wild birds .
44011007	I also heard a voice saying to me , Rise , Peter , kill and eat .
44011008	" Not so , my Lord said I , for nothing common or unclean has ever gone into my mouth .
44011009	" But for the second time a voice spoke from the sky , What God has cleansed , you must not call common .
44011010	" This was said three times , and then everything was drawn up again into the sky .
44011011	" And lo ! at that very moment , three men who had been sent for me from Caesarea stood before the house in which I was .
44011012	" And the Spirit bade me accompany them without misgiving . There also accompanied me these six brothers , and we went into the mans house .
44011013	" Then he told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house and saying . " Send to Joppa and fetch Simon who is also called Peter .
44011014	" He will speak words to you by which you and all your family will be saved .
44011015	" And , " said Peter , " as soon as I began to speak , the Holy Spirit fell upon them , just as he fell upon us at the beginning .
44011016	" Then I remembered the words of the Lord , how he used to say , " John indeed baptized in water , but you shall be baptized in the Holy Spirit .
44011017	" So if God gave them the same gift as he gave to us , when we first believed on the Lord Jesus Christ , who was I that I could withstand God ? "
44011018	On hearing this they held their peace and glorified God , saying , " Forsooth then , to the Gentiles also God has granted repentance unto life . "
44011019	Then those who had been scattered by the trouble that arose over Stephen , traveled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch ; but they preached the word to none except Jews .
44011020	Some of them , however , were Cyprians and Cyrenaeans , who , on reaching Antioch , began to tell the Greeks also the Good News concerning the Lord Jesus .
44011021	The hand of the Lord was with them , and a great number who believed turned to the Lord .
44011022	When news of this reached the ears of the church at Jerusalem , they sent Barnabas as far as Antioch .
44011023	When he arrived , and saw the grace of God , he was glad , and he encouraged them all to remain faithful to the Lord , with full purpose of heart ;
44011024	for he was a good man , and full of faith and the Holy Spirit . And a great multitude was added to the Lord .
44011025	Then Barnabas visited Tarsus , to try to find Saul ,
44011026	and when he had found him he brought him to Antioch , where for a whole year they were guests of the church , and taught many people . And it was in Antioch that the disciples first received the name of " Christians . "
44011027	At that time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch .
44011028	One of them , who was Agabus , rose up , and being instructed by the Spirit , predicted that a great famine was about to come upon the whole inhabited earth . ( It came in the reign of Claudius . )
44011029	So the disciples decided to send relief , every man according to his means , to the brothers in Judea .
44011030	This they did , forwarding their contributions to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul .
44012001	Now , at about that time , Herod the king put forth his hands to ill-treat certain members of the church ;
44012002	and beheaded James , the brother of John , with the sword .
44012003	And when he saw that it pleased the Jews , he proceeded to seize Peter also . ( This was during the days of unleavened bread . )
44012004	He had him arrested and thrown in prison , and put under guard of sixteen soldiers . He intended , after the Passover , to bring him forth to the people .
44012005	So Peter was kept in prison , but earnest prayer to God was made by the church for him .
44012006	Now when Herod was about to bring him forth , on that very night , while Peter was sleeping between two soldiers , bound with chains , and sentries before the door were guarding the prison ,
44012007	suddenly an angel of the Lord stood by him , and a light shone in the cell . Striking Peter on the side , he woke him saying , " Rise up quickly . " At once the chains dropped from his hands .
44012008	" Gird yourself , " said the angel , " and put on your sandals . " He did so . Then he said unto him , " Throw your cloak about you , and follow me . "
44012009	So Peter went out , following him , but did not realize that what the angel was doing was real , but supposed that he was seeing a vision .
44012010	And when they had passed the first guard and the second , they came to the iron gate that led to the city . This opened to them of its own accord ; and they went out passed on through one street ; and suddenly the angel left him .
44012011	Peter , coming to himself , said , " Now I know for a certainty that the Lord has sent his angel and released me from the hand of Herod , and from all that the Jewish people were anticipating . "
44012012	So , after he had thought things over , he went to the house of Mary , the mother of John , surnamed Mark , where a large number of people were assembled , praying .
44012013	When he knocked at the door of the gate , a maid servant named Rhoda came to answer .
44012014	And when she recognized Peters voice , for very joy she did not open the door , but ran in and told them that Peter was standing in front of the gate .
44012015	" You are mad , " they said . But she confidently insisted that it was so . " It is his angel , " they said .
44012016	Meanwhile Peter continued to knock , until at last they opened the door , and were amazed to see that it was really he .
44012017	He motioned to them to keep quiet , and told them how the Lord had brought him out of prison . " Tell all this to James , " he said , " and to the brothers , " and away he went to another place .
44012018	When morning came there was no small stir among the soldiers as to what could possibly have become of Peter .
44012019	Then Herod had search made for him , and could not find him . After sharply questioning the guards , he ordered them off to execution . He then went down from Judea to Caesarea , where he stayed for some time .
44012020	Now Herod was violently displeased with the people of Tyre and Sidon . So they came to him , with one accord , and after conciliating Blastus , the royal chamberlain , they begged for peace because their country depended upon the kings country for its food supply .
44012021	So on the appointed day , Herod put on his royal robes , and after taking his seat upon the throne , began to harangue them .
44012022	" The voice of a god , and not of a man , " the people kept shouting .
44012023	Instantly an angel of the Lord smote him , because he had not given God the glory , and being eaten up by worms , he died .
44012024	But the word of God grew and multiplied ;
44012025	and after discharging their mission , Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem , bringing with them John , surnamed Mark .
44013001	Now there were in the church in Antioch prophets and teachers ; Barnabas and Symeon , surnamed " the Black , " Lucius of Cyrene , Manaen , the foster-brother of Herod the Tetrarch , and Saul .
44013002	And as they were worshiping the Lord , and fasting , the Holy Spirit said to them , " Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them . "
44013003	So after fasting and praying , they laid their hands on them , and let them go .
44013004	So they , sent forth by the Holy Spirit , went down to Seleucia , and from thence they sailed to Cyprus .
44013005	And while they were in Salamis , they proclaimed the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews .
44013006	They had John Mark as an assistant ; and after going through the whole island as far as Paphos , they found a certain Jewish sorcerer and false prophet , named Bar-Jesus ,
44013007	who belonged to the suite of the proconsul , Sergius Paulus , an intelligent man . He summoned Barnabas and Saul , and sought to hear the word of God .
44013008	But Elymas , " the sorcerer , " for that is the translation of his name , opposed them , and tried to divert the proconsul from the faith .
44013009	So Saul , who is also called Paul , filled with the Holy Spirit , gazed steadily at him , and said .
44013010	" O full of all craft and cunning , you son of the devil ! You enemy of all goodness ! Will you never stop perverting the right ways of the Lord ?
44013011	" The Lords hand is now upon you , and you shall be blind , not seeing the sun for a season . " Instantly there fell on him a mist and a darkness , and groping about , he sought some one to lead him by the hand .
44013012	Then the proconsul , seeing what had happened , believed . He was astounded at the teaching of the Lord .
44013013	From Paphos Paul and his party set sail for Perga in Pamphylia ; but John Mark left them and went back to Jerusalem .
44013014	Then they themselves , passing through from Perga , came to Antioch in Pisidia . Here they went into the synagogue on the Sabbath Day and sat down .
44013015	And , after the reading of the Law and the Prophets , the wardens of the synagogue sent word to them . " Brothers , " they said , " if you have any word of encouragement to the people , say it . "
44013016	So Paul stood up , and motioning with his hand , said . " Men of Israel , and you who fear God , listen .
44013017	" The God of this people of Israel chose our forefathers and made this people great , while they sojourned in the land of Egypt . And with an uplifted arm he led them out of it .
44013018	" For about forty years he bore with them in the desert ,
44013019	" and when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan , he gave them their land as an inheritance for about four hundred and fifty years .
44013020	" And afterwards he gave them Judges , until Samuel , the prophet .
44013021	" Then they asked for a king , and he gave them Saul , the son of Kish , a Benjamite for forty years .
44013022	After deposing him , he raised up David to be their king , to whom he also bore witness , when he said , " I have found David , the son of Jesse , a man after my own heart , and who will obey all my will .
44013023	" Of this mans descendants God has brought unto Israel , according to his promise , a Savior , Jesus ;
44013024	" before whose coming John had already preached a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel .
44013025	" And John , when he was finishing his race , repeatedly asked the people . " Who do you suppose that I am ? I am not He . But behold there comes One after me , whose sandal I am not worthy to unfasten .
44013026	" Brothers , sons of Abrahams race , and all among you who reverence God , to us has the word of this salvation been sent .
44013027	" For those who dwell in Jerusalem , and their rulers , because they knew him not , nor the utterances of the prophets which are read every Sabbath , fulfilled them by condemning him .
44013028	" Though they found no cause of death in him , yet they asked Pilate to put him to death .
44013029	" And when they had fulfilled everything which had been written concerning him , they took him down from the tree and laid him in a tomb .
44013030	" But God raised him from the dead .
44013031	" For many days he was seen by those that came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem , and are now his witnesses to the people .
44013032	" And we bring you glad tidings of the promise made to our forefathers ,
44013033	" how that God fulfilled it for us their children in raising up Jesus ; as it is also written in the second Psalm , " Thou art my son , today have I become thy Father .
44013034	" And as to his having raised him from among the dead , now no more to return to corruption , he has said this , " I will give thee the holy and sure blessings of David .
44013035	" Because in another psalm he says , " Thou wilt not give thy Holy One to see corruption .
44013036	" For David , after he had served his own generation according to the will of God , fell on sleep , and was gathered to his forefathers , and did see corruption ;
44013037	but he whom God raised up saw no corruption .
44013038	" Be it known unto you therefore , brothers , that remission of sins is proclaimed to you through this man ;
44013039	" and that by him every one that believes is justified from all things from which you could never be justified by the law of Moses .
44013040	" Beware , then , lest that spoken of in the prophets come upon you .
44013041	" Behold , ye despisers , and wonder , and perish , For in your days I will do a deed , A deed which you will never believe , Though one should declare it unto you . "
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas left the synagogue , the people earnestly begged that these words might be repeated to them on the following Sabbath .
44013043	When the congregation broke up , many of the Jews , and of the devout proselytes , followed Paul and Barnabas , who talked to them , and urged them to continue in the grace of God .
44013044	On the next Sabbath almost the entire city was gathered together to know the word of God .
44013045	When they saw the crowds , the Jews were filled with jealousy , and began to contradict Pauls statements , and to abuse him .
44013046	So Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly . " It was necessary , " they said , " first to proclaim the word of God to you . But since you push it away from you , and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life , lo , we turn to the Gentiles .
44013047	" For such is Gods command to us , saying , " I have set thee for a light to the Gentiles , That thou shouldest be for salvation to the uttermost part of the earth . "
44013048	When the Gentiles heard this , they were glad , and glorified the word of the Lord , and all who had been ordained to eternal life , believed .
44013049	So the Lords message went far and wide , through the whole district .
44013050	But the Jews urged on the devout women of high rank , and the leading citizens , and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and drove them out of the district ,
44013051	But they shook off the dust of their feet against them , and came to Iconium .
44013052	As for the disciples , they were continually filled with joy , and with the Holy Spirit .
44014001	In Iconium it happened that they went together to the synagogue of the Jews , and so spoke that a great number both of Jews and of Gentiles believed .
44014002	But the disobedient Jews stirred up the souls of the Gentiles , and embittered them against them against the brothers .
44014003	Long time , therefore , they tarried there , speaking fearlessly in the Lord , who attested the word of his grace by permitting signs and wonders to be performed by their hands .
44014004	But the mass of the citys people was divided ; part held with the Jews , and part with the apostles .
44014005	And when both the Gentiles and the Jews with their ruler made a hostile move to maltreat and to stone them ,
44014006	the apostles got wind of it , and made their escape to the Lycaonian towns of Derbe and Lystra and the neighboring country .
44014007	And there they continued to proclaim the gospel .
44014008	Now at Lystra there used to sit a certain man , lame in his feet , a cripple from birth , who had never walked .
44014009	He was listening while Paul was preaching , and Paul , looking intently at him , and perceiving that he had faith to be made whole ,
44014010	said in a loud voice , " Stand upright on your feet ! "
44014011	And he sprang up and began to walk about . Then the crowds , when they saw what Paul had done , shouted in the Lycaonian tongue , saying , " The gods are come down to us in human form . "
44014012	And they began to call Barnabas " Zeus , " and Paul , since he was the principal speaker , " Hermes " ;
44014013	and the priest of Zeus , whose temple was at the entrance to the city , brought oxen and garlands to the gates , and along with the crowds was about to offer sacrifices .
44014014	But when the apostles , Paul and Barnabas , heard of it , they rent their garments and rushed out among the crowd , shouting and crying .
44014015	" Men , why are you doing all this ? We also are men , with natures like your own ! We are bringing you good tidings , that you are to turn from these empty things to the living God , who made heaven and earth and the sea and all that in them is .
44014016	In bygone generations he allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways ,
44014017	and yet he left not himself without witness , in that he did good , and gave you rain from heaven and fruitful seasons , filling your hearts with food and gladness . "
44014018	Even with saying this they with difficulty restrained the crowds from sacrificing to them .
44014019	And now a party of Jews came down form Antioch and Iconium , and after persuading the crowds , they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city , supposing him to be dead .
44014020	But as the disciples collected around him , he rose and went back into the city . The next day he went off with Barnabas into Derbe ;
44014021	and after preaching the gospel to that town , and winning many converts , they went back to Lystra and Iconium and Antioch ,
44014022	Everywhere they strengthened the souls of the disciples , encouraging them to hold to the faith . " It is through many tribulations , " they said , " that we must enter into the kingdom of God . "
44014023	They chose elders for them in every church , after prayer and fasting , and commended them to the Lord in whom they had believed .
44014024	Then passing through Pisidia they came to Pamphylia and ,
44014025	after preaching the word in Perga , they came down to Attaleia .
44014026	Thence they sailed to Antioch , from whence they had been commended to the grace of God , for the work which they had now completed .
44014027	On their arrival they assembled the church and reported all things that God had done through them , and how he had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles .
44014028	And they tarried no little time with the disciples .
44015001	But some men came down from Judea and attempted to teach the brethren , saying , " Unless you are circumcised according to Moses custom , you cannot be saved . "
44015002	Now when dispute and controversy sprang up between them and Paul and Barnabas , the brethren appointed Paul and Barnabas , and certain others , to go up to Jerusalem to see the apostles and elders about this question .
44015003	So the church saw them off on their journey , and they passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria . Here they set forth the conversion of the Gentiles , and brought great joy to all the brothers .
44015004	Upon their arrival in Jerusalem they were received by the church and the apostles and elders , and they told them all things that God had done with them .
44015005	But certain men who had belonged to the sect of the Pharisees , but were now believers , stood up and said , " It is necessary to circumcise Gentile , and to order them to keep the Law of Moses . "
44015006	The apostles and elders met to consider the matter ;
44015007	and after there had been a long discussion , Peter rose and said . " Brothers , you know how a good while ago God made choice among you , that from my lips the Gentiles were to hear the message of the gospel and believe .
44015008	" And God , who knows the hearts of all , gave this testimony in their behalf , by bestowing upon them the Holy Spirit just as he did upon us ;
44015009	" and he made no distinction between us and them , in cleansing their hearts by faith .
44015010	" Now then , why are you tempting God by laying on the necks of these disciples a yoke which neither our forefathers nor we have been able to bear ?
44015011	" On the contrary we believe that it is by the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ that we and they shall be saved . "
44015012	Then the whole assembly remained silent , and listened to Barnabas and Saul as they told the signs and wonders which God had wrought among the Gentiles through them .
44015013	When they had finished speaking , James said .
44015014	" Brothers , listen to me . Symeon has told how God first looked graciously upon the Gentiles , to take out from among them a people to be called by his name .
44015015	" And this is in harmony with the language of the prophets , which says .
