45003029	Is God then the God of the Jews alone , and not of the Gentiles also ? He is God of the Gentiles also ,
45003030	since there is one God who will justify the circumcised through faith , and by their faith will he justify the uncircumcised .
45003031	Do we then render law invalid through faith ? Certainly not ; on the contrary we make it stand .
45004001	What then shall we say of Abraham , our ancestor in the flesh ?
45004002	For if Abraham was justified by works , he has something to be proud of , but not before God .
45004003	For what does Scripture say ? And Abraham believed God , and it was set down to his account as righteousness .
45004004	Now if a man earn his pay by his work , it is not counted to him as a favor , but it is paid him as a debt ;
45004005	but a man who does not " work , " but believes in him who justifies the ungodly , has his faith imputed to him for righteousness .
45004006	Just as David also speaks of the blessedness of the man to whom God imputes righteousness apart from actions .
45004007	Blessed he says are they whose iniquities have been forgiven , And whose sins have been covered .
45004008	Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin .
45004009	Is this blessing , then , for the circumcised alone ? or for the uncircumcised also ? Abrahams faith , I say , was imputed to him for righteousness .
45004010	How then was it imputed to him ? When he was circumcised ? or uncircumcised ? Not in circumcision , but in uncircumcision ;
45004011	and he received circumcision as a sign , a seal of the faith-righteousness which he had while he was in uncircumcision ; in order that he might be the father of all who believe , even though they are uncircumcised ; so that righteousness might be imputed to them .
45004012	He is the father of circumcision to those who are not merely circumcised , but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham which he held while he was as yet uncircumcised .
45004013	For the promise that he should be heir of the world did not come to Abraham or to his posterity through law , but through faith-righteousness .
45004014	For if those who are righteous through law are heirs , faith is empty and the promise becomes void .
45004015	For law works wrath ; but where there is no law , neither is there transgression .
45004016	This is why righteousness is of faith , that it may be a free gift ; so that the promise stands firm to all Abrahams posterity ; not to his children of his faith . For in the sight of the God in whom he believed , who gives life to the dead , and calls into being that which is not , Abraham is the father of us all both Jews and Gentiles ,
45004017	as it is written , I have made you a father of many nations .
45004018	For Abraham , hoping against hope , had faith to the end that he might become a father of many nations , according to that which had been spoken , So numberless shall your descendants be .
45004019	Though he was about a hundred years old , his faith did not fail him when he regarded his own body , now as good as dead . and remembered Sarahs barrenness .
45004020	Nor did he with regard to the promise of God waver in unbelief , but he waxed strong in faith , while he gave God glory ,
45004021	and was fully persuaded that what God had promised , he was able also to perform .
45004022	And so his faith was reckoned to him for righteousness .
45004023	Now these words were not written simply for his sake , but for us as well .
45004024	For it will be " reckoned for righteousness . " to us also , who believe on him that raised from the dead our Lord Jesus ;
45004025	who was betrayed to death for our transgressions , and raised again to life for our justification .
45005001	Since we stand justified as the result of faith , let us continue to enjoy the peace we have with God through our Lord Jesus Christ .
45005002	Through him also we have had our access into this grace in which we have taken our stand , and are exulting in hope of the glory of God .
45005003	And not only so , but we are actually exulting also even in our troubles ; for we know that trouble works fortitude ,
45005004	and fortitude character , and character , hope -
45005005	a hope which never disappoints us . For through the Holy Spirit who has given to us , the " brimming river of the love of God " has overflowed in our hearts .
45005006	For while we were still without strength , Christ died in due time for the ungodly .
45005007	Why , a man will hardly give his life for another , even for a righteous man , though perchance for a good man one might even take it upon himself to die .
45005008	But God gives proof of his love to us by the fact that while we were still sinners , Christ died for us .
45005009	By how much more , then , being now justified in his blood , shall we be saved through him from the wrath of God .
45005010	For if , when we were Gods enemies , we were reconciled to him through the death of his Son , how much more , now that we are reconciled , shall we be saved in his life .
45005011	And not only that , but we exult in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , through whom we have now obtained our reconciliation .
45005012	Thus , then , sin came into the world through one man , and through sin came death and so death spread to all men , because all had sinned .
45005013	For prior to the Law , sin actually existed in the world , but sin was not set down to mans account when there was no law .
45005014	Nevertheless , from Adam to Moses death reigned as king , even over those who had not sinned after the likeness of Adams transgression . Now Adam is a type of Him who was to come .
45005015	But the free gift is not like the transgression ; for if through the transgression of that one man the rest on men died , much more did the grace of God and the gift given in his grace in the one Man , Jesus Christ , overflow unto the rest of men .
45005016	And it is not with the free gift as it was through the one that sinned ; for the judgment came from one transgression unto condemnation ; but the free gift came from many transgressions unto acquittal .
45005017	For if through the transgression of the one , death reigned as king through the one , much more shall those who receive the overflowing grace and gift of righteousness reign as kings in life through One , through Jesus Christ .
45005018	It follows then , as through the transgression of one man came condemnation unto all men , even so through the act of righteousness of One came acquittal and life to all men .
45005019	For just as through the disobedience of one man the rest were made sinners ; even so by the obedience of One shall all the rest be made righteous .
45005020	Now law was brought in so that transgression might abound ; but where sin abounded , grace super-abounded ;
45005021	in order that as sin has ruled as king in death , so also grace might rule as king in righteousness which issues in eternal life , through Jesus Christ our Lord , - ours !
45006001	What then shall we say ? Shall we continue to abound in sin , in order that grace may come to abound ?
45006002	No indeed ; how shall we who have died to sin still go on living in it any longer ?
45006003	For do you not know that all of us who have been baptized into Jesus Christ , have been baptized into his death ?
45006004	We have been buried together with him , then , through baptism into his death , in order that just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father , so also we should live in a newness of life .
45006005	For if we have become united with him in the likeness of his death , so we shall also be united with him in the likeness of his resurrection .
45006006	For this we know , that our old self was crucified with Christ , in order that the slave of sin might be destroyed ; so that we should no longer be in slavery to sin -
45006007	for he who is dead is set free from sin .
45006008	Now if we have died with Christ , we believe that we shall also live with him ;
45006009	knowing that Christ , being raised from the dead , dies no more ; death has no more dominion over him .
45006010	For the death that he died , he died unto sin once for all ; but the life that he lives he is living unto God .
45006011	Even so count yourselves also to be dead unto sin , but alive unto God in Christ Jesus .
45006012	Therefore let not sin rule as king in your mortal body , compelling you to obey its lusts .
45006013	Do not continue to present any part of your body to sin to be used as a weapon of unrighteousness . On the contrary , be presenting yourselves to God , as alive from the dead , and the various parts of your bodies to be used as weapons of righteousness .
45006014	For sin shall not lord it over you ; for you are not under the rule of law , but under the rule of grace .
45006015	What then ? Shall we commit an act of sin because we are not under law , but under grace ? Certainly not .
45006016	Do you not know that when you surrender yourselves as slaves to any one to obey him , you are his slaves whom you obey ; whether it be sin , whose end is death , or obedience , whose end is righteousness ?
45006017	But God be thanked that you who were once the slaves of sin have obeyed from your hearts that type of teaching to which you were appointed ;
45006018	and being set free from sin , you became the slaves of righteousness -
45006019	I speak in these homely figures because of the weakness of your fleshly nature - just as you once surrendered your faculties into slavery to impurity and to all lawlessness , so now you must surrender your faculties into slavery to righteousness , unto deeds of holiness .
45006020	For when you were the slaves of sin , you were under no subjection to righteousness .
45006021	What harvest-fruit then had you at that time in the things of which you are now ashamed ? For the end of those things is death .
45006022	But now that you have been set free from sin and become slaves of God , the harvest-fruit which you are reaping tends to produce holiness , and it ends is life eternal .
45006023	FOR THE POOR WAGES OF SIN IS DEATH , BUT THE FREE GIFT OF GOD IS ETERNAL LIFE IN CHRIST JESUS , OUR MASTER .
45007001	Surely , brothers , you know ( for I am speaking to those who know what law means ) that law governs a person only during his lifetime ?
45007002	For a married woman who has a husband is bound by law to her husband during his lifetime ; but if her husband dies , she is released from the law of her husband .
45007003	So then , if during her husband lifetime , she unites herself with another man , she will be counted an adulteress ; but if her husband dies , she is free from the Law , so that she is no adulteress , even if she unites herself with another man .
45007004	So also , my brother , you were made dead to the Law through the body of Christ ; that you should be joined to another , even to Him who was raised from the dead that we might bear fruit for God .
45007005	For while we were unspiritual , the sinful passions , aroused by the Law , were ever active in every part of our bodies , leading us to bear fruit unto death .
45007006	But now we have been released from the Law , because we are dead to that in which we were held ; so that we are now in thraldom in new and spiritual conditions , and not under the old written code .
45007007	What shall we say then ? Is the Law sin ? Certainly not . On the contrary I should not have become acquainted with sin had it not been for the Law ; for except the Law had repeatedly said , " Thou shalt not lust , " I should never have known the sin of lust .
45007008	But when sin had gained a vantage-ground , by means of the commandment , it stirred up within me all manner of lust ; for where there is no law , sin is dead .
45007009	Once I lived apart from the Law , myself ; but when the commandment came , sin revived , and I died ;
45007010	and the very commandment which should have meant life , this I found to mean death .
45007011	For sin , when it had gained a vantage-ground through the commandment , beguiled me , and through it slew me .
45007012	So then the Law is holy , and the commandment is holy and righteous and good .
45007013	Did then that which was good become for me death ? Never ! but sin did ; that it might be manifest as sin , by that the unutterable malignity of sin might become plain through the commandment .
45007014	For we know that the Law is spiritual ; but as for me , I am a creature of flesh , bought and sold under the dominion of sin .
45007015	For what I perform I know not ; what I practise is not what I intend to do , but what I detest , that I habitually do .
45007016	If then I habitually do what I do not intend to do , I am consenting to the Law , that it is right .
45007017	And now it is longer I myself who do the deed , but it is sin which has its home in me .
45007018	For I know that in me , that is in my flesh , no good thing has its home ; for while to will is present with me , to carry out that which is right is not .
45007019	For the good that I intend to do , I do not ; but the evil which I do not ; but the evil which I do not intend to do , that I am ever practising .
45007020	But if I do the very thing I do not intend to do , it is no more I who practise it , but sin which has its home in me .
45007021	I find , then , this law , that when I intend to do good , evil is ever present with me .
45007022	For in my inmost self I delight in the law of God ;
45007023	but I find a different law in my bodily faculties , waging war with the law of my will , and taking me prisoner to that law of sin which is in my bodily faculties .
45007024	Oh , wretched man that I am ! Who shall deliver me from this slave of death ?
45007025	Oh , thank God ! it is through Jesus Christ our Lord . So then I myself in my will am in thraldom to the law of God ; yet in my animal nature I am in thraldom to the law of sin .
45008001	Thus there is now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus ;
45008002	for the law of the spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free from the law of sin and of death .
45008003	For God has done what the Law could not do , weakened as it was by flesh . By sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh , and on account of sin , he condemned sin in the flesh ;
45008004	in order that the Law might be fulfilled in us who order our lives not after the flesh , but after the spirit .
45008005	For they who live after the flesh , give their attention to the things of the flesh ; But they who live after the spirit , give their attention to spiritual things .
45008006	To be earthly minded means death ; To be spiritually minded means life and peace .
45008007	For to be earthly minded is enmity against God ; For such a mind is not subject to the Law of God , Nor can it be ;
45008008	And they who are earthly minded cannot please God .
45008009	But you are not earthly , but spiritual , if indeed the Spirit of God is really dwelling in you . If any one does not have the Spirit of Christ , he is none of his .
45008010	But if Christ is in you , though your bodily self is dead because of sin , your spirit is full of life because of righteousness .
45008011	But if the Spirit of Him who raised up Jesus from dead is dwelling in you , He who raised up Jesus from the dead is dwelling in you , He who raised up Christ Jesus from the dead will also make your dying bodily self live by his indwelling Spirit in your lives .
45008012	Therefore , brothers , we are debtors - but not to the flesh , to live according to the flesh ;
45008013	for if you go on living according to the flesh , you are on the road to die ; but if by the Spirit you keep putting to death the deeds of the body , you will live .
45008014	For only those are sons of God who are led by Gods Spirit .
45008015	For you have not received a spirit of slavery in order that you should once more be afraid ; but you have received a spirit of adoption , in which we cry out , " My Father , my dear Father ! "
45008016	For his Spirit himself bears witness with our spirit , that we are children of God ;
45008017	and if children , then heirs , heirs of God and joint-heirs with Christ ; but to share his glory , we must now be sharing his sufferings .
45008018	For I count as nothing what we now suffer , in comparison with the glory which will soon be unveiled to us .
45008019	All nature even is waiting with eager longing for the unveiling of the vision of Gods sons .
45008020	For nature was subjected to imperfection , not by its own will , but by the will of Him who thus made it subject -
45008021	yet not without the hope that some day nature itself also will be freed from the thraldom of decay , into the freedom which belongs to the glory of the children of God .
45008022	For we know that all nature has been groaning and travailing together until this hour .
45008023	And not only that , we ourselves , although we are grasping the first-fruits of the Spirit , even we ourselves are inwardly groaning , while we are waiting for adoption , the redemption of our body .
45008024	For by hope we are saved ; but hope which is clearly seen is no longer hope .
45008025	Who hopes for what he clearly sees ? But if we hope for something that we do not see , we then patiently wait for it .
45008026	In the same way the Spirit also takes hold with us in our weakness ; for we know knot how to pray as we ought ; but the Spirit himself intercedes for us with groanings which cannot be uttered .
45008027	And the Searcher of Hearts knows what the Sprits meaning is , because his intercessions for the saints are according to the will of God .
45008028	Now we know that all things continually work together for good to to those who love God , to those who have been the called according to his purpose .
45008029	For whom he foreknew , he also foreordained to be conformed to the likeness of his Son , so that he might be the eldest of a great brotherhood ;
45008030	and whom he foreordained , those he also called ; and whom he called , those he also justified ; and whom he justified , those he also glorified .
45008031	What shall we say then , to these things ? If God be for us , Who can be against us ?
45008032	He that spared not his own Son , But freely delivered him up for us all , How shall he not with him also freely give us all things ?
45008033	Who shall accuse Gods elect ? God acquits them ;
45008034	Who is there to condemn them ? Will Christ who died ? Yes , and who rose from the dead , The Christ who is also at the right hand of God , And is interceding for us ?
45008035	What shall separate us from the love of Christ ? Shall anguish , or calamity , or persecution , or famine ? Shall nakedness , or peril , or sword ?
45008036	Even as it is written . For thy sake we are killed all the day long ; We are accounted as sheep for the slaughter .
45008037	Nay , in all these things we are more than conquerors Through Him who loved us .
45008038	For I am fully persuaded that neither death nor life , Neither angels nor principalities , nor powers , Neither the present world nor the world to come , Nor the powers of Nature ,
45008039	Nor height , nor depth , Nor any other created thing , Shall be able to separate us from the love of God Which is in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45009001	I am speaking the truth in Christ , it is no lie . My conscience bears me witness in the Holy Spirit that I have deep sorrow
45009002	and incessant anguish in my heart .
45009003	For I was on the point of praying to be accursed from Christ on behalf of my brothers , my kinsmen according to the flesh .
45009004	For they are Israelites ; to them belong the sonship , the Shekinah glory , the covenants , the giving of the Law ; the service of the temple , and the promises ;
45009005	theirs are the patriarchs , and of them , as concerning the flesh , is Christ , who is over all , God , blessed forever , Amen .
45009006	It is not , however , as though Gods word had failed ! For they are not all Israel who have sprung from Israel ;
45009007	they are not all children of Abraham because they are Abrahams descendants . The promise was , In Isaac shall thy posterity be called .
45009008	That is , it is not the children of the flesh who are children of God ; but the children of the promise are counted as his posterity .
45009009	For thus is the word of promise , According to this season I will come , and Sarah shall bear a son .
45009010	And not only so , but when Rebecca was pregnant by our forefather Isaac , though one man was the father of both children ,
45009011	and even though they were still unborn , and had done nothing either good or bad , in order that the purpose of God might stand according to election , not of works , but of Him who called ,
45009012	it was said to her , The elder shall serve the younger .
45009013	As it is written , Jacob have I loved , but Esau have I hated .
45009014	What shall we say then ? that there is injustice with God ? No indeed .
45009015	His words to Moses are . I will have mercy on whom I choose to have mercy ; I will have compassion on whom I choose to have compassion .
45009016	So then it is not a question of him who wills , nor of him who runs , but of God who has mercy .
45009017	For the Scripture says to Pharaoh , It is for this very purpose that I have raised you up , To show in you my power , And to proclaim my name far and wide , in all the earth .
45009018	So then he has mercy on whom he will , and whom he will , he hardens .
45009019	Then you will say to me . " Why does he still go on finding fault ? Who can withstand his will ? "
45009020	" Nay , but who are you , O man , that replies to God ? Shall the thing formed say unto him who formed it , " Why did you do me like this ? "
45009021	Or has not the potter power over the clay , to make out of the same lump one vessel for noble , and another for ignoble uses ?
45009022	But what if God , while intending to show forth his wrath , and to make known his power , yet endured , with much long-suffering , vessels of wrath , fitted to destruction ?
45009023	And what if he thus purposed to make known the riches of his glory upon vessels of mercy , which he had before prepared for glory ?
45009024	Now such are we whom he has called , not only from among the Jews , but also from among the Gentiles .
45009025	As he also said in Hosea . Those who were not my people I will call " my people , " And her " beloved " who was not beloved ;
45009026	And in that very spot where it was told them , " You are not my people , " There they shall be called " Sons of the living God . "
45009027	And in regard to Israel , Isaiah exclaims . Though the number of the sons of Israel be like the sands of the sea , it is but a remnant of those who shall be saved ;
45009028	for the Lord will execute his word upon the earth , finishing it and cutting it short .
45009029	Even as in an earlier passage , Isaiah says , Except the Lord of Sabbath had us some few descendants , we should have become like Sodom , and should have fared like Gomorrah .
45009030	What then shall we say ? That Gentiles who never pursed righteousness have overtaken it , even the righteousness of faith ?
45009031	But that the descendants of Israel , who were in pursuit of a law of righteousness , did not arrive at that law ?
45009032	And why ? Because they sought it not by faith , but thought to gain it by works . They stumbled at the stone of stumbling ;
45009033	even as it is written . Behold , I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense ; but he that believes on Him shall not be put to shame .
45010001	Brothers , the longing of my heart and my prayer to God is for my countrymen , that they may be saved .
45010002	For I bear them witness that they have a zeal for God , only it is a zeal without knowledge .
45010003	For because they were ignorant of Gods righteousness , and sought to establish their own righteousness , they did not submit themselves to the righteousness of God .
45010004	For to every believer Christ is an end of law as a means of righteousness .
45010005	For Moses writes concerning the righteousness of the Law , saying , The man that doeth it shall live by it .
45010006	But the righteousness of faith speaks in this way . Say not in thine heart , " Who shall ascend to heaven ? " - that is , to bring Christ down ;
45010007	Nor , " who shall descend into the abyss ? " - that is , to bring Christ up from the dead .
45010008	But what does it say ? The word is near thee , even in thy mouth and in thy heart . That is the very word of faith which we preach ;
45010009	Confess with your mouth " Jesus is Lord , " and believe in your heart that God actually raised him from the dead , and you will be saved .
45010010	For with the heart man believes unto righteousness , and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation .
45010011	The Scriptures say , Whoever believes in Him will not be put to shame .
45010012	For there is no difference between Jew and Gentile , because the same Lord Jesus is all over , and is rich unto all who call upon Him ;
45010013	for Whoever will call upon the name of the Lord will be saved .
45010014	How then shall thy call upon Him in whom they do not believe ? And how are they to believe in One of whom they have never heard ? And how shall they hear without a preacher ?
45010015	And how can men preach unless they are sent ? As it is written , How beautiful are the feet of those who bring a glad gospel .
45010016	And yet they did not all hearken to the good news ; for Isaiah said , Lord , who hath believed our message ?
45010017	So faith comes from a message heard , and the message comes from the teaching of Christ .
45010018	But I ask , Did they fail to hear ? Yes , truly , Their sound has gone out unto all the earth , And their words unto the ends of the world .
45010019	But I say , Did Israel not know ? First Moses says . I will provoke you to jealousy with that which is no nation ; Against a Gentile nation , void of understanding , will I anger you .
45010020	But Isaiah speaks very boldly , I was found of those who were not seeking me , I was made manifest to those who were not asking for me .
45010021	But to Israel he says , All day long I have been spreading out my hands unto a disobedient and contrary people .
45011001	Then I ask , Did God cast off his people ? No indeed . For I also am an Israelite , a son of Abraham , a member of the tribe of Benjamin .
45011002	God did not cast off his people whom he foreknew . For do you not know what is said in the Scripture about Elijah ? how he pleaded with God against Israel , saying ,
45011003	Lord , they have killed thy prophets , they have overthrown thine altars ; And now I alone am left , and they seek my life .
45011004	But what was the answer of God to him ? I have reserved for myself seven thousand who have not bowed the knee to Baal .
45011005	In the same way also at this time there is a remnant chosen by gift of grace .
45011006	But if it is by grace , it is no longer of works ; or else grace is no more grace .
45011007	What then ? that which Israel has been seeking for , that he has not obtained ; but the chosen have obtained it , and the rest have been hardened .
45011008	According as it is written , God has given them a spirit of slumber , Eyes that they should not see , Ears that they should not hear , unto this day .
45011009	As David says . Let their table be made a snare and a trap , And a stumbling-block and a recompense unto them ;
45011010	Let their eyes be darkened , that they may not see , And bow thou down their backs forever .
45011011	I ask then , " Have they stumbled so as to fall ? " No indeed ; but by their lapse salvation has come unto Gentiles , " to provoke Israel to jealousy . "
45011012	Now if their stumbling enriches the world , and their loss enriches the Gentiles , how much more must their fulness do !
45011013	For to you who are Gentiles I say that since I am an apostle to the Gentiles , I glorify my ministry ,
45011014	if by any means I might " provoke to jealousy " my kinsmen , and save some among them .
45011015	For if their casting out is the reconciliation of the world to God , what will their restoration be but life out of death ?
45011016	Now if the first-fruits of the dough Abraham and the Patriarchs are holy , so also is the whole mass their descendants . And if the root of a tree Abraham is holy , so also are the branches his descendants .
45011017	Supposing that some of the branches have been broken off , and you , although you were but a wild olive , have been grafted in among the branches and have become a partaker with them of the fatness of the olive tree , do not glory over the branches ;
45011018	or if you are glorying , remember that it is not you who uphold the root , but the root which upholds you .
45011019	" Branches have been broken off , " you say , " that I might be grafted in . "
45011020	True , through their unbelief they were broken off , and by your faith you stand . Do not be puffed up , but fear ;
45011021	for if God spared not the natural branches , neither will he spare you .
45011022	Fix your gaze , therefore , on the goodness and the severity of God ; towards those who fell , severity , but towards you , Gods goodness , if you continue stedfast in his goodness ; otherwise you , too , will be cut off .
45011023	And they also those Jews , if they do not continue in their unbelief , will be grafted in again ; for God is able to graft them in again .
45011024	For if you were cut out of that which is by nature a mere wild olive tree , and have been grafted , contrary to nature , into a fruitful olive tree , how much more shall these , the natural branches , be regrafted into their own olive tree ?
45011025	For I would not , my brothers , have you ignorant of this hidden truth , for fear that you become wise in your own conceits . that a hardening in part has befallen Israel , until the fulness of the Gentiles is come in .
45011026	And so all Israel will be saved , as it is written . The deliver will come from Zion , He will banish all ungodliness from Jacob ;
45011027	This is my covenant with them , When I shall take away their sins .
45011028	In relation to the gospel , the Jews are Gods enemies for your sake ; but in relation to the election , they are dearly loved for their forefathers sake .
45011029	For no change of purpose can annul Gods free gift and call .
45011030	And as in times past you were yourselves disobedient to God , but now , thanks to their disobedience , have obtained mercy ;
45011031	even so they also have now been disobedient , that by the mercy shown to you they also may now obtain mercy .
45011032	For God has locked up all in the prison of disobedience , that upon all he may have mercy .
45011033	Oh , the depths of the riches , both of the wisdom and the knowledge of God ! How unfathomable are his judgments , and how unsearchable his paths !
45011034	Who has known the mind of the Lord ? Or who has been his counsellor ?
45011035	Who has first given to Him , So as to receive payment in return ?
45011036	For of him and through him , and for him , are all things . All glory to him forever and ever ! Amen .
45012001	I entreat you therefore , brothers , by the mercies of God , to present your bodies to Him as a living sacrifice , holy and acceptable to God . This is your reasonable service of worship .
45012002	And be not conformed to this world , but be transformed by the renewing of your minds , so that you may prove what is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God .
45012003	For , through the grace that was given to me , I tell every man among you not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think ; but so to think , as to think soberly , according to the measure of faith which God has given him .
45012004	For even as we have many members in one body , and not all members have the same function ;
45012005	so we , who are many , are one body in Christ , and we are severally members of one another .
45012006	But we have gifts differing according to the grace which was given to us . He that has the gift of prophecy , let him prophesy according to the proportion of his faith .
45012007	If it is the gift of administration , let us give ourselves to our service .
45012008	Let the teacher give himself to his teaching ; and he who exhorts others to his exhortation . He who gives , let him do it in singleness of mind . He who rules , let him rule with diligence ; and he who shows mercy must be cheerful .
45012009	Let love be without insincerity . Abhor what is evil ; wed yourselves to what is good .
45012010	As for brotherly love , be tenderly affectionate one to another , in honor preferring one another .
45012011	In your diligence be free from sloth . Be glowing in spirit . Slave for the master .
45012012	Rejoice in hope ; be patient under affliction ; continue stedfast in prayer .
45012013	Be liberal to needy saints . Practise hospitality .
45012014	Bless your persecutors , bless , and curse not .
45012015	Rejoice with those who rejoice , and weep with those who weep .
45012016	Have full sympathy with one another . Set not your minds on high affairs , but associate with lowly folk . Do not be wise in your own conceits .
45012017	Do not pay back evil for evil . Aim to do what is honorable in the eyes of all .
45012018	If it be possible , so far as it lies with you , be at peace with all men .
45012019	Never revenge yourself , beloved , but leave the field clear for Gods wrath ; for it is written , " Vengeance is mine , I will repay , " says the Lord .
45012020	On the contrary , therefore , If your enemy is hungry , feed him ; if he is thirsty , give him drink ; for by so doing you will be heaping burning coals on his head .
45012021	Do not be overcome by evil , but be overcoming evil with good .
45013001	Every one should be in the higher authorities ; for there is no authority apart from God . The authorities that now exist have been appointed by God .
45013002	Therefore the man who rebels against authority is opposing the divine ordinances ; and those who withstand will bring judgment on themselves .
45013003	For rulers are no terror to good deeds , but to evil . Would you be fearless of the rulers authority ? Do what is good , and you will have his praise .
45013004	For the ruler is Gods minister appointed for your good . But if you are a wrong-doer , be afraid ; he does not carry the sword to no purpose ; he is Gods servant , appointed to vengeance upon the guilty .
45013005	Wherefore you must needs be in subjection , not only because of fear , but also for conscience sake .
45013006	This too , is the reason why you pay taxes ; because the authorities are ministers of Gods service , attending continually upon this very thing .
45013007	Render to all their dues ; taxes to whom taxes , customs to whom customs , respect to whom respect , and homage to whom homage is due .
45013008	Never owe any one anything save the debt of brotherly love ; for he who loves his neighbor has fulfilled the Law .
45013009	For the Law which says , Thou shalt not commit adultery , thou shalt do no murder , thou shalt not steal , thou shalt not bear false witness , thou shalt not covet , and whatever other commandment there be - is all summed up in this one saying , Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself .
45013010	Love never wrongs his neighbor ; therefore love is the fulfilment of the Law .
45013011	Carry out these injunctions because you know the crisis that we are in , that now it is high time for you to awake out of sleep ; for now is our salvation nearer than when we first believed .
45013012	The night is far spent ; The day is at hand . Let is therefore take off the deeds of darkness , Let us put on the armor of light .
45013013	Let us live honestly , as in the day , Not in reveling and drunkenness , Not in lust and licentiousness , Not is strife and jealousy ;
45013014	But clothe yourselves with the Lord Jesus Christ , And make no provisions for your earthly nature And the gratification of its lusts .
45014001	Welcome a man of weak faith , but not for the purpose of deciding doubtful points .
45014002	One man has faith to eat anything ; but he whose faith is weak , eats only vegetables .
45014003	He who eats meat must not despise the man who abstains ; and let not the man who abstains judge him who eats ; for God has received him .
45014004	Who are you just that judges the household-servant of another ? To his own lord he stands or falls . And stand he will , for his Master has power to make him stand .
45014005	There are some who esteem one day above another ; there are others who esteem all days alike ; let each other be fully persuaded in his own mind .
45014006	He who regards the day , regards it unto his Lord ; and he who regards it not , disregards it unto his Lord . He who eats meat , eats unto his Lord , for he gives God thanks ; and he who abstains , abstains unto his Lord , since he , too , gives God thanks .
45014007	For not one of us lives unto himself , and not one dies unto himself .
45014008	If we live , we live unto our Lord ; if we die , we die unto our Lord . So then , whether we live or die , we belong to our Lord .
45014009	For this purpose Christ died and became alive again , that he might be the Lord both of the dead and of the living .
45014010	But you the abstainer , why do you pass judgment on your brother ? Or you again the non-abstainer , why do you despise yours ? For we shall all stand before the judgment-seat of God .
45014011	For it is written , " As I live , " says the Lord , " to me every knee shall bow , And to God shall every tongue confess . "
45014012	So then each one of us shall give account of himself to God .
45014013	So let us no longer pass judgment on one another ; rather let this be your judgment , that no one put a stumbling-block in his brothers way , nor any cause of falling .
45014014	I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus that nothing is in itself unclean ; but any food is " unclean " for one who considers it " unclean . "
45014015	If your brother is continually pained because of your food , you are not conducting yourself any longer in love . Do not , by what you eat , persist in destroying a man for whom Christ died .
45014016	Therefore do not let what is right , so far as you are concerned , be evil spoken of .
45014017	For the kingdom of God is not a matter of eating and drinking , but of righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit .
45014018	Those who are slaving for Christ devotedly in these ways , are well pleasing to God and highly commended by man .
45014019	So then let is eagerly pursue the things that make for peace and the upbuilding of each other .
45014020	Do not , for the sake of food , be tearing down Gods work . All food indeed is ceremonially clean , but a man is in the wrong if his food proves a stumbling-block .
45014021	The right course is not to eat meat , nor to drink wine , nor to do anything through which your brother is made to stumble .
45014022	Have you faith ? Keep it to yourself as in the presence of God . He is a happy man who does not condemn himself in that which he approves .
45014023	But he who has misgivings , and yet eats meat , is condemned already , because his action is not based on faith ; and whatever is not based on faith is sin .
45015001	Now we who are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak , and not to seek our own pleasure .
45015002	Let each one of us try to make his neighbor happy for his good , unto his upbuilding .
45015003	For even Christ pleased not himself ; but as it is written , The reproaches of those who were reproaching thee fell upon me .
45015004	For everything that was written of old has been written for our instruction , that through patience , and through the comfort of the Scriptures , we might have hope .
45015005	Now the God of patience and of comfort grant you to be in full sympathy with one another , in accordance with the example of Jesus Christ ;
45015006	so that with one heart and with one voice you may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
45015007	Wherefore always receive one another into fellowship , to the glory of God , even as Christ also received you .
45015008	For I say that Christ has been made a minister of the Circumcision the people of Israel , in vindication of Gods truth , so that he may confirm the promises given to our forefathers ;
45015009	and so that the Gentiles also should praise God for his mercy , as it is written , Therefore I will offer praise to thee among the Gentiles , And sing to thy name .
45015010	Or again , Rejoice , O Gentiles , with his people .
45015011	Or again , Praise the Lord , all ye Gentiles , And let all the people extol him .
45015012	Or again , as Isaiah says . There shall be the root of Jesse , And he that arises to rule over the Gentiles ; On him shall the Gentiles hope .
45015013	Now the God of all hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing , that you may be overflowing with hope in the power of the Holy Spirit .
45015014	And I myself also am confident regarding you , my brothers , that you yourselves are already full of goodness , filled with all knowledge , and well able to give advice to one another .
45015015	Still I have written unto you the more boldly , in part , by way of reminding you , because of that gift of grace which God bestowed upon me , in making me a priest of Jesus Christ unto the Gentiles .
45015016	I act as priest of the gospel of God ; so that the Gentiles , when offered before him , may be an acceptable sacrifice , because consecrated by the Holy Spirit .
45015017	I have then my boast in Christ Jesus concerning the things of God .
45015018	For I will not dare to speak of any thing except that which Christ has done through me to bring the Gentiles to obedience by word and deed ,
45015019	through the might of signs and wonders , in the power of the Holy Spirit . So that beginning at Jerusalem and its environs , I have proclaimed without reserve the gospel of Christ , even as far as Illyricum .
45015020	My ambition has been , however , to preach the gospel where Christs name was not already known , so that I might not build upon another mans foundation .
45015021	But , as Scripture says , He shall be seen by those to whom no news about him ever came , And those who have never heard of him shall understand .
45015022	This is why I have been so hindered from coming to you .
45015023	But now , since I have no more any " opening " in these parts , and since I have longed for many years to come to you
45015024	whenever I go to Spain , I am hoping to see you on my way there , and to be set forward by you on my way there , and to be set forward by you on my journey thither , after I have enjoyed your company for a little while .
45015025	Just now I am going to Jerusalem to serve the saints .
45015026	For it has been the good pleasure of Macedonia and Achaia to make an offering for the poor among the saints at Jerusalem .
45015027	Yes , it has been made their good pleasure , and their debt , too . For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual riches , they owe it to them also to minister to them the Jews in worldly goods .
45015028	When , therefore , I have settled this , and have secured to them the poor at Jerusalem the fruit of this collection , I shall come on by you into Spain .
45015029	And I know that when I come to you , I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of Christ .
45015030	Brothers , I beseech you , by Jesus Christ our Lord , and by the love which the Spirit gives , to help me in my struggle by your prayers to God on my behalf ,
45015031	that I may be delivered from the disobedient in Judea ; that my mission to Jerusalem may be favorably received by the saints ;
45015032	and that I may come to you in joy , by the will of God , and find rest together with you .
45015033	The God of peace be with you all ! Amen .
45016001	I commend to you our sister Phoebe , who is a minister of the church at Cenchrae .
45016002	I beg you to give her a Christian welcome , as the saints should ; and to assist her in any matter in which she may have need of you . For she herself has been made an overseer to many people , including myself .
45016003	Salute Priscilla and Aquila , my fellow laborers in the cause of Jesus Christ ,
45016004	who risked their own lives to save mine ; who are thanked not only by me ,
45016005	but by all the churches among the Gentiles . Salute likewise the church that meets in their home . Salute Epaenetus , my dearly beloved , the first man in Roman Asia to believe in Christ .
45016006	Salute Mary , who toiled terribly for you ;
45016007	and Andronicus and Junia , my kinsfolk and fellow prisoners , who are notable among the apostles , and who became Christians before I did .
45016008	Salute Amplias , my beloved in the Lord ;
45016009	and Urbanus , my fellow toiler in Christ ; and Stachys , my dear , dear friend .
45016010	Salute Apellas , tested and tried in Christ , and the household of Aristobulus ,
45016011	and Herodion , my kinsman . Salute the believing members of the household of Narcissus .
45016012	Salute Trypheana and Tryphosa , who are ever toiling in the Lord . Salute dear Persis , who has toiled terribly in the Lords service .
45016013	Salute Rufus , the chosen in the Lord , and his mother and mine .
45016014	Salute Asyncritus , Phlegon , Hermes , Patrobas , Hermas , and the brothers who are associated with them .
45016015	Salute Philologus and Julia , Nereus and his sister , Olympas , and all the saints associated with them .
45016016	Salute one another with a holy kiss . All the churches of Christ salute you .
45016017	I exhort you , brothers , to keep watch of those who are causing the divisions among you , and occasions of stumbling , contrary to the teaching which you have learned .
45016018	Turn away from them . For men of that stamp are not the slaves of Christ , but are slaves to their own appetites . By their smooth and fair speech they beguile the hearts of the innocent .
45016019	I say this , for the tidings of your obedience have been told throughout the world . On your own behalf , then , I rejoice ; but I want you to be wise unto the good , but innocents in evil .
45016020	The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet . The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
45016021	Timothy , my fellow worker , salutes you ; so do my fellow countrymen Lucius , Jason , and Sosipater .
45016022	I , Tertius , who write this letter , salute you in the Lord .
45016023	Gaius , my host , and the host of the church , salutes you . Erastus , the treasurer of the city , salutes you , and so does brother Quartus .
45016024	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all !
45016025	Now I commend you to Him who is able to keep you stedfast , according to my gospel , and the proclamation of Jesus Christ , whereby is unveiled the secret truth which was kept secret through immemorial ages ,
45016026	but now has been brought to light , and by command of the eternal God made known to the Gentiles by the scriptures of the Prophets , so that the Gentiles might hold obedience of the faith .
45016027	Unto Him , the only wise God , through Jesus Christ , be glory forever . Amen .
46001001	Paul , called by the will of God to be an apostle of Jesus Christ , and Sosthenes , his brother .
46001002	to the Church of God at Corinth , to those who are sanctified in Christ Jesus , called to be saints , together with all , wherever they are , who call upon the name of the Lord Jesus .
46001003	Grace to you , and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
46001004	I am always thanking God on your behalf , for the grace of God bestowed on you in Christ Jesus ;
46001005	that in everything you have been enriched in him , in all speech , and in all knowledge
46001006	( for thus my witness for Christ was confirmed among you ) ;
46001007	so that you lack no divine gift , while you are waiting for the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46001008	He will also keep you perfectly stedfast unto the end , so that you will be unreprovable in the Day of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46001009	Faithful is the God by whom you were called into fellowship with his Son , Jesus Christ our Lord .
46001010	Now I beg you , brothers , in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , to speak in accord , all of you , and to have no divisions among you , but to be knit together in a common mind and temper .
46001011	For it has been plainly told me concerning you , my brothers , by Chloes people , that there are dissensions among you .
46001012	I mean by this that one of you says , " I am a follower of Paul " ; another , " I of Apollos " ; another , " I of Cephas " ; another , " I of Christ . "
46001013	Has Christ been divided ? Paul , was he crucified for you ? or was it into the name of Paul that you were baptized ?
46001014	I am thankful to God that I baptized none of you except Crispus and Gaius ,
46001015	so that no one can say you were baptized in my name .
46001016	Yes , I did baptize the house of Stephanas also , but I do not think I baptized any one else .
46001017	For Christ did not think I baptized any one else . For Christ did not send me forth to baptize , but to proclaim the gospel ; and that not in philosophic words , lest the Cross of Christ should be made an empty thing .
46001018	For the message of the Cross is indeed for those on their way to destruction , foolishness ; but for us who are on our way to salvation it is the power of God .
46001019	For thus it is written , I will destroy the wisdom of the philosophers , And the prudence of the prudent will I confound .
46001020	Sage , rabbi , skeptic of this present age - where are they all ? Has not God made foolish the philosophy of the world ?
46001021	For when , in the wisdom of God , the world by its philosophy knew not God , the world by its philosophy knew not God , it pleased God , by the foolishness of preaching , to save those who believe .
46001022	Jews continue to ask for miracles and Greeks are ever wanting philosophy ,
46001023	but we come preaching a crucified Messiah - to Jews a stumbling-block , to Greeks foolishness ,
46001024	but to those who are the called , whether Jews or Greeks , Christ , the power of God and the wisdom of God .
46001025	For the foolishness of God is wiser than men , and the weakness of God is stronger than men .
46001026	For consider your own calling , brothers , that not many wise in earthly wisdom , not many powerful , not many of noble birth , have been called .
46001027	No , God has chosen the worlds folly to confound its philosophy ; and the worlds weakness to confound its strength .
46001028	The worlds base things has God chosen , and the things that are not , to bring to naught the things that are ;
46001029	so that no mortal man should glory in his presence .
46001030	It is of him that you are in Christ Jesus , whom God made unto us wisdom and righteousness and sanctification and redemption ,
46001031	so that as Scripture says , He that glories , let him glory in the Lord .
46002001	And when I came to you , brothers , I came not to proclaim Gods great secret purpose in fine language of philosophy ;
46002002	for I determined to know nothing , while among you , but Jesus as Christ , and him a crucified Christ .
46002003	In weakness and fear and great trembling came I among you .
46002004	My message and my preaching were not in the persuasive language of philosophy , but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power ;
46002005	in order that your faith should rest , not on human philosophy , but on the power of God .
46002006	Notwithstanding , among those who are mature I do teach philosophy ; though not the philosophy of the present age , nor of its rulers who are coming to nought .
46002007	No , it is Gods wisdom that I utter , that hidden wisdom which God had decreed before the world began , unto our glory .
46002008	None of the rulers of the present age understands it , for if they had , they would not have crucified the Lord of Glory .
46002009	Nay , as it is written . Eye has not seen , Nor ear heard , Neither have entered into mans heart The things which God has prepared For those who love him .
46002010	Yet God has unveiled them to us by his Spirit . For the Spirit fathoms everything , even the abysmal depths of God .
46002011	For what man knows the depths of man except the mans own inner Spirit ? Even so , also , the Spirit of God knows the deeps profound of God .
46002012	But we have not received the spirit of the world , but the Spirit which comes forth from God , that we may realize the blessings freely given us by God .
46002013	Of these high themes we speak in words not taught by human philosophy , but by the Spirit ; interpreting spiritual things to spiritual men .
46002014	The unspiritual man rejects the teachings of Gods Spirit ; for him it is folly . He cannot understand it , for it is spiritually discerned ,
46002015	But the spiritual man discerns everything , yet is himself discerned by no one .
46002016	For what man understands the mind of the Lord , that he should instruct Him ?
46003001	As for me , brothers , I could not talk to you as spiritual men , but as to creatures of flesh , mere babes in Christ .
46003002	I fed you milk , not meat ; for you were unable to bear it .
46003003	You are not able even now , for you are still unspiritual . While there is among you jealousy and strife , are you not still unspiritual , and behaving like worldlings ?
46003004	When one says , " I follow Paul , " and another , " I follow Apollos , " are you not mere worldlings ?
46003005	What then is Apollos ? What is Paul ? Just ministers through whom you have believed , and each doing the work that the Lord gave him .
46003006	I planted , Apollos watered , but God made the seed grow .
46003007	So neither is he who planted anything , nor he who watered , but God alone , who is making the seed grow .
46003008	Now , though he who plants and he who waters are one , each will receive his own reward , according to his own service .
46003009	For we are Gods fellow workers ; and you are Gods field , you are Gods building .
46003010	According to the grace of God vouchsafed me , like a skillful master-builder , I have laid a foundation ; but another will be building upon it . Let each take heed how he builds on it .
46003011	The foundation is already laid - Jesus Christ - and no man can lay another .
46003012	On that foundation , if a man proceeds to build gold , silver , precious stones , wood , hay , stubble , each mans work will be made manifest .
46003013	The Day will disclose it , for it dawns in fire , and the fire will test each mans work , of what quality it is .
46003014	If any mans work - the building he has made - stands the test , he will be rewarded .
46003015	If any mans work is burned up , he will suffer loss , but he himself will be saved , as it were through the flames .
46003016	Do you not know what you are Gods sanctuary , and that the Spirit of God is dwelling within you ?
46003017	If any one tear down Gods sanctuary , God will tear him down ; for the sanctuary of God is holy , and that is what you are .
46003018	Let no one deceive himself . If any one of you supposes that he is wise in the philosophy of the present age , let him become foolish , so that he may be wise .
46003019	For the philosophy of this world is foolishness in Gods sight . It is written , He snares the wise in their own craftiness ,
46003020	and again , The Lord knows the reasonings of the wise , how futile they are .
46003021	So let no one make boast in men . For all things are yours ;
46003022	Paul , Apollos , Cephas , the world , life , death , things present or things to come ; all things are yours ;
46003023	and you are Christs , and Christ is Gods .
46004001	Let any man look upon us as servants of Christ , and stewards of the secret truths of God .
46004002	Now it is required of stewards , that a man be found faithful .
46004003	But to me it matters very little that I am judged by you , or by any earthly court .
46004004	Indeed I do not even judge myself ; for though I know nothing against myself , yet that does not vindicate me ; for he who judges me is the Lord .
46004005	So make no hasty judgment until the Lord come , who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness , and will make plain the purpose of mens hearts . Then each mans due praise will come to him from God .
46004006	Now these things , brothers , I have applied in a figure to myself and to Apollos for your sakes ; that in us you might learn not to go beyond what is written ; that none of you be puffed up for the one , against the other .
46004007	For who makes you a differ , brother ? Or what have you that you did not receive ? But if you did receive it , why are you boasting as if you had not received it ?
46004008	But you , forsooth , are already full , are you ? You are already rich ? Without us you are already reigning ? Yes , and I would that you did reign , so that we also might reign with you .
46004009	But it seems to me that God has exhibited us apostles , last of all , like men doomed to death ; for we are made a spectacle to the whole world , both to men and to angels .
46004010	For Christs sake we are fools , but you are quite philosophic in Christ . We are weak , but you are strong ; you are honorable , but we are outcast .
46004011	Even to his very hour we are enduring hunger and thirst and nakedness and blows .
46004012	Homeless men , we toil , working with our own hands .
46004013	When reviled , we bless ; when persecuted , we endure ; when defamed , we conciliate . We have been made , as it were , scum-o-the-earth , the very refuse of the world , to this very hour !
46004014	I am not writing this to shame you , but to admonish you , as my beloved children .
46004015	For though you have ten thousand tutors in Christ Jesus , you can have but one father . For in Christ Jesus I begot you through the gospel .
46004016	I beg you then to imitate my example .
46004017	With this in mind I have sent Timothy to you . He is my dear and faithful son in the Lord , who will remind you of my ways in Christ ; the manner in which I ever teach everywhere in every church .
46004018	Now some are puffed up , as though I were not coming to you .
46004019	But come to you I will , and that soon , if it please the Lord , and then I shall learn not the talk of these boasters , but their power .
46004020	For the kingdom of God is not in talk , but in power .
46004021	Which do you want ? Am I to come to you with a rod , or in a loving and tender spirit ?
46005001	It is actually reported that there is immorality among you , and such immorality as is not even among the heathen - that a man has taken his fathers wife !
46005002	Yet you are puffed up instead of mourning and removing from among you the man who has done this thing .
46005003	For I , although absent in body , yet present in spirit , have already passed sentence , by the authority of our Lord Jesus Christ , on him who has done this thing .
46005004	When you are gathered together , and my spirit is with you together with the power of our Lord Jesus ,
46005005	I have handed over such a man to Satan for the destruction of his flesh , that his spirit may be saved , in the day of the Lord Jesus .
46005006	Your glorying is not good . Do you not know that even a little leaven leavens all the lump ?
46005007	Then get rid of the old leaven , so that you may be like a new lump , as you are now unleavened . For our Paschal Lamb has already been sacrificed , Christ himself .
46005008	So let us keep the unending feast , not with any old leaven , neither with leaven of malice and vice , but with unleavened bread of sincerity and truth .
46005009	I told you in my letter not to associate with the immoral .
46005010	Not that in this world you were actually to have no contact with the immoral , the avaricious , the thievish , or with idolaters ; for then you would have to leave the world , altogether .
46005011	But what I wrote was that you were not to associate with any so-called brother who is immoral , or avaricious , or idolatrous , or abusive , or a drunkard , or an extortioner . No , with such persons do not even sit at table .
46005012	What have I to do with the judging of outsiders ? Must not you judge those who are within the church , while God judges outsiders ?
46005013	Expel that wicked man from among you .
46006001	Dare any one of you who has a grievance against his neighbor go to law before heathen judges , instead of before the saints ?
46006002	Do you not know that the saints will judge the world ? And if the world is to be tried by you , are you unfit to try such trifling cases ?
46006003	Do you not know that we are to try angels ? How much more , then , the affairs of life .
46006004	Why then , if you have cases relating to earthly affairs which need to be decided , is it men who are absolutely nothing in the church whom you make your judges ?
46006005	I say this to shame you . Is it so that there is not among you a single wise man , capable of deciding between a man and his brother ?
46006006	Must brother go to law with brother , and that , too , before unbelievers ?
46006007	Indeed , to say nothing more , the fact that you have lawsuits with one another is altogether a defect in you . Why not rather suffer injustice ? Why not rather endure being cheated ?
46006008	On the contrary , you yourselves are inflicting injustice and fraud , and that upon your brothers .
46006009	Do you not know that the wicked will not inherit the kingdom of God ? Do not be deceived . None who are immoral , or idolaters , or adulterers , or catamites , or sodomites ,
46006010	or thieves , or avaricious men , or drunkards , or foul-mouthed men , or extortioners will inherit the kingdom of God .
46006011	Such were some of you , but you have washed away your stains , you have been consecrated , you have been justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ , and in the Spirit of our God .
46006012	" All things are lawful for me " ? Yes , but not all things are good for me . " All things are lawful for me " ? Yes , but I will not let myself be enslaved by the power of any .
46006013	" Food is meant for the stomach , and the stomach for food " ? Yes , but God will soon put an end both to the one and to the other . The body , however , exists not for immorality , but for the Lord , and the Lord for the body ;
46006014	and the God who raised up our Lord will up-raise us also by his mighty power .
46006015	You know , do you not , that your bodies are members of Christ ? Shall I then take the members of Christ , and make them members of a harlot ? God forbid !
46006016	Do you not know that he who joins himself to a harlot is one with her in body ? ( For God says , The two shall become one flesh . )
46006017	While a man who is united with the Lord is one with Him in spirit ?
46006018	Flee from immorality . Every other sin that a man commits lies outside the body , but the immoral man sins against his own body .
46006019	Do you not know that your body is a sanctuary of the Holy Spirit who is within you , the Spirit whom you have from God ?
46006020	You are not your own ; for you have been bought with a price , therefore glorify God in your bodies .
46007001	Now concerning the question in your letter . It is well for a man to have no intercourse with a woman ,
46007002	but because there is so much immorality let each man have his own wife ; and let each women have her own husband .
46007003	Let the husband give his wife her due , and likewise the wife her husband . The wife is not mistress of her own person ,
46007004	but her husband is ; and in the same way the husband is not master of his own person , but his wife is .
46007005	Do not refuse one another , unless it is only temporary and by mutual consent , so that you may devote yourselves to prayer . Then come together again , lest through your lack of self-control Satan begin to tempt you to sin .
46007006	But what I have just said is by way of concession , not command .
46007007	I would that every one lived as I do ; but each man has his own special gift from God , one this , another that .
46007008	But to the unmarried , and the widows , I say that it is well for them to remain as I am .
46007009	If , however , they are not exercising self-control , by all means let them marry ; for marriage is better than the fever of passion .
46007010	But to those already married my commandment is - and not mine , but the Lords - that a wife is not to leave her husband ;
46007011	( or if she has already left him let her either remain as she is , or be reconciled to him ) , and also that a husband is not to put away his wife .
46007012	To the rest it is I who am speaking , not the Lord . If any brother has a wife who is not a believer , if he is willing to live with her , let him not send her away .
46007013	And a woman whose husband is not a believer , if he is willing to live with her , let her not separate from him .
46007014	For the unbelieving husband is consecrated through union with his believing wife ; and the unbelieving wife , through union with her believing husband . Otherwise your children would be unholy , but now they are consecrated to God .
46007015	But if the unbelieving partner be determined to leave , separation let it be . In such cases the believing husband or wife is not under bondage . But it is into peace that God has called us .
46007016	For how do you know , wife , whether you will save your husband ? Or how do you know , husband , whether you will save your wife ?
46007017	Only whatever be the lot in life to which God has assigned each one - and whatever the condition in which he was living when God called him - - in that let him continue . Such is the rule I give in all the churches .
46007018	So , was any man called , being circumcised ? Let him not become uncircumcised . Was any man called when he was uncircumcised ? Let him not be circumcised .
46007019	Circumcision is nothing , and uncircumcision is nothing . Keeping Gods commands in everything .
46007020	Whatever be the condition of life in which he was called , in that let him continue .
46007021	Were you called in slavery ? Let not that trouble you ; but if you can become free make use of the opportunity .
46007022	For the slave who has been called in the Lord is the Lords freedman ; and in the same way , the free man who is called is Christs slave .
46007023	You have been brought with a price ; do not become slaves to men .
46007024	Where each man stood when he was called , there , brothers , let him stay , close to God .
46007025	I have no command from the Lord to give you concerning unmarried women ; but I give you my opinion , and it is that of a man who , through the Lords mercy , is deserving of your confidence .
46007026	I think then , that in view of the time of suffering now imminent , it is best for a man to remain as he is .
46007027	Are you bound to a wife ? Do not seek to be free . Are you free from the marriage bond ? Do not seek for a wife .
46007028	Yet if you do not marry , you have not done wrong ; and if a girl marries , she has not done wrong . Such people , however , will have trouble in worldy affairs , and I wish to spare you .
46007029	Indeed , brothers , the time that remains to us has been shortened ; so let those who have wives live as if they had none ,
46007030	let those who weep be as though they did not weep , those who rejoice as though they did not rejoice , those who buy as though they did not possess ,
46007031	and those who use the world as though using it sparingly . For the present phase of the world is passing away .
46007032	So I want you to be free from all anxieties . An unmarried man is anxious about the Lords business , how he may please the Lord ;
46007033	but a married man is anxious about worldly affairs , how he may please his wife , and he is divided in his mind .
46007034	Again , the woman who is widow , or the maid , is anxious about the Lords business , how she may be pure in body and in mind ; but the married woman is anxious about worldly affairs , how she may please her husband .
46007035	It is in your own interest that I say this ; not that I may entangle you in a snare , but that I may help you to serve the Lord with fitting and undistracted service .
46007036	If , however , a father feels that he is not treating his virgin daughter in a seemly manner , in leaving her unmarried beyond the flower of her age , and so the matter is urgent , let him do what she desires ; he commits no sin . Let the marriage take place .
46007037	On the other hand , he who is firm in his purpose and is under no compulsion , but is free to carry out his own wishes , and who has determined to keep his daughter unmarried , does well .
46007038	So he that gives his daughter in marriage is doing right , and he who keeps her unmarried will be doing right , and he who keeps her unmarried will be doing better .
46007039	A wife is bound to her husband during his lifetime ; but if her husband dies , she is free to marry whomever she will , provided it be in the Lord .
46007040	But she is happier , in my judgment , if she remains as she is ; and I think that I , too , have the Spirit of God .
46008001	Now in regard to food which has been offered to idols , we are sure of course that " we all have knowledge . " But knowledge puffs up , while love builds up .
46008002	If a man thinks that he already has knowledge , he does not yet truly know as he ought to know ;
46008003	but if a man loves God , he is known by him .
46008004	Now as to eating food that has been offered to idols , we know well that an idol has no real existence in the universe , and that there is no God but One .
46008005	For though there be so-called " gods , " celestial of terrestrial , as indeed there are gods many and lords many ,
46008006	yet for there is one God , the Father , from whom are all things , and we for him ; and one Lord Jesus Christ , by whom are all things , and we by him .
46008007	But that " knowledge " is not possessed by all ; but some , accustomed until now to the idol , eat food as that which has actually been offered to an idol , and so their conscience , being still weak , is defiled .
46008008	Now food does not bring us nearness to God . Neither if we eat do we gain any advantage , nor if we eat not , do we lose any .
46008009	But see to it lest this right of yours become a stumbling-block to the weak .
46008010	For if any one should see you , the possessor of " knowledge , " reclining at table in an idols temple , would not his conscience , if he were weak , be emboldened to eat things sacrificed to idols ?
46008011	So he is lost , this weak man , lost by your " knowledge . " this brother for whom Christ died .
46008012	In so sinning against your brothers , and in ever and again wounding their weak consciences , you are sinning against Christ .
46008013	Therefore , if what I eat makes my brother to stumble , I will never eat meat again , lest I make my brother to stumble .
46009001	Am I not free ? Am I not an apostle ? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord ? Are you not my work in the Lord ?
46009002	Even if I am not an apostle to others , to you at least I am ; for you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord .
46009003	This is my reply to my critics .
46009004	Have I no right to claim food and drink ?
46009005	Have I no right to take a believing wife with me on my journey , as the rest of the apostles and the Lords brothers and Peter do ?
46009006	Are we the only ones , Barnabas and I , who have no right to give up manual labor ?
46009007	What soldier ever serves at his own expense ? What farmer ever plants a vineyard and his flock and does not taste the milk ?
46009008	Am I saying this on human authority only , or does not the Law also say the same ?
46009009	Yea , in the Law of Moses it is written , Thou shalt not muzzle an ox while he is treading out the grain .
46009010	Is it the oxen that God is thinking about , or is it really said for our sakes ? It was written for us ; because the plowman ought to plow in hope , and the thresher in hope of getting a share of the crop .
46009011	If I have sown for you the seeds of spiritual good , is it a great thing if I reap from you temporal goods ?
46009012	If others share this authority over you , do not I far more ? Yet I have not availed myself of it , but am patiently enduring ; so that I may not in any way hinder the progress of Christs gospel .
46009013	You know , do you not , that those who minister in the temple , and those who serve at the altar , get their portion of the sacrifices ?
46009014	Even so the Lord ordained that those who proclaim the gospel should get their living by the gospel .
46009015	But for my part , I have never availed myself of any of these rights . I do not say this to bring it about in my own case . I would rather die than let any one make void this boast of mine .
46009016	Proclaiming the gospel gives me no ground of boasting ; for necessity is laid upon me ; woe is me if I preach not the gospel .
46009017	For if I do this of my own accord , I have my pay ; but if unwilling , I have at least discharged my stewardship .
46009018	What then is my wage ? This , that I can make the gospel free where I carry it ; and that I can refrain from using my rights as a preacher of the gospel .
46009019	Though free from all men , I make myself the slave of all , that I may win the more .
46009020	To the Jews I am become like a Jew , that I may win Jews ; to those under the Law , like one under the Law , though I am not under the Law , myself ;
46009021	to those outside the Law , as one outside the Law , to win those outside the Law ( though I am not outside the law of God , but inside the law of Christ ) .
46009022	I am become weak to the weak , to win the weak . I am become all these things to all men that , by any and by all means , I may save some .
46009023	And I am doing it all for the gospels sake , that I may become a copartner in it .
46009024	Do you not know that in a foot-race , though all run , only one receives the prize ? So run that you may win .
46009025	Every man who contends in the games continually trains himself by all manner of self-restraint . Now they do it to get a fading garland , but we , one that is unfading .
46009026	For my part , then , I run with no wavering to the goal . I box not as one beating the air ,
46009027	but I bruise my body and keep it in subjection , lest having called others to the contest , I should myself be disqualified .
46010001	For I would not have you ignorant , brothers , how our fathers were all under the cloud , and all passed through the sea ,
46010002	and all were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea .
46010003	They all ate of the same spiritual bread ,
46010004	and all drank from the same spiritual stream , for they were drinking from a spiritual rock that followed them , and that Rock was Christ .
46010005	But in most of them God was not well pleased , for they were laid low in the desert .
46010006	Now this happened as a warning for us , that we might not long for evil things as they longed .
46010007	And you must not be idolaters like some of them . as it is written , The people sat down to eat and drink , And they rose up for idol dances .
46010008	Nor must we act licentiously , as some of them did , and fell in a single day , twenty-three thousand of them .
46010009	Neither must we presume upon the patience of our Lord , as some of them presumed , and were destroyed by the serpents ;
46010010	nor murmur , as some of them did , and were destroyed by the Destroying Angel .
46010011	Now these things were happening to them typically , but were written down for our admonition who stand at the meeting of the ages .
46010012	So then let him who imagines that he is standing so securely beware lest he fall .
46010013	No temptation has overtaken you that is beyond mans power ; but God is faithful , who will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear , but will , with every temptation , provide the way of escape also , so that you may be able to withstand .
46010014	So then , my beloved , continually flee from idolatry .
46010015	I am speaking to men of sense ; do you yourselves judge what I say .
46010016	The cup of blessing which we bless , is it not a common participation in the blood of Christ ? The bread which we break , is it not a common participation in the body of Christ ?
46010017	Because we who are many are one bread , one body , for we all do share in the one loaf .
46010018	Look at Israel according to the flesh ; are not those who eat the sacrifices in communion with the altar ?
46010019	What then shall we say ? that an offering to an idol is anything ? or that an idol is really anything ?
46010020	On the contrary , what the heathen sacrifice they sacrifice to demons and not to God , and I do not want you to have communion with demons .
46010021	You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and also the cup of demons ; you cannot be partakers in the Lords table and in the table of demons .
46010022	What ! would we provoke the Lord to jealousy ? Are we stronger than he ?
46010023	" All things are lawful , " you say ? But not all things are expedient ; " all things are lawful " ; but not all build up .
46010024	Let not each one be always seeking his own , but rather his neighbors good .
46010025	Eat anything that is for sale in the markets , asking no questions for conscience sake ;
46010026	for the earth and its fulness are the Lords .
46010027	If one who is not a believer invites you to his house , and you wish to go , eat everything that is set before you , without asking questions for conscience sake .
46010028	But if any one tells you , " This food has been offered in sacrifice , " do not eat it , for the sake of him who told you ,
46010029	and for your conscience sake - his conscience , not your own . " But , " you may object , " why should my freedom be decided upon anothers scruples of conscience ?
46010030	If I eat after giving thanks , why am I denounced for eating that for which I have given thanks ? "
46010031	Because whether you are eating or whether you are drinking , you are to do it all for the glory of God .
46010032	Do not be a cause of stumbling either to Jews of to Gentiles , or to the church of God .
46010033	For so I also try to please all men in every way , not by seeking my own good , but the good of the many , that they may be saved .
46011001	Be imitators of me , as I am an imitator of Christ .
46011002	Indeed I praise you for remembering me in everything , and because you are holding fast to the traditions just as you received them .
46011003	But I wish you to understand that the head of every man is Christ , and of a wife her husband is head ; and that God is head of Christ .
46011004	Every man who prays or prophesies with head veiled dishonors his Head ;
46011005	but every woman who prays or prophesies with her head unveiled dishonors her head ( her husband ) . for it is one and the same thing as if she were shaven .
46011006	If a woman does not wear a veil , let her also cut off her hair ; now if it is a disgrace for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved , let her be veiled .
46011007	A man , indeed , ought not to have his head veiled , for he is an image and glory of God ; but woman is a glory of man .
46011008	For it is not man who was made from woman , but woman was made from man .
46011009	And man was not created for woman , but woman for man .
