46011010	For this reason the woman ought to have authority over her head , because of her guardian angels .
46011011	However , in the Lord neither is woman independent of man , nor is man independent of woman ;
46011012	for just as the woman was made from the man , so also is the man born of the woman , while they both come from God .
46011013	Judge of this for your own selves . It is fitting that a woman should pray to God with her head unveiled .
46011014	Nor does nature itself teach you that it is a disgrace to a man to have long hair ,
46011015	but it is womans glory , because her hair has been given her instead of a veil .
46011016	If , however , any one is inclined to be disputatious regarding such a custom , let him know that neither I nor the churches of God hold to such a custom .
46011017	But in giving you the following instructions , I cannot praise you ; your solemn assemblies do more harm than good .
46011018	To begin with , I am told - and I believe there is some truth in it - that when you meet at a church there are divisions among you .
46011019	For there must needs be also parties among you , in order that the good may be tested and made known .
46011020	Again , when you meet together , there is no true eating of the Lords Supper ;
46011021	for each one of you begins to eat his own supper ; one goes hungry , while another gets drunk .
46011022	What ! Have you no houses in which to eat or drink ? or do you wish to show your contempt for the church of God , and to shame those who have no homes to eat in ? What shall I say to you ? Shall I praise you ? In this I certainly do not praise you .
46011023	For I passed on to you the account , which I myself received from the Lord ; how the Lord Jesus , on the very night he was betrayed , took bread ,
46011024	and when he had given thanks , he broke it , saying , " This is my body , broken for you ; this do in memory of me . "
46011025	In the same way also , he took the cup after supper , saying . " This cup is the new covenant in my blood ; do this , whenever you drink it , in memory of me . "
46011026	For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup , you are proclaiming your Lords death until he come .
46011027	So he that eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord unworthy must answer for a sin against the body and blood of the Lord .
46011028	Let each man scrutinize himself , and thus let him eat of the bread and drink of the cup .
46011029	For whoever eats and drinks without discerning the body , eats and drinks condemnation to himself .
46011030	This is why many among you are feeble and sickly , and many sleep .
46011031	If however , we were judging ourselves aright , we should not now be condemned ;
46011032	but through our condemnation by the Lord , we are trained so that we may not be condemned ;
46011033	So , my brothers , whenever you come together for this meal , wait for one another .
46011034	If any one is hungry , let him eat at home , so that your meetings do not bring condemnation upon you . The other matters I will adjust when I come .
46012001	Now concerning spiritual gifts , brothers , I do not wish you to be ignorant .
46012002	You know that when you were heathen you went astray after dumb idols , wherever he be led .
46012003	Wherefore I want you to understand that no one who speaks in the Spirit of God says , " Jesus is accursed , " and no one can say , " Jesus is Lord , " except in the Holy Spirit .
46012004	Now there are varieties of gifts , but the same Spirit ;
46012005	there are various forms of service , and the same Lord ;
46012006	and varieties of work , and the same God , who works in all .
46012007	Now to each man has been given his manifestation of the Spirit for the common good .
46012008	For to one man by the Spirit has been given a word of wisdom , to another a word of insight by the same Spirit ;
46012009	to one man by the same Spirit is given faith , to another gifts of healing by the one Spirit ;
46012010	to another the powers which work miracles , to another prophecy , to another the discernment of spirits ; to another varieties of tongues , to another the interpretation of tongues .
46012011	But the one and the same Spirit gives power to all , distributing his gifts to each as he wills .
46012012	For just as the body is one and has many members , and all the members of the body , although they be many , are one body ; so also is Christ .
46012013	And we can see this , for in one Spirit we were all baptized into one body , whether Jew or Gentile , whether slave or free , and we were all made to drink of one Spirit .
46012014	For the body is not one member , but many .
46012015	If the foot should say , " Because I am a hand , I am not part a part the body , " would it not indeed be a part of the body ?
46012016	Or if the ear should say , " Because I am not an eye , I am not a part of the body , " would it be any less a part of the body ?
46012017	If the whole body were an eye , where were hearing ? If all were hearing , where were smelling ?
46012018	But now God has set the members , each one of them , in the body as it has pleased him .
46012019	If all were one member , where would the body be ?
46012020	But now there are many members , but one body .
46012021	And the eye cannot say to the hand , " I have no need of you " . nor again of head to the feet , " I have no need for you . "
46012022	On the contrary , we need those members of the body which seem to be weaker ;
46012023	upon those parts of the body which we esteem less honorable , we bestow more abundant honor , and our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness .
46012024	For whereas our comely parts have no need , God has tempered the body together , giving more abundant honor to that member in which lacked ;
46012025	that there should be no disunion in the body , but that members mutual care for one another .
46012026	When one member suffers , all the others suffer with it ; and when one member is honored , all the members are glad with it .
46012027	Now you are the body of Christ , and individually members of it .
46012028	And God has appointed those in the church to be first of all apostles , second , prophets , third , teachers . then workers of miracles , healers , helpers , administrators , users of various kinds of " tongues . "
46012029	Are all apostles ? Are all prophets ? teachers ? workers of miracles ?
46012030	Have all gifts of healing ? Do all speak with tongues ? Do all interpret ?
46012031	Desire earnestly the greater gifts . And yet I will go on to show you a still more excellent way .
46013001	Though I speak in the tongues of men and of angels , but have no love , I am become a clanging brass , or a clashing cymbal .
46013002	Though I have the gift of prophecy and understand all mysteries and all knowledge , and have all faith , so that I could remove mountains , but have not love , I am nothing .
46013003	And though I sell all my goods to feed the poor , and though I give my body to be burned , but have not love , it avails me nothing .
46013004	Love suffers long and is kind ; love envies not ; love makes no parade , is not puffed up ,
46013005	is not rude , nor selfish , nor easily provoked . Love bears no malice , never rejoices over wrong-doing ,
46013006	but rejoices when the truth rejoices .
46013007	It knows how to be silent , it is trustful , hopeful , patient , enduring .
46013008	Love never fails ; but though there are prophecies , they will fail ; though there are tongues , they will cease ; though there is knowledge , it will be superseded .
46013009	For our knowing is imperfect , and our prophesying is imperfect ;
46013010	but when the perfect is come , then the perfect will be done away .
46013011	When I was a child I spoke like a child , felt like a child , thought like a child ; now that I am become a man , I have done with childish things .
46013012	For now we see as in a mirror , and are baffled , but then face to face ; now I know in fragments , but then shall I understand even as I also have been understood .
46013013	Faith , Hope , Love endure - these three ; but the greatest of these is Love .
46014001	Hotly pursue this love , yet seek earnestly spiritual gifts , and chiefly that you may prophesy .
46014002	For he who speaks in a " tongue " speaks not to man but to God , for no one understands him , but in the Spirit he utters secret truths .
46014003	But he who prophesies addresses words to men that build up , encourage , and console .
46014004	He who speaks in a tongue upbuilds himself ; but he who prophesies upbuilds the church .
46014005	Now I should like you all to speak with " tongues " ; but I should rather that you prophesied , For he who prophesies is greater than he who speaks with tongues , unless he interprets , so that the church may be built up .
46014006	Now brothers , if I should come to you speaking with tongues , what should I benefit you , unless I speak to you some revelation , or knowledge , or prophecy , or teaching ?
46014007	For if lifeless instruments such as the flute or the harp give no distinction in the sounds , how shall it be known what is fluted or harped ?
46014008	Or , for example , if the trumpet give an uncertain sound , what soldier will be prepared for battle ?
46014009	In the same way with you , if you utter unintelligible words with your tongue , how can what you say be understood ? You will be speaking to the winds !
46014010	There are , let us say , so many languages in the world , and none without its meaning .
46014011	If then I do not know the force of expression , I shall seem a barbarian to the one who uses it , and he will seem a barbarian to me .
46014012	So also in your case , since you are ambitious for spiritual gifts , seek to excel in them for the upbuilding of the church .
46014013	So let him who speaks with tongues pray that he may interpret .
46014014	For if I pray in an unknown tongue , my spirit prays , but my mind is barren .
46014015	What then ? I will pray with my spirit , and I will pray also with my mind . I will praise God with my spirit , but I will praise him with my mind , also .
46014016	For if you in your spirit bless God , how shall he who fills the place of the unlearned say the Amen to your thanksgiving , when he does not know what you are talking about ?
46014017	You on the one hand offer a good thanksgiving , but the other is not built up .
46014018	Thank God I speak with tongues more than you all ,
46014019	but in the church I would rather speak five words with my understanding , so as to instruct others , than ten thousand in an unknown tongue .
46014020	Brothers , do not become children in understanding ; be babes in malice , but in understanding become mature men .
46014021	In the Law it is written . With men of other tongues , and by the lips of strangers , will I speak to this people , and even then they will not listen to me , says the Lord .
46014022	So then the gift of tongues is for a sign , not to believers , but to unbelievers ; but prophecy is not for unbelievers , but for those who believe .
46014023	Accordingly , when the whole church assemblies , and everybody is speaking " with tongues , " if there enter men unlearned or unbelieving , will they not say that you are mad ?
46014024	But if all are prophesying when an unlearned or unbelieving man enters , he is convicted in conscience by your speaker , he feels himself judged by all ,
46014025	and the secret depths of his heart are laid open . So he will fall upon his face and worship God , saying , " Of a truth , God is with you . "
46014026	What follows , then , brothers ? Whenever you meet together , each contributes something ; a psalm , a sermon , a revelation , a tongue , an interpretation . Let all be done for edification .
46014027	If any one speaks in an unknown tongue , let it be by two , or at the most by three , and that in turn , and let some one interpret .
46014028	But if there is no one to interpret , let them keep silence in the church , and speak to themselves and to God .
46014029	Let the prophets speak by two or three , and let the others exercise their judgment .
46014030	But if to one as he sits there some revelation is made , let the first be silent .
46014031	For you can all prophesy one by one ; so that all may be learning , and all may be encouraged .
46014032	The spirits of prophets are subject to prophets ,
46014033	for God is not a God of confusion , but of peace . This custom prevails in all the churches of the saints .
46014034	" In your congregation " you write , " as in all the churches of the saints , let the women keep silence in the churches , for they are not permitted to speak . On the contrary let them be subordinate , as also says the law .
46014035	And if they want to learn anything , let them ask their own husbands at home , for it is shameful for a women to speak in church . "
46014036	What , was it from you that the word of God went forth , or to you only did it come ?
46014037	If any one thinks himself a prophet or spiritual , let him recognize that what I am now writing you is a command of the Lord .
46014038	But if any one disregard it he will be disregarded .
46014039	So , my brothers , be ambitious for the gift of prophecy , and speak not against the gifts of tongues .
46014040	Let everything be done decently and in order .
46015001	Now I am calling to your remembrance , brothers , the gospel which I preached to you , which you also received , and on which you have taken your stand , The first man is of the earth , earthly ; the second Man is of heaven .
46015002	by which also you are saved , if you are holding fast the message which I preached to you ; unless indeed you have believed in vain .
46015003	For the very first thing I taught you was that I had myself been taught , that Christ died for our sins according to the Scripture ,
46015004	that he was buried , and that he was raised the third day , according to the Scriptures ,
46015005	and was seen by Cephas , and then by the Twelve .
46015006	Afterward he was seen at one time by more than five hundred brethren , most of whom are still alive , but some are fallen asleep .
46015007	Then he was seen by James , then by all the apostles ,
46015008	and last of all , as by one born out of due time , he was seen by me also .
46015009	For I am the least of the apostles , I who am not worthy to be called an apostle , because I persecuted the church of God .
46015010	But by the grace of God I am what I am , and that grace of his , bestowed upon me , did not prove ineffectual . I labored more abundantly than all the rest , yet not I , but by the grace of God that is with me .
46015011	But whether it is I or they , thus do I preach , and thus you came to believe .
46015012	If then , we are preaching Christ , that he rose from the dead , how are some of you saying that there is no resurrection from the dead ?
46015013	But if there is no resurrection from the dead , then not even Christ has been raised ;
46015014	and if Christ has not been raised , then our preaching is vain , and vain also is your faith .
46015015	More than that , we are detected in bearing false witness against God ; because we testified of God that he raised Christ from the dead , whom he did not raise , if indeed the dead rise not .
46015016	For if the dead rise not , neither has Christ arisen ;
46015017	and if Christ be not risen , your faith is vain , you are still in your sins .
46015018	More than that , those who are sleeping in Christ have perished .
46015019	If in this life only we have hope in Christ , we are of all mankind most pitiable .
46015020	But now , now , Christ is risen from the dead , the first-fruit of those who have fallen asleep .
46015021	For since by man came to death , by man came also the resurrection from the dead .
46015022	For just as in Adam all die , so also in Christ all will be made alive .
46015023	But each in his own order ; Christ the first-fruits , then those who belong to Christ at his appearing .
46015024	And then the end , when he shall hand over his kingdom to God his Father , after he has abolished all rule and authority and power .
46015025	For he must rule until he has put all his enemies under his feet .
46015026	The last enemy that will be destroyed is Death .
46015027	For He hast put all things under his feet , but in that quotation All things are put under him , it is evident that God is excepted , who put all things under Him .
46015028	For when everything is subjected to him , then the Son himself shall subject himself to Him who made them subject , that God may be all in all .
46015029	Else what shall they do who are baptized for the dead ? If the dead are really not raised , why are they baptized for them ?
46015030	Yes , and why am I myself exposed to danger every hour ?
46015031	Every day I am facing death , my brothers , I affirm it by that pride in you which I have through Christ Jesus our Lord .
46015032	If after the manner of men I have fought with wild beasts at Ephesus , what good does it do me ? If the dead do not rise , Let us eat and drink , For we shall be dead tomorrow .
46015033	Do not deceive yourselves . Evil companions ruin good morals .
46015034	Wake up , do justly , cease from sin ; for I say to your shame that some of you have no acquaintance with God .
46015035	But some one will ask . " How are the dead raised ? and with what body are they coming ? "
46015036	Foolish man ! The seed you sow does not come to life unless it dies .
46015037	And when you sow the seed you are not sowing the body that it will become , but bare grain , of wheat perhaps , or some other grain .
46015038	But God gives it what body he pleases , and to each kind of seed its own body .
46015039	All flesh is not the same flesh ; there is human flesh , another of fishes of animals , another of birds , another of fishes .
46015040	There are both celestial bodies and bodies terrestrial ; but the splendor of the celestial is one thing , and the splendor of the terrestrial is another .
46015041	There is one glory of the sun , another of the moon , and another of the stars ; for star differs from star in glory .
46015042	So it is in the resurrection of the dead . It is sown in corruption , It is raised in incorruption ;
46015043	Sown in weakness , It is raised in power ;
46015044	The body sown is animal The body is raised is spiritual . If there is an animal body , there is also a spiritual body .
46015045	Thus it is written . The first man , Adam , became a living being , the last Adam , a life-giving Spirit .
46015046	Now it is not the spiritual which is first , but the animal , and then the spiritual .
46015048	Like him who was of earth , are the earthy ; and like Him who is of heaven , are the heavenly ;
46015049	As we have borne the likeness of him who was of earth , so also let us bear the likeness of Him who is of heaven .
46015050	I tell you this , brothers , that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God ; nor can corruption inherit incorruption .
46015051	Lo , I tell you a secret truth . we shall not all be sleeping , but we shall be changed ,
46015052	in a moment , in the twinkling of an eye , when the last trumpet sounds . For the trumpet will sound , and the dead will be raised , incorruptible , and we shall be changed .
46015053	For this corruptible must be clothed with incorruption , and this mortal must be clothed with immortality .
46015054	And when this mortal has been clothed with immortality , then will the words of Scripture come to pass , Death has been swallowed up in victory .
46015055	Where , Death , is thy victory ? Where , Death , is thy sting ?
46015056	Now the sting of death is sin , and the power of sin is the Law .
46015057	But thanks be to God , who has given us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ .
46015058	So , my brothers beloved , stand firm , immovable , always abounding in work for the Lord , because you know that your toil is not fruitless in the Lord .
46016001	Now concerning the offering for the saints , you also are to do as I directed the church of Galatia .
46016002	On the first day of each week let each of you put aside something , keeping it in store as he may prosper , so that when I come there may be no collections going on .
46016003	On my arrival I will send those whom you may accredit by letter to carry your bounty to Jerusalem .
46016004	And if it is worth while for me to go too , they will accompany me .
46016005	Now I shall come to you after I have gone through Macedonia .
46016006	I shall remain some time with you ; possibly spending the winter , in order that you may help me forward in whatever journey I take .
46016007	For I do not wish at this present time to see you merely in passing ; but if the Lord permits , I hope to remain some time with you .
46016008	I am staying for the present in Ephesus , until Pentecost ;
46016009	for a door has opened to me , great and effectual , and the opponents are many .
46016010	If Timothy come , see to it that he is among you without trepidation ; for he is doing the Lords work , as I am , so let no one disparage him .
46016011	Whenever he comes to me , send him on his way in peace , for I am expecting him with the other brothers .
46016012	As for our Apollos , I have many times urged him to go to you with the others , but he was always unwilling to go to you at this time . He will come , however , whenever he has a good opportunity .
46016013	Be watchful , stand firm in the faith , be manly , be strong .
46016014	Let all that you do be done in love .
46016015	I beg you this , my brothers - you know the household of Stephanus , that they were the first-fruits of Achaia , and that they devoted themselves to the service of the saints -
46016016	so I want you also to show deference to such , and to every fellow worker , and laborer .
46016017	I am glad that Stephanus and Fortunatus and Achaicus have arrived , for they have made up for your absence .
46016018	They refresh my spirit as they do yours . So cultivate the acquaintance of such men .
46016019	The churches of Asia greet you . Aquila and Priscilla ( Prisca ) , with the church that meets in their house , greet you heartily in the Lord .
46016020	All the brothers send greetings . Greet one another with a holy kiss .
46016021	The greeting of me , Paul , with my own hand .
46016022	If any one does not love the Lord , let him be accursed . Our Lord is coming .
46016023	The grace of our Lord Jesus be with you .
46016024	My love be with you all in Christ Jesus .
47001001	To the Church of God which is in Corinth , and to all the saints throughout Greece . from Paul , by Gods will an apostle of Christ , and from brother Timothy .
47001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father in the Lord Jesus Christ .
47001003	Thanks be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of tender mercies and the God of all comfort ,
47001004	who ever comforts me in all my troubles , so that I may be continually able to comfort those who are in any trouble by the comfort with which God is ever comforting me .
47001005	For just as I have more than my share in the sufferings of the Christ , so also through the Christ I have more than my share of comfort .
47001006	If I am afflicted , it is for your comfort and salvation ; and if I am receiving comfort , it is for your comfort - a comfort produced within you by your patient fortitude , under the same sufferings which I also am enduring .
47001007	My hope for you is firm ; for I know that as you are comrades in my sufferings , so also are you comrades in my comfort .
47001008	Now , brothers , I want you to know about the troubles which befell me in Asia ; how I was burdened altogether beyond my strength , so that I renounced all hope even of life itself .
47001009	Indeed , I had in myself , and still have , the sentence of death , in order that I might not rely on myself , but on God who raises the dead to life .
47001010	He delivered me from such a death , and will deliver me . On him I have set my hopes that he will continue to deliver me ,
47001011	while all of you also are helping me by your prayers ; so that from many lips thanksgiving may rise on my behalf for the blessings vouchsafed to me through the intercessions of many .
47001012	For this is my proud boast , the testimony of my conscience , that it was in holiness and with pure motives before God , not in worldly wisdom , but in the grace of God , that I have conducted myself in the world , and above all in my relations with you .
47001013	For I am writing to you nothing different from what you read aloud and very well recognize , and I hope will continue to recognize to the very end ,
47001014	as some indeed did recognize in part at last , that I am your cause of boasting , just as you will be mine on the Day of Jesus our Lord .
47001015	And in this confidence I intended to visit you , before going elsewhere , that you might have a pleasure twice over .
47001016	I intended to go by you into Macedonia , and to come again to you from Macedonia , and by you to be sent forward on my way to Judea .
47001017	In purposing this did I display " caprice " ? Or what I purpose do I purpose in a worldly way , so that it may mean either " Yes , yes , " or " No , no " ?
47001018	As God is faithful , my message to you is not now " Yes , " now " No . "
47001019	For Jesus Christ , Son of God , who was proclaimed among you by us , that is , by Silvanus and Timothy and me , was not wavering between " Yes " and " No , " but in him is the everlasting " Yes . "
47001020	For however many are the promises of God , in him they are " Yes . " Therefore also through him let the Amen be said by our voices to the glory of God .
47001021	And he who has established me with you in the Anointed One , and has anointed me , is God .
47001022	He has also set his seal upon me , and given me the pledge of his Spirit in my heart .
47001023	But for my part I call God to witness , as my soul shall answer for it , that it was to spare you that I came not to Corinth
47001024	( not that I am attempting to lord it over your faith , but rather to work with you for your happiness ) ; for your faith is stedfast .
47002001	I decided that I would not visit you again in grief ;
47002002	for if I cause you grief , who is there to cause me joy except those whom I have grieved ?
47002003	And for this very reason I wrote you , that I might not come only to be grieved by those who ought to give me joy ; and because I trusted in you all , that my joy is the joy of all of you .
47002004	For I wrote to you out of much affliction and anguish of heart , through many tears ; not to pain you , but to convince you of my love , my abundant love for you .
47002005	As to him who has been , and now is , causing pain , it is not I whom he has pained , but all of you - at least some of you ( not to overstate the case ) .
47002006	Sufficient for the offender is the punishment imposed by the majority ;
47002007	so that now you ought rather to forgive and comfort him , lest he should be overwhelmed by the excess of his grief .
47002008	So I beg you to reinstate him in your love .
47002009	For this very purpose also I wrote you ( before ) , that I might test you , to see if you were obedient in every respect .
47002010	If you forgive the man , I forgive him , too ; for whatever I have forgiven has been forgiven in the presence of Christ ,
47002011	for your sakes , that I may not be overreached by Satan , for I am not ignorant of his devices .
47002012	Now when I came to Troas to preach the gospel of Christ , although a door was opened to me in the Lord ,
47002013	I could get no peace of mind because I failed to find Titus , my brother . So I bade them good-bye and started off for Macedonia .
47002014	But thanks be to God , who in every place is leading me in the train of Christs triumph , and is making manifest through me the knowledge of him , an odor of incense everywhere .
47002015	I am Christs fragrance upwafted unto God , among those who are being saved and those who are perishing ;
47002016	to these latter an odor of death to death , to the former , of life to life . For such service as this , who is sufficient ?
47002017	I am ; for I am not like most , trafficking in the word of God , but rather from a sincere heart , like a man of God , I speak in Christ , in the very presence of God .
47003001	Am I beginning again to " recommend " myself ? Or do I need , as some do , letters of commendation either to you or from you ?
47003002	You are my letter , written on my heart , known and read by all men .
47003003	Since all can see that you are a letter of Christ transcribed by men , written not with ink , but with the Spirit of the living God , not on tablets of stone , but on human hearts as tablets .
47003004	Such confidence I have through Christ before God .
47003005	Not that I am sufficient in myself to reach any conclusion in my own wisdom ; but my sufficiency is from God .
47003006	It is he who has also made me sufficient as a minister of a new covenant ; not of a letter but of a spirit ; for the letter kills , but the spirit makes alive .
47003007	If , however , the administration of death , written with letters and engraved on stones , began in glory , so that the children of Israel could not gaze steadily on the face of Moses , because of the glory of his face - a glory even then fading -
47003008	how much more shall the ministry of the Spirit abide in glory ?
47003009	For if the ministry of condemnation had glory , far more is the ministry of righteousness radiant in glory .
47003010	Indeed that which once was glorious has lost its glory , because of the glory which surpasses it .
47003011	For if that which was fading came in glory , far more will that which ever abides be glorious .
47003012	Therefore , cherishing such a hope , I use great freedom of speech .
47003013	I do not do as Moses did , who used to cover his face with a veil to keep the children of Israel from beholding the passing of a fading glory .
47003014	Nay , their minds were made dull ; for to this very day , at the public reading of the Old Testament , the same veil rests thereon , because it is not revealed to them that in Christ the veil is taken away .
47003015	Yes , to this very day , whenever Moses is read , a veil lies on their hearts ;
47003016	but when their heart turns to our Lord the veil is stripped away .
47003017	( The Lord means the Spirit , and where the Spirit of the Lord abides there is freedom . )
47003018	And we all , with unveiled faces , reflecting like a mirror the glory of the Lord , are ourselves continually being transformed into the same likeness , from glory to glory , as by the Lord , the Spirit .
47004001	So then , as I have this ministry because of Gods mercy to me , I do not lose heart .
47004002	I have renounced the hidden things of shame , not spending my life in craftiness , nor adulterating the word of God ; but setting forth the truth openly , I strive to commend myself to every mans conscience as in the sight of God .
47004003	But even if my gospel , too , is " veiled , " it is among those who are on the way to perish that it is " veiled . "
47004004	Among them the god of this age has blinded the understanding of the unbelieving so that the sunshine of the gospel of God , should not dawn upon them .
47004005	It is not myself that I proclaim , but Christ Jesus as Master , and myself that I proclaim , and myself your slave for Jesus sake .
47004006	For God who said , " Out of darkness light shall shine , " is he who has shone in my heart , that the sunrise of the knowledge of God may shine forth in the face of Christ .
47004007	But I hold this treasure in an earthen vessel , in order that the surpassing greatness of the power may be from God , and not from myself .
47004008	On every side I am hard pressed , yet not hemmed in ; perplexed , but not in despair ;
47004009	persecuted , but not forsaken ; struck down , but not destroyed .
47004010	Wherever I go , I am always carrying about in my body the dying of Jesus , in order that the life also of Jesus may be made manifest in this body of mine .
47004011	For , alive though I am , I am always given over to death for the sake of Jesus , that the life also of Jesus may shine forth in my dying flesh .
47004012	So while death is working in me , life is working in you .
47004013	But having the same spirit of faith of which it is written , I believed , and therefore have spoken , I also believe and so I speak .
47004014	For I know that He who raised from the dead the Lord Jesus , will raise me also with Jesus , and set me at your side in his presence .
47004015	For everything is for your sakes , so that more abundant grace , because of the thanksgiving of many voices , might overflow to the glory of God .
47004016	For this reason , as I have said , I do not lose courage , but even though my outward man is wasting away , my inward man is being renewed , day by day .
47004017	For my light affliction , which is but for a moment , is working out for me a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory ,
47004018	while I am gazing not at things seen , but at things unseen ; for things seen are temporal , but things unseen are eternal .
47005001	For I know , if this earthly tent of mine were struck , I have a mansion built by God , a house not made with hands , eternal in the heavens .
47005002	For in this tent I am groaning , earnestly longing to be under the cover of my heavenly habitation ; if so be that being so covered ,
47005003	I shall not be found naked .
47005004	For in this tent of mine I am groaning in deep trouble ; not that I wish to be unclothed , but to be clothed upon , that what is mortal may be swallowed up in life .
47005005	And He who has wrought me out for this very end is God , who has given me his Spirit as pledge .
47005006	Therefore I am always of good courage , because I well know that while I am at home in the body , I am in banishment from the Lord ,
47005007	for I am walking by faith , not by sight .
47005008	So I have good courage , and am well pleased rather , to be in banishment from the body and to be at home with the Lord .
47005009	And for this reason I also make it home with the Lord .
47005010	For we must all be made manifest , in our true characters , before the Judgment-seat of Christ ; so that each one may receive according to that which he has done in his body , whether good or evil .
47005011	So , because I know the fear of God , I " persuade men . " What I am is manifest to God , and I hope manifest also to your conscience .
47005012	I am not " commending myself to you again , " but I am giving you an occasion of boasting on my behalf , so that you may have an answer ready for those who boast in externals , and not in the heart .
47005013	For if I was " beside myself , " it was to God ; of if I am now " of sound mind , " it is for you .
47005014	For the love of Christ overmasters me ; because I thus judge that if One has died for all , then all have died ;
47005015	and that he died for all in order that the living may live no longer for themselves , but for Him who died and rose again for them .
47005016	Therefore henceforth I know no one simply as a man - even if I have known Christ as a man , yet now I do so no longer .
47005017	So there is a new creation when any man is in Christ . The old life has passed away , behold , the new is come .
47005018	And all this is from God , who through Christ reconciled me to himself , and gave me the ministry of reconciliation ;
47005019	how that God was in Christ reconciling a world to himself , not reckoning to men their trespasses ; and that to me he has entrusted the message of that reconciliation .
47005020	On Christs behalf , then , I come as ambassador . It is as though God was entreating you , through me , on Christs behalf I beg you to be reconciled to God .
47005021	Him who knew no sin , in our behalf he has made to be sin ; so that in him we might become the righteousness of God .
47006001	As a worker with him I beseech you not to receive the grace of God in vain .
47006002	For he said . In an acceptable time have I heard thee , And in the day of salvation have I succored thee . Behold , now is the acceptable time ! behold , now is the day of salvation !
47006003	I am giving no one a cause of stumbling in order that my ministry may not be discredited ;
47006004	but in every way I am striving to commend myself as Gods minister by stedfast endurance , by afflictions , by troubles , by distresses ,
47006005	by floggings , by imprisonment ; in riots , in labors , in sleepless watching , in hunger and thirst ;
47006006	with purity , understanding , patience , and kindness ; by the Holy Spirit , by love sincere ,
47006007	by a true teaching and an energy divine ; by the weapons of righteousness , for attack or for defense ,
47006008	amid honor or dishonor , amid evil report and good report ; as a deceiver and yet true ;
47006009	as unknown and yet well known ; as at deaths door , yet , strange to tell , I live on ; as chastened , but not killed ;
47006010	as grieved , but always glad ; as poor , but making many rich ; as having nothing , yet possessing everything .
47006011	O Corinthians , I am unsealing my lips to you ; my heart is wide open to you .
47006012	There is no narrowness in my love ; but the narrowness is in your own .
47006013	I pray you , therefore , in fair exchange ( I speak as to my children ) , let your hearts also be wide open to me .
47006014	Be not unequally yoked with unbelievers ; for what fellowship has righteousness with lawlessness ? what communion has light with darkness ?
47006015	What concord has Christ with Belial ? What portion has a believer with an unbeliever ?
47006016	And what compact has Gods temple with idols ? For we are a temple of the living God , as he has said . I will dwell among them , and walk about among them ; I will be their God , and they will be my people .
47006017	Therefore , Come out from among them and separate yourselves , saith the Lord , touch not what is unclean ;
47006018	then I will receive you and will be to you a Father , and you shall be to me sons and daughters , saith the Lord Almighty .
47007001	As these promises are ours , beloved , let us cleanse ourselves from every defilement of body and of spirit , and perfect our holiness in the fear of God .
47007002	Make room for me in your hearts ! I have wronged no man , I have ruined no man , I have defrauded no man .
47007003	I am not saying this to blame you , for as I have already said , I hold you in my heart to live together and to die together .
47007004	Great is my faith in you ; great is my cheerful assurance in you . I am filled with comfort ; in spite of all my troubles , my heart is overflowing with joy .
47007005	For even after I reached Macedonia , my flesh had no rest , but I was troubled on every hand . Without were fights ; within were , fears .
47007006	But the God who comforts the down-hearted comforted me by the coming of Titus ,
47007007	and not alone by his coming , but also by the comfort you had been to him . For he told me of your eager longing , of your penitence , and of your zeal on my behalf , so that I was happier still .
47007008	Even if I caused you pain by my letter , I do not regret ; though I did regret it when I saw that my letter had caused you pain , even for a time .
47007009	But now I am glad ; not because you were pained ; but because your pain led you to repentance .
47007010	For your pain came from God , and so you took no harm from me . For the pain which is from God works repentance leading to salvation , a repentance never to be regretted . But the worlds pain works death .
47007011	Note the results of this pain which God permitted ; what earnestness it has called forth in you , what explanations , what indignation , what alarm , what longing , what fervor , what punishment of wrong . In every way you have proved yourselves innocent in the matter .
47007012	So then , even if I did write to you , it was not for the sake of the wrong-doer , or of him who had been wronged , but to make clear to yourselves in the sight of God your earnest care for me .
47007013	This is what comforts me . In addition to this comfort of mine , I have been made still happier by the happiness of Titus ; because his spirit was refreshed by you all .
47007014	Although I have been boasting a little to him about you , I have not been put to shame . But as in every matter I have spoken the truth to you , so also my boast to Titus has been proved to be the truth .
47007015	And his tender affection is all the greater toward you , when he calls to mind the obedience of you all , and the fear and trembling with which you received him .
47007016	I rejoice that I have complete confidence in you .
47008001	Now , brothers , I wish to tell you about the grace of God which has been manifest in the churches of Macedonia .
47008002	For although in heavy trial of affliction , their overbrimming happiness , even in spite of their deep poverty , abounded to the opulence of their unselfishness .
47008003	For I can testify that according to their ability , and even beyond their ability , of their own free will , too , they have given help .
47008004	With earnest entreaty they craved of me the privilege of a share in ministering to the saints in Jerusalem .
47008005	And this not as I had expected , but in accordance with the will of God , they first gave themselves to God and to me .
47008006	With the result that I have been begging Titus that , as he had been the one to begin the work with you , so he should complete among you this grace also .
47008007	Now then , as you excel in everything , in faith and utterance and knowledge and all zeal and in your love to me , see to it that you excel in this grace also .
47008008	I do not say this by way of command , but by the zeal of others I am trying to prove the reality of your love .
47008009	For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ , how though he was rich , for your sakes he became poor , that you through his poverty might become rich .
47008010	And I will give you my opinion in this matter ; for this offering is fitting in your case , considering that you made a beginning before others , not only in the willingness to do something but also in actually doing something a year ago .
47008011	So now complete the doing of it also , in order that just as there was the readiness to will , so there may be the accomplishment according to your means .
47008012	For if there be first willing mind , the gift is accepted according to what a man has , and not according to what he has not .
47008013	Nor are other people to be relieved , and you to be distressed ;
47008014	but burdens are to be equalized . Now your abundance at this present time present time is a supply for their want , in supply for your want ; and so burdens be equalized ,
47008015	even as it is written , He who gathered much had nothing over , and he who gathered little did not lack .
47008016	But thanks be to God who has inspired in the heart of Titus the same zeal on your behalf that I have .
47008017	For he not only consented to my request , but being thoroughly in earnest , comes to you of his own accord .
47008018	And I am sending with him that brother whose fame in the service of the gospel is spread through all the churches .
47008019	More than that , he is the one chosen by the churches to accompany me on my journey , in administering this gift of yours for the Lords glory . And this has my full consent ,
47008020	because I am on my guard in this , that no one should blame me , in respect to this bounty which I am administering .
47008021	For I aim at being above reproach , not only in the sight of the Lord , but also in the sight of men .
47008022	With them I am sending our brother of whose zeal I have often had proof in many ways , and who is now zealous because of his great confidence in you .
47008023	As for Titus , remember that he is a partner of mine , and is also my associate in labors for you . As for the other brothers , remember that they are delegates from the churches , men in whom Christ is glorified .
47008024	So show to the churches an evidence of your love , and a justification to these brothers of my boasting about you .
47009001	It is indeed unnecessary for me to write you in regard to the ministration to the saints at Jerusalem ,
47009002	for I know how ready you are , and am always boasting about you to the Macedonians , telling them that Greece has been ready for a year past ; and your zeal has been a spur to the majority of them .
47009003	Nevertheless I am sending the brothers in order that my boast about you may not prove vain in this instance ; so that , as I kept saying , you may be prepared .
47009004	For if any Macedonians come with me and find you not ready , shame would come upon me ( not to speak of you ) in respect to this confidence .
47009005	So I have thought that I must ask these brothers to visit you beforehand , and get your promised contribution ready in advance . I want it to be given of your bounty , not extorted from your covetousness .
47009006	Mark this ; he who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly ; and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully .
47009007	But let each give according to the purpose of his heart ; not grudgingly of under compulsion . It is a cheerful giver that God loves .
47009008	And God is able to give you an overflowing measure of every grace , so that all your wants of every kind may be supplied at all times , and you may give of your abundance to every good work ;
47009009	As it is written . He scattered broadcast , he gave to the poor ; His almsgiving continues forever .
47009010	He who ever supplies seed to the sower , and bread for the food of man , will supply and make plentous your seed , and increase the harvest springing up from your almsgiving .
47009011	You yourselves will be enriched with all good things , that you may give ungrudgingly ; and your gifts , of which I am the agent , will make men give thanks to God .
47009012	Because the ministry of this contribution not only supplies the needs of the saints , but also overflows in many a thanksgiving to God .
47009013	For this ministration proves you . On account of it men glorify God for your faithfulness to your professions of the gospel of Christ , and for the liberality of your gifts to them and to all .
47009014	Moreover , in their prayers for you they will be longing after you , because of the exceeding grace of God that is resting upon you .
47009015	THANKS BE TO GOD FOR HIS UNSPEAKABLE GIFT !
47010001	Now I Paul , myself , appeal to you by the humble-heartedness and selflessness of Christ - Paul who " in your presence is humble , but bold enough when he is absent " -
47010002	I beseech you , and I say , do not make me show my boldness , when I come in the boldness with which I think I shall show my courage against some who think that I am walking on the low level of the flesh .
47010003	Though I do walk on the low level of the flesh , I do not make war as the flesh does ;
47010004	for the weapons of my warfare are not weapons of the flesh , but mighty for God , in pulling down all fortresses .
47010005	For I pull down imaginations and every crag that lifts itself against the knowledge of God . And I carry every thought away into captivity and subjection to Christ ;
47010006	and I am fully prepared to punish every act of disobedience , when once your submission has been put beyond question .
47010007	Look these facts in the face . If any man is fully persuaded as regards himself that he belongs to Christ , let him consider again with himself , that just as he is Christs , so also am I .
47010008	If , however , I were to boast more loudly concerning the authority which the Lord gave me ( not to cast you down , but to build you up ) , I should have no cause for shame .
47010009	Let it not seem as if I were overawing you with my letters .
47010010	" His letters indeed , " says one , " are mighty and forcible , but his personality is weak , and his speech contemptible . "
47010011	Let such a man assure himself that my actions , when I am present , will be just like my words in my letters when I am absent .
47010012	I have not indeed the audacity to class myself among , or compare myself with , certain of the self-commenders ; yet they are not wise in measuring themselves by one another and in comparing themselves with one another .
47010013	I , however , will not indulge in undue boasting , but will confine it within the limits of the sphere to which God has assigned me - a sphere which reaches even to you .
47010014	For I am not overstepping the limits of my authority , as though I reached you not ; since I have already come even as far as Corinth to proclaim the gospel of Christ .
47010015	I am not " boasting beyond measure in the labors of others , " but it is my hope that , as your faith goes on increasing among yourselves , by the enlargement of my appointed limits ,
47010016	I may carry the gospel to countries beyond you ; and not be boasting of work made ready to my hand within another mans limit .
47010017	Meanwhile . Let him who boasts , boast in the Lord .
47010018	For a man is proved worthy , not by his self-commendation , but when he is commended by the Lord .
47011001	Would that you could put up with a little " folly " from me ! Nay , do bear with me .
47011002	I have a divine jealousy on your behalf ; for I betrothed you to one only husband , even to Christ , that I might present you to him , a chaste virgin .
47011003	But I fear lest , just as the serpent beguiled Eve in his craftiness , so your minds should be seduced from your single-mindedness and purity toward Christ .
47011004	If indeed some one is coming to preach another Jesus , whom I did not preach , or you are receiving a Spirit other than you once received , or another gospel which you did not accept before , you would do well to bear with me .
47011005	For I reckon that I am in no respect behind your superapostolic apostles .
47011006	Yes , though I be unskilled in speech , at least I am not in knowledge ; indeed I made this perfectly plain to you in all things and among all men .
47011007	Is it a sin , forsooth , that I humbled myself that you might be exalted , in preaching the gospel to you free of cost ?
47011008	Other churches I spoiled , and took their wages to do you service .
47011009	Even when I lacked the actual necessities of life while I was with you , I was a burden to no one ; for whatever I lacked , the brothers from Macedonia supplied , when they came . So I kept myself from being a burden to you in any way , and will continue to do so .
47011010	As the truth of Christ is in me , this boasting of mine shall not be stopped within the boundaries of Greece !
47011011	And why ? Because I love you not ? God knows I do .
47011012	I am doing and will continue to do this in order to cut away the ground from under those who wish some cause for slander ; and that the ground of their boasting may appear as does mine .
47011013	For such fellows are sham apostles of Christ .
47011014	No wonder ! for Satan himself disguises himself as an angel of light .
47011015	It is no great marvel , then , if his ministers also disguise themselves as ministers of righteousness . Their end will be according to their works .
47011016	I say again , let no one think me a fool . Or , if you must , at least bear with me as a fool , that I , too , may do a little boasting .
47011017	What I am about to say I am not speaking by the Lords command , but as it were in pure folly , in this boldness of boasting .
47011018	Since so many are making worldly boasts , I shall boast , too !
47011019	Although you are wise , you put up with fools willingly enough !
47011020	You put up with it , though they make slaves of you , live on you , seize your property , lord it over you , even strike you in the face , in the way of degradation !
47011021	I say that I was weak , and yet for whatever reason any one is bold ( I speak in mere folly ) I too am bold .
47011022	Are they Hebrews ? So am I . Are they descendants of Israel ? So am I . Are they descendants of Abraham ? So am I .
47011023	Are they ministers of Christ ? ( I speak as though I were beside myself ) , such , far , more , am I ; in labors more abundant , in imprisonments also more abundant , in floggings beyond measure , in deaths often .
47011024	Five times at the hands of the Jews , I have received one short of forty lashes .
47011025	Three times I have been scourged by the Romans ; once I have been stoned ; three times have I been shipwrecked ; a night and a day have I been adrift in the open sea .
47011026	My journeys have been many ; in perils of rivers , in perils of bandits ; in perils from my countrymen , in perils in the city , in perils in the wilderness ; in perils on the sea , in perils among false brothers ;
47011027	in toil and weariness , often in sleepless watching , in hunger and thirst , often without anything to eat ; in cold and in nakedness .
47011028	Not to mention other things , there is the crowding pressure of each day upon me , the care of all the churches .
47011029	Who is weak , and I am not weak ? Who is caused to stumble , but I burn with indignation ?
47011030	If boast I must , it shall be concerning my weakness .
47011031	The God and Father of the Lord Jesus , he who is blessed forever , knows that I am telling the truth .
47011032	In Damascus , the governor under Aretas the King , kept guard over the city of the Damascus , to arrest me ;
47011033	but through an opening in the wall I was let down in a basket , and so escaped and out of his hands .
47012001	I am forced to boast , though it is unprofitable , but I will go on to visions and revelations of the Lord . I urged Titus to go , and with him I sent our brother . Did Titus make gain of you ? And did I not walk in the same spirit as he did ? Did I not take the very same steps ?
47012002	I know a Christian man who , fourteen years ago ( whether in the body I know not , or out of the body , I know not . God knows ) , was caught up - - this man of whom I speak - even into the third heaven .
47012003	And I know such a man ( whether in the body or apart from the body I know not , God knows ) ,
47012004	who was caught up into Paradise , and heard unutterable words which no human being is permitted to utter .
47012005	Of such a one I will boast ; but on my own behalf I will not boast except in my weaknesses .
47012006	If I should choose to continue boasting I should not be foolish , for I should be speaking the truth . But I refrain , lest by the stupendous grandeur of the revelation any one should estimate me beyond what he sees in me , or hears from me .
47012007	It was for this reason , lest I should be over-elated , that there was given me a thorn in the flesh , a messenger of Satan , to buffet me , lest I should be over-elated .
47012008	Concerning this , three times over I supplicated the Lord that it might leave me ;
47012009	but he has answered me . " My grace is sufficient for you ; it is in weakness that my power is perfected . "
47012010	Most gladly therefore will I boast rather of my weakness , that over me like a tent may be pitched the power of Christ . That is why I rejoice in weakness , in ill-treatment , in troubles , in persecutions and calamities for Christs sake . For when I am weak , then am I strong .
47012011	I am become a fool - you have forced me to ; for you yourselves ought to have been my vindicators . In no respect am I inferior to these superapostolic apostles , even though I am nothing .
47012012	In truth the signs of the true apostle were wrought among you in all patience by signs and marvels and powers .
47012013	In what respect , then , were you inferior to the other churches , except that I myself was not a burden to you ? Forgive me this wrong !
47012014	And now for the third time I am preparing to visit you . I will not be a burden to you , for I am not seeking yours , but you . For the children ought not to lay up for the parents , but the parents for the children .
47012015	For my part , I will most gladly spend , yea , and will myself be spent , for your souls . If I love you more abundantly , am I to be loved the less ?
47012016	But though it be granted that I was not a burden to you , yet , you say , this was my cunning with which I caught you by a trick .
47012017	Did I make gain of you through any of those whom I sent to you ?
47012019	Do you think that all this time I am defending myself to you ? It is before the presence of God that I am speaking in Christ ; and all , beloved , for your upbuilding .
47012020	For I dread that perhaps , when I come , I may not find you to be such as I wish , and that I may be found by you such as you do not wish ; I dread lest there should be quarrels , jealousy , tempers , party spirit , slandering , gossip , arrogance , tumults ;
47012021	and lest when I come again my God may humble me before you , and lest I shall mourn for many those who have sinned before , and have not repented of the impurity and immorality and wantonness which they have practised .
47013001	This will be my third visit to you . Out of the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be confirmed .
47013002	I have said formerly , and I now forewarn you as when I was present the second time , so now when I am absent the second time , so now when I am absent , saying to those who had sinned before , and to all the rest , " If I come again , I will not spare , "
47013003	Since you want a proof of Christ who is speaking in me , he who is not feeble toward you , but powerful among you .
47013004	For though he was crucified through weakness , yet he now lives through the power of God . I also am weak , sharing in his weakness , but I shall live with him by the power of God .
47013005	Examine yourselves to see if you are in the faith ; put your own selves to the proof . Or do you not know , your own selves , that Jesus Christ is in you , unless indeed you fail to abide the proof ?
47013006	But I hope you will find that I abide the proof .
47013007	And my prayer to God is that you may do no evil ; not in order that I may appear approved , but that you may do what is noble , though I should seem unable to abide the proof .
47013008	For I have no power against the truth , but only in defense of the truth .
47013009	For I am always glad whenever I am weak , but you are strong . For this also I am praying , for your perfect reformation .
47013010	For this reason I am writing thus while absent , so that when I come , I may not have to deal sharply , according to the authority which the Lord gave me for building up , and not for pulling down .
47013011	Finally , brothers , farewell . Aim at perfection , take courage , be of one mind , live in peace ; so shall the God of love and peace be with you .
47013012	Salute one another with a holy kiss .
47013013	All the saints salute you .
47013014	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ , and the love of God , and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all .
48001001	Paul , an apostle sent not from men nor by any man , but by Jesus Christ and by God the Father who raised him from the dead ;
48001002	with all the brothers who are with me . To the churches of Galatia greeting .
48001003	Grace be to you , and peace from God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ ,
48001004	who gave himself for our sins , that he might deliver us from this present evil age in accordance with the will of our God and Father ,
48001005	to whom be glory forever and ever . Amen .
48001006	I am amazed that you are so soon shifting your ground , and deserting him who called you by the grace of Christ ,
48001007	for another gospel , which indeed is not another ; only there are certain individuals who are troubling you , and desiring to pervert the gospel of Christ .
48001008	But even though I myself or an angel from heaven were to preach any gospel other than that which I did preach to you , let him be accursed .
48001009	I have said it before , and I now repeat it , if any one is preaching a gospel to you other than that which you have received , let him be accursed .
48001010	Think you that I am now trying to conciliate men or God ? Or am I " seeking to please men " ? If I were still seeking to please men , I should not be a slave of Christ .
48001011	For I would have you know , brothers , that the gospel I preach is not man-made ;
48001012	for neither did I myself receive it from man , nor by man was I taught it , but by a revelation an apocalypse of Jesus Christ .
48001013	For you have heard of my former conduct in Judaism , how furiously I used to persecute the church of God , and how I kept seeking to root it out ;
48001014	and how in my zeal for Judaism I outstripped many of my own age and nation , in my special zeal for the traditions of my forefathers .
48001015	But when God who had set me apart from my very birth ,
48001016	and had called me by his grace , was pleased to reveal his Son in me , so that I might preach his gospel among the Gentiles , without consulting a human being ,
48001017	or even going up to Jerusalem to see those who had been apostles before me , I went off at once to Arabia , and on my return came back to Damascus .
48001018	Then three years later I went up to Jerusalem to get acquainted with Peter , and spent two weeks with him .
48001019	I saw no other apostle except James , the Lords brother .
48001020	( In what I am now writing , I call God to witness that I am telling the truth . )
48001021	Then I went into the districts of Syria and Cilicia .
48001022	But to the churches of Christ in Judea I was personally unknown ;
48001023	only they used to hear it said , " He who was once persecuting us is now preaching the gospel of the very faith which he once tried to ruin . "
48001024	And they were giving glory to God on my account .
48002001	Fourteen years later I went up to Jerusalem again , with Barnabas , and took Titus also with me
48002002	( I went up at that time in obedience to a revelation ) . And I laid before them the gospel which I am wont to preach among the Gentiles . I did this privately before those in authority , lest by any means I should be running , or should already have run , in vain .
48002003	But although Titus , my companion , was a Greek , they did not compel even him to be circumcised .
48002004	Yet there were false brethren who had crept in to spy out the freedom we enjoy in Christ Jesus , in order to enslave us again .
48002005	To them we did not yield submission even for an hour , in order that the truth of the gospel might abide unshaken among you .
48002006	But those in authority - what they once were makes no difference to me ; God is no respecter of persons - those I say who were in authority had no additions to make my message .
48002007	On the contrary , when they saw that I had been entrusted with the gospel for the uncircumcised , just as Peter has with the gospel for the circumcised
48002008	( for he who has equipped Peter for the apostleship to the circumcised , equipped me also for the apostleship to the Gentiles ) ,
48002009	and when they recognized the grace which had been given to me , James and Cephas and John , then thought to be pillars , gave to Barnabas and to me the right hand of fellowship . They agreed that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the Jews .
48002010	They stipulated only that we should remember the poor , which very thing indeed I was quite eager to do .
48002011	But when Cephas came to Antioch I resisted him to his face , because he stood self-condemned .
48002012	For until certain men came from James he used to eat with the Gentile Christians , but when they came , he began to draw back and to separate himself , because he was afraid of the circumcision party .
48002013	And the rest of the Jewish Christians also dissimulated with him , so that even Barnabas was carried away by their hypocrisy .
48002014	But when I saw that they were not walking a straight path , in the presence of the truth of the gospel , I said to Cephas before them all . " If you , although you are a Jew , live like the Gentiles and not like the Jews , why do you try to compel the Gentiles to become Jews ?
48002015	" We are Jews by birth , and not Gentile sinners ;
48002016	" yet because we know that no man is justified by the works of the Law , but by the faith of Jesus Christ , we ourselves also have put our faith in Jesus Christ , that we might be justified by the faith of Christ , and not by the works of the Law ; for " By the works of the Law shall no flesh be justified . "
48002017	But if while seeking to be justified in Christ we ourselves also have been found to be sinners , is Christ then a minister of sin ? Far from it !
48002018	For if I am rebuilding the very things which I destroyed , I am proving myself a transgressor .
48002019	For it is through law I died to law , in order to live to God .
48002020	I have been crucified with Christ , so it is no longer I who am living , but it is Christ who is living in me ; and the life I am now living in the flesh , I am living in faith of the Son of God who loved me and gave himself up for me .
48002021	I do not annul the grace of God ; for if righteousness comes by way of the Law , then indeed Christ died Christ for nothing .
48003001	O foolish Galatians , who has bewitched you ? You , before whose very eyes Jesus Christ was placarded as crucified !
48003002	Answer me this one question . " When you received the Spirit , was it from doing what the Law commands or from believing the message heard ? "
48003003	Are you so without sense ? After beginning with the Spirit , will you now end with the flesh ?
48003004	Did you have such experience to no purpose - if indeed it was really to no purpose ?
48003005	Does he then who supplies you with his Spirit and works miracles among you , do it because you do what the law commands of because you believe the message heard ?
48003006	Even as Abraham believed God and it was counted to him for righteousness ?
48003007	Notice then that the true sons of Abraham are children of faith .
48003008	And the Scripture , anticipating Gods justification of the Gentiles by faith , announced the gospel to Abraham beforehand in the words , In thee shall all the Gentiles be blessed .
48003009	So then they who are children of faith are blessed with Abraham the faithful ;
48003010	but a curse rests on those who have their root in the works of the Law ; for it is written . Cursed is every one that continues not in all the things written in the Book of the Law , to do them .
48003011	And it is manifest that by the Law no man is justified in the sight of God . because The just shall live by faith ,
48003012	and the Law has nothing to do with faith , but declares , The man that has done these things shall live therein .
48003013	Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the Law by becoming a curse for us ( for it is written , Cursed is every one who is hanged upon a tree ) ,
48003014	to the end that in Christ Jesus the blessing of Abraham might come upon the Gentiles , so that through faith we might receive the promised Spirit .
48003015	Let me illustrate , brothers , from every-day life . When once a human testament is made , and formally ratified , no one sets it aside or adds to it .
48003016	Now it was to Abraham that the promises were spoken , and to his offspring . God did not say , " offsprings " as if speaking of many , but " and to your offspring , " as of one ; and this is Christ .
48003017	I mean to say that the testament which God has already ratified could not be annulled by the Law which came four hundred and thirty years later , so as to make the Promise void .
48003018	For if the inheritance comes from law , it no longer comes from a promise ; but God did give it as a free gift to Abraham by a promise .
48003019	To what purpose , then , was the Law ? It was imposed later for the sake of transgressions , until the " Offspring " should come to whom the promise had been made . It was arranged through angels by the hand of a mediator .
48003020	( Now a mediator implies more than one person , but God is only one . )
48003021	Is the Law then opposed to the promises of God ? Certainly not ; for if a law had been given which could make alive , then righteousness would actually have come from law ;
48003022	but the Scripture has shut up the whole world in prison together under sin , in order that the promise due to faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who have faith .
48003023	Before the Faith came we were perpetual prisoners under the Law , in preparation for the destined faith about to be revealed .
48003024	So the Law has been our tutor-slave our pedagogue to lead us to Christ , so that we may be justified by faith ;
48003025	but now that the Faith is come , we are no longer under a tutor-slave .
48003026	You are all sons of God through your faith in Jesus Christ .
48003027	For all of you who were baptized into Christ , have clothed yourselves with Christ .
48003028	In him there is neither Jew nor Greek , there is neither slave nor free , there is no male and female ; for you are all one in Christ Jesus .
48003029	And if you belong to Christ , then you are the descendants of Abraham , heirs according to the promise .
48004001	What I mean is this . As long as the heir is a child , he differs in no respect from a slave , though he be the owner of the whole inheritance ;
48004002	but is under the control of guardians and trustees , until the time appointed by his father .
48004003	So we Jews also , when we were children , were held in bondage under the empty externalities of the world .
48004004	But when the fulness of time was come God sent forth his Son , born of a woman , born under law ,
48004005	to redeem from captivity those under law , in order that we might receive our sonship .
48004006	And because you are sons , God sent forth the spirit of his Son into your hearts , crying , " Dear , dear Father ! "
48004007	So each one of you is no longer a slave , but a son , and if a son , then an heir , too , through Gods grace .
48004008	But once , when you Gentiles had no knowledge of God , you were slaves to gods which have no real being .
48004009	Now , however , when you have come to know God , or rather to be known by God , how is it that you are beginning to turn back to those weak and beggarly externalities , eager to be in bondage to them again ?
48004010	You are scrupulous , are you , in observing " days " and " months " and " seasons " and " years " ?
48004011	I am alarmed about you for fear lest I may have bestowed labor on you to no purpose .
48004012	Brothers , I beseech you , become as I am , because I also have become as you are . You never did me any wrong ;
48004013	on the contrary , you know that although it was illness which brought about my preaching the gospel to you at my first visit ,
48004014	and although my bodily affliction was a trial to you , you did not scoff at it nor spurn me , but welcomed me like an angel of God , like Christ Jesus himself .
48004015	Why then did you account yourselves so happy ? ( For I bear you witness that if you could you would have torn out your own eyes and given them to me . )
48004016	Am I then become your enemy , because I am telling you the truth ?
48004017	These men are courting your favor to no good purpose . They want to isolate you , so that you will be courting their favor .
48004018	It is always an honorable thing to have your favor sought in an honorable cause , always , and not only when I am with you .
48004019	O my little children , of whom I travail again in birth until Christ be formed within you !
48004020	How I wish I could be with you now , that I might change my tone ; for I am perplexed about you .
48004021	Tell me , you who wish to be subject to the Law , why do you not listen to the Law ?
48004022	For it is written that Abraham had two sons , one by the slave woman and one by the free woman ;
48004023	but while the son by the slave woman was born according to the flesh , the son by the free woman was born in fulfilment of a promise .
48004024	Now all this is an allegory , for these women are the two covenants ; one from Mount Sinai , which is Hagar bearing children into bondage
48004025	( for the word Hagar stands for Mt . Sinai in Arabia and represents the present Jerusalem who with her children is in bondage . )
48004026	But the Jerusalem that is above is free , and she is our mother .
48004027	For it is written , Rejoice , O thou barren one who dost never bear , Break forth in joy , thou that dost not travail ; For the children of the desolate woman are many . Yea , more than hers who has a husband .
48004028	But you , brothers , are like Isaac , children of the promise ;
48004029	but just as in old times the son born by the flesh used to persecute the son born by the power of the Spirit , so also it is now .
48004030	But what does the Scripture say ? Send away the slave-woman and her son ; for the slaves son shall not be heir along with the son of the free woman .
48004031	So , brothers , we are the children of no slave woman , but of free woman . For freedom did not Christ set us free ;
48005001	stand firm then , and do not be again entangled in a yoke of bondage .
48005002	Listen to me ! I , Paul , declare to you that if you are to continue to follow the rite of circumcision , Christ will be no profit to you .
48005003	I solemnly testify to every man who submits to circumcision that he obligates himself to keep the whole Law .
48005004	If you are being justified by law , you are cut off from Christ ; you are fallen away from grace .
48005005	But we are not , for we through the Spirit are eagerly waiting by faith for a hope of righteousness ( a hope well founded ) ;
48005006	because in Christ neither circumcision has any value , nor uncircumcision , but faith which works through love .
48005007	You were running your race nobly . Who hindered you from obeying the truth ?
48005008	The influence brought to bear does not come from him who is calling you .
48005009	A little leaven is leavening the whole lump .
48005010	As for me , I am fully trusting you in the Lord that you will be no otherwise minded ; but he who is trying to unsettle you will have to bear his punishment , whoever he may be .
48005011	But I , brothers , if I " still preach circumcision , " why am I still persecuted ? Then surely the stumbling-block of the Cross has ceased to be an obstacle !
48005012	Would to God that those who are trying to unsettle you would even have themselves mutilated .
48005013	For you , brothers , were called for freedom ; only do not make your freedom an excuse for self-indulgence , but in love enslave yourselves to one another .
48005014	For the whole Law has been fulfilled in this one precept , Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself .
48005015	But if you are always biting and devouring one another , take heed lest you be utterly consumed one by another .
48005016	This is my meaning . Let your steps be guided by the Spirit , and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh .
48005017	For the desire of the flesh is against that of the Spirit , and the desire of the Spirit is against that of the flesh , for they two are antagonistic , so that you may not do those things that you wish .
48005018	But if you are habitually led by the Spirit you are not under law .
48005019	Now the works of the flesh are manifest ; such , for instance , as fornication , impurity , indecency ,
48005020	idol-worship , sorcery , quarrels , party-spirit , jealousy , passionate anger , intrigues , factions , sectarianism ,
48005021	envy , drunkenness , revelings , and things like these . I tell you beforehand , as I have already told you , that those who practise such sins shall not inherit the kingdom of God .
48005022	But the harvest-fruit of the Spirit is love , joy , peace , long-suffering , kindness , goodness , fidelity , gentleness , and self-control ;
48005023	against such there is no law .
48005024	And those who belong to Christ have crucified the flesh with its passions and appetites .
48005025	If we are living by the Spirit , let us also keep step in the Spirit .
48005026	Let us not become conceited , provoking one another , envying one another .
48006001	Even if any one should be overtaken in a fault , brothers , you that are spiritual ought , in a gentle spirit , to restore such a one , each one of you looking to himself , lest you too be tempted .
48006002	Ever be bearing one anothers burdens , and so be fulfilling the law of Christ .
48006003	If a man fancies himself to be somebody when he is really nobody he is deceiving himself .
48006004	Let each one test his own work , and he will then have something to be proud of by comparing himself with himself , and not with any one else ;
48006005	for every one must carry his own pack load .
48006006	He , however , who is being taught in the message , should always share with his instructor in all the good things which he possesses .
48006007	Be not deceived . God is not mocked . Whatever a man sows , that will he also reap .
48006008	The man who is sowing to his flesh will of the flesh reap corruption ; but he who is sowing to the Spirit will of the Spirit reap life eternal .
48006009	And let us not be weary in well-doing , for in due season we shall reap if we faint not .
48006010	So then , as we have opportunity , let is do good to all men , but especially to those who are of the household of faith .
48006011	See with what large letters I have written to you in my own handwriting !
48006012	Those who are trying to compel you to be circumcised are such as wish to make a fair show in the flesh , only that they may not suffer persecution for the cross of Christ .
48006013	Even those who are being circumcised , are not themselves keeping the Law , but they want you to be circumcised so that they may glory in your flesh .
48006014	God forbid that I should glory in anything except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ , upon which the world has been crucified to me and I have been crucified to the world .
48006015	For in Jesus Christ neither is circumcision anything , nor uncircumcision , but a new creation .
48006016	On all who will govern their lives by this rule and on the Israel of God may peace and mercy rest .
48006017	From this time forth let no one trouble me , for I bear branded in my body the marks of Jesus , my Master .
48006018	May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit , brothers . Amen .
49001001	Paul , an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God , to the saints who are in Ephesus and to the faithful in Christ Jesus ,
49001002	grace to you and peace from God our father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
49001003	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , who has blessed us in every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms in Christ .
49001004	Even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world to be holy and without blemish in his sight .
49001005	For in his love he predestined us ( such was the good pleasure of his will ) to adoption for himself as sons through Jesus Christ ,
49001006	and to the praise of his glorious grace which he graciously bestowed upon us in the Beloved .
49001007	It is in him we have deliverance , the forgiveness of our trespasses , through his blood ;
49001008	so abundantly did he lavish upon us the riches of his grace in all wisdom and understanding ,
49001009	when he made known to us , I say , that good pleasure which he purposed in himself
