55002015	Strive earnestly to present yourself unto God , tested and proved worthy by trial , a workman unashamed , ever cutting a straight path for the message of the truth .
55002016	but avoid profane babble ; for people will go farther and farther in impiety ,
55002017	and their teaching will spread like a gangrene .
55002018	Among such are Hymenaeus and Philetus , who have gone astray concerning the truth by declaring that the resurrection is already past ; and they are undermining the faith of some .
55002019	Nevertheless Gods firm foundation stands unshaken , bearing this inscription , THE LORD KNOWS THOSE WHO ARE HIS , and this also , LET EVERY ONE WHO NAMES THE NAME OF THE LORD RENOUNCE WICKEDNESS .
55002020	Now in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and silver , but also of wood and clay , some for noble , some for ignoble uses .
55002021	If then a man keeps himself clear of these latter , he will be a vessel for honor , consecrated , useful to the Master , prepared for every good work .
55002022	Flee from the passions of youth , but run after righteousness , faith , love , and peace , in company with those who out of a pure heart call upon the Lord .
55002023	Ever shun foolish and puerile discussions , for you know that they lead to quarrels .
55002024	The Lords slave must not quarrel , but must be kind to all men ; a skilful teacher , patient of wrong .
55002025	He must be gentle when instructing opponents ; for possibly God may give them a change of mind for the recognition of the truth ,
55002026	and they may come to their senses again , and escape the snare of the devil , as they are restored to life by God to do his will .
55003001	But of this be sure . In the last days grievous times will come .
55003002	For men will be selfish , mercenary , boastful , haughty , blasphemous , disobedient to parents , ungrateful , irreligious ,
55003003	without natural affection , merciless , slanderous , dissolute , and brutal .
55003004	They will hate goodness , they will be treacherous , reckless , blinded with pride , lovers of pleasure , rather than lovers of God .
55003005	For although they keep up the outward form of religion , they deny its power .
55003006	Turn away from all such . Some of them creep into private houses and lead captive silly women who , laden with sins ,
55003007	and led captive by ever-changing impulses , are always learning but never able to arrive at knowledge of truth .
55003008	As Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses , so also do these men withstand the truth ; being corrupt in mind and worthless in all that concerns the faith .
55003009	But they will not get on ; for their folly will be made as openly manifest to all as was that of Jannes and Jambres .
55003010	But you , Timothy , have followed my teaching , my conduct , my aims , my faith , patience , love , endurance ,
55003011	as well as the persecutions and sufferings which befell me at Antioch , Iconium , and Lystra . You know all the persecutions I endured , and how the Lord delivered me out of them all !
55003012	Yes , and all who purpose to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted .
55003013	But wicked men and impostors will go on from bad to worse , deceiving others , and being themselves deceived .
55003014	But do you hold fast what you have learned and have held to be true . You know those from whom you have learned it ,
55003015	and how from a child you have known the Holy Scriptures , which are able to make you wise unto salvation through faith in Christ Jesus .
55003016	Every Scripture , seeing that it is God-breathed , is also profitable for teaching , for refutation , for correction , and for training in righteousness ,
55003017	so that the man of God may himself be complete , and completely equipped for every good work .
55004001	I adjure you in the presence of God and of Christ Jesus who is about to judge the living and the dead - by his appearing and his kingdom , I adjure you - Luke only is with me . Pick up Mark , and bring him with you , for he is useful to me in my ministry .
55004002	proclaim the message , be urgent in season and out of season ; convince , rebuke , encourage , with never-failing patience and teaching .
55004003	For a time will come when they will not listen to wholesome teaching , but wanting to have their ears tickled , they will heap up for themselves teachers upon teachers to satisfy their own fancies .
55004004	They will turn away their ears from the truth , and turn aside to myths .
55004005	But as for you , be always self-controlled , face hardships , do the work of a missionary , discharge all the duties of your ministry .
55004006	I for my part am a libation already being poured in sacrifice ; and the time of my unmooring is at hand .
55004007	I have fought in the glorious contest ; I have run the race ; I have kept the faith .
55004008	Henceforth there is laid up for me the garland of righteousness which the Lord , the righteous Judge , will award to me on that Day , and not to me only , but also to all those who have loved his appearing .
55004009	Do your best to come to me speedily ,
55004010	for Demas has deserted me for love of this present world , and is gone to Thessalonica ; Crescens is gone to Galatia ; Titus to Dalmatia .
55004012	Tychicus I have sent to Ephesus .
55004013	When you come , bring the cloak I left in Troas with Carpus ; also my books , but especially my parchments .
55004014	Alexander , the coppersmith , manifested bitter hostility toward me . The Lord will requite him according to his works .
55004015	Be also on your guard against him , for he has violently opposed my arguments .
55004016	At the time of my first defense no one stood by me ; on the contrary they all deserted me - may it not be laid to their charge !
55004017	Nevertheless the Lord Jesus stood by me , and strengthened my heart , that through me full proclamation of the gospel might be made , and the Gentiles might hear it ; and I was rescued from the lions jaws .
55004018	And the Lord will rescue me from every evil assault , and will preserve me for his heavenly kingdom . To him be the glory forever and ever ! Amen !
55004019	Give my greetings to Prisca and Aquila , and the household of Onesiphorus .
55004020	Erastus remained at Corinth ; Trophimus I left behind me ill at Miletus .
55004021	Do try to come before winter . Eubulus greets you , and so do Pudens and Linus and Claudia and all the brotherhood .
55004022	The Lord Jesus be with your spirit . Grace be with you all .
56001001	To Titus , my true son in a common faith , from Paul , a slave of God , and an apostle of Jesus Christ , according to the faith of Gods elect , and to the knowledge of the truth which goes with piety ;
56001002	I write in hope of life eternal which God who never lies , promised before times eternal ,
56001003	but manifested in his own time ; that word of his in proclaiming which I have been entrusted by command of God our Saviour .
56001004	Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour .
56001005	I left you in Crete for this reason , that you might set right the things left unfinished , and appoint presbyters in every city as I had instructed you ;
56001006	men who are blameless , the husband of one wife , with believing children who are not accused of riot or insubordination .
56001007	For indeed a presiding officer , as Gods steward , ought to be blameless , not self-willed or quick-tempered , not a drunkard or violent , or greedy of filthy lucre ;
56001008	but he must be hospitable , a lover of the good , sober-minded , just , holy , self-controlled .
56001009	He must hold to the faithful word according to the teaching , so that he may be able both to encourage by sound teaching , and to confute our opponents .
56001010	For there are many individuals who are unruly , empty talkers and deceivers , particularly those of the circumcision , whose mouths must be stopped ;
56001011	for they upset whole households and , for filthy lucres sake , teach what they ought not to teach .
56001012	By one of their own number , by a prophet of their own , it has been said , " Cretans are always liars , evil beasts , idle gluttons . "
56001013	This testimony is true . So rebuke them sharply ,
56001014	so as to make them sound in the faith , not giving heed to Jewish myths and commandments of men who turn away from the truth .
56001015	All things are pure to the pure ; but to the contaminated and the faithless nothing is pure , nay , their very minds and consciences are tainted .
56001016	They profess to know God , but by their deeds they disown him ; in that they are detestable , disobedient , and reprobate for good work of any sort .
56002001	But do you , on your part , speak what becomes sound teaching ;
56002002	that the older men be self-controlled , serious and sober-minded , sound in faith , in love , in patience ;
56002003	that older women likewise be reverent in demeanor , not slanderers or slaves to much wine , but teachers of what is right .
56002004	They should train the younger women to love their husbands and children ,
56002005	to be sober-minded , chaste , workers at home , kind and submissive to their husbands , in order that Gods message be not maligned .
56002006	The younger men exhort to be sober-minded ; in every respect showing yourself an example of good works .
56002007	In your teaching be serious and sincere .
56002008	Let the instruction that you give be sound and above reproach , so that our opponents may be ashamed because they find no evil things to say about us .
56002009	Exhort slaves to be obedient to their own masters , and to be well-pleasing to them in every respect ;
56002010	not to contradict nor pilfer , but to exhibit praiseworthy trustworthiness in every thing , that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things .
56002011	" For Gods grace has shined forth bringing salvation to all men
56002012	And schooling us to renounce impiety and evil passions , And to live soberly , righteously , and godly in this present age ;
56002013	While we look for the blessed hope and epiphany of the glory of our great God and Saviour , Jesus Christ .
56002014	He gave himself for us to redeem us from all iniquity , and to purify unto himself a people zealous of good works . "
56002015	Thus speak , exhort , reprove with all authority . Let no one despise you .
56003001	Remind them to be submissive to their rulers and authorities ; let them be obedient , ready for every good work ;
56003002	they must speak evil of none , they must not be quarrelsome , but gentle , showing perfect meekness toward all .
56003003	For we were ourselves once foolish , disobedient , deceived , slaving for various lusts and pleasures , passing our lives in malice and envy . We were hateful , and we hated one another .
56003004	But when the kindness of God our Saviour , And his love toward men shined forth ,
56003005	He saved us , not because of any deeds that we had done in righteousness , But because of his own pity for us . He saved us by that washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit
56003006	which he poured out upon us richly , through Jesus Christ our Saviour ;
56003007	In order that being justified by his grace , We might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life .
56003008	This saying is trustworthy . On this I want you to firmly insist ; that those who have faith in God must be careful to maintain honest occupations . Such counsels are good and profitable for men .
56003009	But avoid foolish questionings and genealogies and dissensions and wranglings about the law ; for these are unprofitable and empty .
56003010	After a first and second admonition , refuse a man who is causing divisions ;
56003011	you may be sure that such a man is perverted and sinning , and is self-condemned .
56003012	As soon as I send Artemas or Tychicus to you , join me in Nicopolis as quickly as you can , for I have arranged to winter there .
56003013	Speed Zenas the lawyer , and Apollos , on their journey diligently .
56003014	Let them want nothing , and " let our people learn to devote themselves to honest work to supply the necessities of their teachers , " so that they be not unfruitful .
56003015	All who are with us salute you . Salute those who love me in faith . Grace be with you all .
57001001	To my beloved friend and coworker Philemon ,
57001002	to my sister Apphia , to my fellow soldier Archippus , and to the church which meets at Philemons house . From Paul , a prisoner of Jesus Christ , and brother Timothy .
57001003	Grace and peace be to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
57001004	I am ever mentioning you in my prayers , and giving thanks to God ,
57001005	because I am hearing of your love and of the faith which you hold , not only toward the Lord Jesus Christ , but toward all the saints .
57001006	And I pray that your participation may become effectual , as you come to acknowledge every good thing which is in you to Christ .
57001007	For I have great joy and comfort in your love , my brother , because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed .
57001008	And so , although I might be bold in Christ to dictate to you what is fitting ,
57001009	yet for loves sake , I rather beseech you , I , Paul , an old man , and now a prisoner for Christ Jesus !
57001010	I beseech you for my son , Onesimus , whom I have begotten in these chains .
57001011	Once you found him " unprofitable , " but now he is " profitable " to you and to me .
57001012	I am sending him back to you , he himself , that is , my very heart !
57001013	I could wish to retain him at my side , so that he might minister to me in your stead , in my bonds for the gospel .
57001014	But without your consent I was unwilling to do anything , so that your kindness to me might be of your own free will , and not of compulsion .
57001015	Perhaps for this reason you were separated from him for an hour , in order that you might have him back forever ,
57001016	no longer as a slave , but more than a slave , as a brother beloved ; especially dear to me , but how much more to you , both as a man and a fellow Christian .
57001017	If then you count me as a partner , receive him as you would me .
57001018	And if he has wronged you at all , or is owing you anything , charge that to me .
57001019	I Paul am writing this in my own handwriting , " I will repay you . " But I will not mention that you owe me , over and over , your very soul .
57001020	Come my brother , let me have joy in the Lord because of you ! Refresh my heart in Christ !
57001021	Because I am thoroughly persuaded of your obedience , I have written you , knowing full well that you will do by me what I am asking .
57001022	Please also prepare for me a lodging , for I am hoping by your prayers to be restored to you again .
57001023	Epaphras , my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus , sends you greeting ;
57001024	so do Mark , Aristarchus , Demas , and Luke , my fellow workers .
57001025	May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . Amen .
58001001	God , who in ancient days spoke to our ancestors in the prophets , at many different times and by various methods ,
58001002	has at the end of these days spoken to us in a Son whom he appointed heir of all things ; through whom also he made the universe .
58001003	He being an emanation of Gods glory and stamp of his substance , and upholding the universe by the utterances of his power , after by himself making purification of our sins , has taken his seat on the right hand of the Majesty on High .
58001004	He is as much superior to the angels as the name that he has inherited surpasses theirs .
58001005	For to what angel did God ever say , Thou art my son ; this day have I become thy Father ? and again , I will be a father to him , and he shall be to me a son ?
58001006	And further , when he brought the firstborn into the habitable world , he said , Let all the angels of God worship him .
58001007	While of the angels he said , He makes his angels into winds , His ministering servants into flames of fire .
58001008	But to the Son he says . Thy throne , O God , is forever and ever , And the scepter of thy kingdom is the scepter of justice .
58001009	Thou hast loved righteousness and hated lawlessness ; Therefore did God , thy God , anoint thee with the oil of gladness beyond thy comrades .
58001010	And , Thou , O Lord , in the beginning didst lay the foundations of the earth , And the heavens are the work of thy hands .
58001011	They will perish , but thou remainest ; They all will grow old like a garment ,
58001012	Like a mantle thou wilt fold them up , And like a garment they will be changed . But thou art the same , And thy years will never fail .
58001013	To which of the angels has he ever said , Sit at my right hand , Till I make thy foes a footstool for thy feet ?
58001014	Are they not all ministering spirits , sent forth for service in behalf of those who are about to inherit salvation ?
58002001	For this reason we must pay the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard , for fear we should drift away .
58002002	For if the word uttered through angels stood firm , so that every transgression and act of disobedience met with its just retribution , how shall we escape if we neglect so great a salvation ?
58002003	Which having begun to be spoken by the Lord , was confirmed to us by those who heard him ;
58002004	God himself corroborating their testimony by signs and wonders and a variety of miraculous powers , and by gifts of the Holy Spirit imparted in accordance with his own will .
58002005	It is not to angels that God subjected the age to be , of which we are speaking .
58002006	But some one , somewhere , testified , saying . What is Man , that thou art mindful of him ? Or any man , that thou carest for him ?
58002007	Thou hast made him only a little lower that the angels ; With glory and honor hast thou crowned him ; And hast set him to govern the works of thy hands ;
58002008	Thou hast put all things under his feet . For this putting all things under man means leaving nothing not subject to him . But we do not yet see all things subject to him .
58002009	What we do see is Jesus , who was made for a time a little lower than the angels , now crowned with glory and honor , because of the suffering of death , in order that through Gods grace he might taste death for every man .
58002010	For it befitted him , for whom and through whom all things exist , in bringing many sons to glory , to make the Pioneer of their salvation perfect through sufferings .
58002011	For both he who sanctifies and those whom he is sanctifying are all from One ; for which reason he is not ashamed to call them brothers , saying .
58002012	I will proclaim thy name to my brothers ; In the midst of the Church I will hymn thy praises .
58002013	And again , I myself will put my trust in God . And again , Lo , I and the children God has given me .
58002014	Therefore , since the children are sharers in flesh and blood , he also similarly partook of the same , in order that through death he might render powerless him that had the power of death , that is , the devil ;
58002015	And might deliver those who through fear of death had been subject to life-long bondage .
58002016	For assuredly it is not angels , nay , it is the offspring of Abraham , whom he is ever taking by the hand .
58002017	And so it was necessary that he should in all points be made like his brothers , so that he might become a compassionate and faithful high priest , in all that relates to God , to make reconciliation for the sins of the people .
58002018	For inasmuch as he himself has suffered , being tempted , he is also able instantly to succor those who are tempted , he is also able instantly to succor those who are tempted .
58003001	Therefore , holy brothers , comrades of a heavenly calling , fix your thoughts then upon Jesus , the Apostle and High Priest of our confession .
58003002	How faithful he was to the God who appointed him ! For while Moses also was faithful in all Gods house ,
58003003	Jesus has been counted worthy of greater glory than Moses , inasmuch as he who has built a house has higher honor than the house itself .
58003004	For every house has its builder ; but he who built the universe is God .
58003005	And Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant , bearing testimony to a witness about to be spoken ;
58003006	but Christ as a Son in his own house ; and we are that house , if we retain the cheerful courage and pride of our hope firm unto the end .
58003007	Therefore , as the Holy Spirit says . If you hear Gods voice today ,
58003008	Continue not to harden your hearts as in the Provocation , On the day of temptation in the wilderness ,
58003009	When your forefathers tried my forbearance And saw my deeds for forty years .
58003010	For this reason I was sore displeased with that generation , And said , " They are always wandering in their hearts ; They have never learned my ways " ;
58003011	So I swore in my wrath , " They shall never enter into my rest . "
58003012	See to it , brothers , that there shall never be in any one of you an evil and unbelieving heart , manifesting itself in apostasy from the living God .
58003013	On the contrary , encourage each other daily , so long as there is a " Today , " so that no one of you is hindered by the deceitfulness of sin .
58003014	For we are become comrades of the Christ , if we hold our first title deed firm until the very end .
58003015	In the words of Scripture , Today , if you hear his voice , Do not continue to harden your hearts as at the Provocation .
58003016	For who were they that heard and yet provoked him ? Was it not all who came out of Egypt under the leadership of Moses ?
58003017	And with whom was he grieved for forty years ? Was it not with those who had sinned , and whose dead bodies fell in the wilderness ?
58003018	And to whom did he swear that they should never enter into his rest , if not to those who had proved faithless ?
58003019	So you see that it was through unbelief that they were not able to enter in .
58004001	Let us be on our guard , then , though there is a promise still standing of being admitted to his rest , lest any one of you should be found to have come short of it .
58004002	For the Good News is come to us just as it did to them . But the message they heard was of no benefit to them , because they did not share the faith of those who gave heed to it .
58004003	We are actually entering into that rest , we who have believed , as God has said , - In my wrath I swore - " They shall not enter into my Rest , " although his works were finished since the foundation of the world .
58004004	For he has said , somewhere , regarding the seventh day , And God rested on the seventh day from all his work .
58004005	And again in this passage , They shall not enter into my rest .
58004006	Since , then , it remains that some should enter into it , and since those who formerly had the Good News preached to them did not enter in because of unbelief ,
58004007	he again fixes a day , saying long afterward by Davids lips , in words already quoted , Today if you hear his voice , Continue not to harden your hearts .
58004008	For if Joshua had given them rest , he would not have spoken afterward of another day .
58004009	So there remains a Sabbath Rest for the people of God .
58004010	For whoever has entered into his rest has rested from his works , just as God did from his .
58004011	Let us , then , be earnest to enter into that rest , so that no one may fall into the same example of disobedience .
58004012	For living is the Word of God , and active , and sharper than any two-edged sword , piercing even to the severance of soul form spirit , of both joints and marrow , and is a discerner of the very thoughts and conceptions of the heart .
58004013	And there is not a creature hidden form him , but all things are naked and laid prostrate before the eyes of him with whom we have to do .
58004014	Inasmuch , then , as we have a great High Priest , Jesus , the Son of God , who has passed through the heavens , let us hold fast our confession of faith .
58004015	For we have not a High Priest who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses , but one who has been tempted in all points like as we are , yet without sin .
58004016	Let us , then , draw near with glad boldness to the throne of grace , that we may receive mercy , and find grace to help us in our times of need .
58005001	For every high priest chosen from time to time from among men is appointed on behalf of men , in matters relating to God , to offer both gifts and sacrifices on behalf of sins .
58005002	He is able to deal gently with the ignorant and erring , since he himself also is encompassed with moral weakness ,
58005003	and because of this weakness he is bound to offer sin-offerings not only for the people , but also for himself .
58005004	Again no one takes this honorable office for himself , but he is called by God , just as Aaron was .
58005005	So even the Christ was not raised to the high glory of the priesthood by himself , but on the contrary by Him who said to him . Thou art my Son ; this day have I become thy Father ;
58005006	and again , Thou art a priest forever , after the order of Melchisedek .
58005007	In the days of his flesh , with better cries and weeping Jesus offered up prayers and supplications to Him who was able to save him out of death ; and he was heard because of his devout submission .
58005008	Though he was a son , yet learned he obedience through the things which he suffered ;
58005009	and by being thus made perfect , he became the source of enduring salvation to all who obey him ,
58005010	while God himself pronounced him High Priest according to the order of Melchisedek .
58005011	Concerning him I have much to say , and much that is hard to make clear to you , because you have grown dull of hearing .
58005012	And this too , although you ought by this time to be teaching others , you are still needing some one to teach you the very rudiments of divine revelation . You need milk , not solid food .
58005013	For every one who feeds on milk is inexperienced in the word of righteousness . He is still an infant .
58005014	But solid food is for adults , that is , for those who by constant practise have their faculties trained to discriminate between good and evil .
58006001	So let us get beyond the teaching of the elementary doctrines of Christ , and let us be borne along toward what is mature . Let us not be continually laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works ,
58006002	of faith in God , of the teaching regarding ablutions and the laying on of hands , of the resurrection of the dead , and of eternal judgment .
58006003	And this we will do , if God permit .
58006004	For in the case of those who have been once for all enlightened and have tasted of the heavenly gift ,
58006005	and become partakers of the Holy Spirit , and tasted the good word of God , and the powers of the Future Age ,
58006006	and then fallen away , it is impossible to renew them again unto repentance . For they repeatedly crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh , and expose him to an open shame .
58006007	For land that has drunk the showers that now and again fall upon it , and produced vegetation useful for those for whom it was tilled , receives a blessing from God ;
58006008	but if it produces thorns and thistles , it is considered worthless , and is in danger of being cursed , and its end will be to be burned .
58006009	But though we thus speak , we are persuaded better things of you , beloved , and things that accompany salvation .
58006010	For God is not unjust ; he will not forget your work and the love you showed for his cause , in sending help to your fellow Christians , as you are still doing .
58006011	but I am longing that each of you continue to show the same diligence to realize the fulness of your hope , even to the end .
58006012	Then do not become slack , but be imitators of those who through faith and patience are inheriting the promises .
58006013	For when God make the promise to Abraham , since he could swear by none greater , he swore by himself , saying .
58006014	Surely I will bless you , and bless you ; I will increase you , and increase you .
58006015	And so by patiently waiting , Abraham obtained the promise .
58006016	I am referring to the oath because men swear by what is greater than themselves , and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation .
58006017	On which principle God , wishing to show more convincingly to the heirs of the promise the immutability of his purpose , mediated with an oath ;
58006018	that by means of two immutable things - his promise and his oath - in which it is impossible for God to break faith , we refugees may have strong encouragement to grasp the hope set before us .
58006019	This hope we have as an anchor of the soul , secure and strong , and passing into the sanctuary which is beyond the veil ;
58006020	whither Jesus himself is entered as a forerunner on our behalf , having become a priest forever , after the order of Melchisedek .
58007001	It was this Melchisedek , King of Salem and Priest of the Most High God , who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him ;
58007002	and it was to him that Abraham apportioned a tithe of all the spoil . He was first , as his name signifies , King of righteousness , and then King of Salem , that is , King of Peace ;
58007003	without father or mother , without lineage , having neither beginning of days nor end of life , but resembling the Son of God , he remains a priest in perpetuity .
58007004	But observe how great this man was , to whom even Abraham , the Patriarch , gave a tenth part of the spoils .
58007005	Now those of the sons of Levi who are appointed to the priesthood , are authorized by the Law to take tithes of the people , that is , of their brothers , and that too , although these are descended from Abraham .
58007006	But this man who had no Levitical genealogy actually took tithes of Abraham , and blessed him to whom the promises belong .
58007007	Now it is beyond all controversy that the inferior is always blessed by the superior .
58007008	Again it is mortal men who receive tithes in the one case ; while in the other it is he of whom it is attested , " He lives . "
58007009	And even Levi , who is the receiver of tithes , so to speak , paid tithes through Abraham ;
58007010	for Levi was yet in the loins of his father , when Melchisedek met Abraham .
58007011	Now if there were perfection through the Levitical priesthood , ( and it was under it that the people received the Law ) why was it still necessary for another kind of priest to arise , after the order of Melchisedek , instead of being reckoned according to the order of Aaron ?
58007012	For when the priesthood changes , of necessity the law also changes .
58007013	He who is thus described belonged to another tribe , not one member of which has ever served at the altar .
58007014	For it is evident that our Lord was descended from Judah , a tribe of which Moses said nothing concerning the priesthood .
58007015	And this is yet more abundantly clear if , after the likeness of Melchisedek , there arises another Priest ,
58007016	who has become such , not according to the law of a transitory enactment , but according to the energy of an indissoluble life .
58007017	For the words are in evidence , Thou art a priest forever after the order of Melchisedek .
58007018	For there is a setting aside of a foregoing commandment , because of its weakness and unprofitableness
58007019	( for the Law brought nothing to perfection ) ; and there is the bringing in of a better hope by which we draw near to God ;
58007020	mightier because it was not promised apart from an oath .
58007021	For although those priests became such without an oath , He had an oath form God who said to him , The Lord hath sworn and will not change , Thou art a priest forever .
58007022	And by so much Jesus becomes the guarantor of a better covenant .
58007023	And they indeed have been made priests , many in number , because they have been prevented by death from continuing ;
58007024	but he , because of his abiding forever , holds his priesthood inviolable .
58007025	Hence also he is able to continue saving to the uttermost those who are ever drawing near to God through him , seeing that he is ever living to intercede for them .
58007026	For we needed just such a high priest , holy , innocent , undefiled , separated from sinners , and exalted above the heavens ;
58007027	one who has no need , like the high priests , to offer up daily sacrifices , first for his own sins , then for those of the people . For his sacrifice was made once for all , when he offered up himself .
58007028	For the Law appoints human beings to be high priests , men with all their weakness ; but the word of the oath , which was later than the Law , appoints a Son , perfected forevermore .
58008001	The pith of all that we have been saying is this ; we do have such a High Priest ; and he has taken his seat on the right hand of the throne of Majesty in the heavens ,
58008002	a minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle , which the Lord pitched , not man .
58008003	For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices ; whence it follows that this High Priest also must have some offering to make .
58008004	Now were he on earth , he would not even be a priest , since there are here those who present the gifts according to the Law -
58008005	those priests who serve a mere outline and shadow of the heavenly reality , just as Moses was divinely instructed when he was about to build the Tabernacle . " See " , he says , " that you make everything on the pattern showed you on the mountain . "
58008006	But Jesus has obtained a better ministry , by so much as he is also Mediator of a better covenant , which has been enacted upon better promises .
58008007	For if the first covenant had been faultless , there would have been no need for a second .
58008008	But finding fault with them , He says . " There are days coming , " says the Lord , " When I will establish with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah a new covenant ;
58008009	Not according tot he covenant which I made with their forefathers , On the day when I took them by the hand to lead them forth out of the land of Egypt ; For they did not continue in my covenant , And therefore I disregarded them , " says the Lord .
58008010	" For this is the covenant which I will covenant with the house of Israel , After these days , " says the Lord ; " I will put my laws into their minds , And upon their hearts will I write them ; And I will be their God , And they shall be my people ;
58008011	And they shall not teach every man his fellow citizen , And every man his brother , saying , Know the Lord ; For all shall know me , From the least to the greatest of them .
58008012	For I will have mercy upon their wrong-doings , And their sins I will remember no more . "
58008013	By calling the covenant " new , " He has made the first one obsolete ; and whatever is becoming obsolete and aged , is near to vanishing .
58009001	Now even the first covenant had its ordinances of public worship , and its sanctuary , a material one .
58009002	For a tent was built , the outer one called the Holy Place , in which were the lamp and the table and the loaves of the Presence ;
58009003	and behind the second veil was the tent called the Holy of Holies .
58009004	In it was the golden altar of incense , and also the Ark of the Covenant covered all over with gold , in which was a golden pot holding the manna , and Aarons rod that budded , and the tables of the covenant ;
58009005	while above it , overshadowing the mercy-seat , were the cherubim of glory . But I must not speak about these in detail .
58009006	Such then were the arrangements . Into the outer tent the priests enter continually in the performance of their duties ;
58009007	but into the inner tent the high priest only goes alone , once a year , and that not without blood , which he offers for himself and for the ignorances of the people .
58009008	The Holy Spirit teaching by this that the way into the Holiest has not yet been disclosed while the first tent is still standing .
58009009	This is a parable , for the present time , according to which gifts and sacrifices are offered that are not able , as far as conscience is concerned , to perfect the worshiper ;
58009010	since they consist only in meats and drinks and various ablutions , carnal ordinances , imposed until the time of reformation .
58009011	But when Christ came , a High Priest of good things to come , he passed through the greater and more perfect tent not made with hands , that is to say , not of this material creation ,
58009012	not taking the blood of goats and oxen , but his own blood , and entered once for all into the Holy Place , obtaining for us an eternal redemption .
58009013	For if the blood of bulls and goats and the ashes of a heifer sprinkled on those who have been defiled , sanctify to the cleansing of the flesh ,
58009014	how much more shall the blood of Christ , who through his eternal spirit offered himself free from blemish to God , cleanse your conscience from dead works unto the service of an ever-living God !
58009015	And because of this he is the Mediator of a new testament , in order that , since a death has taken place to atone for offenses committed under the first testament , those who have been called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance .
58009016	For where there is a testament , there must also be brought forward in evidence the death of the testator .
58009017	For a testament is only of force in case of the dead , being never valid so long as the testator lives .
58009018	Accordingly we find that not without blood was the first testament enacted .
58009019	For after every commandment according to the law had been spoken by Moses to the people , he took the blood of calves and goats , and scarlet wool and hyssop , and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people .
58009020	saying , This is the blood of that testament which God commanded in regard to you .
58009021	Moreover the tabernacle and all the vessels of service he sprinkled likewise , and indeed , according to the Law ,
58009022	almost everything is purified by blood , and without the shedding of blood there is no remission of sins .
58009023	While , then , it was necessary that the copies of the heavenly things should be cleansed by such sacrifices , the heavenly things themselves required nobler sacrifices than these .
58009024	For it was not into a Sanctuary made by hands , a mere type of the reality , that Christ entered , but he entered into heaven itself , now to appear in the very presence of God on our behalf .
58009025	Nor did he enter to offer himself repeatedly , as the high priest entered into the sanctuary , year after year , with blood that was not his own ; ( for in that case he would have needed to suffer repeatedly , ever since the foundation of the world ; ) but now , once for all , at the end of the ages , he has appeared to abolish sin , but the offering of himself .
58009027	And since it is appointed to men once to die , and after that the judgment ;
58009028	so also the Christ , after being once for all offered to bear the sins of many , will appear a second time , without sin , to those who wait for him for salvation .
58010001	For the Law , being only a shadow of the good things to come , and not their very substance , its priests cannot with the same sacrifice which year after year they offer continually , make perfect those who draw near .
58010002	Otherwise would they not have ceased to be offered ? Because the worshippers having been once cleansed , would have had no more consciousness of sin .
58010003	But on the other hand , in these sacrifices sins are called to memory , year after year .
58010004	For it is impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sin .
58010005	It is for this reason that the Christ , on coming into the world , declared . Sacrifice and offerings thou dost not desire , But a body didst thou prepare for me ;
58010006	In whole burnt offerings and sin offerings Thou hast taken no pleasure .
58010007	Then I said , " I am come - in the roll of the book it is written of me - - To do thy will , O God . "
58010008	First when it is said , Thou hast no longing for , thou takest no delight in Sacrifices and offerings , or whole burnt offerings and sin offerings ,
58010009	( offerings regularly made under the law ) , and then it is added , Lo , I come to do thy will , he does away with the first , in order that he may establish the second .
58010010	And it is by this will that we have been sanctified by the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all .
58010011	For while every priest stands , day after day , at his ministrations , and many times repeats the same sacrifices , which can never take away sins ,
58010012	this Priest , after offering one Sacrifice for sins , sat down forever on Gods right hand ;
58010013	henceforth waiting until his enemies be put as the footstool of his feet .
58010014	For by one single offering he has perfected forever those whom he is sanctifying .
58010015	And the Holy Spirit also gives his testimony , when he said .
58010016	" This is the covenant I will make with them After those days , " says the Lord . " I will set my laws upon their hearts , And I will inscribe them on their minds . "
58010017	Then he adds , And their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more .
58010018	But when these have been remitted , there is no more any offering for sin .
58010019	Since , then , we have a cheerful confidence , brothers , to enter into the Holiest by the blood of Jesus ,
58010020	by the way which he dedicated for us , that new and living way , through the veil ( that is , his flesh ) ;
58010021	and since we have a great High Priest over the house of God ;
58010022	let us draw near with a true heart , in full assurance of faith , our hearts sprinkled from and evil conscience , and our bodies bathed in pure water .
58010023	Let us hold fast the confession of our hope , unwavering ( for He is faithful who promised ) ;
58010024	and let us consider one another , to provoke unto love and good works ;
58010025	not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together , as is the custom of some , but exhorting one another ; all the more as you behold the Day drawing near .
58010026	For if we sin wilfully , after we have received the knowledge of the truth , there no longer remains any other sacrifice for sins ,
58010027	but a certain fearful expectation of judgment , and a fiery indignation which is about to devour the adversaries .
58010028	Any one who set at naught the law of Moses was put to death without pity , on the testimony of two or three witnesses .
58010029	How much surer , think you , will be the punishment of one who has trodden under foot the Son of God , and has profaned that covenant blood with which he was sanctified , and has done despite to the spirit of grace ?
58010030	For we know Him who said , Vengeance is mine , I will repay , and again , The Lord will judge his people .
58010031	IT IS A FEARFUL THING TO FALL INTO THE HANDS OF THE LIVING GOD !
58010032	But ever call to mind the former days , in which , after having been enlightened , you endured a great conflict of sufferings ;
58010033	partly by being made a public spectacle in reproaches and afflictions , and partly by sharing the fortunes of those that were so used .
58010034	For you did sympathize with the prisoners , and you did take joyfully the confiscation of your goods ; conscious that you had for yourselves greater , even lasting possessions .
58010035	Now do not fling away your bold confidence , for it has a great recompense of reward .
58010036	For you need stedfastness , so that after having done the will of God , you may receive the promise ,
58010037	For yet a very , very little while , and then The Coming One will have come , without delay .
58010038	But it is by faith that my Righteous One will live , And if he draws back , my soul takes no pleasure in him .
58010039	" But we are not of defections unto perdition , but of faith unto the gaining of the soul . "
58011001	Now faith is the title-deed of things hoped for ; the putting to the proof of things not seen .
58011002	For by it men of old times had witness borne to them .
58011003	By faith we understand that the world was fashioned by the Word of God , so that what we see was not made out of what is visible .
58011004	By faith Abel offered to God a sacrifice more acceptable than that of Cain , through which he had witness borne to him that he was righteous , God giving the testimony by accepting his gifts ; and through it he , although he is dead , still speaks .
58011005	By faith Enoch was translated so that he should not see death ; and he was not found , because God had translated him . Before his translation he had witness borne to him that he pleased God .
58011006	now without faith it is impossible to please him ; for he who comes to God must believe that he is , and that he ever rewards those who are seeking .
58011007	By faith Noah , warned of God of things not yet seen , reverently gave heed , and built an ark for the saving of his house ; by which he condemned the world , and became an heir of the righteousness which is of faith .
58011008	By faith Abraham obeyed when he was called to go out unto a place which he was to receive for an inheritance ; and he went out , not knowing whither he went .
58011009	It was by faith that he sojourned in the promised land as an alien , living in tents with Isaac and Jacob , his fellow heirs of the same promise .
58011010	For he continually looked for the city which has foundations , whose builder and maker is God .
58011011	By faith even Sarah herself received power to conceive seed , although she was past the age for child-bearing , because she counted Him faithful who had promised ;
58011012	and thus there sprang from one man , and him practically dead , a nation like the stars in the heavens in multitude , or grains of sand upon the seashore , innumerable .
58011013	These all died in faith , not having yet received the promises ; nay , but they saw them from afar , and hailed them , and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth .
58011014	For those who say such things make it plain that they are seeking a Fatherland .
58011015	And if they had cherished the memory of that land from which they went out , they would have found an opportunity to return ;
58011016	but now they are longing for a better homeland , that is , a heavenly . Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God ; and he has prepared a city for them .
58011017	By faith Abraham , when he was put to the test , was on the point of offering up Isaac ; yes , he who had received the promise was about to offer up his only son ,
58011018	of whom it had been said , It is through Isaac that your posterity will be traced .
58011019	For he accounted God able even to raise from the dead , from whence , figuratively speaking , he did indeed receive him back again .
58011020	By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau , even concerning things to come .
58011021	By faith Jacob , when he was dying , blessed each of Josephs sons , and worshiped , leaning on the top of his staff .
58011022	By faith Joseph , when his end was nigh , made mention of the exodus of the children of Israel , and gave instructions in regard to his bones .
58011023	By faith Moses , when he was born , was hid three months by his parents , because they saw that he was a beautiful child , and they were not afraid of the kings decree .
58011024	By faith Moses , when he was grown up , refused to be called the son of Pharaohs daughter ,
58011025	choosing rather to share ill-treatment with the people of God , than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season .
58011026	He accounted the obloquy of Christ to be greater than the treasures of Egypt ; for he fixed his eyes on the reward .
58011027	By faith he left Egypt , not because he feared the wrath of the king , but he endured as seeing Him who is invisible .
58011028	By faith he established the Passover , and the sprinkling with blood , in order that the Destroying Angel might not touch the firstborn .
58011029	By faith the people crossed over the Red Sea as on dry land ; and when the Egyptians tried to do this they were swallowed up .
58011030	By faith the walls of Jericho fell down after they had been encircled seven days .
58011031	By faith Rahab , the harlot , perished not with the disobedient , because she had received the spies in peace .
58011032	And what more shall I say ? for time would fail me to tell of Gideon , of Barak , of Samson , and of Jeptha ; of David and Samuel and the prophets ,
58011033	who through faith conquered kingdoms , wrought righteousness , obtained promises , stopped the mouths of lions ,
58011034	quenched the power of fire , escaped the edge of the sword , out of weakness were made strong , proved valiant in warfare , and routed armies of aliens .
58011035	Woman received their dear ones alive from the dead ; and others were broken on the wheel , not accepting the offered deliverance , in order that they might obtain a better resurrection .
58011036	Others again bore trial of mockings and scourgings , yes , even of chains and imprisonment .
58011037	They were stoned , they were sawn asunder , they were tempted , they were slain with the sword , they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins , being destitute , persecuted , tormented -
58011038	of whom the world was not worthy - wandering in deserts and mountains and caves and holes in the ground .
58011039	Yet , though these all had witness borne to them by their faith , they received not the promise ;
58011040	since it was for us that God had in store some better thing , so that apart from us they should not be perfected .
58012001	Seeing then that we are encircled with this great cloud of witnesses , let us also lay aside every weight , and the sin that clings about us . Let us run with patience the race that is set before us ,
58012002	looking unto Jesus , the pioneer and perfecter of our faith , who for the joy that was set before him endured a cross , despising shame , and has now taken his seat at the right hand of the throne of God .
58012003	Compare yourselves with him who endured such hostility against himself at the hands of sinners , lest you grow weary , fainting in your souls .
58012004	Not yet have you resisted unto blood in your fight against sin ;
58012005	and have you forgotten the exhortation which reasons with you as sons ? My son , do not despise the training of the Lord , Nor faint when he corrects you ;
58012006	For it is those whom he loves that he disciplines , And he scourges every son whom he acknowledges .
58012007	It is for discipline that you are enduring these sufferings . God is dealing with you as sons . For what son is there whom his father does not discipline ?
58012008	If you are left without discipline , in which all children share , then are you bastards and not sons .
58012009	Furthermore , our earthly fathers used to discipline us , and we gave them reverence . Shall we not much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits , and live ?
58012010	For they only disciplined us for a few days , as seemed good to them ; but he does it for our profit , that we may share his holiness .
58012011	Now no discipline seems for the present to be joyous , but grievous ; but afterward it yields the peaceable fruits of righteousness to those who have been trained under it .
58012012	Wherefore lift up your listless hands , strengthen your feeble knees ;
58012013	make straight path for your feet , so that what is lame may not be put out of joint , but rather be healed .
58012014	Run swiftly after peace with all men , and holiness , without which no man shall see the Lord .
58012015	Look carefully that there be no one who falls back from the grace of God ; that no root of bitterness springs up to trouble you , and by its means many become defiled .
58012016	Take care lest there be any fornicator or scorner like Esau among you , who for one meal sold his birthright .
58012017	For you know that even when he afterward desired to inherit the blessing , he was rejected ; he found no room for repentance , though he sought it earnestly , with tears .
58012018	For you are not come to a palpable and enkindled fire ,
58012019	nor to gloom and darkness and tempest and the blare of a trumpet and an audible voice . Those who heard that voice entreated that no word more should be spoken to them .
58012020	For they could not endure that which was enjoined , Even if a wild beast touches the mountain it shall be stoned to death ;
58012021	and so terrible was the scene that Moses said , I exceedingly fear and tremble .
58012022	On the contrary you are come to Mount Zion , the city of the living God , the heavenly Jerusalem , to innumerable hosts of angels ,
58012023	to the festal assemblage and church of the firstborn , registered in heaven , to a Judge who is God of all , to the spirits of just men made perfect ,
58012024	to Jesus the Mediator of the New Covenant , and to his sprinkled Blood whose message cries louder than that of Abel .
58012025	See that you do not refuse him who is speaking . For if they did not escape punishment when they refused to listen to their instructor on earth , much less shall we escape if we turn away from him who is teaching us from heaven ;
58012026	whose voice then shook the earth , but now he has promised , saying , Once again , once for all , I make not only earth , but heaven also to tremble .
58012027	That phrase , " Once again , " signifies the removal of the things which can be shaken , created things , in order that the things which cannot be shaken may remain .
58012028	Wherefore since we are receiving a kingdom which is unshakable , let us give thanks , and so offer acceptable worship to God , with holy awe and fear ,
58012029	FOR INDEED OUR GOD IS A CONSUMING FIRE .
58013001	Let brotherly love continue .
58013002	Do not neglect to show hospitality ; for by it some have even entertained angels unawares .
58013003	Remember those who are in prison , as if you were fellow prisoners ; remember too , those who are being ill-treated , since you too , are in the body .
58013004	Let marriage be held in honor by all , and the marriage bed be undefiled ; for fornicators and adulterers will God judge .
58013005	Let your life be untainted by love of money ; be content with such things as you have ; for God himself has said , I will never leave thee ; I will never forsake thee .
58013006	So that we can say with confidence , The Lord is my helper ; I will not be afraid . What can man do to me ?
58013007	Remember your leaders , the men who spoke the message of God to you ; consider the issue of their lives , and imitate their faith .
58013008	Jesus Christ is the same yesterday , today , and forever .
58013009	Do not allow yourselves to be swept away by various and strange teachings . For it is a beautiful thing to be established in heart by grace , and not by regulations regarding food , from which those that occupied themselves with them have derived no benefit .
58013010	We Christians have an altar from which those have no right to eat who minister in the Tabernacle .
58013011	For the bodies of the animals whose blood is carried by the High Priest into the Holy Place are burned outside the camp ,
58013012	and so Jesus suffered outside the gate in order to sanctify the people by his own blood .
58013013	Let us then go forth to him outside the camp , bearing his reproach .
58013014	For we have not here an abiding city , but we are earnestly seeking the city that is to be .
58013015	In his name , then , let us continually offer up a sacrifice of praise to God , that is the fruit of lips that confess his name .
58013016	And forget not to be kind and liberal ; for with that sort of sacrifice God is well pleased .
58013017	Obey your leaders and submit to them ; for they are keeping watch over your souls , as those who must give account ; that they may do thus with joy and not with lamentation , for this would be unprofitable to you .
58013018	Keep on praying for me . I am persuaded that I have a clear conscience , and I desire in every way to live nobly .
58013019	I the more earnestly ask for your prayers , that I may be the more speedily restored to you .
58013020	Now the God of peace , who brought up from the dead our Lord Jesus , that great Shepherd of the sheep , by the blood of an eternal covenant ,
58013021	equip you in every good deed for the doing of his will , doing in you what is well-pleasing in his sight , through Jesus Christ . To him be the glory unto the ages of the ages ! Amen !
58013022	But I entreat you , brothers , bear with my word of exhortation , for I have written to you briefly .
58013023	You know that our brother Timothy has been set free . If he comes soon , I will see him with you .
58013024	Salute all your leaders and the saints . The brothers from Italy send you greeting .
58013025	Grace be with you all , Amen .
59001001	James , a slave of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ , sends greeting to the twelve tribes that are scattered abroad .
59001002	My brothers , when you are beset by various temptations , count it all joy ,
59001003	because you know that the testing of your faith is working out endurance .
59001004	But let endurance have its perfect work , so that you may be perfect and entire , not lacking in anything .
59001005	If any one of you is lacking in wisdom , let him ask it from the God who gives to all men freely and without upbraiding ; and it will be given to him .
59001006	But let him ask in faith , without wavering ; for he who wavers is like a surge of the sea , wind-driven and tossed .
59001007	Such a man need not suppose that he will receive anything from the Lord ,
59001008	double-minded as he is , unstable at every turn .
59001009	Let a brother in humble circumstances glory in his exaltation ;
59001010	but a rich brother , in his humiliation ; because like the flower of the grass the rich man will pass away .
59001011	For as the sun comes up with a burning heat , it withers the grass , and its flowers fall , and the grace of the fashion of it perishes ; so also shall the rich man fade away amid his pursuits .
59001012	Blessed is the man who endures temptation ; for when he has stood the test he will receive the crown of life which the Lord has promised to those who love him .
59001013	When he is being tempted , let no one say , " It is God who tempts me , " for God cannot be tempted with evil , nor does he tempt any man .
59001014	But each man is tempted by his own lusts that allure and entice him .
59001015	Then lust conceives and gives birth to sin ; and sin , when it is mature , brings forth death .
59001016	Do not be deceived , my brothers !
59001017	Every good gift and every perfect boon is from above , and is ever coming down to us from the Father of the heavenly lights , with whom is no variation nor shadow of eclipse .
59001018	Because he willed , he gave us birth through the word of truth , so that we should be a kind of first-fruits among his creatures .
59001019	Mark this well , my dear brothers . Let every man be swift in hearing , slow in speaking , slow in growing angry ;
59001020	for a mans anger does not further the righteous purpose of God .
59001021	So strip off all filthiness and superfluity of wickedness , and in meekness receive the implanted Word , which is able to save your souls .
59001022	And become doers of the Word , and not merely hearers , deceiving yourselves .
59001023	Because if any one is a hearer of the Word and not a doer , he is like a man who looks at his natural face in a mirror ;
59001024	for after he has looked carefully at himself , he goes away , and at once forgets what he is like .
59001025	But the man who looks closely into the perfect law - the law of liberty - and continues looking , this man will be blessed in his deed because he is not a hearer who forgets , but a doer who does .
59001026	If a man thinks himself to be religious , and yet does not bridle his tongue , but deceives his own religion ,
59001027	and undefiled before our God and Father , to look after orphans and widows in their affliction , and ever to keep himself unspotted from the world .
59002001	My brothers , do not hold the faith of the Lord Jesus , the Lord of Glory , in a spirit of caste .
59002002	Suppose a man comes into your synagogue with a gold ring and dazzling clothes , and suppose a poor man comes in , also , in shabby clothes ,
59002003	and you look up to him who wears the fine clothing , and say to him , " Sit here in this fine place ! " and to the poor man you say , " Stand there ! " or " Sit on the floor at my feet ! "
59002004	are you not drawing distinctions among yourselves , and have you not become judges with evil thoughts ?
59002005	Listen , my dear brothers , has not God chosen the poor of this world to be rich in faith , and to inherit the kingdom which he has promised to those who love him ?
59002006	But you have dishonored the poor man . Do not the rich oppress you and drag you to court ?
59002007	Are they not blaspheming that glorious Name by which you are called ?
59002008	If you are keeping the royal law , which says , Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thou dost thyself , you are doing well .
59002009	If you have the spirit of caste you are committing sin , and are convicted by the Law as transgressors .
59002010	For if a man keeps the whole of the Law , and yet stumbles in one point , he is guilty of all .
59002011	For he who said , Do not commit adultery , said also , Do not Kill . Now if you do not commit adultery , but if you do kill , you have transgressed the Law .
59002012	So speak and act like men who are to be judged by the law of liberty .
59002013	For judgment is without mercy to the man who has showed no mercy . but mercy glories in the face of judgment .
59002014	My brothers , what good is it if any one says that he has faith , if he has no deeds ? Can such faith save him ?
59002015	If a brother or sister be naked and in need of daily food ,
59002016	and one of you says to them , " Depart in peace , find warmth and food for yourselves , " but at the same time you do not give the necessaries of the body , what good would that do them ?
59002017	In just the same way faith , if it have not deeds , is by itself a lifeless thing .
59002018	Some one indeed may say , " You have faith , and I have deeds . " " Then show me your faith , " I answer , " apart from any deeds , and I will show you my faith by my deeds . "
59002019	You believe that God is one ? You do well ; even the demons believe , and they shudder .
59002020	But do you want to be convinced , O foolish man , that faith apart from deeds is barren ?
59002021	Was not Abraham our ancestor justified by deeds , in that he offered up Isaac , his son , upon the altar ?
59002022	You see how faith was cooperating with deeds , and faith was made perfect by deeds .
59002023	And the Scripture was fulfilled which said , And Abraham believed God , and this was imputed to him as righteousness , and he was called Gods friend .
59002024	You see , then , that it is by his deeds a man is justified , and not simply by his faith .
59002025	In like manner was not Rahab , the harlot , justified by her deeds , in the fact that she received the messengers and sent them forth by another way ?
59002026	So just as the body without a spirit is dead , so faith is dead without deeds .
59003001	Do not become many teachers , my brothers , because you know well that we teachers shall be judged by a severer standard than others .
59003002	For in many respects we often stumble . If any man never stumbles in speech , the same is a perfect man , able to bridle the whole body as well .
59003003	When we put bits in the mouths of horses to make them obey us , we control their whole body also .
59003004	Look at the ships too , though they are so large , even when driven by fierce winds they are turned by a very small rudder , wherever the impulse of the helmsman wills .
59003005	So also the tongue is a small member and makes great boasts . Behold , how great a forest is set on fire by a little spark !
59003006	And the tongue is a fire ; it is a very world of iniquity among our members , defiling the whole body , and setting on fire the wheel of nature , and is itself set on fire by hell .
59003007	For while every kind of beast and bird , and of reptiles and sea-creatures are tamable , and actually have been tamed by mankind ,
59003008	no man can tame the tongue , restless evil that it is , full of deadly poison .
59003009	With it we continually bless our Lord and Father , and with it we are accustomed to curse men made in the image of God .
59003010	From out of the same mouth pour forth blessings and cursings ! My brothers , this ought not to be so .
59003011	Does a spring pour forth from the same opening sweet water and bitter ?
59003012	Can a fig tree , my brothers , bear olives ; or a grape-vine , figs ? No more can salt water yield fresh water .
59003013	Who among you is wise and intelligent ? Let him show his deeds by his good life , in the meekness of wisdom .
59003014	But if you have bitter jealousy and faction in your heart , do not be boasting of that , and be false to the truth .
59003015	Such wisdom is not that which is descending from on high , but is earthly , sensual , demonlike .
59003016	For wherever jealousy and faction exist , there is confusion and every evil deed .
59003017	But the wisdom which comes from on high is first pure , then peaceable , gentle , conciliatory , overflowing with mercy and good fruits , without partiality and without insincerity .
59003018	And the fruit of righteousness is being sown in peace by those who are working peace .
59004001	Where do the conflicts and quarrels that go on among you come from ? Do they not come from your passions which are always making war among your bodily members ?
59004002	You continually crave and do not obtain ; you are killing and coveting and cannot acquire ; you are fighting and at war . You do not have , because you do not ask .
59004003	You continue to ask and do not receive , because you are asking with a wrong purpose , in order to spend it upon your pleasures .
59004004	You adulteresses , do you not know that the friendship of the world is enmity to God ? Whoever , then , desires to be a friend of the world , makes himself and enemy of God .
59004005	Or do you suppose that it is in vain that the Scripture says , " The spirit which has its home in us yearns over us unto jealousy ? "
59004006	But he gives more and more grace . therefore it is said , God ever resists the proud ; but to the humble he gives grace continually .
59004007	So then ever be subject to God , Ever resist the devil and he will flee from you .
59004008	Draw near to God And he will draw near to you . Cleanse your hands , you sinners , And purify your hearts , you double-minded .
59004009	Lament and mourn , and weep aloud ! Let your laughter be turned into mourning , And your joy into gloom !
59004010	Humble yourselves before the Lord , And he will raise you up .
59004011	Do not be talking against each other , brothers . He who is talking against a brother and condemning his brothers is talking against the Law and condemning the Law . But if you are condemning the Law , you are not a doer of the Law , but a judge .
59004012	But One is your Lawgiver and Judge - he who is able to save and to destroy . But you , who are you , to be condemning your neighbor ?
59004013	Go to now , you who say , " Today or tomorrow we shall journey to such a city and spend a year there , and trade and make money , "
59004014	when all the time you do not know what will happen on the morrow . For what is your life ? You are but a mist , appearing for a brief time , and then vanishing .
59004015	You ought instead to say , " If the Lord wills it , we shall live and do this or that . "
59004016	But now you are glorying in these insolent boastings of yours ; all such glorying is evil .
59004017	So to him who knows how to do right and does not do it , to him it is sin .
59005001	Go to now , you rich men ! Weep aloud , howl for the miseries which are about to come upon you !
59005002	For your riches lie rotting , and your clothing has become moth-eaten .
59005003	Your gold and silver are rusted . and their rust will be for a testimony against you , and it will eat your flesh . For you have been storing up fire in these last days !
59005004	Look ! the wages of the laborers who mowed your fields , which you have been keeping back by fraud , are crying aloud ! And the cries of the reapers have entered into the ears of the Lord of Sabaoth !
59005005	You have lived luxuriously on earth , you have taken your pleasure , you have fattened your hearts for a day of slaughter .
59005006	You have condemned , you have murdered the righteous man unresisting !
59005007	Be patient , then , brothers , till the coming of the Lord . Behold the farmer who waits for the precious fruit of the earth , being patient over it , until it gets the early and the latter rains .
59005008	So you also must be patient . Stablish your hearts ; for the coming of the Lord is at hand !
59005009	Do not make complaints against each other , brothers , lest you yourselves be condemned . Behold the Judge is standing before the very door !
59005010	Take , my brothers , for an example the suffering and the patience of the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord .
59005011	Remember we count those that were stedfast happy . You have heard of the stedfastness of Job , and have seen the end of the Lord with him , seen how the Lord is full of tenderness .
59005012	Again , above all things , my brothers , swear not at all , neither by the heavens , nor by the earth , nor by any other oath . Let your " yes " be " yes , " and your " no , " " no , " so you will not fall under condemnation .
59005013	Is any one of you in trouble ? Let him pray .
59005014	Is any in good spirits ? Let him sing unto his harp . Is any one of you ill ? Let him send for the elders of the church , and let them pray over him , after anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord ;
59005015	and the prayer of faith will restore the sick , and the Lord will raise him up . And if he has committed sins , it will be forgiven him .
59005016	So confess your sins one to another , and pray for one another , that you may be healed . For the fervent prayer of a righteous man is mighty in its working .
59005017	Elijah was a man of like passions with us , and he prayed again , and the sky gave rain , and the earth brought forth her fruit .
59005018	Then he prayed again , and the sky gave rain , and the earth brought forth her fruit .
59005019	My brothers , if any one of you strays from the truth , and some one brings him back ,
59005020	let him know that he who brings a sinner back from the error of his ways , saves his soul from death , and hides a multitude of sins .
60001001	Peter , an apostle of Jesus Christ , to the elect who are sojourners of the dispersion in Pontus , Galatia , Cappadocia , Roman Asia , and Bithynia ,
60001002	according to the foreknowledge of God the Father , in the sanctification of the spirit , unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ ; Grace and peace be multiplied to you .
60001003	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , by whose great mercy we have been born anew into a living hope , through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead ;
60001004	and into an inheritance imperishable and undefiled and fadeless , which has been kept in heaven for you
60001005	who , through faith , are continuously guarded by the power of God for a salvation , ready to be revealed in the last days .
60001006	Exult in this , though now for a brief moment , if need be , you have suffered many hardships .
60001007	These are in order that the test of your faith , more precious than gold that is perishable and yet is tested by fire , may redound to praise and glory and honor , at the revelation of Jesus Christ .
60001008	Him you love , though you have never seen him ; in him you ever believe , though even now you see him not , and you are rejoicing with joy unspeakable and full of glory ,
60001009	as you continually receive the reward of your faith , even the salvation of your souls .
60001010	Concerning this salvation the Prophets who prophesied regarding the grace intended for you , diligently sought and searched .
60001011	They were searching to know to what time , or to what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them kept pointing , when he ever testified beforehand concerning the sufferings of Christ and the glories that would follow .
60001012	It was revealed to them that it was not for themselves , but for you , that they were ministering the truths which have now been announced to you , by those who preached the gospel to you , through the help of the Holy Spirit sent forth from heaven - truths into which angels long to look .
60001013	So then brace up your minds , be steady in spirit , and fix your hope firmly in the grace that is coming to you , at the revelation of Jesus Christ .
60001014	Like obedient children , do not fashion yourselves according to the former passions of your days of ignorance ,
60001015	but become yourselves holy in your whole manner of living , as He who has called you is holy ,
60001016	as the Scripture says , You shall be holy , because I am holy .
60001017	And since you call upon him as Father , who impartially judges each one according to his deeds , pass the time of your sojourning here in reverence .
60001018	For you well know that not with perishable things , with silver or gold , were you redeemed from the emptiness of your manner of life , received by tradition from your ancestors ;
60001019	but with precious blood , like that of a lamb without spot or blemish , even the blood of Christ .
60001020	He was indeed foreknown before the foundation of the world , but was manifested at the end of the times for your sake .
60001021	Through him you believe in God who raised him from the dead and gave him glory ; so that your faith and hope are now in God .
60001022	Now that by obedience to the truth you have purified your lives for a brotherly love without hypocrisy , you must love one another from your hearts , fervently .
60001023	For you have been born anew , not of perishable , but of imperishable seed , by the living , lasting word of God .
60001024	For , All flesh is grass And all its glory like the flower of the grass . The grass fades , The flower falls ,
60001025	But the word of the Lord abides forever . And this is the word of the gospel which has been told to you .
60002001	Therefore put away all malice , all deceit , insincerity , jealousy , and slander of every sort .
60002002	Like new-born babes long for the pure spiritual milk to make you grow up into salvation ;
60002003	since you have tasted that the Lord is gracious .
60002004	Come to him then , that living Stone , rejected indeed by men , but chosen by God , and precious .
60002005	And yourselves like living stones be built into a spiritual house , to be a holy priesthood offering spiritual sacrifices , acceptable to God , through Christ Jesus .
60002006	For , as Scripture says . Behold , I lay in Zion a chief corner-stone , elect , precious , And he who believes on Him shall never be put to shame .
60002007	For you , then , that believe , is the preciousness ; but for those who do not believe , A stone which the builders rejected , The same has become the head stone of the corner ,
60002008	and , A stone of stumbling , and a rock of offense . They stumble over it because they are disobeying Gods word , and to this they were also appointed .
60002009	But you are an elect race , a royal priesthood , a holy nation , a purchased people , that you may show forth the virtues of Him who has called you out of darkness into his marvelous light -
60002010	you who once were not a people , but now are the people of God ; who were once without mercy , but now you have found mercy .
60002011	I beseech you , beloved , as pilgrims and exiles , to abstain from passions of the flesh that war upon your souls .
60002012	Let your manner of life before the Gentiles be honest ; so that , although they are now slandering you as evil-doers , they may , by beholding your noble conduct , come to glorify God , in the day of visitation .
60002013	Submit yourselves , for the Lords sake , to every human authority ; whether it be to the Emperor as supreme ruler ,
60002014	or to governors as sent by him for the punishment of evil-doers and for the encouragement of well-doers .
60002015	For it is the will of God that by well-doing you should silence the ignorant talk of foolish men .
60002016	Live like free men ; and yet do not make your freedom a cloak for misconduct , but be the slaves of God .
60002017	Honor all men . Love the brotherhood . Reverence God . Honor the Emperor .
60002018	Household slaves , submit yourselves to your masters in all reverence ; not only to the kind and gentle , but also to the unreasonable .
60002019	For it is an acceptable thing to God , if from a sense of duty to him , a man endures a wrong , even suffering unjustly .
60002020	For what credit is it if , when you are struck for a fault , you take it patiently ? But if when you are doing well and suffer for it , you always take it patiently , this is acceptable with God .
60002021	For this is your calling ; because Christ also suffered for you , leaving you an example , so that you should follow in his footsteps ;
60002022	He committed no sin , Neither was guile found in his mouth .
60002023	He was reviled , and reviled not back . When he suffered he never threatened but always committed his cause to the One who judges rightly .
60002024	He bore our sins in his own body upon the tree , in order that we might become dead to sins , and be alive unto righteousness . By his wounds you have been healed .
60002025	For you were straying like lost sheep , but you are now returned to the Shepherd and Guardian of your souls .
60003001	In the same way you wives must be submissive to your own husbands ; so that if some of them will not believe the message , they may apart from the message be won over by the behavior of their wives ,
60003002	when they see how pure and reverent you are .
60003003	Your adornment ought not to be the outward adornment of plaited hair and golden jewels and the wearing of beautiful dresses ;
60003004	but rather that hidden personality of the heart , the imperishable ornament of a quiet and gentle spirit , which in the sight of God is indeed precious .
60003005	For in this way in the olden time the holy women also , who put their trust in God , used to adorn themselves . They were ever in submission to their own husbands ;
60003006	thus , for example , Sarah obeyed Abraham , calling him lord . And you are daughters of Sarah , if you do what is right , and permit nothing to make you afraid .
60003007	In the same way you husbands live with your wives , according to knowledge , honoring your wife as of the weaker sex , yet as an heir with yourself of the grace of life ; so that your prayers may not be hindered .
